items.original: <Wordwrap>Practe sa! Richtár dnes zakázali vstup do dediny. V krčme kvôli tomu tiež skoro zatvárajú, neunúvajte sa.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Get lost! The burgmaster forbid anyone from entering the town! The tavern also closes early because of this, don't bother going.\n<Guard>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Páni dobrotiví, vidím, že dobré úmysly máte, ale nesmieme vás pustiť. Richtár prikázali, bojíme sa, že husiti vyčíňajú, podpálili zase starý hrad alebo ak nie husiti... tak ešte horšia banda... Ale do krčmy choďťe, isto vám aspoň jedno ešte nalejú na dobré spanie.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Good men, I see that you mean well, yet passage I cannot grant. The burgmaster commands that none enters, he fears the Hussites. They set blaze to the old castle! And if it weren't Hussites, then even a fouler band. To the tavern, however, go. At least a pint they will pour, for restful slumber.\n<Guard>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Važeni pani, za čože do dediny ste k nám dorazili?\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hark, good lords, for what cause hath led thee unto our humble village? \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Za richtarom idzeme.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: We seeketh the burgmaster. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mal by doma byť. Byva v strede dediny.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: He should be at his abode, dwelling midst the heart of yon village. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nervozny už je pes. Pome ho richtarovi vracic. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Dog doth grow restless. Let us return her unto the burgmaster. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Áh, tu ste. Poď Nora, poď k páničkovi.\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Ah, there thou art. Come, Nora, come to thy master. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Banda skončila... a s nimi aj zopár kultistov. Ty si na nás poslal tých hrdlorezov z kultu? \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The band is vanquished... and with them, a few cultists. Didst thou dispatch those cutthroats from the cult against us? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ja? Chlapi, prečo ma z takého krivo obviňujete? \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I? Why dost thou falsely accuse me, good sirs. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Banda skončila. Lupiči už viac nebudú lúpiť, lež sme ich dobili.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The band is defeated. The robbers shall pillage no more, for we hath routed them.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vynikajúco, vynikajúco.\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Excellent, excellent. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mali by sme Aničke pomôcť, čaká pri útese.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>We should go help Anička, awaiting by the cliffside, she is.
\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ja do koscela nejdzem takto zaodety. Haňba nad haňbu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I shall not go to the church so scantily clad. 'Tis a shame upon shame. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Do katakomby sa bojim isc takto nahaty. Tam žimno, prechladneme ani sa nenazdaš.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I fear to venture into the catacombs so naked. 'Tis cold there, we shall catch a chill before we know it. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dvaja holoprdi idu do lesa na vylet? Nebarz dobry napad.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Two simpletons venture into the woods for an outing? 'Tis indeed a rotten idea. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Maceju, isto chceme teraz totych mantakoch pipovych hledac?
Šak doraz cma a my tu v lese jak puci.\n
items.translation:
Matej, dost we truly plan to pursue the priest’s minstrels at this hour?
For anon the darkness doth approach, and we find ourselves in the woods like lost souls. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Abo še pomodli, možno že sa ci zjavi svata Tereza a ce nasmeruje abo co… i kedz aši to nema barz zmysel...
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Or mayhaps ye shouldst pray, perchance Saint Teresa shall appear and guide us, or some such... Although methinks it bears little sense.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Ach. Asi máš pravdu.
Nuž dobre, ale zajtra musíme ích ísť hľadať.\n
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Ah, thou mayst be right. Very well, but on the morrow we must venture forth in search of them. 
\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, hej. Hlavne už pome. Jutre vyriešime\^ \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, aye, let us haste. Tomorrow we shall resolve \^ \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Počkaj! \!
<Wordwrap>Pohľaď! Niekto oheň tam zapálil!\n<Matej>
items.translation:
Halt!\!
Look! Someone hath kindled a fire yonder! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To je sprostô toto. Takto sa prezradiť.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: This is folly indeed. To reveal themselves thus. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Potichu, potichu! Načúvajme.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hush, hush! Let us listen. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Cicho budzeš? Šak ty ši horši jak moja stara, co mi ucekla. Šak vidziš, že to su len taki degeši, ani pip tu ne je.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hold ye tongue! Ye art worse than my old woman who ran away. Canst ye not see they are but mere jesters, and the priest is nowhere to be found.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Heh... čoby nie.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Heh... why not. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Prostred dediny žije Richtár. Mal by byť doma.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster dwelleth here, amidst the very core of our village, upon the square. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Neznam, či še zejtrajška dožijeme.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: The morrow's survival is uncertain. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kec ani richtar neje v bezpeču ta co my, bidaci? Sa na nas vrhnu, dortriapu, dorežu.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Even the burgmaster art not safe here, and what of us poor souls! They shall descend upon us, they shall rend, they shall slay. \n<Guardsman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kejc chcece znac šicko ta idzce za židom, v ľeše ma chižu. Aľe dakto mi hutorel, že dajaki čehuni še mu tam hoscia. Husiti volajaki! Dneška to tu sama sekta, jaj Bože tota dnešna mladež nas do hrobu privedie. 
\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>If ye want to know everthing go seek the Jew, in a hut in the woods. But some hath whispered, he lies in league with czechs. Husites or somesuch! Today, 'tis naught but a congregation of misfortune, oh Lord, this youthful generation shall lead us to our graves. \n<Guardsman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pri rieke husiti vystrajaju! Zaš tam topia kohosi. Som rano šiel okolo, strašny pohľad. 
\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hark! By the river, the Hussites linger! They're drowning someone there oncemore. I passed by this morning, a dreadful sight. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Našiel si \c[14]zásoby!\c[0]
items.translation: <Wordwrap>You found \c[14]supplies\c[0]!

items.original: <Wordwrap>Takto do koscela nejdem. Rovno s holu riťu možem byc.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I shall not venture thus to the church. I might as well go stark naked. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jaj, hnev Boži na nas sadnul! A richtar fras na šecko sere, prstom nepohne. Ľem še vymluva, Boh zna s jakym čartom ďablom še bratričkuje! A zemepan tyž ľem by cale dni pexeso hral a na totu svoju scenu v komnate kukal.\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, the wrath of the heavens hath descended upon us! And the burgmaster cares naught, not a finger doth he lift. \n<Peasant>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Poradky by tu trebalo porobic. Polka dzeci nam ušla, to bars divne veci še tu deju a taki su jak omameni i agresivni. Ja furt hvarim že kemu net rady temu net pomoci. Nezname v dzedzine či še spojic a isc s vidlami vyrabovac totych kultistoch abo co. Aľe zaš nechočeme svoje ditky na šmerc ubic.\n<Pradlena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, the wrath of the heavens hath descended upon us! And the burgmaster cares naught, not a finger doth he lift. His excuses abound, God alone knows with what devil's bargain he hath struck! And the Lord himself, spends his days idly playing and gazing upon his mural within his chamber. \n<Cotter>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Neznam, co im do hlavy hudli toti kultisti. Vodcu nam treba, richtar i zemepan na to seru cale. I še bojime bo v lesoch še dajake zrudy hybu.\n<Pradlena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, we need things in order. Half of the children hath fled from us, a strange occurrence indeed. They act as if they were enchanted, aggressive. I lament that for those who seek no guidance, there be none to be given. We doth not know should we band together and set upon cultists wth pitchforks, or what. Yet we doth not seek our children beaten dead. \n<Cotter>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Taky ryk divoky sa neška ozyval zos cintiru pri kosceľe. Bohzna či dajaky dzivy dzik tam spadol abo horše, dajaka pačmaga zos ľeša. Už to neška neje jak dakedy, kejc som mala bola ta som kľudne šla na maľinky a som sa nemusela bac, že ma tam dajaky sataň vežňe.
\n<Pradlena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ferocious roar echoed from the graveyard near the church. God knows whether a wild boar fell there or worse, some monster from the woods. It's not as it used to be, when I was young, I went to the forest and I did not have to worry that I would not come back. \n<Cotter>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Parobci moji, čuli sce už o qahwahu? Take nove zrna z juhu, calkom še to rozmohlo vof našim vaľale. Ale ja nechočem nijake novoty, mne pivko stači. Ale to tež taka horkota, možno by som aj okoštoval, keby sce dakus mali. Čarne to je, jak bez mešaca noc.
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My lads, have you heard of qahwah? These new beans from the south, 'tis become quite the rage amongst our folk. But I care not for such novelties, a pint suffices for me. Though if ye hath some I might partake 'tis as dark as a moonless night. \n<Villein>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Aľe teho Turka, co to furt pije, by som poslal tam, dze slnuko nešvici, bars divne veršovačky furt hutori.
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Alas that Turk who incessantly imbibes it, I'd send him where the sun don't shine, he's forever spouting strange rhymes. \n<Villein>

items.original:
Ci pana, sce čuli? Vof ľese husitoch je jak mravcoch. Minule še sami medzi sebu mlaceli! Aľe neradzim vam ku potoku chodzic, oni še tam hraju na inkviziciu švetu
a krsca ľudzi nasilu. Aľe to hrich je byc formatovany katoľik, pip nam v koscele hutoreli. Račej volim še nechac utopic, jak byc sformatovany.\n
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Hath you heard? In the woods, the Hussites swarm like ants.
Last time, they slaughtered each other! But I advise against wandering near the stream, they play holy inquisition there and baptize people by force. Yet, 'tis a sin to be a formatted Catholic, that's what they preached to us in the church. I'd rather drown than be formatted.\n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak še zda, že budze padac. A asi riadne. Musim si isc po kalap, žeby mi za kark nepadalo.\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It will rain, so it seems, gotta find my cap, lest I want water trickle down my neck.\n<Footman>

items.original: Pre Božiu lásku, nezabijajce nas!\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: By the grace of God, spare our lives! \n<Warrior>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nesmieme ich nechať ujsť!\n<Matej>
items.translation: We must not let them to flee! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kašlime na nich, Maceju. Šak ich nebudzeme po lese nahaňať jak šaleni. Pocme račej skusic tym zrnom nakrmic dajakeho zvera. Patkaňa abo co. Kurku možno.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us not concern ourselves with them, Matej. We shall not pursue them through the woods like lunatics. Instead, let us attempt to lure some creature with the bean. Perhaps a duck or a chicken. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nuž... Predsa ale mali by sme ich ísť hľadať. Isto ešte dačo vedia.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily... Nonetheless, we should still seek them out. Surely, they still possess knowledge. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Parobci, kam máte tak naponáhlo? Do tmy ďaleko ešte.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: Where so hastily rush ye, lads? The day be still young. \n<Bodyguard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Uhni hovado, to ne tvoja starosc. Še idzc odbavovac do bordeľu a migaj het zos cesty, bo ce očapem jak riňavu baganču. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Step aside, ye fool! 'Tis none of ye concern. Go seek relief to the brothel, and clear the path ere I thrash ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zdochni! \n<Strážnik>
items.translation: Begone! \n<Bodyguard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Co toto ma byc? To už moja chyža, si zapomnul?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What's this? This is already my chamber, hast ye forgotten? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vy švine!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ye swine! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No domariše, schovaj qahwah. Nás prichytili, inflagranti.
\n<Valér>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Mother… hide quahwah. We hath been caught in the act, in flagrante delicto. \n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Páni, ukľudnime sa. Toto je čisto obchod. Som súčasťou distribučného uzla. Predsa pozrite sa, qahwah je v surovom stave. My nemáme nič spoločné s kultistami. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us temper our spirits, gentlemen, for this is but a matter of commerce. I am but a cog in the wheel of distribution. Behold, qahwah doth be unprocessed. We hath no dealings with the cultists. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zatajovali ste nám informácie súvisiace s vyšetrovaním. Teraz tu strácame čas, toto ste nám zavše mali hneď včera ráno vyklopiť. Zemepánovi sa to nebude páčit.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matters would hath progressed more smoothly had ye divulged pertinent information sooner. We squander time now. The lord shall not take kindly to this. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja nepodlieham zemepánovi, nech len sa sem skúsi natlačiť so svojimi zbrojnošmi. Moje kontakty so šľachtou sú bohatšie. Bratrím sa s Pálffym. Ale o takom ste vy ani nepočuli.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I bend not my knee to the lord. Let him attempt to force his hand with armed men. My ties to the nobility run deep. I am allied with the Pálffys, though such alliances may be beyond your ken. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mne može byc jedno, s kym sa ty mojkaš! Za zadržiavanie informacii vas tu možem oboch popravic. Vyklopce, co znace!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I care not for thy alliances! For withholding vital knowledge, I hath the authority to mete out punishment to both of ye. Speak! What know ye? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
...
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: ... \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Náš zdroj je istý Koreň. Nikto presne nevie, kto to je, ten Koreň. Ale organizuje karavany z Etiópie... to je v Afrike. Potom si však začal vymýšľať podmienky, vyhrážal sa nám smrťou. Museli sme na ne pristúpiť. Ak však budeme držať hubu a krok, obchody pôjdu ďalej. Dokonca nám bude dávať qahwah za polovičnú cenu. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Our source is a man known as Root. His origins remain shrouded in mystery. Yet, he orchestrates caravans from Ethiopia, a land distant and foreign. But then he grewth audacious, threatening us with dire consequences should we defy him. We acquiesced, yet should we maintain our silence and compliance, trade shall continue unhindered. He hast even consented to furnish us with qahwah at half the price. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak sme si s ním na to štrngli. Ale tušili sme, ba dúfali, že to niekto začne riešiť. Našťastie sme sa stihli pripraviť. A teraz hneď odchádzame.
\n<Valér>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So, we hath struck a bargain with him. Yet, we nurtured hopes that someone would stir an inquiry. By the grace of God, we hath taken measures and stand ready to depart with haste. \n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Myslíte si, že vás prepustíme?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: And dost thou presume we shall simply permit thee to depart? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Valér tým, že sme sa pripravili, chcel naznačiť, že sme aj bez vás riešili vojnu proti kultistom. Len sme vojnou nechceli ohroziť obchody. Jednak to sype a ničomu by to nepomohlo. Bez zlata by sme nič podniknúť nemohli. Preto sme medzitým spoločnými silami s istým kolegom získali vlastný kontakt z Etiópie a pripravili sa na útek z tejto prekliatej dediny.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Colleague Valér doth imply that even without thy involvement, we were engaged in the struggle against the cultists. We were loath to imperil our trade with the specter of war. 'Twas folly, nay, futility to engage thus. Bereft of means, we could take no decisive action. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A celý čas popritom zhromažďujeme arzenál. Písali sme listy šlachticom, lenže ten Koreň musí mať kontakty na vysokých miestach. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thus, through a certain colleague we sought another contact from the distant lands of Ethiopia and readied ourselves to flee this accursed village. All the while, we hath been amassing an arsenal. We hath dispatched missives to the nobles, yet Root holds sway in the highest courts. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Všetci nás ignorujú. Však to nie je normálne, už dávno tu mal Huňady zasahovať, ale... asi je roptýlený a oslabený bojmi o moc. Ťažko ľudom vysvetliť, čo sa tu deje. Kto tie ozruty nevidel na vlastné oči, neverí. Ale s pomocou spomínaného kolegu sa veci konečne pohli. Verte nám, my vám budeme užitočnejší ako podpora z Prešova.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We are but disregarded by all. 'Tis an injustice. Hunyadi should hath intervened long since, yet perchance he is entangled in internal strife. 'Tis a formidable challenge to unveil the truth to the populace. Those who hath not witnessed these horrors firsthand shall scarcely lend credence. But with the help of the mentioned colleague, things were finally put in motion. We offer ourselves as comrades, more resolute as the backing from Prešov. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>...s pomocou Ignáca?? Takže to ty si ten Ric z kalendára!! Ako to, že mi to nedošlo, či som ja len sprostý! A to ako naozaj čakáš, že ti po tomto budeme veriť?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>...with the help of Ignác? Thou art the Bur from his calendar! How come I didn't think of it, how foolish of me! And how dost thou really expect us to trust thee now? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No a čo, že s Ignácom? Pre dobrú vec sa spojím aj s Jiskrom. Šak si ho neberiem za ženu, čo bude o týždeň, to je predsa vo hviezdach.  
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So what? For a good cause, I will work even with Jiskra. I do not take him to be my wife, what will be in a week is in the stars.\n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neznam, či pravdu hutorice. Ale kedz hej, ta čemu sce mi hnedka nepovedali.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know not if ye words bear the seal of truth, yet if they do, why didst ye delay their divulgence? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sme nevedeli, či vám môžeme veriť. Ste mohli byť Koreňove volavky. Alebo ste mohli byt podplatiteľní. Som vás odvčera sledoval. Konfrontovať sme sa vás ešte nechystali, ale tak čo už. 
\n<Valér>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We harbored suspicions regarding thy trustworthiness. Ye could hath been agents of Root or bribed informants. I hath kept a vigilant watch upon thee since yesterday. We had not intended to confront thee so soon, but fate hath brought us together. \n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta dobre potom, dze toten vaš arzenal?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: And where, pray tell, dost ye house this arsenal? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Na fare v kostole. Pip dovolil Valérovi. Za zľavu na qahwah, ale on má kľúčik od tajnej komory. A včera zmizol. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It dwells within the confines of the church's rectory. The preist granted Valér entry in exchange for a reduction in qahwah prices, holding the key to the hidden chamber. However, he vanished yesterday. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale veď sa nás práve na ulici pokúsili zabiť vaši hromotĺci. Vôbec nedáva logiku, čo nám tu tvrdíte.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But did not thy minions assail us in the streets? Thy account appears incongruous. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To boli kultisti, nanútili nám tých dvoch tupcov, akože ochranku, ale v skutočnosti to boli ich špicli. By som sa nečudoval, keby už mali rozkazy ma odstrániť. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>These hat been the disciples of the cult, thrust upon us as guardians. Those two dimwits were naught but spies. I hath wager me last, they hath received orders to silence me. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No, ale keď nás teda necháte žiť, my berieme nohy na plecia. Problém, ktorý sme nestihli vyriešiť je, že kultisti držia hliadky na všetkých cestách z dediny a našim strážam sa už nedá veriť. Neujdeme len tak. By sme potrebovali vašu ochranu, zaplatíme vám 300 korún.
\n<Valér>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Should thou grant us continued existence, we shall take our leave with all haste. Yet, the conundrum remaineth the cultists maintain watch over every road leading from the village, and our own guards hath proven as unreliable as a wisp of smoke. We cannot flee unaided. We beseech thy protection, and in exchange, we offer three hundred coins. \n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Maceju, možeme im veric podľa cebe?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej, dost ye deem them trustworthy? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neviem... keď na nich kultisti zaútočia, tak vieme, že vravia pravdu a kultisti ich držali pod kontrolou. Ale môže to byť pasca, a keď s nimi budeme, ľahko nás premôžu.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know not... should the cultists assail them, then we shall know their words hold true, and the cultists held them ensnared. Yet, 'tis also possible it be a trap, and should we join them, we would be at their mercy. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No Zbohem, ta co zrobime…
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: By God, what path shall we tread... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hlavne to nekomplikujme. Zbehneme za zemepánom, dá nám pár chlapov, nech máme zaistenú presilu. Pôjdeme s richtárom z dediny a uvidíme ako sa to vyvinie. Valéra si berieme ako rukojemníka.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Above all, let us not complicate matters further. We shall seek an audience with the Lord, petitioning for a handful of stalwart men to bolster our ranks. Accompanied by the village mayor, we shall monitor the unfolding events. And Valér shall accompany us as a pledge of sincerity. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Valér sa pridal do tvojej družiny.
items.translation: And so, Valér joined your party.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jožu, poc von!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Jožo, come forth! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zamknuto.
items.translation: Locked.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tu žiju toty Pallmerofci. Co tota ich cerka o kulte daco zna. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is where those Pallmers live. Whose daughter knows something about the cult. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zdravím. Vašu cerenku zhaňame. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Greetings. We seek ye daughter. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dojdzem sem potem s Macejom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I'll come back with Matej by my side.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobry. Zemepan i z richtarom me poverili vyšetrovac sektu, co sa tu paseku robi. Vraj vaša cerenka daco o tom zna.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Good morrow to thee. The lord and the burgmaster hath entrusted me with a quest to unravel the mystery of the cult blights this land. 'Tis said yer daughter knows something about it. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Anička sa nám odcudzila, domov skoro nechodí a včera sme po nej ziapali aj bitku dostala. Ráno nebola v posteli. Nevieme, či sa vôbec vráti.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Anička, she hath distanced herself from our hearth, scarce returning home. Only yesterday doth we berate even laid hands on her. Come dawn, she was not to be found in her chamber. Whether she shall return, we know not. \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Strašne neščesce!
\n<Pallmerová>
items.translation: A grievous plight, indeed! \n<Lady Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nič nám nevravela, ale voľačo si škriabala do tejto knížky. Lenže my nevieme lúštiť litery, aspoň vidíte, že sme sa jej o učenie postarali, aj keď trieme biedu. A tak sa nám odplatila.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nay a word hath she spoken to us, yet she hath been seen to etch into this tome.  We doth made her learned, alas we are unable to decipher its contents. Despite our toil, this is her recompense. \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ukažce sem. "Zima 1444... abo 1448? Bola s-o-m dme... dnes... za babičkou v Sobram- Sombrancoch? Sobrancoch. Navarila mi tvarohové..." Znace co, kym sa preluskam tym ta zoštarneme. Pridzem potem s Macejom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Give me the diary.
"Winter 1444... or 1448? I w-e-n-t to see my great mother tob... today in Sobram... Sobrance? Sobrance. She made cheese pies-" Ye know what, we'll turn gray until I get trough it. I shall return with Matej.\n

items.original: <Wordwrap>Za richtarom idzece? V strede dzedziny byva.\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Going to the burgmaster? Lives in the middle of the town.\n<Villager>

items.original: Ďakujeme, že si dohral demo. Daj nám chytro vedieť, jak sa ti pozdáva.
Kľudne i vecej razy si zahraj. Abo i ne, neznam. Idzem spac.
JAAJH PADAAAM!\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: AAAAAAH FAAALLIING I AM!\n<Drunkard>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zgruchotal. Jak še mu to podarilo še nedozname asi.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Down he goes. How he managed to slip on flat ground, that is far beyond me.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Me vykradli! Teraz, za biľeho dňa! Normalne som išol k sušedovi po hrabľe, a kym som domu prišol, ta almara vyrabovana dočista. Nikto mi veric nechce, vraj, že sam som si tote veci moje odľifroval.  
\n<Občan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They've robbed me! In broad daylight! I merely went to my neighbor's for a rake, and upon my return, my home was ransacked entirely. No one believes me, they claim I hid my own belongings. \n<Villein>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Som sem prišol sa pozreť z mesta na život sedliakov. To samá nahota, buranstvo. Opilci všade. \n<Mešťan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I came from the city to witness the life of peasants. 'Tis nothing but nakedness, uncouthness. Drunkards abound. \n<Townsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zajtra sobota chlopci! Pride šmelinar predavac taľafatky! \n<Šťastlivec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Saturday comes the morrow, the trader shall come sell his wares! \n<Cottager>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale ale, pán richtár. Na prechádzke?
\n<Kultista>
items.translation: But what's this, good burgmaster? Taking a leisurely stroll?\n<Evil doer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Máš proti tomu niečo?
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Dost thou take offense at my movements? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neklamal! Zahlušia ho! poďme mu na pomoc!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: He doth speaks verily! They seek to silence him! Cometh, let us lend him aid! \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tu máte 300 korún. Napriek tomu ja a moja rodina sme vašimi dlžníkmi, páni. Prijmite tento dedičný prsteň. Dúfam, že sa mi podarí presvedčiť Palffyho a získať podporu pre odboj. Zatiaľ s Pánom Bohom.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Take these 300 coins. Despite this, my family and I remain indebted to thee, noble sirs. Accept this ancestral ring. I hope to sway Palffy and garner support for our cause. Until then, may God watch over thee. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Získal si \c[14]300 korún\c[0] a dedičný \c[14]prsteň\c[0].
items.translation: You gained \c[14]300 coins\c[0] and an \c[14]ancestral ring\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Skúste ešte nájsť pipa, nech vás pustí k našemu arzenálu.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Try locating the priest, he will let thou to our arsenal. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj, ešči zas teho kdzeška nahaňac treba...
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Lord in heaven, what an endless task, locating that man.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Možno tie dievčatá v nevestinci budú vedieť, kde sa skrýva.
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Mayhaps the bathmaidens will tell us of his whereabouts.
\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ideme takoj za zemepanom, povieme mu, co še tu odohralo.
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us hasten to the lord forthwith and apprise him of the events that transpired here. \n<Man at arms>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Konečne dniška dakus zapršalo. Už tak sparno bulo, nedalo še vytrimac.. 
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: At last, it hath rained today. 'Twas so sultry, unbearable. \n<Cotter>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ku rieke nechocce neš, molodci. Husiti tam dakeho zdrapli a vo vode tryznia.\n<Pradlena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Stay away from the river, lads. The Hussites hath seized someone and torment them in the water. \n<Cottager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Idem k rieke na vodu. \n<Občan>
items.translation: ...am off to the river for water. \n<Freeman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tady bydlí.
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: They dwell here. \n<Freeman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Idze kuknuc k Pallmerofcom. Hore v dzedzine byvaju, hneď pri mosce. Ich dcerka Anička tyž do kultu vnišla, možnaj vam daco o tym povi. 
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Go see Pallmers. That faimily lives up in the village, right by the bridge. Their daughter Anička joined the cult, mayhaps they shall tell you about it themselves. \n<Freeman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Panstvo važene! Byc vami ta tyž už sa davam na utek! Hrozne veci sa tu deju už paru mešace, ale toto čo sa porobilo neška to už je neunosne! Kym v ľeše nas mordovali, ešči som to predychal. Ale v karčme kejc neje človek v bezpeču, ta to možem dlabac na take.
\n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Respected folk! Should I be thee I wouldst flee with thee! Terrible things hath been happening here for months, but what has just occurred is unbearable! While they murdered us in the forest, I could still bear it. But to not be safe in a tavern, ‘tis the harbinger of doom.\n<Fugitive>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Panstvo važene! Byc vami ta tyž už sa davam na utek! Hrozne veci sa tu deju už paru mešace, ale toto čo sa porobilo neška to už je neunosne! Kym v ľeše nas mordovali, ešči som to predychal. Ale že richtara zamorduju, to už je predzvesť skazy.
\n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Respected folk! Should I be thee I wouldst flee with thee! Terrible things hath been happening here for months, but what has just occurred is unbearable! While they murdered us in the forest, I could still bear it. But for the burgmastrer to be slain, ‘tis the harbinger of doom.\n<Fugitive>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nema cenu sa tu zdržovac ani dzeň! Do dzedziny sa neunuvajce, zabarikadovany most.
\n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>'Tis no use lingering here even a day! Venture into the village not, the bridge is barricaded.\n<Fugitive>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zahlušili nam richtara! Do dzedziny sa neunuvajce, zabarikadovany most.
\n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They hath murdered our burgmaster! Venture into the village not, the bridge is barricaded.\n<Fugitive>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Stojce! Ratujce še. V krčme masova vražda! Caly valal hore nohama! Trecina ľudzi pošla het, trecina sa zamkla doma. Hrstka nas pobrala zbrane a tu budzeme branic most!\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Halt! Steel thyselves. ‘tis a massacre in the tavern! Chaos reigns! A third of the people hath fled, a third art locked in their homes. A handful hath taken up arms and here we shall defend the bridge!

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chlopi! Caly valal hore nohamy! Richtara zabili! Trecina ľudzi už je na uceku do susedneho panstva, trecina še zamkla doma a zvyšok je Bohzna dze. Hrstka nas pobrala zbrane a sa pripravujeme na najhoršo.\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Lads! Chaos reigns! The burgmaster has been slain! A third of the people hath fled to the neighboring lordship, a third art locked in their homes, and the rest are God knows where. A handful of us hath taken up arms and we prepare for the worst. \n<Guardsman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Moj kamoš pošol do lesa s delobuchom. Furt daco taral o dajakom netvorovi neviditeľnom, že ho vyduri zos vybušninu. Už tri dni som ho nevidzel.
\n<Lesný robotník>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My friend went into the forest with a petard. He kept talking about some invisible monster, that he would extort it with the explosive. I haven't seen him in three days. \n<Woodworker>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sme ho našli. Je mi to ľuto, už sa nevrati.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We found him. I'm sorry, he's not coming back. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Do pyska! Skym budzem chodzic do lesa teraz? No ci pana. Ta ale ďakojem, že ste mi prišli povedac. Tu mace jeho založny \c[14]delobuch\c[0], on ho už nebudze potrebovac.
\n<Lesný robotník>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Damn it! With whom shall I venture into yon forest now? Well, sir, thank you for coming to tell me. Here's his spare \c[14]petard\c[0], he won't have use for it anymore. \n<Woodworker>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toto hrozny kraj. Mi vravel stary otec, že jeho stareho otca zabili mongoli, a že stareho otca jeho stareho otca tatari. No a nas biju husiti a ešči i dajake potvori z lesa.
\n<Lesný robotník>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is a terrible land. My grandfather told me that his grandfather had been killed by Mongols, and that his grandfather's grandfather had been killed by Tartars. And we are beaten by Hussites and even more sinister beasts from the forest. \n<Woodworker>

items.original: V sude objavil si \c[14]zákys\c[0].
items.translation: In the barrel you found \c[14]sour cream\c[0].

items.original: Vo vreci našiel si \c[14]zásoby\c[0].
items.translation: In the bag you found a \c[14]toolkit\c[0].

items.original: Vo vreci našiel si \c[14]alpu\c[0].
items.translation: There was \c[14]alpa\c[0] in this bag.

items.original: Na ohníku sa prihrievala \c[14]kaša\c[0].
items.translation: In the fireplace the \c[14]porridge\c[0] was kept warm.

items.original: Amencma s našim valaľom. Kultisti zaútočili. \n<Pradlena>
items.translation: Moonless night befell this hamlet. The cult attacked. \n<Cottager>

items.original: Zamknute
items.translation: Locked.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nikto sa nesmie dostac do dzedziny! \n<Marek>
items.translation: None shall pass into the village! \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ty? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Thy? \n<Matej>

items.original: Hej. Practe sa preč. \n<Marek>
items.translation: Aye. Get lost. \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Taste meče! \n<Adam>
items.translation: Draw thy swords! \n<Adam>

items.original: Naj ce skare! \n<Marek>
items.translation: Come at me! \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ďalší kultisti idú do dediny! Rýchlo rytieri, do kostola!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>More fiends approach our village! Haste, noble knights, to the church!\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nechajte ma! Vy lotri! \n<Žid>
items.translation: Let go of me! You villains! \n<Jew>

items.original: Žid kam pošol? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Where hath the Jew gone? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Videl som ho do kostola utekať! \n<Matej>
items.translation: I saw him fleeing towards the church! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zachrance me! \n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: Help me, please! \n<Mercenary>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chlopaci moji, no kdepak ste buli toliko? Tu som sa braniu, som im dau na budku zopar, ale by ma již rychle premohli! \n<Kandich>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My comrades, where hath thou been? I hath been holding them off as best I could, but they hath overwhelmed me soon! \n<Kandich>

items.original: Ľudze boži, šmerc v očoch mam! Berce nohy na ramena, kultisti palia dzedzinu.\n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <WordWrap>O, heavens! My heart quivers with fear! Quick, save thyselves, for the cultists set the village ablaze.\n<Fugitive>

items.original: Žida si videl? Vrav!\n<Adam>
items.translation: Hath you seen the Jew? Speak! \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Žida? Co, vy sce mu rodzina? Išol do kosceľa še zabarikadovac jak i cala dzedzina. Aľe ho peršeho odchycili a ho tryznia za mostom. Som mal vecej rozumoch a som opačny smer volil. Neblaznice ľudze, podzce se mnu! Neznam dokedy še vytrimu branic v kosceľu. Obliehaju ich. \n<Utečenec>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The Jew? Are you all kin to him? He went to the church to fortify it along with the entire village. But they caught him first and torment him beyond the bridge. I had more sense and chose the opposite direction. Flee with me, good people! I know not how long thy can defend the church. ‘Tis besieged.\n<Fugitive>

items.original: Poďme!\n<Adam>
items.translation: Let us be off! \n<Adam>

items.original: Moja chyža! MARHA! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: My abode! SHITE! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Mŕtvola.
items.translation: Corpse.

items.original: Sme ich riadne dobili, ale hore pri kostole sa ešte bojuje.\n<Rytier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We hath dealt them a heavy blow, but the battle still rages near the church. \n<Knight>

items.original: Mrchy jedne kultistické. Toľko hrôzy spôsobili.\n<Rytier>
items.translation: Wretched cultists! Such horrors hath they wrought. \n<Knight>

items.original: Postavíme baranidlo, kult sa má načo tešiť!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: We shall build a ram! The cult has a lot to look forward to. \n<Knight>

items.original: Už ich máme na lopatkách!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: We have them cornered. \n<Knight>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Väčšinu sme ich zahnali na útek do ich nory, už vieme, kde je vstup, ale bez baranidla sa tam nedostaneme. Dal som príkaz na stavbu. Spomedzi štrbín sa odtiaľ šíri podivný voňavý dym.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Most of them hath fled back to their lair, we now know its entrance, yet without a ram, we cannot breach it. I hath ordered its construction. Strange fragrant smoke emanates from within the crevices. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Netreba nič stavac, ich vydurime.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: We need no construction, we shall force them out. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Väčšinu sme ich zahnali na útek do ich nory, už vieme, kde je vstup, ale bez baranidla sa tam nedostaneme. Dal som príkaz na stavbu. Spomedzi štrbín sa odtiaľ šíri podivný voňavý dym.
\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Most of them hath fled back to their lair, we now know its entrance, yet without a ram, we cannot breach it. I hath ordered its construction. Strange fragrant smoke emanates from within the crevices. \n<Ďusi>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toto tu už nie je celkom človek, ale démon, ktorý spôsobil všetky vaše strasti!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, this creature is no longer of human kin, but a demon who hath wrought all our miseries! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Vyberte ten meč!
\n<Marek>
items.translation: Pull out the sword! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pľujem na teba, beštia! Za moje dve dietky!
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: I spit upon thee, foul beast! For the sake of my two offspring! \n<Villager>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pauli! \! Hahaha... chrk... pfuj... Ta ty... do mňa s dedinčanmi šutre rucaš? ...kto by bul povedal, že takto dopadneme.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Paula! Hahaha… cough... pthuy... Thou... dost thou pelt stones at me with the villagers? ...who would hath thought we would end up as such. \n<Marek>

items.original:
...
\n<Paula>
items.translation:
...
\n<Paula>

items.original:
To je tota bosorka, čo nam dzeci trovila! Upaľme babu hnusnu!
\n<Dedinčanka>
items.translation: 'Tis the witch who hath brought us calamity! Burn the vile woman! \n<Villager>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pali, veď to je tvoja žena!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali, she's thy wife! \n<Matej>

items.original:
To je ona! Upáliť tú sviňu! 
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: 'Tis she! Burn that swine! \n<Cottager>

items.original:
Hnusoba vyškerená!
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Accursed wretch! \n<Villein>

items.original:
Zahlušic! Zahlušic! Zahlušic!
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Kill! Kill! Kill! \n<Freeman>

items.original: Paula!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Paula!\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>TICHO! Padajte domov kravy dojiť, banda dosraná. Toto patrí pred súdny stolec a právoplatnú popravu a nie na hromadný lynč.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>SILENCE! Cease this tumult, ye peasants! This is not the place for mob justice, but for the halls of justice and the rightful executioner's hand. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Stichnite! Sedlač biedna! Toto je prípad pred súdny stolec, s vupočúvaním i s právnou popravou. Lynčovať sa môžete navzájom.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Quiet! Hold thy tongues, ye downtrodden serfs! This matter belongs before the court, with proper hearings and lawful judgment. Let not chaos rule. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Uhni ty fras, bo i ty dostaneš po hube! Si caly čas na rici sedzel, kym nam dzeci kapali!\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Away with thee, fool, lest thou meet thy end! Thou hast idled while calamity befell us all! \n<Villager>

items.original: Pali, odsekni jej hlavu! Za môjho brata!\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Pali, sever her head! For my brother! \n<Peasant>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Rychlo ju dobi! Šak nas ešči očaruje a budze čoro-moro. Zaš ľen švindľuje, dzivadzilko robi, jak bude mocť ta ťa uhryzne jak had.\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Quick, put her down! Lest she bewitch us anew and sow chaos. She deceiver, pretending. She could strike thee down like a serpent. \n<Ida>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No jistě, vodsekni ji hlavu, dyť tě bezbranného bodla dýkou, co si zapomněl?! Podívaj sa, jak hraje divadýlko zase, sa trase a plače, bublina sa jí z nosu nafukuje.\n<Kandich>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed, sever her head, for did she not stab thee when thou wert defenseless?! Look at her now, playing her pathetic theatre, trembling and weeping, a bubble forming from her nose. \n<Kandich>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zbav sa jej! Teraz plače, ale je to i tak iba divadielko! Povolá na nás nové monštrá, hneď ako sa otočíš chrbtom.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Be rid of her! Though she weeps now, 'tis all theater! She will summon new monsters upon us as soon as thou turnest thy back.\n<Man at arms>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jake divadylko, čo si slepy? Šak sa dogrcala od strachu, chudera. Neblazni, Pali, snaď nenechaš, žeby ju toti sedlaci zlynčovali. Krvi na rukách už maš dosc, so sektu je amen a bez nej ona nič už neporobi. Skusim nakecať dedinčanom, že bula zhypnotizovana i zdrogovana. Pošli ju het, s touto ženou ťa nič dobré nečaká.  
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation:
What theatre, art thou blind? She trembles... God, she even barfed. Full of fear, that poor soul. Do not be foolish, Pali, lest thou permit these peasants to take justice into their own hands. Thou hast enough blood on thy hands, the sect is finished, and without it, she can do naught. I shall try to convince the villagers that she was bewitched and drugged.
Send her away, for nothing good awaits thee with this woman.\n

items.original:
Pali, ty musíš vedieť, čo spraviť.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali, thou alone know what must be done. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Trimce šicke piču!\! Hovno sa do mňa vyznate, ja možem odpušťac, kemu chcem. Pauli, poď sa prejsť.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Begone, foul-mouthed wretches! Thou knowest naught of my heart's counsel. I may grant forgiveness to whomsoever I choose. Paula, come take a walk with me. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A co ty s ňu, ty koňu? Cebe ditky netrovila!\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <WordWrap>And what of thee, thou nag? 'Tis not thy children hast she bewitched! \n<Villager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Šak my jej odpuscime... kedz budze ležac skapata v jame.\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: We shall forgive her... when she lies cold in the grave. \n<Peasant>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kam ju berie? Stoj!\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Whither dost thou take her? Halt! \n<Freeman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pauli, ma ľubiš ešči dakus vobec? Ale mi už hutor pravdivo, bo ce zakolem tu na miesce.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Paula, dost ye still love me at all? But tell me not a lie, for I shall strike the down on the spot. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ja neviem... asi nie.\n<Paula>
items.translation: I doth not know... probably not. \n<Paula>

items.original: Uhm.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Mm-hmm. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Poďme naspäť, Pali... si zaslúžim smrť... len... keď mám hrozný strach. Nájdi si už inú ženu, ja ani nemám výčitky za to, čím si si kvôli mne prešiel.\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us return, Pali... I deserve death... only... when I am terribly afraid. Find thyself another woman, for I do not even hath regrets for what thou hast endured for me. \n<Paula>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Och...\! 
Ta... šak ja ci rozumim, tyž som sa staval k cebe jak farizeus... ale ľubim ce furt. Ta... kec ja ce milujem... a to nemožem zradic. By som si do konca života vyčital. Ale kedz ty mňa už ne, ta to asi inše... 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Oh... \!
Well... I understand ye, I hath behaved towards ye like a hypocrite... but I love ye still. Well... I say I love thee... and I cannot betray ye. I would reproach myself for it until the end of my days. But if ye no longer love me, that is a different happenstance... \n

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pali... čo ti mám na to povedať?\n<Paula>
items.translation: Pali... what am I to say to thee? \n<Paula>

items.original: Podz tadzi, ci ešči daco ukažem.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Cometh hither. I will show thee something. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Na druhý deň sa Matej, Vlado a Adam vrátili do mäsohradu spraviť omšu a vzniknutou svätenou vodou navždy uhasili horiace srdce Mäsohradu. Po týždni sa Matej rozlúčil s týmto krajom a odcestoval späť do Debrecína.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Upon the morrow, Matej, Vlado, and Adam did return into the Meat keep to perform the Mass, and with the hallowed water thus created, they did quench the burning hearts of the Meat keep forevermore. After a week, Matej bid farewell unto this land and journeyed back unto Debrecen.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zemepán Jozef spolu so židom nasledujúce roky mieru vo Felvídku venovali vynálezu knihtlače. Bohužial, predbehol ich Guttenberg o niekoľko rokov. Ich vynález sa preto neuchytil.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The lord Jozef along with the Jew in the following years of peace in Felvídek devoted themselves to the invention of the book press. Unfortunately, Gutenberg surpassed them by several years. Hence, their invention did not take hold.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Inkvizítor Adam bol poverený správou zemepánovho hradu, ale po roku sa mu cnelo za košickým ruchom. Hrad ponechal v správe odvážneho rytiera Ďusiho.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Inquisitor Adam was tasked with the management of the lord's castle, but after a year, he yearned for the hustle of Košice. The castle he left in the care of the brave knight Ďusi.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Richtár spolu s Valérom šikovne využili kontakty do Etiópie a z Felvídku vytvorili hlavný distribučný uzol pre rozvoz qahwahu do okolitých krajín. Felvídek prosperoval. Po rokoch sa o Felvídku rozprávalo ako o najtriezvejšom kraji široko-ďaleko. Pip Vlado dokonca predložil žiadosť do Vatikánu o povolenie pre svätú liturgiu s omšovým qahwahom miesto vína.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster, along with Valér, cunningly utilized their contacts in Ethiopia and established the main distribution hub for the delivery of qahwah to surrounding lands. Felvídek flourished. After years, Felvídek was spoken of as the most sober land far and wide. Priest Vlado even submitted a request to the Vatican for permission for the holy liturgy with qahwah instead of wine.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Po richtárovej smrti sa po okolí rozniesli desivé chýry o udalostiach vo Felvídku. Kraj potom pomaly spustol.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>After the burgmaster's death, dreadful rumors of events in Felvídek spread throughout the vicinity. The land then slowly declined.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Po rokoch služby na hrade Anička spísala pamäti na hrozivé udalosti vo Felvídku, čo vstúpilo do dejín ako Neuveriteľné udalosti na Felvídku roku pána 1451. Všeobecne sa to pokladá za vymyslený príbeh a postupne sa naň zabudlo.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>After years of service at the castle, Anička wrote memoirs about the dreadful events in Felvídek, which entered history as "The Unbelievable Events at Felvídek in the Year of Our Lord 1451." Generally, it is regarded as a fabricated tale, and gradually, it faded into obscurity.

items.original: <Wordwrap>O osude lupičky Idy sa mnoho nevie. Po krčmách však dlho chyrovala povera, že každého, kto sa kedysi pridal ku kultu Zurvana, Ida si ho nájde a zahluší.
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>
Little is known about the fate of the rogue Ida. However, a gossip lingered in the taverns for a long time that anyone who once joined the cult of Zurvan, Ida would find them and render them dead.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ako presne pokračoval príbeh Paliho, nik presne nevie. Jediné, čo je isté je, že Pali sa znova pridal do tiahnutí proti Osmanom na Balkáne.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>How precisely Pali's story continued, no one knows for certain. The only thing that is known is that Pali once again joined the struggle against the Ottomans in the Balkans.

items.original:
Už ste jej dohovorili?
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: Have thou talked to her yet? \n<Pip Vlado>

items.original:
Chlopi, už nemusice nič, asi som sa zaľubil. Tu mace lekvar a orechovicu.
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: Lads, thou needs not to do anything anymore, I think I fell in love. Here, take this jam and liquour. \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: Dostal si \c[14]lekvár\c[0] a \c[14]orechovicu\c[0].
items.translation: You received \c[14]jam\c[0] and \c[14]hazelnut liquour\c[0].

items.original:
Bude sveta žiť.
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: Blessed is the world. \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: Nuž.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Well.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vitajte, páni. Čo by som pre vás mohla spraviť?\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: Welcome, gentlemen. How may I be of service to you?\n<Neviestka>

items.original: Najviac nám pomôžeš, ak nám poradíš, kam mohol ísť farár.\n<Matej>
items.translation: The best way to help us is to tell us where the priest might have gone.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak to môžem ľahko. Vždy po naších stretnutiach chodí do kostola. Pripravuje kázeň na ráno. Nechcete radšej nejak inač pomôcť? Vyumývať by som ťa mohla, čo ty na to, rytieru?
\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That I can do it easily. He always goes to church after our meetings. He prepares a sermon for the morning. Is there nothing else you'd want me to do? I could wash you, what say you, knight? Once I'm through with you, they'll smell thee all the way to Pressburg .\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Čomu by ne? Patrilo by sa raz za čas pazuchy umyc.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hm, indeed, 'tis time. Ye couldst provide some good scrubbing. 'Tis been three days since I last changed my attire. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ja dohliadnem, aby všetko prebehlo v počestnosti.\n<Matej>
items.translation: I shall ensure that the entire process proceeds with utmost propriety. \n<Matej>

items.original: Jak dobre. Navoňany som jak sam papež.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: How good. I am perfumed like the Pope himself.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Aj sme ti trenky vyprali. Bude ti sviežo.\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: We also washed your undergarments. Your life will be fresh.\n<Neviestka>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Už ma to ďalej nebaví, Bože, toto som nechcela. Mám všetkého plné zuby. Už aby bola nedeľa.\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I don't like it anymore, God, I didn't want this. I'm fed up with everything. May it be Sunday already.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original:
Fíha, duchovenstvo aj šľachta, to k nám naraz často nevíta. 
Ako by som len vás mohla obslúžiť? Prišli ste si zaobcovať?\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By the saints, the clergy and the nobles both, such esteemed guests we seldom receive. How may I be of service to thee? Art thou come for revelry?\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: On nemôže. Má kvapavku.\n<Matej>
items.translation: He cannot. He hath the pox. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Maceju! Si nehvarel teraz, že ja mam sa s nimi rozpravať?! \!
A nemam.\!
I tak robotu mame teraz. Pipa hľadame, neznaš, kam mohol ujsc?\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Matej! Didst ye not say that I should converse with them now?! \!
And I doth not! \!
We hath other matters to attend to. We seek the priest, knowest ye where he might hath gone? \n

items.original: Tak asi do kostola, nie?\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: Perhaps to the church, perchance? \n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Hej, to by sme mohli skusic. A co to pil?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, we could try that. And what was he drinking? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Neviem, ale celkom dobre to chutí, sám si nosí tie kôstky.\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know not, but it tasted quite good. He often brings those little seeds with him.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Nechcete aspoň gate vyprať?\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Should I wash your undergarments, at least?\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: V bedni nejaké trenky tu sú, ale hľa! Medzi nimi \c[14]alpa\c[0] sa povaľuje.
items.translation: <WordWrap>In the chest, lie some undergarmnts, but lo! Among them lies \c[14]alpa\c[0]  wine.

items.original: V sude medzi kadejakým haraburdím \c[14]kaša\c[0] sa skrývala.
items.translation: In the barrel amidst various odds and ends, \c[14]porridge\c[0]  was concealed.

items.original: Podriememe? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Shall we snooze? \n<Pavol>

items.original: V nevestinci? Tak to v žiadnom prípade! \n<Matej>
items.translation: In a brothel? Never, under any circumstance! \n<Matej>

items.original: Fajne si zadriemal. Lepšie sa cítiš, sa ti zahojilo všetko.
items.translation: You've had a good nap. You're feeling better now, every wound has healed.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jaj, šak vlastne Matej zostal pri zemepanovi. Sa mi zdalo, že dajak je cicho.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, who am I asking? I completely forgot Matej stayed in the castle.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Chudinky dzivčata. Snaď sa im nič nestalo. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Poor little girls. Hope nothing bad happened to them. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Takto poľahko zaodetí nevojdeme nikam, a už vôbec nie do nevestinca!\n<Matej>
items.translation: We shall not venture forth lightly attired, least of all to the brothel!\n<Matej>

items.original: Pali! Do krčmy som s tebou šiel, ale do nevestinca ti vojsť nedovolím!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali! I accompanied thou to the tavern, but I won't let thee enter the brothel!\n<Matej>

items.original: Pali! Tolerujem ti všeličo, ale do nevestinca ti vojsť nedovolím!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali! I tolerate lots, but I won't let thee enter the brothel!\n<Matej>

items.original: A šak isto dačo sa tam mudro dozvieme. Poc het- \^ \n<Pavol>
items.translation: And we will certainly learn something of use there. Come now- \^ \n<Pavol>

items.original: NIE! \n<Matej>
items.translation: NO! \n<Matej>

items.original: Dobre šak.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Alright, alright.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
V mene Otca i Syna i Ducha Svätého. 
Keby ma tu uvideli otec Gejza, kožu by zo mňa zdrali.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. If Father Gejza were to see me here, he would flay the skin from my bones. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Še ukľudni, tu nijaky Gejza neni a tote dzifčatka by z cebe zdrali ľen rúcho tvoje.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Fret not, there be no Father Gejza, and these lasses would scarce lay a finger on ye, save to strip ye of ye clothes. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mysli na to, že ideme za pipom, svatym mužom. Šak to skoro jakeby na omšu si išol.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Consider that we are going after a priest, a holy man. 'Tis akin to attending Mass.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Tam je, farizeus jeden!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Lo, there he sits, that Pharisee. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pip! Z akého titulu tu sedíš? Tieto dievky máš chrániť pred diablom, miesto toho chodievaš sem diablovín sa na nich dopúšťať.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Priest! By what decree dost thou recline in this place? 'Tis thy duty to safeguard these maidens from the clutches of the devil, yet thou partakest in devilry alongside them. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A tá chuderka babuška, čo tri dni čakala na spoveď? Bol som poslaný arcibiskupom Gejzom vykonať audíciu tvojho pôsobenia v tomto Bohom zabudnutom kraji, ale teraz som nanajvýš sklamaný.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And what of the poor grandmother who languished three days awaiting confession? I was dispatched by Archbishop Gejza himself to scrutinize thy conduct in this forsaken realm, yet now I find myself sorely disillusioned. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo tak agresivne rušite moju kontemplaciu s qahwahom po milovani? Stara Anča? No ta to su mi novinky, aj vam sa priznala ako čura na hrob svojho švagra? Sa hnevala naňho, že si zobral jej sestru a ňe ju. Sa ukľudni, ma kľudne i vyruc zos carkvi, ale teraz mi daj pokoj svaty.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Why dost thou rudely intrude upon my solitude, with cups of qahwah after carnal indulgence? Old Anča, thou sayest? 'Tis news to mine ears. Did she, perchance, confess unto thee her curses upon her brother-in-law's grave? She bore resentment, for he took her sister and not herself. Rest assured, Thee can absolve me from the clutches of the church, but for now, I beseech thee, leave me to my peace.\n<Priest>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sprosták jeden! Vidím, že ani spovedné tajomstvo ti nie je sväté. A treba kráčať v asketických šľapajách Jána Krstiteľa. Čistá duša musí byť v harmónii s telesnou čistotou!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou art a fool! It appears that even the sanctity of the confessional holds no sway over thee. 'Tis imperative to tread the ascetic path of John the Baptist. A pure soul must walk in tandem with bodily purity! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Moja ric nech je čista. Ja tvrdim, že dokym nikemu neškodite, je Bohu najhorša choroba okliešťovať svoju slobodu. Dobrota by mala byť nadobudnuta slobodnym rozhodnutim, šicko ine je len pretvarka. Ja uražam Boha, že za ženami chodim? Šak tote zadky tiež On vytvoril.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let my ass be pure. I maintain that so long as one does no harm, God views the curtailment of one's freedom as the gravest offense. True kindness must spring forth from the free will, for all else is but a façade. Doth my pursuit of women offend the divine? Nay, for did not He fashion those very behinds? \n<Priest>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Svätá panenka Mária… Čítal si vôbec Nový zákon? Vieš, kto je Ježiš?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God above... Hast thou not perused the New Testament? Art thou acquainted with the teachings of our Lord, Jesus Christ. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Novy čo? Šak len toten jeden je už das tisic roky. Ja som v tom slaby, še nebars vyznam.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The 'New' what? I know only one Testament, the one that is a few millenniums old. I must confess, I am remiss in my studies. \n<Priest>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Smilstvo oslabuje tvoje svedomie, až kým celkom nezhnije. Ty tu vravíš o slobode, ale si len plaziacim sa otrokom hriechu, priviazaným k ženským nohám. Nemáš žiadnu slobodu. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Lust doth corrode the soul until it is naught but rot. Thou pratest of freedom, yet art but a servile thrall to sin, bound to the feet of women. Thou hast no freedom. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Priviazať sa k ženskym noham? Toto som ešči neskušal, ale... raz možno. Ale ne, šak neznaš, že najvecej si človek uživa veci, keď ku nim ne je priputany? Mysliš, že čemu nemam normalnu ženu, ktoru by som miloval, šak to konec radovankam.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Bound to a woman? 'Tis an experience I hath yet to encounter, but... mayhap someday. Yet know ye not that one savors life's pleasures most when not ensnared by them? Dost thou think I yearn for a virtuous wife to cherish? That, methinks, would mark the end of revelry. \n<Priest>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Sloboda znamená slobodu konať dobro. Ja ťa nechápem. Načo si v cirkvi, keď sa opovažuješ ohýbať jej pravidlá?!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>True freedom is the liberty to perform good deeds. Thy words confound me. Why doth thou prescribe to the church whilst daring to flout its precepts? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kvôli peniazom a tomuto ruchu. Keď som v ňom, ľudia sluchaju moje myšlienky. Šak celibat chujovina jak traky. Vidiš, že tu už toleruju i bordeľ v dedine, to je moja robota.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>For the coin and the sway it bestows. When ensconced within its walls, my thoughts carry weight. Celibacy is but a trifle, akin to tattered raiment. Dost thou not see? The village now harbors a brothel, and 'tis of my making. \n<Priest>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Už mám dosť tvojich heretických kecov! Rozrežem ťa, ty zver! Poď von sa biť!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I hath heard enough of thy heretical prattle! I shall cleave thee asunder, thou vile creature! Come forth and face me! \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobre, dobre! Už nekrič toľko. Keď prehrajem ferovku, dobrovoľne opustim cerkev, 
a keď neprehram, tak ma z nej nevykopneš. Spišeme zmluvu.
\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well, very well! Cease thy bellowing. Should I lose by fair means, I shall willingly vacate the church. Yet if victory be mine, thou shalt not cast me out. Let us make this pact. \n<Priest>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No, fararu. Maceja som takeho namosureneho ešte nevidzel.
Dufam, že dake svaly ti pri milovani narošli.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So be it, priest.  I hath never seen Matej so incensed before. Mayhaps ye gained muscles from that fornication. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Mlč aj ty. Tiež máš na rováši.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hold thy tongue, thou art as culpable as him. \n<Matej>

items.original: Vzácne panstvo, idem sa ešte vycikať.\n<Pip>
items.translation: Noble sirs, I shall take my leave to relieve myself. \n<Priest>

items.original: No ale hybaj!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Be off then! \n<Matej>

items.original: Maceju? Už še asi nevraci.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej? Methinks he shall not return. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pokakanec.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Coward. \n<Matej>

items.original: Kukaj tu ale, zostal tu toten napoj po ňom. Jak to nazval?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Behold, he hath left his drink untouched. What did he call it? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Qahwah? Mohli by sme sa na to povypytovať tuhľa dievčin. Možno, že niečo
o farárovi už vedia. \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Qahwah? We could inquire of these maidens. Perchance they possess knowledge of the priest's doings. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Rozprávaj sa s nimi ale radšej ty. Tak sú poľahko zaodeté, nehodno sa mi na ne dívať.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Then thou shalt converse with them, for 'tis unseemly for me to gaze upon their scantily clad forms. \n<Matej>

items.original: Pocme nakuknuc, isto daco sa fajne dzifčata od včera vyzistili. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us go and have a peek, mayhap something hath been gleaned by the pleasant maidens since yestereve. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Raz stačilo! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Once was sufficient! \n<Matej>

items.original: Hehehe, konečne ho nemam za zadkom. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hehehe, at long last, ye be not dogging my heels. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ahoj, žrebec. \n<Neviestka>
items.translation: Hello thy sirdom.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Maš chviľku času? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Might ye spare a moment? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Na teba kedykoľvek. \n<Neviestka>
items.translation: Any time for thee. \n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Zacahni firhangy, naj nekuka nikto. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Close the curtains, let noone see us. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jáájh jak fajne... \!ma vyumyvala. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oyy, how marveolous... \! was the bath. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Mno, caly deň zaš tam travic nebudzem. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Well, shall not be there all day. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Urodu budze treba zbirac, aľe cežko bez totych našich molodych. Šicke še na nas vysrali zvysoka. Človek to karmi caly život, od ustoch šebe odtrha a toto ma byc tota vďaka! Idzem šebe Joba čitac, bo ja už neznam co so sebu, zufaly som načisto. \n<Stráž>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, the crop must be gathered, yet 'tis hard without our young ones. They look down upon us. One feeds them, torn food from thy mouth, and this is to be our gratitude! I shall retreat to the Book of Job, for I know not what else to do, I am utterly despondent. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta čemu toto naš vaľal poscihlo? Ja znam, malo sme še modľeli, to pip je na vine šeckemu. On tu ľem sukne nahaňa, ja mu dam, vidli mu do rici pichnem!\n<Stráž>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And why hath our valley fallen into such disarray? I know, we've neglected our prayers, the priest the root of it all. He's the one chasing skirts here, I shall give him what-for, pitchfork up his backside. \n<Guardsman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mmm, by ma zajimalo, že dze toten žid je. Už das tyždzeň som ho nevidzel. Predtym ľem coška o ohni hutal, še pytal ľudzi, že či neznaju coška ľehke, co dobre hori… Som mu chcel taku vecičku vyšmelic, kedz som bul tesarčinu robic v Pešti, ta som pocahol od jednoho pana taku bars šumnu fajku i na nej piše "Azanyát".
\n<Vydriduch>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Methinks, where might that Jew be? 'Tis been a fortnight since I last laid eyes on him. Before, only fire on his mind, he asked folk if they knew of anything light that burns well... I wanted to procure such a thing for him, when I was in Buda, I snatched a pipe from a gentleman, and upon it was inscribed 'Azanyát. \n<Freeman>

items.original: Neznam, co to v totej hatlanine znači, asi že fajka.\n<Vydriduch>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know not what that gibberish signifies, likely 'tis something like a "pipe". \n<Freeman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ci pana, ty ši bars šumny. Nechočeš isc poza bučky se mnu? By sme šebe pexeso zabaveli. Bublaninu som napekla, možem zobrac, co ty na to hutoriš? Možeš i kamarata zobrac, nedbam.
\n<Dedinčanka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oy, thou art quite boisterous. Wouldst thou not venture beyond with me? We could amuse ourselves with some game. I hath baked a bublanina; perhaps thou wouldst care to join? Thou mayest bring a friend, I care not. \n<Cottager>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj, kdeže toten moj parobok zas čavarguje, cale dni ho nevidzim. A susedovie Mariša tyž zmizla kdeškai! Jaj, veruže pip by mali coška o tom hutoric na omši, do duše vstupic! Aľe kejc on tyž po čartoch ďabloch še flaka! Ryba šmerdzi od hlavy, zato to s našim vaľalom do marišky cale idze!
\n<Dedinčanka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, where hath my apprentice gone again, not seen him all day. And neighbor Anička has vanished too! Oh truly, the priest ought to speak of these matters at Mass, to cleanse souls! But when he too dallies with devil's tricks! The fish stinks from the head, 'tis all heading to hell with our folk! \n<Villein>

items.original: Vaľer! Nemaš nam jednu tuniku požičať?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Vaľer! Doth ye hath a spare tunic. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali, aj tak by nám nesadli. Veď je to trpaslík.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali,'Tis wouldts not fit, For he be a dwarf. \n<Matej>

items.original: Valer, poc von. Zname co robiš!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Valer, come forth. We know what ye're up to! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nesom doma.\n<Valer>
items.translation: I am not home.

items.original: Kúpime zrno od teba. Na cene isto sa dohodneme.\n<Matej>
items.translation: We seek to purchase beans from thee. Let us negotiate a fair price. \n<Matej>

items.original: ...\n<Valer>
items.translation: ...\n<Valer>

items.original: Šak še nehaňbi. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Do not fret, do not be shy. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Márna snaha, obávam sa. \n<Matej>
items.translation: A fruitless endeavor, methinks. \n<Matej>

items.original: Rozdzigam už tote dvere!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Demolish this door I will!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Sa nacahovac zos každym malym geňom vof totej dzedzine! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Loose time with every little creep in the village! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Kľud, Pali, čo ti hrabe už tiež? Šak okno rozbi, keď už! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Peace, Pali, such rage befell you. Here, break the window perchance! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jaj... Boha s tymi malymi oknami, še cez to neprepcham! Vaľer! Vaľer, ty kifľik! Takoj otvor! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Argh... To hell with these little windows, I can not push through!  Vaľer! Vaľer, ye little scamp! Open at once! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ani Bohovi. \n<Valér>
items.translation: Not a chance. \n<Valér>

items.original: Šak ty dočkaj. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Just ye wait. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Poc von, Valer!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Step forth, Valer! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Možnaj, že fakt neni doma.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Mayhaps he speaks true, and his dwelling remains vacant. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zaprete dvere.
items.translation: Locked door.

items.original: Pasoval mlynárov kľúč do tohoto zámku.
items.translation: The miller's key fit into this lock.

items.original:
Bitka tam je, poďme!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: A skirmish brews within, let lend aid! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Kdeže bitka, poď potichu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Not a skrimish, come softly now. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Panebože, však dvaja polonahí chlapi tu spolu tancujú! Také čosi som iba raz v kláštore v Debrecíne videl.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God..., behold! Two barely-clad men, engaged in a curious dance! Such a spectacle I witnessed but once, within the halls of a Debrecen monastery. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ci pana, ta toto nam nikto neuveri. Macej, chytaj tužku a krešli, naj mame dokazovy material.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By God, none shall believe our tale sans evidence. Matej, take quill in hand and sketch, we must secure proof. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Namojdušu Maceju, to jak žive! Mňa dakedy nenakrešliš?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By the saints, Matej, 'tis remarkably lifelike! Might ye render me thus someday? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
To je len taká skicka. Vedel by som to lepšie spraviť.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: 'Tis but a rudimentary sketch. I could execute it with more finesse. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Každopádne... Aničke môžeme ísť povedať, že už na svojho milého čakať nemusí.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nevertheless... we may apprise Anička that her paramour awaits her no more. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Ešte totych dvoch zrafame a odvlečieme do areštu. Kultisti dvojo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And these two miscreants we shall seize and incarcerate forthwith, both being adherents of the cult. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vy gluptaci dvojo. Že ti hanby nit, Matúš. Zanevrec na take dzifče dobre. Tam čeka na cebe das pol dňa. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ye doltish pair! What shame doth befall ye, Matúš? Forsake such a maid, for she hath awaited ye these many hours. \n<Pavol>

items.original: V sude bola \c[14]alpa\c[0].
items.translation: In the barrel, there was \c[14]alpa\c[0].

items.original: Sudovitý sud.
items.translation: Barrel-like barrel.

items.original: V bedni našiel si malinový \c[14]lekvár\c[0]. Ročník 1449.
items.translation: In the crate, you found raspberry \c[14]jam\c[0]. Vintage 1449.

items.original: V sude je len dažďová voda.
items.translation: In the barrel, there is only rainwater.

items.original:
Pšenička še meľe meľe. 
\n<Mlynár>
items.translation: The millstone grinds away, grinds away. \n<Miller>

items.original:
Pane, hľadáme tvojho syna.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Sir, we seek thy son. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Vy ste chuje z tej sekty?
\n<Mlynár>
items.translation: Art thou ruffians from that accursed cult? \n<Miller>

items.original:
Nie, my sme od zemepána.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Nay, we come from milord. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Aha, co zas vyviedol ten zasran? Robotu flaka a do noci čavarguje, idzte za nim, asi je ešči vo veži, na poschodi spi, tu mace kľuče. A dajte mu za mňa zo dve vychovne, naj še spamäta.
\n<Mlynár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, what mischief hath that scoundrel wrought now? He shirks his work and carouses until the dead of night. Go fetch him, he is likely still in the tower, asleep on the upper floor. Here, take the keys. And give him a good thrashing on my behalf, mayhap it shall bring him to his senses. \n<Miller>

items.original: Mlynár ti dal \c[14]kľúč\c[0] od veže.
items.translation: Miller gave you \c[14]key\c[0] to the tower.

items.original:
Syna mojho sce už stretli? Tam vof veži isto spi na poschodi.
\n<Mlynár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hast thou encountered my son yet? He surely slumbers on the upper floor in the tower. \n<Miller>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mlynaru, syna si daj do richtu. Neznam jak si ho vychovaval, že taky galgan z neho.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Miller, discipline ye son. I know not what manner of upbringing hath wrought such unruliness. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jak som bola mladá, som myslela, že to špinavé prádlo stačí raz očistiť a pokoj. Nie, že do nekonečna sa bude špiniť.\n<Dedinčanka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>When I was young, I thought it was enough to clean the dirty laundry once and be calm. Not that it will get dirty forever.\n<Villager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ty ši Maja? Sme ci prišli pomocť zbalic Vlada, naj še dakus ukľudni. Kejc nevytrime v celibate, ta aspoň naj nechodzi do burdeľu a normalnu ma ženu. Neznaš, co on ľubi?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ye art Maja? We're here to help you seduce Vlado, may he calm down. If he cannot be content in celibacy, may he at least have a good wife and not frequent the brothel. Don't ye know what he likes?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ja kašlem naňho už, keď ma nechce... no... ale on má rád umenie. Keby ste mi doniesli nejaký obraz, možno ho to obmäkčí.\n<Maja>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>To hell with him if he doesn't want me... well... but he likes art. If you bring me a painting, it might soften him up.\n<Maja>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chlopi, Vecheť je moje meno, podzce nam pomocť, topia Ňumu! Še ku vam i pridam i šecko zrobim co chcete, len ho zaratujme.
\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Good folk, I am Dick, and I beseech your aid! They are drowning Weenie! I will join you and do whatever you ask, just let us save him.\n<Dick>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nie! Nie, nie, nie! Nebite ma, prosím, vzdám sa Zurvana, všetko spravím pre vás, len ma nebite!
\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nay! Nay, I pray thee, spare me! I renounce Zurvan, I'll do aught for thee, only spare me! \n<Dick>

items.original: Šak my zname, že še ho vzdaš. Stači ce kus na škripci ponacahovac. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We know ye wilt renounce him. A little pressure on the rack shall do. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pocme ho zemepanovi ukazac.  \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us present him to the lord. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Do temnice-kamenice s ním, tam biť ho budú. \n<Matej>
items.translation: To the dungeon with him, where he shall face his judgment . \n<Matej>

items.original: Poďte, poďte! Bo oni ho domaruju uplne!\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: Come forth, come forth!  They wilt surely end him! \n<Dick>

items.original: Maceju! Co ši še pojašil? Jemu pomahac chceš, šak to jasny kultista! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej! What madness hath befallen ye?  Doth ye wish to aid him? 'Tis clearly a cultist! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Veď práve! Obalamutíme ho, bude si myslieť, že sme jeho spojenci. Isto nás potom zavedie k svojmu veliteľovi. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed! Let us confuse him, that he may deem us his allies. Surely then shall he lead us to his commander. \n<Matej>

items.original: Jáj, jasne. Rozumim. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ah, aye. I understand. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Koukej, ryba se neumí nadechnout na vzduchu. Dej ji zpátky, neubližuj ji, Honziku! Nebuď debil, spusť to lano dolů! 
\n<Husita>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Behold, a fish cannot breathe in the air. Return it forthwith, do not harm it, Honziku! Do not be foolish, lower the rope! \n<Hussite ruffian>

items.original: Tak co, rybo, zříkáš se hereze a přijímáš křest?\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: So, fish, dost thou renounce heresy and accept baptism? \n<Hussite pillager>

items.original: Nikdy sa nevzdám Zurvana!\n<Ňúma>
items.translation: I shall never renounce Zurvan! \n<Weenie>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak ať se ti daří, snad ti dorostou ty ty... Honzo, co mají ty rybičky?\n<Husita>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So be it. May fortune favor thee. Mayhaps thee shal grow back the… the…  Honzo, what do the fishes hath? \n<Hussite ruffian>

items.original: Já nevim, doprdele, asi šupiny nebo co, ty vole. Ploutve.\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: I know not, by God, perhaps scales or such, ye mother… Fins. \n<Hussite pillager>

items.original: Na dýchání myslím, debile!\n<Husita>
items.translation: I spoke of their breathing, thou fool! \n<Hussite ruffian>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dyť ryby nedejchaj, vole, seš úplně mimo, nebo co? Voni jen tak jako snědí vodu a z ní maj ty ty. Vole, živiny, nebo co.
\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But fish doth not breathe, ye mother… Art thou completely daft? They merely hath eat water ang get those... ye mother… nutrients or what of it, ye mother… \n<Hussite pillager>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Slava Isusu Christu. Rád vidím svatú inkvizicu pži pžáci. Móžeme vas pozorovati, jakže sa to dělá? 
\n<Matej>
