items.translation: <Wordwrap>Praise be to Jesus Christ. I am gratified to witness the sacred inquisition in action. Might we observe how 'tis done? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Když se chceš dívat na proces inkvizični, moh' bys nám sem přinýst ňákou hezkou šťabajznu, to víš, bez pořádný bosorečky to není vopravdická inkvizice.
\n<Husita>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>When ye wish to observe an inquisition process, bring us some fine maidens, ye know, without a proper wench, 'tis not a true inquisition. \n<Hussite ruffian>

items.original: A se mnu by ši še nechcel pomarovac? Ric mam statnu jak kobyla. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And dost ye not wish to join me for some merry-making? I reckon I hast a sturdy rear like a mare. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pohlednej seš, ale raději bych měl toho kňeze, ať to je všechno v harmonickém souladu s láskou boží. Co, hezoune?
\n<Husita>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou art comely, but I would prefer the monk, so that all is in harmonious accord with the love of God. What sayest thou, fair one? \n<Hussite ruffian>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Boha, Maceji, to už še neda počuvac. Som čekal, že še vyprovokuju, marne. Idzem ich dorubac.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God, hath mercy, Matej, this is unbearable. I hath expect provocation in vain. Let us decimate them! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Chlope, zober nas ku svojim kumpanom. Še chceme pridac ku vam.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Peasant, lead us to ye companions. We wish to join ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: To nemôžem!\n<Ňúma>
items.translation: I will not!\n<Weenie>

items.original: Pali, spusť ho naspäť do potoka.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali, release him, back into the river with him. \n<Matej>

items.original: Už nie! Ideme za nimi. \n<Ňúma>
items.translation: Naught anymore! I shall thake thee. \n<Ňúma>

items.original: Heslo?\n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Password? \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Qahwah nad hlavou. \n<Ňúma>
items.translation: Qahwah over head. \n<Weenie>

items.original: Poďte dnu.\n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Enter. \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ňuma, Vecheť! Vy mantaci! Šak to mace zakazane sem vodzic ľudzi.\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: Weenie, Dick! Ye scoundrels! 'Tis forbidden to bring folk hither. \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: Holy život mi zachranili! \n<Ňúma>
items.translation: They saved my life! \n<Weenie>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Parťaka mace oddaneho, radšej volil šmerc, jak še vzdac teho vašeho Zurvana. Chlapi, šak kľud, sme na vašej strane.  
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thy comrade is steadfast; he chose the abyss over forsaking ye Zurvan. Fear not, good sirs, we stand with ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ano, ano! Husiti nas tryznili a tito nas zachranili.\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, aye! The Hussites tormented us, yet these souls came to our aid. \n<Dick>

items.original: Daco už sce mi našli? Začina už mi zima byc. \n<Holy dzedo>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Found anything? I'm starting to shiver. \n<Butt naked man>

items.original:
Hľa, máme o halenu viac, než sami využijeme. Kľudne si ju zoberte. Nech vám slúži dobre. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We possesseth a tunic in surplus to our needs. Taketh it. Mayhap it doth serve thee well.\n<Matej>

items.original:
Joj ta vam ďakujem, žena by mi das mešac nedala, keby som sa bez gačoch vracil
i calej dzedzine by som bul na pošmech. Tu mace, o dajaku prilbicu na dne som
s nohu zavadzil, kym som vas čekal.\n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh, thank you! My wife would evade me for a month, had I come home naked. The whole town would mock me. Here, take this helmet I stumbled upon while waiting for ye. \n<Butt naked man>

items.original: Od deda si dostal \c[14]starú helmu\c[0] tvarom pripomínajúcu vajco.
items.translation: You were given an egg shaped \c[14]old helmet\c[0].

items.original: Tu maš Maceji, tebi šedzi. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej, take it. Will fit ye for sure.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej dzedku, še nehambice tu s holu ricu čavargovac? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hey! Old fellow! Dost ye not feel shame, prattiling around all undressed?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Zľutujce še chlopi. Dokym som rozjimal vof vodze jakašky pankharti mi nohavky 
čorkli. Še haňbim tepir do dzedziny vracic, stara mi novu halenu na jarmarku 
zehnala. Jak zisti, že som ju stracil ma rozneše v zuboch. \n<Holy dzedo>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Have mercy, merry men. While I contemplated in the water, some rascals took my hosen. Ashamed I am to go into the town like this. My lady just bought me a new attire; she will tear me appart when she finds out I lost it already.\n<Butt naked man>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hľa, máme o halenu viac, než sami využijeme. Kľudne si ju zoberte. Nech vám slúži dobre. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We possesseth a tunic in surplus to our needs. Taketh it. Mayhap it doth serve thee well.\n<Matej>

items.original:
Joj ta vam dakujem, žena by mi das mešac nedala, keby som sa bez gačoch vracil
i calej dzedzine by som bul na pošmech. Tu mace, o dajaku prilbicu na dne som
s nohu zavadzil, kym som vas čekal.\n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh, thank you! My wife would evade me for a month, had I come home naked. The whole town would mock me. Here, take this helmet I stumbled upon while waiting for ye. \n<Butt naked man>

items.original:
Zľutujce še chlopi. dokym som rozjimal vof vodze jakašky pankharti mi nohavky 
čorkli. Še haňbim tepir do dzedziny vracic, stara mi novu halenu na jarmarku 
zehnala. Jak zisti, že som ju stracil ma rozneše v zuboch. \n<Holy dzedo>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Have mercy, merry men. While I contemplated in the water, some rascals took my hosen. Ashamed I am to go into the town like this. My lady just bought me a new attire; she will tear me appart when she finds out I lost it already.\n<Butt naked man>

items.original:
Dobre dedko, niečo vám prinesieme. Len choďte nazad do vody nech tu dajakú 
počestnú starenu šľak netrafí. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Good fellow, we shall bring thee something. Just go back to the water so that no honorable old dame may stumble upon thee here.\n<Matej>

items.original: Taky dzedo holoprd tu bul včera. Neznaju už toti ľudze z obce co so sebu. \n<Ozbrojenec>
items.translation: <WordWrap>There was an old naked man here yesterday. Truly, the townfolk is going insane. \n<Highwayman>

items.original: Co tady chcete? \n<Husita>
items.translation: What do you want here? \n<Hussite Ruffian>

items.original: Nič, sme prišli len kuknuc, co porabate. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Not much, only came to see you at work. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Vodu naberam. \n<Občan>
items.translation: I came for water. \n<Villager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Možem osrac caleho Zurvana i zos kultom! Nas obalamucili! Furt, že na husitoch idzeme, furt, že budze pokuj v kraju. A teraz nam kažu vlastnych marovac. Veľo ich šlo, ale ja nesom glupy, nejdzem nikam.\n<Kultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Curses upon Zurvan and his accursed cult! We've been hoodwinked! Constantly told we'd be marching against the Hussites, bringing peace to the realm. Yet now they've turned us against our own brethren. Many hath heeded their call, but I'm not so easily led astray. \n<Cultist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ja som netušila, že nás pošlú proti našim. Sľubovali, že proti husitom vyrazíme! Už keď sme otrávili pár ľudí z dediny, nepozdávalo sa mi to. Tvrdili však, že inač to nepôjde. Teraz však už im neverím, prečo musíme podpáliť dedinu? Nejdem vlastnú rodinu vraždiť!\n<Kultistka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I never imagined they'd send us to fight against our own kindred. They promised wilt be rallying against the Hussites! But when they ordered us to poison a few souls in the village, it doth not sit well with me. They claimed it was necessary. Now, however, I no longer place my trust in their words. Why must we raze the village? I refuse to spill the blood of my own kin! \n<Cultist>

items.original: V truhle ani prt.
items.translation: Not even a fart within the chest.

items.original: Za dveramy je \c[14]luk\c[0] a šípy.
items.translation: Behind the doors you found \c[14]bow\c[0] and arrows.

items.original: Dobrý deň. \n<???>
items.translation: Greetings. \n<???>

items.original: Panabeka, ja vidzim dvojito! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Panabeka, I see double! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nevidíš dvojito, brat môj nešťastný, jeho dvi sn sú totiž zrastené dvojčatá. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nay, thou seest not double, my hapless brother. His two sons are joined as one, twinned by fate. \n<Matej>

items.original: Co?! Pane Kriste na nebesiach, panenko Maria ochraňuj me. Dze mam meč?! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What?! Lord Christ in heaven, Virgin Mary protect me. Wherefore is my sword? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Što, jakij mič bis hľedal?! To sut mi dvi sn'! Hrušk' jiďat! Sn' hrušk' ľubit jisti! Tipir musm hrušk' zavarati do noči, žeby maľ jem do zimy! I hruškovu paľinku dam kvasiti.
\n<Marian>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What art thou seeking with such urgency?! These are my two sons! Pear devourers! They delight in feasting upon pears! Today, I must preserve pears until nightfall, that we may hath sustenance for winter! And I shall set pear brandy to ferment.\n<Marian>

items.original: To nie je príšera, ale choroba. Zriedkavo sa narodia takéto deti! \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is not a monster, but an unusual condition. Rarely are children born thus. \n<Matej>

items.original: Panenko skakava. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Virgin Mary aid us. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Dajak barz bľuvno mi. Toto ne je normalne, co ja tu vidzim!
Macej poc se mnu het, šak ja še bojim jak fras! \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Somehow I feel queasy. This is not normal, what I am witnessing here! Matej, stand by me, for I am as fearful as a child! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Anciaša. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Anciaša.\n<Pavol>

items.original: V sude sú slivky
items.translation: Glob. \n<Monster>

items.original: V bedni plno proviantu
items.translation: God, another creature. How many children hath this lad spawned? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobrý deň. \n<Dvojčatá>
items.translation: Greetings. \n<Marian’s children>

items.original: V mene Zurvanovom. Čo chcete? Žiadanku máte?\n<Okultista>
items.translation: In Zurvan's name. What seek ye? Have ye a writ? \n<Cultist>

items.original: Jaku žiadanku? Ty co ši zač?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What writ? What manner of thing art ye? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Žiadanku na zbrane! Nič vám nepovedali, do riti Paľovej? Keď máte podpísanú žiadanku, môžem vám za ne vydať matroš miesto peňazí.\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A writ for arms! Know ye naught, simpletons? Once a writ be sealed, I may furnish ye with goods instead of coin. \n<Cultist>

items.original: Jak ši ošľepol?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Art ye blinded? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mal to byť rituál, pri ktorom výmenou za oči získam od Zurvana vnútorný zrak. Ale sa nepodarilo. Nuž, teraz tu robím skladníka.\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>'Twas meant to be a ritual, wherein for eyes, I'd be granted inner sight by Zurvan. But it did not succeed. Hence, I now labor as a storekeep. \n<Cultist>

items.original: V mene Zurvanovom. Čo chcete?\n<Okultista>
items.translation: In Zurvan's name. What seek ye? \n<Cultist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Možem to tu cale osrac. Sľubili nam, že vyženieme husitoch z chotara. Miesto toho na rodnu dedinu nas nutili zautočiť. Kto neušiel hneď, zomrel. Zostali už len mutanti.\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Could bloody well curse this entire place. Promised we wouldst drive the Hussites from our lands. Instead, they forced us to attack our own village. Those who doth not flee met their end. Only mutants remain. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dajakeho pajaca. Vieš čo, pustim ťa k nemu, je mi to fuk. \n<Okultista>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Some bloody fool. Know what, I let thee through to him, matters not to me. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

items.original: Nezabijajte ma, prosim. \n<Okultista>
items.translation: Spare me, I beg. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

items.original: Nachádzame sa v Mäsohrade. \n<Okultista>
items.translation: We art in the Meat Keep. \n<Cultist>

items.original:
Boha, to co za prerasceny jaščur? Caly som zamľazgraveny z ňoho, do pyska!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: God, what kind of blasted lizard is this? Covered in slime from head to toe! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Z toho si nič nerob, rýchlo sa to vstrebe do pokožky. \n<Okultista>
items.translation: Fret not, 'twill seep into thy skin soon enough. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

items.original:
Čo za streštenosť má byť ten vstup?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: What madness is this entrance? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kedysi to býval Komár, tak ho volali v celej obci. Bol dosť otravný, tak sa nám aj uľavilo, že prijal túto formu existencie. U nás každý nájde svoje pravé miesto. Poskytuje nám útočisko, rozsrastá sa podľa rozkazov. Kŕmime ho zapichnutím ľudí do zeme, potom ich polievame qahwah. Aj teraz stojíme na Komárových črevách. \n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Once ‘twas named Komár, 'tis what they called him throughout the village. He was rather bothersome, so we were relieved when he assumed this form of existence. Here, everyone finds their true place. It provides us sanctuary, expanding as commanded. We feed it by impaling people into the ground, then dousing them with qahwah. Even now, we stand upon the Komár's bowels. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

items.original:
Fantazija. Idzem dakych kultistov tam tyž šturic.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Fanciful. I wilt be off to skewer some cultists hither as well. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Preboha! Kde sme sa to ocitli?.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Oh my God! Where are we?\n<Matej>

items.original:
Maceju, cahaj! Ty za jednu nohu, ja druhu berem.\!
Raz... dva...\!
Hej rup!!!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Matej, lend a hand! Thou takest one leg, and I shall grasp the other! \!
One... two... \!
Heave-ho!!! 
\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ojh. Chlapi, diky.\n<?>
items.translation: Oh. Lads, thanks be to thee.\n<?>

items.original: Brat môj, hrozné súženie si musel prekonať. Prezraď mi, kto že si? \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My brother, thou must hath endured terrible suffering. Reveal to me, who art thou? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Feri som. Slnko som nevidel už celé dni, aký je deň? Pár hodín dozadu ma sem zapichli. Hlava ma boli jak delo, krvi sa mi nalialo do nej.\n<Feri>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am Feri. I hath not beheld the sun for days. What day be it today? A few hours past, they impaled me hither. \n<Feri>

items.original:
Chlape, pretrpel si si dosc. Poc s nami.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Man, you've suffered enough. Come join us. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]Feriho\c[0].
items.translation: You acquired \c[14]Feri\c[0].

items.original: Potrava pre mäsohrad.
items.translation: Food for meat keep.

items.original:
A! tento šklbol sebou... či, nie vlastne. 
\!Potrava pre mäsohrad.
items.translation:
Oh! This one twitched... wait. Did not.
\!Food for meat keep.

items.original: Checheche...\n<Marek>
items.translation: Hehehe...\n<Marek>

items.original: Čo sa rehlíš, ty monštrum!\n<Adam>
items.translation: What art thou gawking at, thou monster! \n<Adam>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Marek! Vzdaj to! Še ci caly kult rozpadnul! Totych par, co prežilo, už na cebe z vysoka seru! Ce rozdzigame na maderu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Marek! Surrender! Ye cult is crumbling! Those few who survived now look down upon ye! We shall burn ye at the stake. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chichichúúú... ma rozdzigajúúúú. Ši čula, Anča? Už znam, že ty ši tota zradkyňa! Angra mainyu vo mne všetko vidí, všetko číta ako cez sklo, šeckemu rozumim.Matej, ja znam, že ju chceš! "A... dávaj si pozor, Anička!" Chechty. I kedz ši taky mnišok. Ta kukaj tu jak ju roztarham!\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hehehehe... thee burning meeee. Didst thou hear, Anča? I know thou art the traitor! Angra Mainyu within me sees everything, reads all like through glass, I understand everything. Matej, I know thou dost desire her! "And... take care, Anička!" Laughable. Even though thou art but a monk. Look here how I tear her apart! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nieeeeeeee!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Noooooo! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chichichúúú... ma rozdzigajúúúú. Angra Mainyu vo mne všetko vidí, všetko číta ako cez sklo, šeckemu rozumim. Ši čul, Feri? Znam, že si už mal byc po šmerci, ale oni ce zachranili! Chechty. Ta kukajte tu jak ho roztarham!\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hehehehe... thee burning meeee. Angra Mainyu within me sees everything, reads all like through glass, I understand everything. Didst thou hear, Feri? I know thou shouldst hath been dead by now, but they saved thee! Laughable. Look at them how I tear him apart! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Feri! Nieeee!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Feri! Nooooo! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chichichúúú... ma rozdzigajúúúú. Angra mainyu vo mne všetko vidí, všetko číta ako cez sklo, šeckemu rozumim. \n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hehehehe... thee burning meeee. Angra Mainyu within me sees everything, reads all like through glass, I understand everything. \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Co chcece tu ešči, paľce do Marie. Neskoro sce došli, lofasi! Jamu do pekla už sme stihli vykopať! Som nesmrteľnym ďablom!\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What dost thou still want here, thou wretch? Too late hath ye come, fools! We've already dug the pit to hell! I am an immortal demon! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nesmrteľny? Bic ho možeme i tak, ne?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Immortal? We can still trash and beat ye, can we not? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
To je ten Turek! S ním som debatil večer v krčme.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: 'Tis the Turk! I conversed with him yesternight at the tavern. \n<Matej>

items.original: Osem hodín tu ležím... som len bafkal shishu, úplne som vynervovaný. \n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I been lying here eight hours... just puff on shisha, all with nerves. \n<Ottoman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Čo máš s týmto celým dočinenia? Ak nám budeš klamať, hrozí ti smrť, som inkvizítor Adam z Kassau.
\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What business hast thou in all this? Shouldst thou deceive us, death awaits thee. I am Inquisitor Adam of Kassau. \n<Adam>

items.original: Len ma prosím vyslobodťe.\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: I beseech, set me free. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Moje pravé meno je Hasan Bey. Som agent sultána Murada II. Bol som vyslaný ako špeh za účelom podvratnej činnosti, plán bol zneužiť mýtus spotvorenej podoby mazdaismu. Lákať vašich ľudí a presviedčať ich k rebélii, živiť ďalšiu uhorskú vnútornú krízu.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My true name Hasan Bey. I agent of Sultan Murad II. I dispatch as a spy for nefarious purpose, aiming to exploit myth of distorted form of Mazdaism. To allure folk and sway to rebellion, stir further turmoil within Hungary. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kráľovský edikt, ktorý mi umožňuje prebývať v hornom Uhorsku je falzifikát, ale podplácame vašu šľachtu a niekoľkých palatínov, takže správy a nenápadné snahy richtára o riešenie situácie ostávajú nevypočuté. Lenže celé sa mi to vymklo spod kontroly.  
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The decree grant residence in Upper Hungary is forgery, yet bribe nobility and several palatines, the burgmaster's report and attempt to resolve situation remain unheard. Yet, it hath all spiral out my control. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Títo moji malí falošní zurvanisti získali prepojenie na perzskú odnož. Podcenil som Marekove styky z minulosti s Arménskom, sú stále aktívne, podmanil si tam vtedy istého Ibn al Chajjáma a vedie s ním korešpondenciu.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>These my small false Zurvanist gain connection to Persia branch. I underestimate Marek's past connection with Armenia, they still active. He subdu Ibn al-Chajjám there and correspond with him. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ten Chajjám im poslal tajné verše k rituálu a mystickú čarovnú lampu, v ktorej prebýval uväznený Ahriman po prehranom boji s legendárnym Faramarzom, synom Rostamovym, ako sa píše v spisoch Shahnamehu. S Ahrimanovou mocou mi začali prerastať cez hlavu. 
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Chajjám send secret verse for rituals and mystical magic lamp, in which Ahriman  imprisoned after lost battle with legendary Faramarz, son of Rostam, as written in the Shahnameh. Rimanská power they began outgrow control. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A myslíte si, že Sultán tu má agentov a Uhorsko je nevinné? Nejaké špehúňky sa nájdu aj v sultánovom háreme, nejakej sa asi zase chvastal o plánoch na severe, Hunyady potom správu rozposlal richtárom po Felvídku a zrejme nejak cez neho sa kult dozvedel pravdu o mne a o reálnom zmysle svojej existencie.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou believe that the Sultan agents here, and Hungary innocent? There will spies even in Sultan's harem. Someone must boasted about plans in north. Hunyady later dispatch message to the burgmasters across Felvidék, and through him, the cult learn the truth about me and real purpose of they existence. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Richtár to prezradil Ignácovi. V jeho zápisníku sa totiž písalo "stretnutie ohľadom dohody s Ric". Pali to následne vyvrieskal Paule v krčme a tá to povedala Marekovi, bol som pri tom ako zajatec.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster hath revealed it to Ignác. In the ledger, it hath been written 'meeting regarding a deal with Ric'. Pali hath blurt it out to Paula in the tavern, and she hath told Marek. I hath been there as a captive. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nuž a zároveň sa stali nezávislými od môjho organizovania dodávok qahwahu. To bola zase raz Ignácova robota, predstavte si, že ten blázon rozdrapený dal normálne spáchať atentát na vodcu Estefanitov v ďalekej Etiópii, aby sa nástupcom stal ním podmazaný farár, ktorý nedbal na dohody so mnou. 
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, they become independent from mu organization of qahwah supplies. That be again Ignác's doing. Imagine, madman actually orchestrate assassination on leader of Estefanites in distant Ethiopia, so the successor be greased-up priest who disregard agreements with me. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šikovný ten Ignác, mal talent, ale nerátal, že do jeho dômyselných plánov vletíte ako hovno do pavučín. Moja posledná nádej bola, že Ignác sa definitívne rozháda s tými pojašenými okultistami a vyhlási im vojnu, v poslednom čase to medzi nimi poriadne iskrilo. 
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Clever that Ignác, had talent, yet he no count on thee barging onto elaborate schemes like a shite into spider's web. My last hope be that Ignác would definitively fall out with those cultists and declare war on them, lately there be quite some friction between them.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No ako som spomínal, pravda o mne sa dostala k Marekovi a stal som sa pre nich nepriateľom číslo jeden. 
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>As I mention, the truth about me reach Marek, and I become enemy one number to them. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ohromná sranda je to. A zároveň to mätie ľudí, keď potom rozprávate normálne, nespoznajú vás.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Tis tremendous fun. And it also confuse people, when you talk normal. afterwards, they don't recognize you. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To on bol môj... brat. Kedysi bol janičiarom, ranili ho však pri Varne. Aby mohol aj ďalej slúžiť našej ríši a sultánovi, dal sa na špionáž. Vybavil túto prácu aj mne.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>He was my... kin. Once Janissary, wounded he was near Varna. To serve our realm and Sultan still, turned he to espionage. He arranged such task for me, too. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Akolyta Marek sa chystá naliať mi do hrdla prekliaty qahwah, po mutácii mi odseknú končatiny a takto odovzdajú Mehmedovi. Pri Allahovi vás prosím, zachráňte ma, som naveky vaším pokoreným sluhom... Turecko sa vám kráľovsky odmení.
\n<Hasan Bey>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Acolyte Marek, he schemes to force upon me accursed qahwah, post-mutation to sever my limbs, then to present me thus to Mehmed. By Allah, I beseech thee, rescue me, forever shall I be subservient. Turkey shall reward lavishly. \n<Hasan Bey>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Berme ho. Nám neprislúcha vyniesť ortieľ nad tým prašivým psiskom. To je zemepánova robota.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Take him. 'Tis not our place to pass judgment upon such a wretched creature. That is the lord's affair. \n<Matej>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]Osmana\c[0].
items.translation: You have gained an \c[14]Ottoman\c[0].

items.original: V truhlici bolo \c[14]200 korún\c[0].
items.translation: There were \c[14]200 coins\c[0] in the chest.

items.original: V skrini bol vzácny \c[14]kalený kyrys\c[0].
items.translation: A precious \c[14]temperet quirass\c[0] was in the wardrobe.

items.original: Zdroj zajímavého dymu, vypĺňajúceho celé podzemie.
items.translation: A source of interesting smoke filling the entire underground.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Anička! Čo tu robíš?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Anička! What art thou doing here? \n<Matej>

items.original:
Mám plán. Možno nevyjde, ale mám šancu Marekovi prekaziť jeho rituál. 
\n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I have a plan. It may not succeed, but I have a chance to thwart Marek's ritual.

items.original:
No ta to v žadnom pripadze. Už dosc si sa obetovala. Bež domu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Enough of that. Ye hast sacrificed plenty. Off home with ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Si si ista? Neni mi zaľahko ce tam posilac.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Art ye sure? 'Tis not with ease to send ye hither. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Je to risk, ale isto sa to vyplatí.
\n<Anička>
items.translation: 'Tis a risk, yet it wilt surely pay off.

items.original:
Kejc mysliš, no ta idz.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ye think thus, than off with ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
A...\! dávaj si pozor, Anička!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: And... take care, Anička! \n<Matej>

items.original: Chlapi! Čakajte!\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: Lads, wait!\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Ďusi? Ty co tu? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ďusi? What art ye doing here? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Som sa motal okolo tej sochy chrliča a sa odrazu otvorila cesta predo mnou. Som vošiel dnu a -čerta aby to chcel- sa zavrela zamnou chodba. Tak som šiel Feriho hľadať.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I was wandering around the statue of the gargoyle and suddenly the passage opened in front of me. I walked in an the devil closed the corridor behind me. So I went looking for Feri. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Už sme ho našli. Poc s nami, nebudeš šak tu sam sa motať.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: We've already found him.  Come with us, ye shall not be wandering around alone.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>I som ho našiel! V zemy bol zakopaný. \n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And I found him! He was buried in the ground. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Poc s nami, nebudeš šak tu sam sa motať.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Come with us, ye shall not be wandering around alone.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pridal sa k tebe zbrojnoš Ďusi.
items.translation: Man at arms Ďusi joined you.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mám aj dajakú alpu pri sebe, snáď ju nebude treba. \n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I also have some alpa with me, hopefully it will not be needed. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]2 fľašky alpy\c[0].
items.translation: You have earned \c[14]2 bottles of alpa\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kultisti sa rozmohli medzi našimi mladymi, fialova je v mode. Kto im zakazovac proboval, ten už vecej svoje ditky ani neuvidzel doma. Čvarga! A richtar še ľem prizera, zemepan tyš ric nezdvihne. Vam hutorim, dokym ľud sam šebe veducich nebudze voľic, ta furt ľen zle budze, ľenivci nam budu rozkazovac!
\n<Starena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The cultist have spread among our young, purple is popular. Whoever tried to forbid their young to join the cult, did not ever see their children home again. Čvarga! And burgmaster just stands by, lord also shall not lift his ass up. I tell you. Until the leaders are not voted for by the people, the sloths will command us! \n<Elder>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Me vyrabovali! To čim som si ja starena take daco zaslužila? Naj ich Panbu skare.
\n<Starena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I was looted! How did I, an old woman, deserve such horror? May Lord strike them down. \n<Elder>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Keby mi nohy služili už by som tyž pošla, šicke ucekaju. Sama vražda tento kraj, kus sa zle pozreš a takoj ce zamorduju.
\n<Starena>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>If my feet still served me, I would go already. There is only murder in this region, you look someone wrong in the eye and there you go... murder. \n<Elder>

items.original:
Niekde v lese blúdi naša chudinečka. Hrozný to svet.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: She is lost somewhere in the woods perhaps. What a dreadful world . \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
Joj, tota dcérka naša. Nech jej odpustí Boh.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: Oh, our hapless daughter. May God grant her forgiveness.\n<Pallmer>

items.original:
To za trest toto. Šicko som pre ňu robela, a kukajce.
\n<Pallmerová>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is her chastisement. I labored tirelessly for her, yet see how she has repaid me. \n<Lady Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šicko som pre ňu robela, a kukajce. Som ju chcela vydac už davno, lem manžel furt hudol, že by sa mala naučic pisac.
\n<Pallmerová>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is her chastisement. I labored tirelessly for her, yet see how she has repaid me. I sought to wed her off long ago, yet my husband persistently urged her to learn the art of writing. \n<Lady Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tu máte ešte šnapsu, to môj herrpapa doniesol z Bavorska, som šetril dcére na svadbu, ale toto treba poriadne osláviť. Anička, šak my ťa ľúbime, jak si nám toto mohla spraviť…
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Take this flask, there's yet some schnapps left, a gift from my honored father hailing from Bavaria. 'Twas reserved for my daughter's wedding feast, but this occasion warrants a proper revelry. Anička, we professed our affections, how could you bring such sorrow upon us... \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
Dobre vraví otec, takých Matúšov ešte postretávaš habadej.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Indeed, the father speaks wisdom. Such fellows as Matúš are encountered all too frequently. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak, tak, kukni tu i na mnicha, jaky suci chlop, kym mal rucho, som ani nezbačila.
\n<Pallmerová>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, verily. Look upon that monk, what sight he be. When he still wore garments, I scarcely noticed. \n<Lady Pallmer>

items.original:
Sme vašimi dlžníkmi. A hlavne tvojimi, Matej.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: We be in your debt, and most especially you, Matej. \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Joj, už teľo nefňukajce. Kedz nam ste zaviazani, znali by sme coška, co nam fakt že treba. Vaša dcerka budze naš agent u kultistoch. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Cease your lamenting, for as you are indebted to us, we may hath a task in mind for ye. Yer daughter shall serve as our spy amidst the cultists. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nič, kľud, riziko minimalne, nemusi vobec nič robic. Len sa vrati medzi svojich druhov, kuštičko nech sa popyta ostatnych, co a jak. A nam da informacie, keby coška chystali.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Fear not, for the peril is minimal. She need only return to her companions, subtly inquire, and furnish us with intelligence should they plot any mischief. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Stratia moment prekvapenia.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They shall be bereft of their element of surprise. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Uch. Anička, si ochotná dačo také robiť?
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, Anička, art thou prepared to undertake such a task? \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
...
\n<Anička>
items.translation: ... \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Spravím, čo len chcete. Vzdávam sa Zurvana. To isto v sekte môjho Matúša skazili, on má dobré srdce.
\n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I shall do as you command. I renounce my allegiance to Zurvan. 'Twas surely the influence of the cult that let my Matúš astray. He bears a good heart. \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Aj heslo k ich brlohu vám môžem prezradiť. Pri bráne povedzte "Qahwah nad hlavou". Schádzajú sa vo pevnosti na západe.
\n<Anička>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Even the password to their den I can reveal to you. At the gate, say "Qahwah over head." They gather in the fortress to the west.
\n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Qahwah nad hlavou? Fajne, to sa zíde.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Qahwah over head? Good, that will be of use.
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Idem teda hľadať niekoho z vedúcich. Myslím, že viem, kde by mohol byť.
\n<Anička>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>As of now, I am going to look for one of the leaders. I think I know where he might be.
\n<Anička>

items.original:
Nech ťa Pán sprevádza.
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
May God guide you.
\n<Matej>

items.original: Ju idze roztarhnuc. Tu dade musi byc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: She's onto something. There must be something here. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Veď tu nikoho niet! Vôbec nič tu... Počkaj. Tu sa nejak prehýba podlaha. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But there's nary a soul here! Naught at all... Hold. The floor seems to sag here. \n<Matej>

items.original: Odsuňme tote dosky. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us shift those planks aside. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Namojdušu... \n<Matej>
items.translation: Aye, bless the heart. \n<Matej>

items.original: Priviažem psa a zlezieme tam. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: I'll tether the hound and we shall descend.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali, obávam sa, že toto priestranstvo v rámci dema ešte nie je dokončené.\n<Matej>
No a? Šak len nakukneme.\n<Pavol>
Náradie tu drevorubci majú rozložené, akoby snáď pracovali. Ibaže tu nikoho niet.
items.translation: <WordWrap>Tools for woodcutting lie around, yet noone seems to be present.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nikoho tu niet, snáď sa vyparili všetci. Akurát po niekom tu ostala \c[14]vlnená halena\c[0]. Škoda bolo by ju tu nechať.
items.translation: <WordWrap>Noone is around, as if everyone vanished. Only this \c[14]woolen tunic\c[0] is here. Would be a shame to leave it here.

items.original: Daco zavetrila! Blizko musime byc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: She seems to hath caught a scent! We must be near. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pohladiť psíka?
items.translation: Pet the dog?

items.original: Dóbra si, dóóóóbra. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Good girl, gooooood. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Milučký, dobrý psík. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: What a kind, nice dog. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Husite, husite. Proč si doma nezúústal.
items.translation: Hussite, Hussite. Why didn't you stay at home?

items.original:
Oco! Mojho oca... mojho oca zabili. 
\n<Dievčina>
items.translation: Dad! My dad... my dad got killed.  \n<Girl>

items.original: Nevladzem už. Kedy to prestane, všecko to vraždenie.
items.translation: I am tired. When will it stop, all the killing.

items.original:
Vy svine!
\n<Dievčina>
items.translation: You swines! \n<Girl>

items.original:
Děvenko, neplaš se. Pojď s náma, vemem tě k nám do tábora, zahřeješ si nožičky.
\n<Husita>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Little girl, don't worry. Come with us, we'll take you to our camp, you'll warm your feet. \n<Hussite>

items.original:
Dzivče v pohodze si?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Girl, are you alright? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale... ale oco... oca zabili... Bože moj šak on nikemu nezrobil nič... len im vravel, nech ma nechajú.
\n<Dievčina>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But... but Dad... Dad got killed... God, he didn't do anything to anyone... he just told them to let me go. \n<Girl>

items.original:
Bože.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: God. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
...
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: ... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Pošla het... krucipisek. Ta snaď najdze ščesce hocikam pošla.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: She is gone... Christ. Hope she finds happiness wherever she went. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nora! K nohe! Jaky psik milučky. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nora! To me! What a good dog. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Fena Nora sa pridala do tvojej družiny.
items.translation: Nora the dog has joined your party.

items.original: Spoločník zlodejky.
items.translation: Companion of the thief.

items.original: V bedni \c[14]figa\c[0] bola!
items.translation: In the chest, you found a dried \c[14]fig\c[0]!

items.original: V debničkách našiel si \c[14]orechovicu\c[0]!
items.translation: Within the crates, you found \c[14]nut brandy\c[0]!

items.original: \c[14]Lekvár\c[0] v bedni!
items.translation: In the chest rested some \c[14]jam!\c[0]!

items.original: Zlodejkyn spoločník.
items.translation: Thieves companion.

items.original: Dig more, nazdar gádžu, co ši še zaľubel?\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Dig more, hi gádžu, you in love?\n<Thief>

items.original: Co tu v džure si jak borsuk zalezena? Vrac nam šicko! Teraz takoj! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Why doth ye hide in this burrow like a badger? Give back everything! Immediately! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Kym si kus privyrobime ta tu žijem. Deži, pocem! \n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Till I hath some extra I live ere. Deži come! \n<Thief>

items.original: To co za šviňa? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: What manner of swine are ye? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tos... Tosm... To som takô neivdel... asi. Tak sa mi zda. Idem domu račej.\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nevev... nerv... never saw something alike, methinks... better go home.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Neee! Šicke mrtvi.\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Enough! All dead! \n<Thief>

items.original: Tak to vyklop, kde sú nakradnuté veci. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Speak up! Where are the stolen goods? \n<Matej>

items.original: T... t... tam... vof truhlici...\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: T... t... there... in the chest... \n<Thief>

items.original: Dosť tu toho je. A náhrdelník richtárovej ženy?  \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>That's it. And what about the necklace of the burgmaster's  wife? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>T... to... Kajo ukradol... nas začali nahaňac richtarovi chlopi a sme še rozdzelili... ucekal na sever od dzedziny.
\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>T... that... Kajo stole... were chased by burgmaster's men, and scattered... he go north of the village. \n<Thief>

items.original: Nuž, ten sme teda našli. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Well, we found it then. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Richtárovi zbrojnoši ho nedostali, on náhrdelník nemá. Jedine ak by si ho nechali. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster's men did not get him; he bears no necklace. Only if they kept it. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Ta dobre. A ty... by sme ťa mali do temnice zobrať, ale...
Ťahaj naspak kočovac a naj ce tu nevidim už. \n<Pavol>
items.translation:
So be it. And regarding thee... though we should lead thee to the dungeon, yet...
Leave and vanish! May ye never cross our path again! \n

items.original: A sto rázy ruženec! Nie! Tristo rázy! Možno ti Boh odpustí... \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And hundred times the rosary! Nay! Three hundred! Perchance the Almighty will grant thee forgiveness... \n<Matej>

items.original: Cebe ešči splnim posledne želanie... \n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: I give ye final wish. \n<Thief>

items.original: Jahody chcem. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: I desire strawberries. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Daco inšo mam na myšľi. Podzme si zatancovac! \n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Something other I have in mind, let us dance!. \n<Thief>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta ja nebudzem mac najhorsu šmerc, dobre sme si zatancovali. Len chudak Macej, on si za toto co tu vidzel zasluži aspoň svatorečenie. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I shall not meet the worst fate. Only poor Macej, for what he has heard, deserves at least a saintly commendation.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Heh, mu daco ľepši zrobim, gádžo. Chav tiro peloro! \n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Heh, I give him better gádžo. Chav tiro peloro! \n<Thief>

items.original: Teper vas zabijem.\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: I kill you now. \n<Thief>

items.original: Kto ste, čo tu robite? \n<Kultista>
items.translation: How did you come here? Who are you, and what are you doing? \n<Cultist>

items.original: Thovel tuke o kar dži andre meň!\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Thovel tuke o kar dži andre meň! \n<Thief>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Do Mariše, neni to tu take opustene jak ši hutorela! Nešaľ še a rozviaž nas! Sama ich nedaš dolu! 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>For Mary's sake, this place is not as deserted as ye say! Do not hesitate and untie us! Ye cannot handle them yeselves. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tak to vyklop, kde sú nakradnuté veci. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Then spit it out, where are the stolen things. \n<Pavol>

items.original: T... t... tam... vof truhlici...\n<Ida>
items.translation: T... t... there... in the chest... \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>T... to... Kajo ukradol... nas začali nahaňac richtarovi chlopi a sme še rozdzelili... ucekal na sever od dzedziny.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>T... that... Kajo stole... were chased by burgmaster's men, and scattered... he go north of the village. \n<Ida>

items.original: Jaj, ta ten sme našli teda. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oh, we found that one then. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ktovie jak sa sem dostal, podliak.
items.translation: Who knows how he got here, a villain.

items.original: Zomrel ako žil. Na nič.
items.translation: Died as he lived. Dead.

items.original: To by ma zajímalo, jak sa sem dostal?
items.translation: I wonder how he got here?

items.original: No jak sa sem len mohol dostať?
items.translation: But how could he get here?

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pana beka, to keľo tajnych chodboch ešči najdzeme. Caly kraj podkopany jakeby bane tu boli.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Dear God. How many more secret passages shall we uncover? The entire region is tunneled as if mines once lay beneath. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pojdzem het. \n<Ida>
items.translation: I go quick. \n<Ida>

items.original: Co tu robiš ešte? Pal het! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Why dost ye linger here? Begone. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Šicke mrtvi. Nikto mi nezostal.  \n<Ida>
items.translation: All dead. I haht naught. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To bul Deži. Fifľena ho v dzedzine otrovila a zrobela zos ňoho pačmagu. 
\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It was Deži. A damsel poisoned him in the village,made hime into the beast. \n<Ida>

items.original: Jak ho otrávili? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: How did they poison him.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Čarnu vodu vyligal. Ale še vracil ku mne, bo tota bosorka mľandrava ho nezvedla, on še ľen so mnu chočel mojkac.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>He drank the black waters. But Deži came back to me, she not seduce him, only with me wanted he to cuddle.\n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta so, imar pijes o kara so?! Ujo, šak šicke mŕtve. Mi nikto nezostal.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: Ta so, imar pijes o kara so?! Thee all dead. I haht naught. \n<Ida>

items.original: Čo to bolo? \n<Matej>
items.translation: What was that? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Maceji, pome stadzi! Potem, čo v Kosove som vidzel, som nemyslel, že daco ešči ma v živote vydesi. Uplne ma cisne v hrudi.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, let us leave. After what I saw in Kosovo, I did not think that anything would scare me in life. Yet my chest is tight as if it was to implode.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Zaprete dvere z druhej strany.
items.translation: The door is braced from the other side.

items.original:
Poďme na to. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us press on. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Čo má toto znamenať? Vy gágaji! Stráže!
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: What sorcery is this? You miscreants! Guards! \n<Ignác>

items.original:
Živého ma nedostanete!
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: Ye shan't take me alive! \n<Ignác>

items.original:
Pojdzeš pekne ty na dereš. Tam ťa trošku ponaťahujeme- \.\^
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Come now, peacefully to the rack. There, we shall have our reckoning- \.\^
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Vypil jed!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: He imbibed poison! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Jožku, daj znamenie svojim chlopom! Ja idem im naproti!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Jožef, signal ye men! I shall engage them head-on! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Skapaté hovädo.
items.translation: Dirty beef.

items.original: V skrine objavil si vzácny \c[14]prsteň vôľe\c[0]!
items.translation: In the wardrobe you discovered a rare \c[14]ring of will\c[0]!

items.original:
Pana beka, to keľo tajnych chodieb ešči najdzeme. Caly kraj podkopany jakeby bane tu boli.
\n<Pavol>
Bedničky plné všeličoho. Neviem čoho, dačoho. Nie je tu nič proste ešte, no.
Pal het.
No dobre, tu máš 50 korún a vypadni. Choď testovať hru tam kde treba.
Darmo tu snoríš teraz.
Fakt tu nič nie je namojdušu.
Maceji, pome stadzi! Potem, čo v Kosove som vidzel, som nemyslel, že daco ešči ma v živote vydesi. Uplne ma cisne v hrudi.\n<Pavol>

O tomto nešťastníkovi sa prisamveru niečo dozvieme v plnej verzii hry. 
Zatiaľ v deme tu len tak vylihuje, no čož.
Ste zošaleli? Paliho žena snorí mi po hrade a my na vandrovku ideme?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Are you mad? Pavol's wife snoops around my castle, and we embark on a journey?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Jožku! Vstavaj! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Jožko! Arise! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ajájh, čo ma budíš! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Aye, why dost you wake me? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Mateja zajali. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej hath been captured. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Mateja? 
Kto, kultisti? 
Adam? Adam, zdar! \n<Jozef>
items.translation:
Matej? 
By whom, the cultists? 
Adam? Adam, greetings! \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zdar. Hej, v krčme. Toto bolo pribité na dverách do hradu. Buď chcú naozaj vyjednávať alebo je to pasca.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Greetings. Aye, at the tavern. This was affixed to the castle gates. They either truly wish to negotiate or 'tis a trap. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hogy csészné meg a kibaszott öreg lófaszát! Pištik!!! Ihneď mi pomôž do zbroje! A vy choďte napred, zbrojnoš z nočnej hliadky pôjde s vami. To čo za meč maš?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hogy csészné meg a kibaszott öreg lófaszát! Pištik!!! Help me don my armor immediately! And you, go ahead, the night watchman's squire shall accompany you. What sort of sword dost you wield? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Nestrimuj, potom ci povim.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Do not worry, thou shalt see soon enough. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jak pokojne blkoce. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: How calmly it flickers. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Uvidzime, či i v akcii budze taky kľudny. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: We shall see if it shall be so calm in battle. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali! Bože! Zemepana zabili! Co budzeme robic teraz?\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <WordWrap>vPali! By God! The lord hath been felled! What course shall we chart henceforth? \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Do pyska, ja še zbešnim! Aaaaaaaaaaaargh!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Son of a bitch! God darn it! Aaaaaaaaaaaargh! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ticho! Pozri sa na mňa! Matej ešte žije, tak sa tu prestaň teraz hádzať o zem! Čo si nebol na vojne? Kto tu je dajaký schopný zbrojnoš, nech mu to dám na povel?\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hold thy tongue! Look hither! Matej still draws breath, so cease thy wailing! Wert thou not a soldier? Who among thee is a skilled warrior? Let him step forth and heed my command!\n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dobré ráno... som ho objavil už včera... neskoro som ho prišiel varovať, ešte som zbadal vysmiatych okultistov ako utekali. \n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Good morrow... I chanced upon him yesternight... alas, I arrived too late to forewarn him, yet I witnessed the fiends of darkness fleeing with scornful laughter. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: <Wordwrap>V prípade núdze preberá zodpovednosť za hrad najvyššie postavený šľachtic, čo som teraz ja. Poď s nami, ideme do akcie, držia mnícha Mateja v stodole za hradom. Potom to tu máš na povel, zemepán už má iné starosti na onom svete. \n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>In times of peril, the highest noble assumes command of the fortress, which now falls upon me. Come, join us in our venture, for the monk Matej is held within the barn beyond yonder castle. Then, thou shalt hold sway here, for our lord now attends to matters in realms beyond. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dobre, počkajte ma pred stodolou, musím ešte ísť na záchod. Zoberte so sebou aj Piťa, teraz mu končí nočná hliadka, tak je vykekešený na boj. \n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well, await me afore the barn; I must attend to a call of nature. Take Piťo with thee, for his nightly watch wanes, and he is now free to join the fray. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Zbrojnoš sa pridal do tvojej družiny.
items.translation: Man at arms has joined your party.

items.original: Kadibudka.
items.translation: Outhouse.

items.original: Počuť, len ako Janči funí.
items.translation: You can hear Janči's heavy breathing.

items.original: Po Jančim len puch tu ostal.
items.translation: A stench is all that Janči left here.

items.original: P...Pauli! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: P...Paula! \n<Pavol>

items.original: ...\n<Paula>
items.translation: ...\n<Paula>

items.original:
Za tebu som prišol, všadzi ce hľedam. Podz domu.
Mam ce koľenačky prosic?\n
items.translation:
I have come for ye, I have searched everywhere for ye. Cometh home.
Should I beg ye on my knees?\n

items.original: Môžeš!\n<Paula>
items.translation: Thou mayest!\n<Paula>

items.original: Čo si to-\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What are you-\n<Pavol>

items.original: Aj teraz si na mól!\n<Paula>
items.translation: Thou art still a drunk!\n<Paula>

items.original: ...\n<Pavol>
items.translation: ...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Daj mi pokoj, ty chudák!\n<Paula>
items.translation: Leave me be, thou poor wretch.\n<Paula>

items.original: ...\n<Matej>
items.translation: ...\n<Matej>

items.original: Mno.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Well.\n<Matej>

items.original: Daj pokuj.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Len' me peace.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ja len, že kde je ten posol?\n<Matej>
items.translation: I but wished to know where the messenger is?\n<Matej>

items.original: Uuuuh! Mňa hľadáte? \n<Janči>
items.translation: Uuuuh! Seek ye me? \n<Janči>

items.original: Janči, ty si to?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Janči, is it thee?\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tá krásavica mi dala vínko, ale bars horké bolo, takoj ma z neho prehnalo. A že večer mám za ňou ísť, tu sa stretneme.
\n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>That fair maiden gave me some wine, but 'twas so tart it didst rush through me. And told me that I am to meet her in the evening, here shall we gather.\n<Janči>

items.original: Môjtybože... podozrivú ženu máš, Pali. Beštiu.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Lord in heaven... thou hast a suspicious woman, Pali. A fiend.\n<Matej>

items.original: Ich mušime sledovac! Ja jej dam, stretavac sa s posličkami!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We must follow them! I shall give her a piece of my mind for consorting with messengers!\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hlavne sa upokoj, tu ide o vážne veci. Janči, mali by sme zistiť, čo má tá bosorka za lubom. Domnievame sa, že voľajaké čary sa tu robia s tým nápojom, čo si vypil. Poďme za zemepánom.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Peace, stay composed, this is serious. Janči, we must ascertain what vile purpose that witch doth harbor, we suspect dark meddlings are woven with that drink thou didst consume. Let us go to the lord.\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta škoda, som sa tešil na randevú dneška... ale keď hvarite, že o kark mi ide, tak nedbam. Ale ja teraz ne som schopny dojsť ku zemepanovi, caly sa trasiemvof vnutri a studeny pot mi steka po hribete.\n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Tis a pity, I looked forward to the rendezvous today... but if thou sayest my life is at stake, then I heed your warning. But I am not capable of going to the lord now, as I tremble within, and cold sweat runs down my spine.\n<Janči>

items.original: Nič to, bude musieť prísť hora za Mohamedom.\n<Matej>
items.translation: For naught, the mountain must cometh to Mohamad.\n<Matej>

items.original: Janču, szivecske, žiješ?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Janči, szivecske, art you living?\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Žijem pane, ale v bruchu mi bobtná, jak keby sto červoch behalo. Aj zimnica ma chytá. Ale mam pocit, že už lepšie dakus, po tom skazenom vine bolo bars zle.
\n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I live, my lord, yet my belly swells as if a hundred worms did wriggle within. And the fever hath taken hold of me. But I feel somewhat better now, after that spoiled wine didst ill upon me.\n<Janči>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Do večera musíš byť v cajku. Tá potvora má prsty v nejakej zlobe, šak sám vieš, že pred týždňom nám Feri zmizol bez stopy... Posla pošlem iného za Adamom. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>By eventide, you must needs be in better health. That fiend hath fingers in some mischief, for you knowest well, a week hence, Feri vanished without a trace... I shall send another in your stead to seek Adam. \n<Jozef>

items.original: A vy mu aspoň sucháre a bylinný odvar hneď zožeňte.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: And you, procure at least some biscuits and a herbal decoction forthwith.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
Nemam mu rovno aj ric vytrec?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Should I also wipe his rump?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nevydumuj. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Don't be snide.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Máte všetko? Výborne, chlopi. Janču, poď von, máme tu dáke liečivo pre teba.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hast you everything? Excellent, lads. Janči, come forth, we have a remedy for you.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Och, oj... ta snaď sa mi priľepši po totych byľinkoch.\n<Janči>
items.translation: Oh, pray it the herbs shall bring comfort. \n<Janči>

items.original: Dobre, šak už nekňuč. Hlavne ma dobre počúvaj teraz. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: No more whining now. Pay heed to me closely.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jak tá Paliho nevesta pride, nenápadne sa tej trútny vypytuj, čo je zač a čo dorába v mojom chotári. Aj na to víno sa jej pýtaj. Najskorej ti klamať bude, kľampa jedna, ale všetko si dobre pamätaj. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>When Pali's bride arrives, discreetly inquire of her condition, what she does in our domain. Ask her also of the wine. She may well lie to you, that deceitful wench, but remember all well. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>My ťa budeme sledovať, neboj nič, keby sa veci zvrtli budeme obďaleč. Myslíme, že patrí k nejakej bande. A keby sme nestíhali za vami alebo kdesi do lesa by ste šli, tak som vydumal, že ti dám na nohu prepichnuté vrecko zos popolom a ťa nájdeme podľa toho.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We shall follow you, fear not. Should things take a dire turn, we shall be close at hand. We suspect she belongs to some band of miscreants. And if we lose track of thee in the woods or elsewhere, I have devised a pierced bag of ash upon your foot, and thus we may find you by it.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
Tak, teraz čekaj a tvár sa zaľúbene.
My ideme do brány striehnuť.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Now, await and feign affection. We shall keep watch from the gatehouse.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Jak to, že zos hradu prišla? Šak sme ju vidzeli jak vychadza von.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>How hath she returned from the castle? We saw her depart afore.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Teremburáját, to sa mi nepáči celé. Nič to, poďme za nimi. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Teremburáját, this doth not bode well. Nevertheless, let us follow them.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Návšteva si vzácna, Pali, ale sem ťa nevpustím. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: Thou art an honored visitor, Pali, but thou shalt not pass.\n<Knight>

items.original: Nuž dobre, ale nikemu nevrav, že ja som ťa vpustil. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>So be it, but tell no soul that 'twas I who let thee in.\n<Knight>

items.original: Ale ma neurážaj zas! Sľúbiš peniaz, ale nemáš! \n<Rytier>
items.translation: Yet do not insult me again! Thou promisest coin, yet deliverest naught.\n<Knight>

items.original: V sude nič!
items.translation: The barrel is empty!

items.original: Na dne suda leží \c[14]15 korún\c[0]. Jak sa sem dostali, Boh vie iba.
items.translation: <WordWrap>There are \c[14]15 crowns\c[0] at the bottom of this barrel. Only God knows how they ended up here.

items.original: Vozík je plný \c[14]alpy\c[0].
items.translation: Wagon is full of \c[14]alpa\c[0].

items.original: V rebriňáku plno \c[14]zásob\c[0]!
items.translation: There was a \c[14]toolkit\c[0] in the haywagon.

items.original:
S vínkom lepšie sa mi stráži. Ba, čo sa mi zdá, aj lepšie do diaľky vidím.
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: <WordWrap>With wine, my watch is more pleasant. Aye, methinks I also see better into the distance.\n<Guard>

items.original:
Jáj, veru by som si dal vínečka.
Nemáš aspoň deco?\n<Hliadka>
items.translation:
Ah, indeed, I would partake of a little wine.
Hast thou not even a drop?\n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tisícerá vďaka. Ako by som sa ti len odvďačil. Pár \c[14]mincí\c[0] nechceš? Alebo tento \c[14]kľúč\c[0] ti móžem dať, len čo neviem k akému zámku patrí.
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: <WordWrap>A thousand thanks. How might I repay thee? Wouldst thou some \c[14]coins\c[0]? Or perhaps this \c[14]key\c[0] I could give thee, though I know not to which lock it belongs.\n<Guard>

items.original: \c[14]5 mincí\c[0] si dostal.
items.translation: You were given \c[14]5 coins\c[0].

items.original: \c[14]Kľúč\c[0] si dostal.
items.translation: You were given a  \c[14]key\c[0].

items.original:
Ale veď vína nemáš, len čo si ma navnadil! Teraz mi je mrzuto.
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Why thou didst tempt me with promise of wine when you have naught! Now I am disheartened.\n<Guard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Včera som stadzi kukal na vas, jak sce še marovali dole s totymi... Klustimami či skym. Kulstimanmi. Som ich perši raz vidzel. Musia barz potichu sa do hradu vkradať.
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation:
Yesterday I observed you. How you fought with those. Clustim.. Cultimen. First time
I saw them. They must slither into our castle while being utmost quiet.\n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zašpavam už.
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: Hard to keep me eyes open.\n<Guard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zaš v totej stodole sa zbiehaju! Jak much na hovne ich tam jest!
\n<Hliadka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Again they converge in the barn! They swarm as flies to dung! \n<Watchman>

items.original: Odomkol si dvere do chyže!
items.translation: You unlocked the door!

items.original: Čo vy?\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What is it?\n<Squire>

items.original: Noo, darmo vysvetľovať budem. Poďte, vas zavediem.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well, it will be in vain to try and explain. Come, follow me.\n<Squire>

items.original: V pivnici v hrade.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well, it will be in vain to try and explain. Come, follow me.\n<Squire>

items.original: Čo ešte?\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What more do you want?\n<Squire>

items.original: Šak už som ti to ukazal. Tu cez tuto branu prejdi a na dvore tam domček.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: I showed you already. Through the gate, then you see a house.\n<Squire>

items.original: Nejdem už nikam.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I'm not going anywhere.\n<Squire>

items.original: Jančiho si nevidel?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hast ye seen Janči?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej-hej. Dajaka dievčina ho do hradu ťahala.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Yes, yes. A maiden dragged him towards the keep.\n<Squire>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zásoby nemožno doplniť počas boja. Daj preto pozor, aby si bol vždy pripravený. 
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Tools cannot be replenished during battle. Therefore, be careful to always be prepared.\n<Man at amrs>

items.original: Vraj okrem vina i alpa mizne, ďalšie veci tiež.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Besides wine, alpa also disappears, as well as other items.\n<Man at amrs>

items.original: Ste počuli? Dakto kradne vinko v hrade.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Hast thou heard? Someone is pilfering wine within the castle.\n<Man at arms>

items.original: Ty si posol Janči?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Art ye the messenger Janči?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ne, Janči bude inde.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: Nay, Janči will be elsewhere.\n<Squire>

items.original: <Wordwrap>V kraju to tu začina byc strašlivejše každym dňom. Neška v karčme vyvraždili kultisti šicke, ani krčmara neušetrili.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>In the county, it get's more horrid every day. Today in the tavern plenty were murdered by the cultists, not even innkeeper was spared.\n<Man at arms>

items.original: Neščesce! Zemepana zabili! \n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Plight! Milord was killed! \n<Man at arms>

items.original: Nee, ta čo si. Ten budze až pri vonkajšej brane.\n<Panoš>
items.translation: Nay, nay, I am naught. He shall be at the outer gate.\n<Squire>

items.original: Byliny dajake tu rastú.
items.translation: Some kind of herb grows here.

items.original: Sme dopadli. Posličkom sucheho chleba nosic.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Look at us. What a sorry sight. Carrying biscuits for some... messenger.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pali, rozumiem, že ťa to celé musí dráždiť riadne. Teraz ale ozaj chladnú hlavu si zachovať musíme. Vydrž, všetko sa vyrieši.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Pavol, I understand this must truly vex thou. However, now we must keep our heads cool. Endure, all shall be resolved.\n<Matej>

items.original: Hm.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hm.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Je to zberba, husiti. Žižka vraj, než sa stal ich vodcom, tak bol v družine s niekým, koho prezývali hovno. 
\n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Tis band of thugs, Hussites. They say befere Žižka became their leader, he was in the company with someone they called Dung.\n<Soldier>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Husiti by si na náš hrad dovoliť nemali. Ale ta... to si i na Kapušanoch mysleli. \n<Strážnik>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The Hussites should not beset our castle. Yet, they thought that in Kapušany, yet look at them now.\n<Soldier>

items.original: Vy co tu chcete?! Aj vy si na moju ženu zalusk robice? Dodzigam vas šicke!! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What seek ye here? Dost ye also covet my wife? I shall vanquish thee all!\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Láska… taký nežný cit. Ale jej rodina sme teraz my.
A ty, hnida, skap v mene Zurvanovom!\n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Ah, love... such tender sentiment. Yet her allegiance now lies with us. And thee, nitwit, shalt meet thy end in the name of Zurvan.\n<Agitator>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nőjön gitár a hasadba és a rák pengesse!!! Pali, ja ťa obesím, prisámbohu! Prepiduša zosraná, kvôli tebe sme tu skoro všetci bačkory natiahli. Prac sa mi z očú! Hülye!
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nőjön gitár a hasadba és a rák pengesse!!! Pali, I swear by the Lord, I shall hang thee by the neck! You foul, drunken wretch, 'twas you who nearly brought us all to ruin. Away with you from my sight, Hülye!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Možem osrac. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>This shite is beyond me.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Janču, ty tekvica! Čo si Paliho ženu nezadržal?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Janči, bumbling fool! Why didst you not restrain Pavol's wife?\n<Jozef>

items.original: No, ta ja... šak ledva stojim a jak nabehli na nas ta...\n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well, I... I could barely stand, and when they ambushed us... \n<Janči>

items.original:
Buď ticho radšej.
A ty, Matej, poď sebe dať so mnou partičku šachoch na ukľudnenie. 
A to je rozkaz!\n<Jozef>
items.translation:
Silence.
And you, Matej, come hither and play a game of chess with me to soothe the nerves.
That is an order!\n

items.original:
Hneď, pane, len povyzvedám, čo počul Janči, kým nezabudne detaily. 
Hlavu má deravú.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Right away, my lord, let me just gather what Janči heard before he forgets the details. His mind is addled and his wits baren.\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dobrô, ja zatiaľ figúrky rozložím, môžeš byť biely. I prepelice dám zarezať, nech sa aspoň najeme dobre.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Very well, I shall arrange the pieces, you can play as white. I'll have some quails prepared, so we may dine heartily.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Janči, zistil si niečo?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Janči, hast thou discovered aught? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nič, vravel som jej, že bárs plano mi bulo, aj že furt divne sa cítim a ona stále ma len bozkávala, a že sa nemám báť, že to prejde. Len mám s ňou ísť kamsi, a že mi sľubuje, že zachvíľu mi už dobre bude ako v raji. Že sa o to postará. \n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, I told her how sick I was and that I have been feeling strange, yet she persisted in kissing me and bid me not to fear, assuring me that it would pass. She told me to accompany her somewhere, promising that all would be blissful, akin to paradise. She vowed to take care of everything. \n<Janči>

items.original:
Aj som sa pýtal na víno a ona, že to špeciálne pre mňa vyrobila, 
a ževraj z toho silnejší budem.\n<Janči>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I inquired about the wine, she claimed to have crafted it for me specially, saying it would grant me strength. \n<Janči>

items.original: Satanova nevesta!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Devil's harlot! \n<Matej>

items.original: No nič, poďme spať.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Well, let us retire for the night. \n<Matej>

items.original: Co ty tu mimo hradu porabaš?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What dost ye do outside the castle walls?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Feriho idem hľadať. Zmizol, jakeby sa zem po ňom zľahla.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: I am off to seek Feri. He vanished as if the earth swallowed him whole.\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Hodiť mincu do studne?
items.translation: Cast a coin into the well?

items.original: Kto sem ruca mince, cipana? Šak mi to tu cvendži o hlavu.\n<?>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Who tosses coins, knave? Thou shalt meet thy fate if thou continue with thy antics.\n<?>

items.original: Haló? Ty co tam dole robiš?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hail! What dost ye do below?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ja tu žijem od nepamäti. Teraz ma nehaj už.\n<?>
items.translation: I have dwelled here since the mists of antiquity. Now leave me be.\n<?>

items.original: No čeeekaj, čekaj! Jak tam žiješ? Kto si, cipana?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hold, hold! How dost ye live there? Who art ye?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vodník som. Zbieram duše a pijem ich jak vínečko. Ak nechceš, aby som aj tebe dušu vypil, odíď.
\n<Vodník>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I am a water sprite. I gather souls and drink them like wine. If thou dost not wish for me to drink thy soul as well, depart.\n<Water sprite>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tebe riadne šušti v hlave. Sluchaj! Vyplav von, abo ci tam rucim petardu!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hath water washed away yer wits? Listen! Come forth, or else I shall toss a petard yonder.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Tu maš!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here, catch.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ták, už je s nim amem.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: There we go, he is done for.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ej, kukaj, co to vyplavalo tam? Dajaka butylka čudesna...\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hey, look, what floated there? Some wondrous thing...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]svätivo\c[0].
items.translation: You obtained \c[14]sanctifier\c[0].

items.original: Terazky ci dam pokuj. Dufaj, že to sebe nerozmyslim.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Now I shall grant ye peace. Pray that I do not reconsider.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tebe riadne šušti v hlave. Šak počkaj ty, jak najdem dajaku petardu! Ce stadzi vydurim jak patkaňa!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hath water washed away yer wits? Listen! Come forth, or else I shall toss a petard yonder.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Čuješ me, ty haveď? Ajh, pošol pod hladinu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hear me, ye scoundrel! Ah, he swam beneath the surface.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nemáš peneži veď
items.translation: You have no coins to throw.

items.original: Prišol si o korunu.
items.translation: You are a coin shorter.

items.original: Nemáš peneži veď.
items.translation: You have no coins to throw.

items.original: Posledna šanca von vyplavac! Bo ce vydurim inač!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Last chance to come forth, lest I compel thee otherwise.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Vyplav von, ty karas porantany!
Juj, me nečuje. Šak ho stadzi vydurim ešte dajak.\n
items.translation:
Come forth, ye wretched carp!
Alas, he doth not hear. Yet I shall rout him out in some manner.\n

items.original: Tu stražim, žeby už žaden papľuh nepozvany nam do hradu nevošol.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I guard this place, so that no more scoundrels may enter our keep.\n<Man at arms>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Toten pištik jaky truľo, ne? By si nevšimol ani koňa, keby mu po hlave prešol. Teraz koli nemu musim tu kysnuc vonku.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation:
What a dullard that Pištík is. Wouldn't notice a horse if it ran over his face. Now,
I must rot here.\n

items.original: Do hradu nejdzem teraz, me uvidi zemepan a ma dorichtuje cipana.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I dare not go to the castle thus; the lord will see me and chastise me. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pozri, na bráne je tu pribitý pergamen, na ktorom sa píše: "Zemepánovi: držíme mnícha Mateja v stodole za hradom. Príďte ráno vyjednávať o výkupnom. Ak sa o niečo pokúsite, mníchovi podrežeme hrdlo."\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Behold, upon the gate, a parchment is affixed, bearing these words: 'To the Lord: We hold captive the monk Matej in the barn beyond the castle. Come at dawn to negotiate his ransom. Shouldst thou attempt aught, the monk's life shall be forfeit. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pozri, na bráne je tu pribitý pergamen, na sa ktorom píše: "Posádke hradu: držíme mnícha Mateja v stodole za hradom. Príďte ráno vyjednávať o výkupnom. Ak sa o niečo pokúsite, mníchovi podrežeme hrdlo."\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Behold, upon the gate, a parchment is affixed, bearing these words: 'To the men at arms: We hold captive the monk Matej in the barn beyond the castle. Come at dawn to negotiate his ransom. Shouldst thou attempt aught, the monk's life shall be forfeit. \n<Adam>

items.original: Macej žije! Poc, šibko! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej doth live! Cometh hasten! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Čo vy tu, szivecke? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Ah, what brings you here, lads? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Sme priviedli rukojemnika! 
...vysvetlim potom, teraz nam daj paru chlapoch, idzeme raziu robic!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
We hath brought a captive! 
...I shall explain later. For now, grant us a handful of men. We ride to take action! \n<Pavol>

items.original: No dobre vy. Pošlite mi toho... rukojemníka sem hore. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Aye, as you wish. Bring forth... the captive! \n<Jozef>

items.original: Pridali sa k tebe zemepánovi zbrojnoši!
items.translation: The lord's soldiers have joined your party.

items.original:
Tak poďme!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us be off. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Kukaj! Kultisti sa tam zaš zdržuju!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Behold! Cultists lurketh yonder! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nebudzeme tu čekac, pome takoj na nich!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: We shall not tarry here, let us go forth upon them at once! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Panie! Nie chcielibyście czegoś kupić? Poszedłem do wioski handlować ale dziś dzieje się tam coś strasznego! Nie zarobię ani grosza!\n<Šmelinár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Milord! Wouldst thou fancy purchasing aught? I ventured to the village for trade, but today, calamity hath befallen! I shall not earn a single coin!\n<Trader>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Majce še na pozore. Byc ja zemepan, zavrem branu a čekam kym nepride Huňady zos vojskom. Šak toto je šalene co še tu dzeje. 
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Be on guard! If I was milord, I'd close the gate and wait till Hyunady arrives with the army. 'Tis be insanity, what takes place around here.\n<Man at arms>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zemepána nám zavraždili! Čo si počneme? 
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Our lord! Murdered, what are we to do!\n<Man at arms>

items.original: Boh nech naše duše chráni, ped pekelnýma kultistáma!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: God save our souls from the hellish cultists!\n<Knight>

items.original: V dedine mám sesternicu.\n<Rytier>
items.translation: I have a cousin in the village.\n<Knight>

items.original: Dosc už! Naj skare totych kultistoch zaraz teraz! Hajzli!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: Enough already! Down with the cult! Knaves, all of them!\n<Knight>

items.original: S pomocou Boha porazíme kultistov!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: With God's help, we will defeat the cultists!\n<Knight>

items.original: Jak to vobec taky kult mohol vzniknuc? Co im nasľubovali?\n<Panoš>
items.translation: <WordWrap>How could a cult have arisen in the first place? What did they promise them?\n<Squire>

items.original: Neznášam kultistov! Neznášam kultistov! Neznášam kultistov!\n<Rytier>
items.translation: I hate cultists! I hate cultists! I hate cultists!\n<Knight>

items.original: Drtený kultista je najlepší kultista!\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: The crushed cultist is the best cultist!\n<Man at arms>

items.original: Idem so zbrojnošmi do dediny, ťažký boj nás čaká.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: I shall lead the men-at-arms to the village, a weighty battle awaits us. \n<Jozef>

items.original: My ideme do ľadnice, musíme ihneď pitvať Jančiho.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We venture forth to your larder we must commence the dissection of Janči posthaste. \n<Adam>

items.original: My ideme do židovho sídla. Poletíme.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We are off to find the Jew. We will fly like birds. \n<Adam>

items.original: ...\n<Jozef>
items.translation: ...\n<Jozef>

items.original: Robte, jak myslíte.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Do as you wilt. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Ideme pomstiť zemepána. Jediného kultistu nenecháme na žive.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We ride forth to avenge our lord. Not a single cultist shall escape our wrath. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: ...\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: ...\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Dobre, robte, jak uznáte za vhodné.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: Very well, act as thou seest fit.\n<Ďusi>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To, aké finty môžeš používať závisí od toho, akú zbraň a vybavenie máš pri sebe. \n<Strážnik>
items.translation: You can use different feints, depending on what equipment you carry.\n<Guard>

items.original: V truhlici bola \c[14]oceľová helma\c[0].
items.translation: <WordWrap>There was a \c[14]steel helmet\c[0] in the chest.

items.original: Bedňa obsahovala \c[14]strieborný prsteň\c[0].
items.translation: You found a \c[14]silver ring\c[0].

items.original: Keď sa pri oltári pomodlíte, vyliečia sa vám rany!\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: When ye pray at the altar, your wounds shall be healed! \n<Herbalist>

items.original: Skúste sami! U nas v kaplnke, abo kľudne i do dediny do kostola choďte.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Try it for thyself! In our chapel, or even in the village church if ye wish.\n<Herbalist>

items.original: Dosť už bylín som vám veď dal. Nech si dá do vody tú vňat a bude lepšie, snáď.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Enough herbs I have given thee. Let him soak the hearbs in water and mayhap it shall improve.\n<Herbalist>

items.original: Sluchaj tu, zemepan nas po byliny dajake poslal.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Listen here, the lord hath sent us for some herbs.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Byliny? Hocijake?\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: Herbs? Any kind?\n<Herbalist>

items.original: Neznam ja, lokajovi čreva kruti. Dačo nam daj na to.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I know not, the servant's guts are writhing. Give us something for it.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]byliny\c[0].
items.translation: You were given \c[14]herbs\c[0].

items.original: Keď sa pri oltari pomodlite, vyliečia sa vam rany!\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: When ye pray at the altar, your wounds shall be healed! \n<Herbalist>

items.original: Skuste sami! U nas v kaplnke. Abo kľudne i do dediny do kostola choďte.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Try it for thyself! In our chapel, or even in the village church if ye wish.\n<Herbalist>

items.original: Vravel som ti už. Aj byliny si dostal. Nehaj ma teraz.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: I have already told thee. Thou hast also received herbs. Leave me be now. \n<Herbalist>

items.original: Felčiarom som tu. Ratujem ľudí, keď treba. Bylinky zbieram pre chorých a tak.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation:
I am the herbalist. I aid folk when needed. 
I gather herbs for the sick and such. \n<Herbalist>

items.original: Aj mňa porichtuješ, jak by trebalo?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wilt ye also aid me if I was in need?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vravím ti, keď ťa dačo trápi, choď sa k oltáru modliť. Oltár máme i v hrade v kaplnke.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I tell thee, when something troubles thee, go pray at the altar. \n<Herbalist>

items.original: Ta aspoň dajake byliny nam nedaš?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>At least grant us some herbs?\n<Pavol>

items.original: A vieš čo, tu maš a idz.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Aye, very well. Take these and be gone. \n<Herbalist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Keď sa pri oltari pomodlite, vyliečia sa vam rany!\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: When ye pray at the altar, your wounds shall be healed! \n<Herbalist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Skuste sami! U nas v kaplnke, abo kľudne i do dediny do kostola choďte.\n<Felčiar>
