items.translation: <WordWrap>Try it for thyself! In our chapel, or even in the village church if ye wish.\n<Herbalist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Felčiarom som tu. Ratujem ľudí, keď treba. Bylinki zbieram pre chorých a tak.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation:
I am the herbalist. I aid folk when needed. 
I gather herbs for the sick and such. \n<Herbalist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Aj mňa porichtuješ jak by trebalo?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wilt ye also aid me if I was in need?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Som sa bol modliť z rána. Ci beky, hovorím vám, chrbát sa mi narovnal a kolená ma nebolia.\n<Felčiar>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Forsooth, I prayed at the altar in the morning. I tell you, my back straightened and my knees no longer hurt.\n<Herbalist>

items.original: V skrini niekto nechal \c[14]alpu\c[0].
items.translation: Someone left \c[14]alpa\c[0] in the wardrobe.

items.original: Sudy plné \c[14]vínka\c[0]!
items.translation: Barrels full of \c[14]wine\c[0]!

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo ty tu? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What manner of business brought you hither?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Jožku, bi na poplach, stary hrad hori jak fakľa! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Jozef, sound the alarm, the old castle ablaze lik' a torch! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tota zrucanina? Jej škoda nebude. Od kedy ju ešte aj husiti vyrabovali, nič dobré sa tam nezdržiava. Choď ale radšej pozrieť, či dajaké deti tam slamu nezapálili abo čo. Ale Pali... Boha ti... tiahne z teba na tri siahy, načo sa trepeš za mnou, keď furt len slopeš a spíš doobedia?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The old ruin? Its loss won't be mourned. Since even the Hussites ransacked it, naught but ill fortune resides there. Still, go there and see whether some mischievous youths set fire to it. But Pali... by the grace of God... Your stench precedes your presence by three yards. Why do you persist in pestering me whilst inebriated?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Ľen še mi čežko zašpava. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Bah, just had a hard time falling asleep.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Héj tam, jasné. Kvôli žene chlastáš, priznaj sa! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Clear as day, I shall believe you not. You carouse for the sake of a woman, admit it! \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta kejc furt na ňu myšľim, šak som ci hutorel. Dogabany som z teho, cij pana. Neznam, co doraz. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Tis true, I cannot cease thinking of her, as I did warn ye. I am vexed beyond measure, lost I am. I know not what to make of it.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sa spamätaj, Anciáša! Čo teraz, akože budeš dokedy sa ožierať kvôli temu? Šak aj mne jedna žena ušla a neslopem tu od rána do noci furt jak Tatár.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Gather your wits, Anciáša! So what, are you going to drown yourself in sorrow over that? I too, lost a woman, yet you don't see me drinking dusk till dawn like a Tatár.\n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kašlem na šicko. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: I dinnae care fur anything. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Počuj sem, ty oplan. Iď za Matejom ihneď! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Listen here, you numskull. Go seek counsel from Matej right away!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Matejom? Toten mnich, co sem tyž nedavno privandroval? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej? The monk who too recently reached our midst?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Hej, ten. Nach ťa dá dokopy s totými svojimi modlitbami abo s čím chce. Načo je mi taký chumaj dodžubaný. Kej ani svätená voda ti nepomôže, ta ja už neznam. \!
...a tu, daj si figu, kukaj tu. Z Pešti mi došlo. \n
items.translation:
Yes, him. He will put you right with those endless prayers of his or whatever. What use are you to me in such wretched state? If not even holy water can aid you, I am at my wits end. \!
...and here, take this fig. Behold, it came from Pešť. \n

items.original: Získal si \c[14]figu\c[0].
items.translation: You got a \c[14]fig\c[0].

items.original: Ci dušu, ta to sladota. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Dear God, sweetness for my sould, I say.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No, ale poď prv zahrať so mnou dakus. Z totej Pešti ešte, aha, došli takéto kartičky štvorcové. Že obracať musíš furt po dve a kej trafíš, ta si ich zoberieš. Zábavka to, pexeso sa to volá.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>But come play something with me first. Such square cards have arrived, also from Buda. You have to flip two at a time and if you match them, you take them. It's merriment itself, Pexeso it's called .\n<Jozef>

items.original: Neee, daj pokuj... Idzem za totym švetym. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nay, len' me peace... I shall seek solace with yer saint.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Akorat mi povedz ešči... \n<Pavol>
items.translation: But tell me this... \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vidno, že na spoveď nechodíš často. V kapli na konci chodby je. Tu len doprava choď. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Clearly, you don't frequent the confessional. In the chapel at the end of the hallway. Just go right.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Kam sa náhliš? Najprv pekne ty za Matejom choď. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Where are you rushing off to? First, go pay respect to Matej.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
Joži, podz še kuknuc užaj, fras akysi mi do okna vľezol! 
Šcesce, že som v zbroji zašpal. \n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Jozef, hasten to peer inside! Some monstrosity climbed into my window!
Fortune, that I fell asleep clad in armor.\n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Azanyát, Pali… znaš, že keby ťa zamordoval, po tom včerajšku by mi ani ľúto nebolo. Ešte som i prehral s Matejom… fiškus ma zblokoval. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Azanyát, Pali... dost you know that had he slain you, after yestereve's affair, I would hardly lament? I was even bested by Matej... that rogue hath outwitted me, blocked all my moves.\n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo to je za ohavnosť? Pane na nebi, veď tá nestvora musela zo samého pekla vyliezť! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What manner of foulness is this? By the heavens, forsooth that creature must have emerged from the very depths of hell!\n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Boh nech nás ochraňuje. Ale hľa! Veď má na sebe Jančiho odev i zbroj! \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>May God protect us. But look! It wears Janči's attire and armor. \n<Matej>

items.original: Co kejc to on sam? Barz dobre mu včera nebulo. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Is it not him? Verily, he was not in good spirits yesterday. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Išteném… toto bol náš Janči, kuknite na ten chrup. Také krivé zuby v hrade mal len on. Feri asi tak isto dopadol. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Isteném… this was our Janči, behold his countenance. Such crooked teeth in the castle he alone possessed. Likely, Feri fared similarly.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toto nebude práca nejakej biednej sekty, ba ani husitov. Tá banda, čo nás včera napadla, to boli heretici. Vzývali akéhosi Zurvana. Máme dočinenia s čiernou mágiou! V noci ho isto zo zášti zakliali! 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>This is not the machination of some impoverished sect, nor even the Hussites. The band that assailed us on yestereve were heretics. They invoked a being named Zurvan. We are confronted with sorcery of the darkest kind! Surely, they did set upon him beneath the shroud of night to curse him! \n<Matej>

items.original: Isto mi aj ženu oni dopsuli! Šak ona čistunke dievča! To zle čary! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: They must bewitched my wife as well! She, the purest maiden! 'Tis foul sorcery!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ó, hogy bassza meg egy talicska apró majom! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Ó, hogy bassza meg egy talicska apró majom! \n<Jozef>

items.original: No nič. Pištík, sem poď. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Thus be it. Pištík, come hither. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zober tú potvoru do ľadovne, holnap príde Adam. On sa vyučil na univerzite a tam rezali mŕtvoly. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Take this fiend to the ice-house. Come the morrow, Adam shall arrive to us. He, schooled in the halls of learning, hath dissected corpses aplenty.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Mno. A vy dvaja. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well and good. And you two.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Choďte do dediny a richtárovi poviete, kam nám miznú ľudia. Tuhľa spíšem i list, že v akej veci vás posielam. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Venture to the town and apprise the burgmaster of our missing folk. A letter I shall pen, detailing the urgency of the matter.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No aľe, chlapci moji, veď ešte sme ani nejedli, si zahráme človeče pri frištiku. Také nové z Nemecka mi včera došlo, to ľahké, sa nebojte, furt len s kockou sa rúca do ošalenia a sa vyhadzujú von figúrky, bárs smiešne to je! 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>But come, good fellows, we have yet to breakfast; let us engage in a game of Ludo during our meal. I have acquired it from Germany. Fear not, for with the toss of the dice, the pieces shall dance in jest, a spectacle of mirth indeed!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Nas nestrimuj, idzeme za totym richtarom, coška zakušneme v hostincu. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hinder us not. Let us pay the burgmaster a visit, and perchance sample a morsel at the inn.\n<Pavol>

items.original: No jak chcete. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>As you wishest. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Pištík! Rozkladaj pexeso! \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Pištík! Ready the game of Pexeso!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Našiel si 3 deci \c[14]slivkového vína\c[0].
items.translation: You found three bottles of \c[14]plum wine\c[0].

items.original: V skrini si našiel \c[14]podšitú čiapku\c[0].
items.translation: You found an \c[14]arming cap\c[0].

items.original: Drychmať môžeš inokedy.
items.translation: Slumber you will at another time.

items.original: Paskuda zakapatá tu leží.
items.translation: Loathsome entity lies here prostrate.

items.original: V diaľke horí starý hrad.
items.translation: In the distance, the old castle is ablaze.

items.original: Výhľad na starý hrad pôsobí rovnako nešťastne ako vždy.
items.translation: The view of the old castle appears as hapless as ever.

items.original: Scenka
items.translation: Fresco.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo moj? Šak len tam zájdi. Barz ich neagituj, daj im len ten obrázoček. Kus tam posnor a vráť sa s informáciami.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Go forth. Just venture there. Do not incite them, merely present the painting. Tarry not, glean what knowledge thou canst, and return. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Už si našiel v kostole Bohdana? Choď ho chytro hľadať.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hath you found Bohdan within the church? Waste no moment in your pursuit. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Budem aj ja s lukostrelcom obďaleč. Nie je mi zaľahko vysielať vás do takého nebezpečia. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I shall accompany the archer at a distance. I doth not take lightly the prospect of sending thee into such peril. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toho qahwah tam bolo strašne veľa. Väčšina zrna neopražená, našli sme však už aj zrnká s vyrytými symbolmi. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>There was so much qahwah there. Most of the grains are unroasted, but we have already found grains with engraved symbols.  \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Už ste boli v tej krčme? 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Have you been to the tavern yet?  \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Nechceli ste ísť žida hľadať? Ja tu organizujem rytierov, vyrazíme dedinčanom na pomoc.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Didn't you want to go looking for a Jew? I organize the knights here, we go to help the villagers. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Bežte po Mateja, ja som hneď tam.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Go get Matej, I'll be right there. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Teraz hybajte do krčmy! Možno ešte tam zastihnete toho Kor.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Now get moving to the inn! You may still find the Rot there. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Vytrimeš to tu s nim sam?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wilt ye confront him alone? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ale hej. Ten šach sa dá ešte. Pexeso hrať, to by som nepredýchal. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, that I shall. The chess match be prefered. Playing Pexeso games, I could not bear. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Inač... jak si totim Husitom hutorel, ty si fakt počul Husa "mluviti"?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Anyway, as you told the Hussites... You heard Hus speaketh?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>V živote som nebol v Prahe! Ba čo viac, keď Husa upálili, mal som dva roky, aj tak by som si prd pamätal.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I've never been to Prague in my life! What's more, when Hus was burned, I was two years old, I wouldn't remember a fart anyway.\n<Matej>

items.original: Hehehe, ty si iny fiškus. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hehehe, you are more of a fox then I anticipated. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zemepán tu má \c[14]frndžalicu\c[0].
items.translation: Zemepan here has a \c[14]frndžalitz\c[0].

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak to je koniec toto.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This is the end of us.\n<Ďusi>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Musíme sa pripraviť na najhoršie.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We need to prepare for the worst.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Uskladnené je tu jedlo pre posádku hradu.
items.translation: Food for the castle crew is stored here.

items.original: Fľaška \c[14]frndžalice\c[0]. Neopovrhneme.
items.translation: A bottle of \c[14]frndžalitz\c[0]. We will not despise.

items.original: Toto svinstvo kedysi bol náš Janči.
items.translation: This mass of meat used to be our Janči.

items.original: Chudák Janči. Riadne sme ho dorichtovali. Snáď mu to nevadí.
items.translation: Poor Janči, hopefuly he doesn't mind how he ended up.

items.original: Koniec leta sa blíži, ľadu je však ešte dosť. Do zimy vydrží.
items.translation: The end of summer is near, but there is still enough ice. It will last until winter.

items.original: Pan zemepan, som zistil, že na vás chystajú atentát! Rýchlo utečte!\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Milord, I found out that they are planning to assassinate you! Run fast!\n<Ďusi>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ďusi môj zlatý, teraz sme ich vybili do jedného. Ale aj tak ti mocno ďakujem za snahu, vidím, že sa neflákaš. Len pred pár minútami sa odohral boj. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ďusi my darling, now we have put them down. But still, thank you very much for your effort, I can see that you are not slacking off. There was a fight just a few minutes ago. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Nič to, pôjdem ďalej Feriho hľadať!\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: It's all right, I'll keep looking for Feri!\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Slava Isusu Christu. Ty si toten hlavny svatuškar?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Praised be Jesus Christ. Ye art the sanctimonious one?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Na veky amen, brat môj. Prečo rušíš moje rozjímanie?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Praised be brother. Why dost thou disturb my contemplation? \n<Matej>

items.original:
Poslal me za tebu zemepan. Treba se mnu což zrobic, chodzim jak bez duše.
Ma žena opustila.\n
items.translation:
The lord sent me hither. I am in need of something, I wander as if bereft of soul.
My lady hath forsaken me.\n

items.original:
Brat môj, veľké nešťastie ťa postihlo, ale pamätaj, že sa píše:
"Pán uzdravuje skrúšených srdcom a obväzuje im rany." Nuž vzdaj sa svojho žiaľu
a primkni dušu k Pánu. A pálenky sa stráň, podľa pachu mal si dosť. Desať rázy otčenáš. Nech ťa Pán sprevádza, v mene Otca i syna... \n
items.translation:
Brother, great misfortune hath befallen thee, but remember, 'tis written:
\"He healeth the broken in heart and bindeth up their wounds.\" Relinquish thy sorrow and give thy soul unto the Lord. Let go of spirits, for thou hast had thy fill by reason of the odour. Ten times recite the Lord's Prayer. May the Lord be with thee.\n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No, ta ďakujem pekne, že tak šibko ši me zbavil smutku za ženu. Takoj še cicim jak novy človek, prisamveru. Jááj, keby ja znal, že še stači pomodľic a hotovo. Vidno, že o tom nič neznaš v totym celibate.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Ha! I thank you kindly for relieving me of sadness over my wife so swiftly.
I immediately feel renewed, truly. If only I had know that a simple prayer would suffice. Clearly, in yer celibacy you know naught of trials that accompany wedlock. \n

items.original: Sluchaj ma bratu, poc se mnu prezreť stary hrad, což tam hori dačo, požiar.\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Listen brother, come search the old castle with me. Something seems to be aflame,
a fire. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Čo si rozum potratil? Práve iluminujem Pojednanie svätého Marka o žalospevoch nad Izraelitmi, daj mi pokoj s požiarom. Sprevádzať ťa tam môže hocjaký lokaj.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hath thou lost your mind? I am currently illuminating the Book of Lamentations of Saint Mark over the Israelites; leave me be with the fire. Any servant may accompany thee thither.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nene, tak rozkazal zemepan. Ty maš isc a hotovo. Naj dohliadaš na spásu mojej duše ubolenej.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, so commanded the lord of the land. Ye must go, and that's final. To ensure the salvation of my weary soul. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mňa sem poslal arcibiskup Gejza z Debrecínskej farnosti na audíciu miestneho farára, nie na liečenie miestnych alkoholikov. Idem sa sťažovať zemepánovi.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I was sent here by Archbishop Gejza of the Debrecín Parish for audition of a local priest, not for the treatment of local alcoholics. I shall make my grievance known to the lord of the land.\n<Matej>

items.original: Ta co vravel?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Well, what did he say? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>...protiví sa mi opustiť iluminovanie, ale čo je Božie Bohu a Pánu čo Pánovo. Brat môj, až však zahliadnem, že piješ...
<Wordwrap>Všetko zapíšem tuto do knižky i nažalujem zemepánovi, rozumieš?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>...though it vexes me to abandon my illumination... what is God's to God, and the Lord's to Lord. But brother, if I behold thee partaking of the cup... All shall be duly inscribed in this book, and I shall lodge a complaint with the lord of the land, dost thou comprehend?\n<Matej>

items.original: Dóbre veď, dobre. Podz už het, doraz tma bude.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Alright then, alright.  Come now, the dusk is nigh.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Mních Matej sa pridal do tvojej družiny.
items.translation: Monk Matej has joined your band.

items.original:
Na nich! \.\.\^
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Get them! \.\.\^\n<Jozef>

items.original:
Pozrite. Ďuri bol medzi nimi. Včera ešte pexeso so mnou hral. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Behold, amongst them Ďuri, who just yesterday engaged me in a game of Pexeso. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Ty si tá Anička? Si mi krk zachránila. Bez teba by ma nachytali s holým zadkom, jak by som čupel nad pexesom a zas hral sám proti sebe. Abo ešte horšie vo svojej komnate kukal na fresku… \!
Miesto meča by som mal v rukách- \^ \n
items.translation:
Art thou Anička? Thou hast preserved my life. Without thee, I would have been caught unawares, squatting over the gameboard, playing against mine own self. Or worse, gazing at my fresco, adorning it. \!
Stead a sword in hand I wouldst… - \^\n

items.original:
Zas nemusíš nám to tak farbisto vykresľovať.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Thou needest not render the scene so vividly. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Tu máš 10 zlatých a dajakú robotu ti nájdem na zámku, nech nemukluješ na poli. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Here, take these ten gold coins, and I shall procure you employment within the castle walls, sparing you from toil in the fields. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Ona je vzdelaná, vie aj čítať.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Verily, she is learned, she can read as well. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No azanyát, však mi treba niekoho, nech nemusím všetky tie objednávky sám vypisovať. Aj som mal minule taký nápad… že šak to by sa dalo, žeby bol taký stroj, že iba stisneš písmenko a vyletí odniekiaľ razítko a to písmeno sa ti samo odtlačí na pergamen.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Azanyát, we need someone to assist me with all these orders. I once had such a notion... that it could be done, could be a contraption, where you merely press a letter and from somewhere a stamp emerges, and the letter is imprinted on parchment. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Hmmm, ale nejak by sa muselo to písmenko zafarbiť. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hmmm, but the letter wouldst need to be inked somehow. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No a ja mám čo robiť? Však som jediná nažive. Nemôžem sa len tak vrátiť. A bez škrabanca, keď všetkých ste zamordovali. \n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And what am I to do? I am the only one left alive. I cannot just return as if nothing happened, with everyone else murdered. \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Akože bez škrabanca, však ťa v noci otec zmlátil ako žito. Im poukazuj sinky, kus ťa ofŕkame prasacou krvou. Potrháme oblečenie. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>As if without a scratch? Yet thy father beat thee like grain in the night. Show thee wounds, we wilt smeare you with pig's blood, and tear your clothes. \n<Matej>

items.original:
To čisty blud. I tak budu znac, že ona bola krysa, kedz jedina prežila.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: 'Tis pure folly. Even so, suspicions shall linger, for she alone survived. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vedieť nebudú, ale podozrievať isto hej… Dievča, chceš také riziko podstúpiť? Ťa tu môžeme schovať, nemusíš toto robiť… si nám už pomohla habadej.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They may not know, but suspicion shall surely follow... Damsel, dost thou wish to undertake such a risk? We can harbor thee here, thou needst not embark upon this... thy aid hath been ample already. \n<Matej>

items.original: Skúsim… ale chcem, aby ste potom pustili Matúša. \n<Anička>
items.translation: I shall endeavor... yet I would hath thee release Matúš thereafter. \n<Anička>

items.original:
Stále ho miluješ? Po tom všetkom?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Dost thou still hold affection for him? After all this? \n<Matej>

items.original: Jasné, že áno. Ale neviem, či ho chcem ešte vidieť. \n<Anička>
items.translation: Aye, I do. But I know not if I wish to lay eyes upon him again. \n<Anička>

items.original:
Láska, Bože, láska… dze ce ľudze beru? 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ah, love, the enigma of the divine... whence doth it spring? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Vyhlasujem veľkú amnestiu na neveru.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: I declare a great amnesty upon infidelity. \n<Matej>

items.original: Ci dušu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: By my soul.\n<Pavol>

items.original: To de zas som?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Where am I this time?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej, ty!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hey ye!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Teho? Tutaj dole? Darmo ho tu hľadať.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Him? Down here? No point seeking him here.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Šak ja nič už.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Leave me be.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Pištík, ty si taky glupy jak toto drevo.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Pištík, ye art as dull as this wood. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dakto klope. \n<Pištík>
items.translation: Someone is knocking. \n<Pištík>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pištík, idz do hradu a mi zožeň dajake vinko abo co. Nech ťa nikto nevidí, a keby sa dakto na nás pytal, ta mu povidz, že nič neznaš.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pištík go to the castle and fetch some wine or something. Let none see ye, and if anyone should inquire, tell them ye knowest naught. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobre, skusim. \n<Pištík>
items.translation: Very well, I shall try. \n<Pištík>

items.original: Tu som aha čo našol. \n<Pištík>
items.translation: Behold what I found. \n<Pištík>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]starú bagandžu\c[0].
items.translation: You gained  an \c[14]old boot\c[0].

items.original: Neznam, co som čekal.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I knew not what I expected. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Povedzte zemepanovi, že už pexešo rozložene.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Tell the lord the pexeso is ready.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Minule už som pochopil, jak sa pexeso hraje.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Methinks I finally understand pexeso. You have to match 2 cards.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Neznace dze je zemepan? Tu od rana čekam naňho s pexesom.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Where is milord? Do you know not? I'm waiting for him all morning with pexso.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Sudy pripravené na vínko. Zatiaľ smutné prázdnotou.
items.translation: The barrels are ready for some wine. For now, sadly empty.

items.original: V peci sa dačo pečie asi, zavoňalo.
items.translation: Mayhaps something is being baked in the oven. It smells pleasant.

items.original: Na peci ležia práve upečené \c[14]sucháre\c[0]. Vzal si ich.
items.translation: There be fresh \c[14]biscuits\c[0] on the oven. You take them.

items.original: Co tam robia?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What vileness is this?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Šak ona ho bozka!!!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: She doth embrace him!!!\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Krista, žena moja, ty sa tu budzeš oblizovac s posličkami? 
Ja toto nevytrimem, takoj ju rozdrapim jak hada!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>By Christ, my wife, dost ye seek to cavort with messengers? I shall not abide this affront; I shall rend her asunder like a serpent!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Drž ho! Chuju, popsuješ akciu! Azanyát!\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Hold him! By the heavens, you dost imperil our scheme! Azanyát!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Pali, stoj!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Pali, hark!\n<Matej>

items.original:
Pauli, ty suka! Ja ťa zabijem! Ta ty tu nohy rozcahovac budzeš? 
Ťa rozštvrtim, prisamboha!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Paula, ye harlot! I shall end ye! Dost ye spread yer legs here? I shall cleave ye limb from limb, by almighty God!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Darmo ma prenasleduješ, zúfalec! Berte ho!\n<Paula>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Came to play?\n<Jozef>

items.original: V tejto truhle ktosi skrýval \c[14]fľašu vína\c[0]. Už je tvoja.
items.translation: Someone hid a \c[14]bottle of wine\c[0] in this chest. It is now ours.

items.original: Sud bol plný \c[14]zakysaného mlieka\c[0].
items.translation: The barrel was full of \c[14]sour cream\c[0].

items.original: Konec stopy. Ta co še vyparili?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: The trail's end. What manner of sorcery be this?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Diablove čary!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Tis' devil's craft!\n<Matej>

items.original: Buďte ticho obidvojo. Ty Pištik, caly deň tu sedíš. Si nevidel tu prejsť Jančiho teraz?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Silence, both of ye! Pištík, you hast been seated here all day. Didst you see Janči passing by?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Hej i s dajaku dievčinu. \n<Pištík>
items.translation: Aye, accompanied by a maiden fair.\n<Pištík>

items.original: No? A kam zmizli?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Well? Whither did they disappear?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Tuto do tajnej chodby.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Into yon secret passageway.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Počúvajte, tu keď buchnem, duto sa to ozýva.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Listen, when I strike here, it doth sound hollow.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hmmm, tuhľa, skúsim na tehlu zatlačiť... Alebo tu snáď? Vyzerá byť kus ináč zafarbená.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hmmm, mayhap pressing on this brick... Or perchance this one? This one doth seem to bear a different hue. \n<Matej>

items.original: Krisztusát.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Krisztusát.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pištík, čo si ihneď za mnou nešiel? Také veci, keď sa tu dejú mi pod riťou, musím takoj znac!
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Pištík, why didst you not come to me forthwith? When such events take place, I must needs be informed!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Jaj, ja myslel že to naši tu chodia. Bo už das mešac tu kopu dačo.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh, I thought 'twas our comrades arriving. 'Tis been a month since digging here started.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Bolond vagy! Na dereš pôjdeš! Teraz hneď, ty hlava prepitá!\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Bolond vagy! Hollowhead! Torture shall seal thy doom!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Ser naňho teraz. Musime Jančiho najsc. Šak moja žena tam kdesi sama s nim je.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Worry not for him at this hour. We must locate Janči with all haste, for my wife is alone with him.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobre. Poďme, no. A ty Pištík, ty sa teš.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Agreed. Let us proceed. And you, Pištík, prepare yourself.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Čo?\n<Pištík>
items.translation: What?\n<Pištík>

items.original: Bratku, na teba som tu čakal... Nechceš sa pridať k nám?\n<Čudák>
items.translation: Comrade, I have awaited thy arrival... Wouldst ye join us?\n<Miscreant>

items.original: Jak čakal, šak ja som sem len zabludzil, bo neznam co mam robic.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Awaited? How? I wandered here by chance, for I know not what course to pursue.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Žiadna náhoda neexistuje, to hviezdy ťa sem nasmerovali. Tak čo, pridáš sa k nám alebo nie? Ak sa pridáš, dokážeme veľké veci, získaš moc, o akej sa ani Hunyadymu neprisnilo. Ak nie, umrieš v zabudnutí ako pes.
\n<Čudák>
items.translation: <WordWrap>No mere chance exists, for the stars that have guided ye here. So, wilt ye join us or nay? Should ye join, we shalt accomplish great deeds, and ye shalt gain power beyond Hunyady's wildest dreams. If not, ye shalt perish in obscurity like a mut.\n<Miscreant>

items.original: Dobrá voľba. Poď, zavediem ťa medzi našich.\n<Čudák>
items.translation: A wise choice. Come, I shall lead ye amongst our ranks. \n<Miscreant>

items.original: Tu ťa kričať nikto nebude počuť.\n<???>
items.translation: No one shall hear you scream here.\n<???>

items.original: Ty hajzel!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Knave!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej, riaden som macher!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Some hero am I!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Paľko! Zachránil si calý kraj i moju dušu! Nebolo lepšieho dňa v Uhorsku!\n<Paula>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Paľko! You saved me and my soul! There never was a better day than this one!\n<Paula>

items.original: Dám ti zato pol chotára do daru!\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I will give you half of my domain!\n<Jozef>

items.original: Popiči.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Fuck yeah.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Drevo pripravené na zimu.
items.translation: The firewood prepared for winter.

items.original: Rovná stena tu len je.
items.translation: Nothing but a straight wall.

items.original: Tak čo? Si si rozmyslel? Zahráme? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: So? Changed your mind? Shall we play?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Nebarz. Račej mi povidz...\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nay. Just tell me...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vidno, že na spoveď nechodíš často. V kapli na konci chodby je. Tu len doprava choď.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Clearly you don't frequent the confessional. The chapel is just right of here.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Kam sa náhliš? Najprv pekne ty za Matejom choď.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Where are you rushing off to? First, go pay respect to Matej.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Čo vy tu ešte? Šak hybaj na stary hrad. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Why are you still here? Make haste to the old castle forthwith.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jáj Pali, ty si snaď rozum prepil. Predsa z hradu ako vyjdeš, ta len na sever choď. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh Pali, have you lost your mind to drink. Whence you depart the castle, just head north.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobry večer sa praje, Jožo. Ta čuj tu, boli sme tam kuknuc a coška bars plano še tu robi. Zhorety turek tam bul a dajaky nastroj hudobny, Matej hutori, že to z pekla čorta vola. Ja tak dumam, že lepše Adama z Kassau na toto povolať. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Good eve to ye, Jožo. Hark ye well, we ventured forth and found strange doings still afoot. A burnt Turk lay there, and a curious musical instrument, Matej suspects it hails from the infernal depths. Methinks 'twould be better to summon Adam of Kassau hence.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobry večer sa praje, Jožo. Ta čuj tu, boli sme tam kuknuc a coška bars plano še tu robi. Zhorety turek tam bul. Ja tak dumam, že lepše Adama z Kassau na toto povolať. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Good eve to ye, Jozef. Hark ye well, we ventured forth and found strange doings still afoot. A burnt Turk lay there. Methinks 'twould be better to summon Adam of Kassau hence.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Krisztušát! Turci? Isto sa bratria s dajakou odnožou husitskou alebo čo. Ja už neviem. Nieto chvíľe pokoja. Ale áno, Adam jest dobrý inkvizítor, mnoho zločincoch pochytal na Uhroch. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Kristusát! Turks? Mayhap cohorting with some Hussite offshoot, or the like. I know not. There's scant moment of peace. Yet verily, Adam is a stout inquisitor, who hath caught many miscreants in Hungary.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tu máte zapečatený list, kedvešem. Dajte to tomu rytierovi Jančimu pri bráne, nech ihneď vyrazí cvalom do Kassau. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Here's a sealed letter, kedvesem. Make haste, deliver it unto knight Janči at the gate, that he may speed to Kassau forthwith.\n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kukni še i na tote zrnka, ty ši expert na take. Boli tam rozrucane všade. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Take heed of yon seeds, ye art learned in such matters. They were scattered all around the old castle.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hát, tak toto je interesantné. Bárs to nepoznám, iba som raz počul od grófa Eszterházyho, že taká horká vodička sa v Perzii z podobného varí, možno to je ono... Jaj, azanyát, szivecske, barátok moji, ale veď podme si zahrať jednu partiu mariáša, akurát sme traja, to rýchlo bude! 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hát, intriguing, indeed. Albeit I am unfamiliar, I once heard from Count Eszterházy that such bitter water is brewed in Persia; mayhap this be it... Oh, woe is me, szivecske, but let us play a game of Mariáš, for we are but three, 'twill be swiftly done! \n<Jozef>

items.original: ...Ehm. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>...Ahem. \n<Matej>

items.original: Neeee, daj pokuj, nemame času, idzeme za totym poslom. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, len' me peace, we lack time; let us go find yon messenger.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ste si rozmysleli? Zahráme predsa? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Hast you changed thy mind? Shall we play after all? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Pri bráne vravím. Totej, čo keď ňou prejdeš, ta von z hradu vyjdeš. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: At the gate, I say. That one, whence you shalt depart the castle. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No ako asi, platím výpalné Jiskrovi, tomu ich vodcovi. Isteže je mi to proti srsti, inak by sme ale dopadli jak na Kapušanoch...\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>How do you think? I pay off Jiskra, their leader. Of course It pains me, but otherwise we would end up like at Kapušany...\n<Jozef>

items.original: Idete zahrať?  \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Came to play?\n<Jozef>

items.original: Veď v dedine, predsa. Tam sa spýtajte miestnych. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>In the town, naturally. Inquire with the locals. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Szivecske, čo vy tu? Dačo už ste od richtára vyzistili? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Szivecske, what brings you here? Hast thou learned aught from the burgmaster? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Nuž, sluchaj. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Listen well. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sam neznam, co si mam mysľec. Toten pip z takych kostkoch si robi napoj, jake sme spatreli vof starom hradze rozrucane. Ale tote co buli v starom hrade, ta take su počmarane, a kejc to daš dakomu zjesc, ho to uplne dopsuje.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Myself am uncertain what to make of it. This priest brews a concoction from such beans as we found in the old castle ruins. Yet those found within the castle are tainted, and should one consume them, it could be one's undoing. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toten pip, počuvaj, to samy problem. Poslal nas richtar za nim, že nam poradi. Potem, čo v burdeli sme ho našli, ušol het. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, that priest is a thorn in our side. The burgmaster sent us in pursuit of him, seeking counsel. But after discovering him in the brothel, he hath vanished once more. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Čo je veľa, to je veľa. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Indeed, too much of a coincidence. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No čekaj. Tak sme ho v kosceli našli a tam o kostkoch sme sa rozpravali. Totych, co v hradze sme našli. On presne take ma tyž a si z teho napoj robi.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Stay a moment. We found him in the church, and there we spoke of the beans. The very beans we found within the castle. He possesseth the same, brewing some manner of beverage from them. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pravda. Qahwah to nazýval. \n<Matej>
items.translation: True indeed. He named it Qahwah. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, tak. Akorat potom zdrhol dakam zaš. A poslal na nas dajakych lapkoch svojich. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, precisely so. Yet anon he vanished once more, sending his minions after us. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ci pánečku. Ta vysnorte ho. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: God protect us. You must need go and seek him out. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Sebe predstav, že pipa sme v burdeli našli. Akorat doobcoval. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Picture this, we found the priest in the brothel. Frolicking  away his sorrows. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Márnosť šedivá. Hát, s vyšetrovaním toho kultu nám to ale asi bárs nepomôže. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, a grim state of affairs. But that's unlikely to shed much light on our investigation of the cult. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Praveže asi i hej. Taky napoj tmavy tam pil. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Mayhaps. He was partaking of something dark there. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Myslíš, že to z toho zrna v hrade? Šak mohol aj kalnú vodu piť, neviem. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Do you reckon 'tis from the beans in the castle? Though he might as well hath been swilling muddy water for all we know. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Zajimava nahoda by to bola. Ku všeckemu zdrhol het a kdovie, kde sa skryva. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It would be a curious twist of fate. And to make matters worse, he hath fled , and who knows where he hath taken refuge. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Skuste dačo ešte vyzistiť. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: You ought to endeavor to gather further intelligence. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Nas richtar poslal za pipom. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: The burgmaster sent us after the priest. \n<Pavol>

items.original: No. A ste za nim boli? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Ah, and hath you found him yet? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Tá, ne ešče. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nat, not yet. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mno, husitoch sme Židovi vyhnali z domu. Mu tam riaden brajgeľ robili... Ale to nejest doležite. Prezradil daco barz fajne, toti plani kultisti maju šatstvo zdobene vampirskyma zubama. Kejc dajakeho najdzeš, ta takoj ho štur do basy.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, we have succeeded in driving the Hussites from the Jew's home. They wrought havoc within... But that is of little consequence. He divulged some interesting tidings. The cultists don garments adorned with the teeth of vampires. Should ye encounter any such, detain them posthaste. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Interesantné, dobre vedieť. Dám hneď vedieť posádke, nech sa majú na pozore... \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Interesting indeed, good to know. I shall promptly apprise the gurads as to they remain vigilant. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Židov dom dajaka husitska banda obsadila. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: The Hussite rabble has laid claim to the Jew's dwelling. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šak ja viem. Sme sa rozpravali terazky o tom, totych dvoch chlapov, čo sú s vami, tých som vám k tomu pridelil. Ak si zabudol.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, I am aware. We spoke of it but moments ago. Those two lads accompanying you, I have tasked them with this mission. Perhaps you have forgotten. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak še veci maju. Žid vraj o kultistoch coška zna. Ale husiti mu dom obsadili a nehodla ani slova prezradic. Teda dokym sa naspak k imaniu nedostane.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So it stands. The Jew claims to possess knowledge concerning the cultists. However, the Hussites have seized his dwelling, and he vows not to speak until he reclaims his property. \n<Pavol>

items.original: No a teraz čo my? Akože mu ideme vyháňať husitov z domu? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And what course shall we take now? Shall we endeavor to expel the Hussites from his abode? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta bolo by dobre. I zaplatil fajne. Akorat totych husitoch tam bulo jak muchoch na hovne. Sam s Macejom ich isto nevyženiem. Posily nam treba.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Twould be wise. He offered fair coin. Yet those Hussites, they swarmed within like flies upon dung. Alone with Matej, we shan't drive them hence. We require reinforcements. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Posily, hej? Pošlem s vami dvoch chlopoch. Dajte im paru korún na pivo potom.
Nech nepindajú. \n
items.translation:
Reinforcements, you say? I shall dispatch two lads to accompany you. Provide them with a few coins for ale afterward.
Let them not grumble. \n

items.original: Poslal nas richat žida hledac. Vraj kadečo zna. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The burgmaster hath sent us to consult the Jew. Supposedly, he knows many things. \n<Pavol>

items.original: A jak? Našli ste ho? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: And hast you found him? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Ešči ne, vraj v lese žije.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Not as yet. He is said to dwell within the forest. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jak sa vám darí, mládenci?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: How are you lads? \n<Jozef>

items.original: No! Barátok moji, tu ste konečne.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Aye! My good brethren, here you are at last. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Kde ste v noci boli?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Where were you last night? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Sme pipa v lese hledali, ale to škoda reči.
Tu kukaj keho sme sem priviedli. \n
items.translation:
We were a-hunting for the priest in the forest, but that tale must wait.
Look who we took hold of for ye.\n

items.original: <Wordwrap>Milosť! Jhaaj, prosím! Pre šecko, čo vám je sväté, prosím, neubližujte mi, nieee. Ja som len chudáčik úbohý aaaai!\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Mercy! I beseech thee! For all that is holy, I beg thee, do not harm me, nooo. I am but a poor wretch aaai! \n<Dick>

items.original: Stichni! Čo to za paholka ste sem dovliekli?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Silence! What manner of lad hath you brought here? \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kultista. Pri dedine sme ho našli. Dali sme pozor, aby sa mu nič nestalo. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A cultist. We found him near the village. We ensured no harm befell him. \n<Matej>

items.original: Tak to je skvost! Šup s ním na dereš.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: What a sight. To the rack with him. \n<Jozef>

items.original: NIEEEEEeeeee.\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: Mayyy…\n<Dick>

items.original: Tak vykladaj! Kto je tvoj vodca? Kde sídli? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: So speak! Who commands you?  Where doth he reside? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nemôžem, oni so mnou zrobia amencma! Neubližujte mi! Nie, nie, nieeeee, šak ja nič vám nechcem zle! Nechcel som sa pridať ani k totej sekte, to Ňúma ma nútil, to jeho na dereš vezmiteeeEEE NIEEEE! Prosím, nie! Nebite ma.
\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Spare me! Nay, nay, nay! I mean thee no harm! I did not wish to join that cult, it was Weenie who coerced me, take him instead, noooo! I beg thee, no! Spare me. \n<Dick>

items.original: Kec takoj neodpoviš zemepanovi, ta papekom ca precahnem jak psa! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Should ye not answer the lord I wilt beat ye like a dog! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To nechcel som nikdy sa pridať k nim, nechcel som, nieee. Sľubovali mi, že husitov vyženu z kraju, a že mi pomôžu chyžku napraviť. Som nevedel, že oni také činia, čo sa nesmie. Ratujce me, prosím, dakto, prosím. Zurvana nechcem už, choď preč! Choď preč! Joooj, jaaaajh. \^\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I never wanted to join them, never! They hath promised to drive the Hussites out of the land and help me fix my hut. I hath not know they doth such forbidden deeds. Someone, please, save me, please. I no longer serve Zurvan! Begone! Begone! Ooh! \^\n<Dick>

items.original: Kto ti veli?! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Who commands ye?! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>AAAAAh! Všetko vám poviem, všetko vám poviem! Kto mi velí, neviem, ale sídli v sídle severozápadne odtiaľto. Jaaaajh, panečku janečku, čím som si to zaslúžil, šak nikemu som jakžif nič nespravil zlého.
\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>AAARGH… Spare me! I'll tell thee all, I swear! I know not his name, but he resides in a stronghold northwest from here. Oh, dear saints, what hath I done to deserve this? I hath wronged no one! \n<Dick>

items.original: Čo to splietaš? Jak si sa k tej bande dostal? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: What nonsense is this? How didst ye fall in league with that rabble? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jojh, jojh. Pár mládencov od nás z dediny raz prišli, a vravia, že nejaká družina robí nábor. Že nás vyzbroja, zaodejú. Že vyženú husitov odtiaľto! Som sa nechcel s nimi bratriť, ale Ňúma ma presviedčal, nútil.  
\n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, oh. Some lads from our village came by, talking of a group seeking recruits. They promised to arm us, clothe us. They claimed they would drive the Hussites away! I did not wish to join, but Ňuma persuaded me, forced me. \n<Dick>

items.original: Ako sa dostaneme do toho sídla?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: How do we enter this stronghold? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Pri bráne sa vás spýtajú na heslo, odpovedzte "Qahwah nad hlavou". \n<Vecheť>
items.translation: <WordWrap>At the gate, they shall ask thee for a password. Reply with "Qahwah over head". \n<Dick>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Qahwah nad hlavou? Dobry drist. Dumam, že už nam tento nič mudro ďalšie nepovie. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Qahwah over head? What prattle. I fear this wretch has naught more to offer. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vskutku skvelé. S heslom sa ľahko infiltrujeme medzi kultistov, zistíme, čo je ich plánom, čo je ich cieľom. Fujh, len čo mi búši srdce. Poďte, zahráme si na ukľudnenie sedmu. Zatiaľ pošlem tam Pištíka na výzvedy. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed. With the password, we may infiltrate their ranks and learn their plans. 'Tis a dangeorous plan. My poor heart. Let us play the calming game of seven I wilt send Pištík off. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Si zošalel, Pištíka? Šak ten zabludzi i vo vreci. Na vyzvedy takoj my k totym patkaňom pojdeme. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Art ye mad? Pištík? That bumbkin can‘t find a way out of his britches, ‚tis us who shall be off to investigate. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
"Qahwah nad hlavou" Tak to vravel ten chudák.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Just remind me of the password. "Qahwah over head" Thus spoke the poor soul. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Už ste vysliedili kultistu? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Hath you tracked down the cultist? \n<Jozef>

items.original: No! Barátok moji, tu ste konečne. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Aye! Barátok, here you are at last. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Kde ste v noci boli? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Where were you last night? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Sme pipa v lese hledali, ale to škoda reči.
<Wordwrap>Žid daco barz fajne nam však poradil, toti plani kultisti maju vraj šatstvo zdobene upirskima zubama. Kejc dajakeho najdeš ta takoj zo zadrž. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
We were a-hunting for the priest in the forest, but that tale must wait.
The Jew, however, imparted some useful knowledge; he spake of the cultists' garb bedecked with vampire teeth. Encountering one, ye shalt know them at once. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Markantné. Dobre teda, dám vedieť posádke hradu, nech sa majú pred takými na pozore.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Noteworthy. Very well then, I shall apprise the castle garrison to be wary of such ilk.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Už sa po okolí predpokladám celkom vyznáte. Skúste nejakého kultistu vysliediť...
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>You seem to be quite versed in the lay of the land now. Try Seek out some cultists... \n<Jozef>

items.original: Heslo viete už, tak choďte chytro tam.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: You know the password, be off. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sluchaj! Sme ziscili heslo od ich brlohu! Sa schadzaju v totej pevnosti na zapade doliny! "Qahwah nad hlavou" abo take daco!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Listen! We know the password to their outpost. They gather in the fortress in the west of the valley. "Qahwah over head", or something like that!
\n<Pavol>

items.original: To už si zabudol hneď? "Qahwah nad hlavou."\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Forgot already? "Qahwah over head."\n<Jozef>

items.original: Obed bol už. Kej si hladny, musiš vytrimac.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The midday meal hath passed. If thou art hungry, thou must fend for thyself.\n<Servant>

items.original: Suchare si nevidzela?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hast ye seen biscuits?\n<Pavol>

items.original: V pivnici by mohli byc. Skus na pec pozreť.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: They may be in the cellar. Try looking on the oven. \n<Servant>

items.original: Jančiho si nevidela?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Didst Janči pass by?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Išol do pivnici. Šak kukaj tu, po zemi všadzi bordeľ po ňom ostal.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Went into the cellar he did. Look at all this mess he left behind.\n<Servant>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zemepan zaš na mäso dostal chuť. Furt len mäsko, mäsko, mäsko. Halušky mu nigda nekoštuju, ľen slaninu zos nich povybera.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The lord hath developed a fervor for meat. 'Tis meat, meat, meat incessantly. Halušky don't please him, he just picks the bacon out of them.\n<Servant>

items.original: Neška perši raz za paru tyždne zemepan chcel len daco posne. Som už mala i buchty napečene, som dala stražam, žeby na zmar nevyšlo.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: <WordWrap>For the first time in weeks, milord wanted to lent. I had cakes prepared, had to give them to the guards, lest they go waste.\n<Servant>

items.original: Zemepan taky dobry vždy bol na mňa. Furt si pochvaľoval šicko jedlo.\n<Služobná>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Milord was always good to me. Oh, he'd praise me for every meal.\n<Servant>

items.original: Fuh, Pali, radšej sem nechoď.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Oh. Pali, Thou better not see this.\n<Matej>

items.original: Co? To moja izba, pušči me dnu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What? This be my room, let me in!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Néé fakt. Pali. Poď.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, Pali. Truly, stay out.\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Počuvaj, Jožku. Bol som u kultistoch a stretol som ich veliteľa. I keď asi ešči je dakto nad nim, furt tam šicke o jakaškom Koreňovi daco splietaju.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hark, Jožko. I ventured amongst the cultists and faced their leader. Though another may hold sway above him, the name 'Root' ye kept mentioning. \n<Pavol>

items.original: No a ako to prebiehalo? Nenapínaj ma.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: And how did it unfold? Do not keep me in suspense. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Som mu nadristal glupociny uplne, že Macej je heretik a take. Vypatralo, že temu uveril. Neznam ale, na jak dlho. Takoj ma poslal dajakeho Bohdana zamordovac. Že ma takoj potom do kultu vežne. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I wove a tapestry of sheer absurdity, painting Matej as a heretic and the like. It seems he took the bait. Yet, I cannot fathom for how long. He promptly assigned me the grim task of dispatching a certain Bohdan, promising entry into their ranks. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Hmmm, tak čo ďalej? Asi toho kultistu by ste mohli ísť nájsť.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hmm, what lies ahead? Mayhaps we should seek out this cultist. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Počekaj, to ne je šecko. Ne si jediny, komu vedu tajne chodbičky pod ricu. Toti gluptaci tyž maju podkopany brloh. Cez taku drevorubecku chyžu sa tam ide. Kladinu na dveroch som už dal het.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But hold, there's more. Ye art not the sole keeper of the secrets beneath the castle. Those fools hath their own labyrinth beneath our feet. One can access it through a humble lumberjack's abode. I hath secured the passage, that hath been barred. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nádhera! Zaútočíme na nich! Prv ale, tak dumám, bolo by lepšie toho Bohdana predsa len nájsť. Ak ho kult chce zahlušiť, isto vie niečo extrémne dôležité.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Excellent! We shall assail them! However, it would be prudent to locate Bohdan first. If the cult seeks his silence, he undoubtedly harbors vital knowledge. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Ne zly napad. Poc se mnu Maceju.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: A wise course. Cometh Matej. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kult kejc ho chce zahlušic, ta musi ten Bohdan znac daco barz chulostive. Pojdem takoj ho hľedac, vravel Ignác, že v kostole budze.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Should the cult move to silence him, he holds secrets of grave import. I shall swiftly seek him out. Ignác hinted he might be within the church walls.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Maceju, poc so mnu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Come hither, Matej. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Inač v dzedzine som zatiaľ objavil taku rodzinu co maju curku co daco zna o kulte. Akorat še stracila a šicko sebe do dennička zapisovala, strašne drobulinko pisala a... ja už slabše vidim. By sme sa tam mohli zajsc.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Also, I found a faimly whose daughter joined a cult. Only she got lost, not before she wrote everything down in her diary. Might be useful I reckon.\n<Pavol>

items.original: V sude si \c[14]zakysaného mlieka\c[0] našiel zadosť.
items.translation: You found \c[14]sour cream\c[0] in the barrel.

items.original: V sude si objavil \c[14]fľašku alpy\c[0].
items.translation: A flask of \c[14]alpa\c[0] was found among the contents of this barrel.

items.original: No nazdar, chlapi, jak pokračuje investigatíva? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Greetings, lads, how fares the investigation? \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Sme še infiltrovali ku kultistom. Aľe žeby nas puscili k hlavnemu, mame im donesť jakašku maľufku, čo v izbici skryvaš. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath ventured into the midst of the cultists. Yet, to gain audience with their leader, we must present them with some painting hidden within thy chamber. \n<Pavol>

items.original: No, chlapi moji… heh… ta keď ja sa trochu hanbim, ale vám to teda ukážem…  \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well, my lads... heh... I confess a tinge of shame, but I shall reveal it unto you... \n<Jozef>

items.original: No, ale pán zemepán. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Oh… thee...  milord. \n<Matej>

items.original: No i tak neviem, ako by ste to zobrali, vidíte, že je to freska na stene!  \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I'm unsure how are you to take it, behold, 'tis a fresco adorning the wall! \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šumne, Jožku, bars šumne. No toti neznabohovia neznaju ništ, len nam daj hocjaky škandalny obrazok a budu spokojni, natrimani su jak zajace. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thing of beauty, Jožko, truly. Such heathens know naught yet to revel in scandalous imagery. Ye art as easily put in mood as rabbits. Just give us any engraving and all will be well. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak ale srdce mi puká, keď vám takú vzácnosť dávam, veľa šťastných chvíľ mi priniesla. Pre uľahčenie môjho žiaľu, choď to vybaviť sám a ja si zatiaľ dám odvetu 
v šachu s bratom Matejom, neviem zniesť tú ponižujúcu prehru… S bielymi isto vyhrám. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Yet, my heart doth ache as I relinquish such a rarity. 'Tis brought me many a moment of joy. To ease my sorrow, go forth and arrange matters thyself, whilst I engage in a game of chess with brother Matej. I cannot bear the ignominy of defeat... With the white pieces, victory is assured. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Zemepán ti dal \c[14]sprostý obrázok\c[0].
items.translation: Lord gave you a \c[14]scandalous picture\c[0].

items.original: Bez zemepána to strašný život bude.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: Twill be a terrible life without milord. \n<Ďusi>

items.original: Nechcem vedieť, čo by sa stalo, kebyže nedojdete aspoň vy na čas.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I don't want to know what would happen if at least you didn't arrive on time.\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Chudák, isto sa dal naverbovať mysliac si, že vyženie husitov z rodného kraja.
items.translation: Poor fellow, he certainly got recruited thinking that he would drive the Hussites out of his homeland.

items.original: Keby dal na slová svojej matere, neležal by tu mŕtvy.
items.translation: Had he listened to his mother, maybe he'd still be alive now.

items.original: Kto vie, či mal deti.
items.translation: Wonder if he had children.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pozri naňho, bedáka. S kultistami asi nechcel spolupracovať, nuž ho skúšali presviedčať.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Look upon yon poor soul. Mayhap he wished not to consort with the fiends of the cult, hence they did seek to sway him by cunning persuasion.\n<Matej>

items.original: Vypatra to, že nazor nakoniec zmenil.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I'm afraid he had to change his opinion.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Chudák akýsi tu leží. Dedinčan asi.
items.translation: <WordWrap>Poor soul lies here. A villager most likely.

items.original: Jedno oko, jeden zub.
items.translation: One eye. One tooth.

items.original: Hajzli! Puscice ho! Takoj!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Vile scum! Release him! Immediately! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Máme podmienky.\n<Kultista>
items.translation: We hath conditions. \n<Cultist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zadarmo to nepôjde.\n<Kultista>
items.translation: 'Twill not come for free. \n<Cultist>

items.original: Nevyjednávame.\n<Adam>
items.translation: We shall not negotiate. \n<Adam>

items.original: Maceju! Jak rad ce vidzim, ani neznaš!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej! 'Tis a joy to see ye, even if ye knowest not how much! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Už nikdy nebudem piť. \n<Matej>
items.translation: I shall never drink again. \n<Matej>

items.original: Ani omšove?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Not even during Mass? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nič nikdy. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Nevermore. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dobre, páni. Konečne máme trochu času. Rýchlo mi vysvetlite, čo sa to tu deje.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well, gentlemen. Finally, we hath a moment's respite. Quickly, explain to me what is happening here. \n<Adam>

items.original: Hej, si medzitym možme konečne haby naspak vymenic.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, in the meantime, we can exchange back our garments. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta tak... Najprv som sem prišol prostred leta hľedac svoju ženu a Macej tu už bol, došol iluminovac spis o dajakych Izraelitoch.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well then... I arrived here in the midst of summer in search of my wife, and Macej was already here, studying some illuminated manuscript about the Israelites. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nie, Pali, ja som privandroval až po tebe.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Nay, Pali, I arrived after thee. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No to jedno. Ja som pil veľo v izbici a vtedy som zbadal, jak stary hrad še rozhorel. Ta nas tam poslal s Macejom zemepan a sme tam našli zomreteho Turka i qahwah začarovany...\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That matters not. I drank much in my chamber when I noticed how the old castle began to burn. So the lord sent us yonder with Matej, and we found the Turk dead and the cursed qahwah... \n<Pavol>

items.original: A takú sféru s kľukou na točenie...\n<Matej>
items.translation: And such a sphere with handle for rotating... \n<Matej>

items.original: ...no a tak me manželka dobodala. Potom si ma našol ty.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: … so my wife hath stabbed me. Then ye found me. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nuž. Existuje nejaký plán starého hradu? Dá sa dostať do hladomorne inou cestou?\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed. Doth anyone possess knowledge of an alternative route into yon dungeon within the old castle? \n<Adam>

items.original: Mienim, že to sa musíme spýtať zemepána.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Methinks we should inquire of the lord about this matter. \n<Matej>

items.original: Spomeň čorta.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Speak of the devil. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A hátad legyen elöl! A dér marjon meg! Kým vy ste sa tu s paru kultistami naťahovali, armáda kultistov zaútočila na obec! Tak nám to posol z dediny povedal, utekal jak zošalený.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A hátad legyen elöl! A dér marjon meg!  Whilst you hast dallied here with but a few cultists, an army of them hath besieged the village! So spoke the messenger who fled thence, running as if driven mad. \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Aha, hmmm... a ako sa dá dostať do hladomorne starého hradu? Potrebujeme inú cestu, hentí dvaja mi tvrdia, že normálny vstup je magicky blokovaný.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, hmm... and how might we gain access to the dungeon of the old castle? We require another path, for these two do inform me that the usual entrance is enchanted. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vy ste sa zbláznili, všetci traja jak tu stojíte. Ma nepočujete, že celú obec obliehajú?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>You hath all lost your wits, standing thus. Can you not hear that the entire village is under siege? \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nikto nezošalel, ukľudni sa Jozef. Normálne sa sústreď a spomeň si, ako sa dostaneme do tej hladomorne.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>None hath lost their wits, calm thyself, Jozef. Focus and recall how we may reach that dungeon. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Eeeeeh... no... ale tak to by ste museli vzlietnuť jedine. Treba sa dostať za ten vysoký múr do druhej časti.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Eeeeeh... well... it would seem thou must needs take flight, perchance. We must surmount the lofty wall to reach the other side. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Ideme za židom.\n<Adam>
items.translation: Let us seek out the Jew. \n<Adam>

items.original: Čo...?\n<Jozef>
items.translation: What...? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Si nečul, Jožku? Nemame času teraz.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hearest ye not, Jožku? We hath scant time to tarry now. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Marha jól.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Marha jól.\n<Jozef>

items.original: To ťažko povedať. Ale je to len malí hrad. Veža a hlavná budova, nič viac. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Hard to say, but it's just a small castle. Tower and main building, nothing more. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Aha, hmmm... akoby sme sa mohli dostať do hladomorne starého hradu? \n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hmmm. How could we reach the dungeon of the old castle by an alternative route? \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No ak by sme vedeli lietať, ľahko by sme sa tam dostali. Celá strecha odhorela.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, if we possessed the power of flight, we could swiftly enter. Behold, the flames consumed the entirety of the roof. \n<Matej>

items.original: Za židom?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: The Jew?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Uvidíš. Mám plán.\n<Adam>
items.translation: You'll see. I have a plan.\n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Páni! Strašná novina, na obec zaútočili kultisti. Snáď armáda kultistov! Posol pribehol, bežal ako šialený.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Men! Terrible news, cultists attacked the village. Perhaps an army of cultists! The messenger came running like mad.\n<Ďusi>

items.original: Hmmm... Náš plán to nemení. Budeme sa k židovi musieť prebiť.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hmmm... Our plan doesn't change. We will have to fight our way to the Jew.\n<Adam>

items.original: No čo, richtár už je v bezpečí?\n<Valér>
items.translation:
Well, is the burgmaster safe already?
\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Našťastie áno, ale bol to tvrdý boj. Neklamali ste nám, si voľný.
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Fortunately, yes, but it was a hard fight. Thou didst not deceive us; thou are now free.
\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No áno, ale čo ja tuto teraz zmôžem, po richtárovej pravici by som bol nápomocnejší... ach, do pekla s vami... uhnite mi z cesty.\n<Valér>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, yes, but what can I achieve here, at burgmaster's right I would have been more helpful... oh, to hell with you... get out of my way.\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šekaj ešči... sme s cebu neskončili. Nam pohutor o totym biznise zos qahwahom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Wait a moment... we haven't finished yet. We need to talk about this qahwah business of yers.
\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo ešte chcete vedieť? Plány sme mali veľké, každému to chutí, máme aj podozrenie, že spôsobuje určitú závislosť. \n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>What else do you want to know? We had big plans, everyone enjoys it, and we even suspect it causes a certain addiction.
\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A ty ši co vlastne zač, jak si sa dostal ku takym obchodom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>And what about ye? What exactly do ye do, how did ye get into such businesses?
\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Som syn hradného šaša, slúžil na dvore Albrechta II. Po smrti jeho ženy Alžbety sme ostali na strane Ladislava Pohrobka... lenže ten prekliaty strýc Fridrich ho už deväť rokov drží ako rukojemníka, ja som odtiaľ ušiel. \n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>I am the son of the court jester, I served at the court of Albrecht II. After the death of his wife Elizabeth, we remained on the side of Ladislav Pohrobok... but that cursed uncle Friedrich has been holding him hostage for nine years now, I escaped from there.
\n<Valér>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Richtár je tiež na našej strane a ponúkol mi útočisko. V štyridsiatom štvrtom ten sprostý Poliak Vladislav III. nepočúvol Hunyadyho - Bieleho rytiera- čelne vrhol na janičiarov a skapal... \n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>The Reeve is also on our side and offered me refuge. In forty-four, that foolish Pole Vladislav III. didn't heed Hunyadi - the White Knight - and bravely charged at the janissaries, and perished...
\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hej, šak som to vidzel na vlastne oči. Hunyady znal, že to glupotu robi.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Aye, I saw it with my own eyes. Hunyadi knew it was foolishness.
\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nuž, oslavovali sme uznanie Ladislava za právoplatného kráľa, ale aj tak... zatiaľ boli všetky naše snahy o vydanie Ladislava márne... \n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Well, we celebrated Ladislav's recognition as the rightful king, but still... all our efforts to release Ladislav were in vain...
\n<Valér>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Turecký vpád narušil richtárove obchody s dolnou zemou a hľadali sme nejakú ekonomickú alternatívu, s qahwahom sa to celkom začalo rozbiehať. A teraz ma už pusťte.\n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>The Turkish invasion disrupted the Reeve's trade with the lowlands, and we were seeking some economic alternative; qahwah business started to pick up quite well. And now, step aside, I will go.
\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A kam chceš ísť, veď určite mali okultisti v pláne zarezať aj teba. Zemepán ti určite ponúkne útočisko, kým sa veci ukľudnia.
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>And where dost thou intend to go? Surely the occultists had plans to carve thou up as well. The lord will surely offer thou refuge until things settle down.
\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dobre teda. \n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Very well then.
\n<Valér>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pokecame potem. Teraz musim kamoša najsc.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>We will talk later. I must find me friend.
\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ta tu budem čekac.\n<Valér>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Then I'll wait here.
\n<Valér>

items.original:
Do zámku pasoval kľúč od strážnika!
Našiel si 10 000 forintov (\c[14]30 korún\c[0]).
items.translation:
The guard's key matches this lock. 
You found 10 000 forints (\c[14]30 crowns\c[0])!

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Keby som neznal, že si s Huňadym bojoval proti Turkom pri Kosove, nestrpel by som ce tu ani okamih.
\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation:
Had I not known that you fought alongside Hunyady against the Turks at Kosovo,
I would not endure your presence for a moment.\n

items.original: Co rypeš do mňa? Ti pomožem s dačim?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Why do you pry into me? Do you need help?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Šmerdziš jak tchur. Oči me ščipu, idz stadzi.\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: <WordWrap>You stink like a polecat. My eyes sting. Go away.\n<Armorer>

items.original: Podz vonku še bic, dosc už si tu našmradzil.\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: Come fight outside, you stank up the place enough.\n<Armorer>

items.original: Pfuh, už me nemaruj! Vzdavam sa. \n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: Pfuh, stop! I yield. \n<Armorer>

items.original: Aj ti predam dajake zbroje a zbrane zos hradnej zbrojnice, len ma nebi už.\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I'll sell you armor and weapons from the castle armory, just be not vexed anymore.\n<Armorer>

items.original: Pal het! Kym sa neumyješ ta už sa neukazuj tu.\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Get lost! Until you bathe, dont show your face around here.\n<Armorer>

items.original: Co ci predam?\n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: What can I sell to you?\n<Armorer>

items.original: Ci pisek, jaky si navoňany. \n<Zbrojmajster>
items.translation: Oh my, what pleasant smell.\n<Armorer>

items.original:
Keby sce stretli dajakeho husitu, ta ho žente stadzi! Mi zahlušili kuma!
\n<Dáma>
items.translation:
If you meet any Hussites, drive tham away!
They murdered my godfather!\n

items.original: Dame im za teba. I za tvojho kuma.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: We'll show them. For you, and your godfather.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Sme pohlušili par husitoch, za tvojho kuma. Tu aha sme ti priniesli... ucho.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We ended some Hussites for ye and yer godfather. Here, we brought ye an... ear.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Panenko Mária! Pfuj! Prečo ucho práve?\n<Dáma>
items.translation: Mother of Jesus! Ugh, why an ear?\n<Damsel>

items.original:
...No, ale, ďakujem ti. Tuhľa, dajte si pálinky, zostala po kumovi.
Isto by si s tebou vypil.\n
items.translation: <WordWrap>...Well, thank you anyway. Here, take this moonshine, my godfather would enjoy it with you.\n<Damsel>

items.original: Dostal si butylku \c[14]orechovice\c[0].
items.translation: You were given \c[14]moonshine\c[0].

items.original:
Keby sce stretli dajakeho husitu, ta ho žente z tadzi!
Mi zahlušili kuma!\n
items.translation:
If you meet any Hussites, drive tham away!
They murdered my godfather!\n

items.original:
Zhodou okolnosti sme paru husitoch domarovali prave. 
Tu aha sme ti priniesli... ucho.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>By coincidence we met some. Here, we brought you an... ear.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Husitov márujte kľudne naďalej. Akorát tie uši mi sem už nenoste.\n<Dáma>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Feel free to continue hunting the Hussites. Just bring me no more of their ears.\n<Damsel>

items.original: \c[14]Delobuch\c[0] sa tu povaľuje! Ten sa isto zíde.
items.translation: A \c[14]petard\c[0]! You shall make use of it.

items.original: Ničoho tu niet. Dokonale to tu niekto vyraboval.
items.translation: Nothing remains here. Someone pillaged this house.

items.original: \c[14]Frndžalica\c[0]! Bude blaho.
items.translation: \c[14]Frndžalitz\c[0]! There will be bliss.

items.original: Div že tu skriňu nechal ten, kto to tu vyraboval.
items.translation: A wonder that this wardrobe was left here by the one who pillaged this place.

items.original: Nehal tu kultista \c[14]arkebuzu\c[0]. Prach i náboje, všetko tu je.
items.translation: A cultist left an \c[14]arquebus\c[0] here. Powder and bullets, everything is here.

items.original: Fajne si si podriemal.
items.translation: You took a nice nap.

items.original: Fajne si si podriemal. Akorát ťa okradli.
items.translation: You took a nice nap. You just got robbed.

items.original: V skrini je \c[14]pletená čiapka\c[0].
items.translation: In the cabinet there is a \c[14]lined cap\c[0].

items.original: V truhle objavil si \c[14]10 korún\c[0].
items.translation: You found \c[14]10 crowns\c[0] in the chest.

items.original: Dobré ráno. Za Adamom idete? \n<Stráž>
items.translation: Good morrow. Are thee bound for Adam's abode\n<Guardsman>

items.original: Ano, list mu nesiem, doležity. \n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Aye, bearing a missive of weight, meant for his eyes alone. \n<Man at arms>

items.original: Dobre poďte, dnu. Adam pracuje pri stole.\n<Stráž>
items.translation: Proceed then, within. Adam tends to his affairs at his table. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: Môžete vojsť. \n<Stráž>
items.translation: Enter freely. \n<Guardsman>

items.original: Zdravím. V akej veci za mnou prichádzaš?\n<Adam>
items.translation: Greetings. What brings thee hither? \n<Adam>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zdar! Nesiem ti list doležity od zemepana Jozefa. Už včera večur som došol do Kassau, ale som ce najsc nemohol, dva hodziny som ce hľedal.
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hail! I bear a missive of import from Lord Jozef. I arrived in Kassau last eve but could not locate thee, spending two hours in search. \n<Man at arms>

items.original:
Dve. \!
Tak dobre, ukáž mi tú listinu.\n
items.translation: Very well, show me the missive. \n<Adam>

items.original: Fúha.\n<Adam>
items.translation: Whew.\n<Adam>

items.original: Vládzeš cestovať?\n<Adam>
items.translation: Art thou prepared for a journey? \n<Adam>

items.original: Ale ba, som oddychnuty.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Aye, I am well-rested.\n<Man at arms>

items.original:
Vyrazíme teda ihneď, zavedieš ma k svojmu zemepánovi. \!
Nachystajte mi koňa!\n
items.translation:
Then let us depart henceforth lead me to thy lord.
\! Ready a steed for me ! \n<Adam>

items.original: Zavrela sa cesta.
items.translation: The path is closed.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hroznú vec som spravil, neskutočnú. Jak len mi bude odpustené? Počkať, ty si svätý, nie? Tu máš na odpustok! Sú to moje životné úspory.
\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The deed I hath done is dreadful, unspeakable. How wilt I ever be forgiven? Wait, you art a holyman, art thy not? Take this as my offering!'Tis my life savings. \n<Cultist>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]185 korún\c[0].
items.translation: You gained \c[14]185 coins\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nechal som sa úplne doblúzniť... Bože. Či sa nájde pre mňa opustenia?
\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I hath been completely deceived... Oh God. Wilt there be redemption for me? \n<Cultist>

items.original: Napriahol na nás ruku. Už leží jak v hore drevo.
items.translation: Lies on the ground as wood lies in the forest.

items.original: Mreža.
items.translation: Grate.

items.original: Socha protivného chrliča.
items.translation: Statue of an unpleasant gargoyle.

items.original: Tak mu tam to chápadielko teda nainštalujme. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Let us thus affix that tentacle. \n<Matej>

items.original: Poďme. \n<Adam>
items.translation: We may proceed. \n<Adam>

items.original: Truhla je vybrakovaná, len čo zostala v nej \c[14]dýka\c[0].
items.translation: The chest is pillaged, only this \c[14]dagger\c[0] remained here.

items.original: Truhla je vybrakovaná, len čo zostala v nej \c[14]kuša\c[0].
items.translation: The chest is pillaged, only this \c[14]crossbow\c[0] remained here.

items.original: Kultista, stále verný Zurvanovi.
items.translation: A cultist, still loyal to Zurvan.

items.original: Choď za marekom hneď, povedz mu, že ktosi sem prišol.\n<Zlomocník>
items.translation: Quickly, go to Marek and inform him that a visitor has arrived \n<Deliquent>

items.original: Idem.\n<Okultista>
items.translation: I shall depart at once. \n<Cultist>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Okrem hrstky verných s Marekom zostali už iba mutanti. Tým je jedno, koľko hrôzy a nešťastia napáchajú. Nechápem, jak som sa mohol nechať nahovoriť na takú somarinu. Že vraj Zurvan. Kto to kedy počul? Bože. Všade smrť.
\n<Okultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Say for a handful of loyal cultist, only mutants remain with Marek. It matters little to them how much horror and misfortune they cause. I don't understand how I could let myself be talked into such crap. Zurvan, what nonsense. Who has ever heard of it? God. Death everywhere. \n<Cultist>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No slava Isusu Christu! Ja že už pip konečne idze! Jaj, čort nam bol dlžen takôho pipa, furt len dagdzi čavarguje, v kosceľu menej času stravi jak hin tota mucha. 
\n<Starenka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Glory be to Christ! I thought, the priest approaches at last! The devil that priest,  ever prattling away, spending less time in the church than a bothersome fly. \n<Elder>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Babko a neznace de je toten pip? Hľedame ho v doležitej veci. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: And where is this priest of ye? We seek him for a matter of import. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta veru znam, ale kedz to bars neslušne cale. Mne to sušeda prezradzila, ale že nemožem nikemu dalšimu povedac, bo na Božoho pipa neslobodno kidac hnuj! Ale kedz ja chudinka tu už tri dni šekam na ňoho, kedy še vyšpovidam z hrichoch, ta už horedole jeden hrich.
\n<Starenka>
