items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, I know, but 'tis not meet to speak of such openly. My neighbour hath disclosed it yet not to spread it,'tis not propper to cast dung upon God's anointed! But I, a poor soul, hath waited upon him these three days, eager for confession, yet still he tarries. 'Tis yet one more sin. \n<Elder>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ľem bačim, že dajaky svaty s tebu idze. 
<Wordwrap>Kedz ma potim aspoň vyšpovida, ta vam prezradzim. \n<Starenka>
items.translation:
Ay, I see some holy man attends thee. 
Should he take my confession, then I shall reveal it to thee. \n<Elder>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Babko, ja by som aj rád, ale bohužiaľ, nemám od cirkvi povolenie spovedať. To by som veľmi porušil naše regule. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Grandmother, I would fain comply, but alas, I lack the church's sanction to hear confessions. 'Twould transgress our ordinances greatly. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Maceji, dobre ci hutorim, zmiluj še a vyšpovedaj starenu, naj ma šerco na misce!
Še nikto nedozna. \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, for the love of God, hath mercy and hear her confession; let her soul find solace! None know about it. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ach... nech mi je Pánboh milostivý. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Ah... may the Lord show mercy upon me. \n<Matej>

items.original: Aľe pocce ven, tam vam pošepcem, naj takô nečuje Kristus na oltaru. \n<Starenka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well then, come outside. I shall whisper to you, lest Christ hears upon the altar. \n<Elder>

items.original: On tam chodzi, dze šumne divky nohy rozcahujut! \n<Starenka>
items.translation: He wanders where the fair girls' spread their legs! \n<Elder>

items.original: Aha. Dobri. Maceji, ic babku vyšpovidac. Tu ce počekam. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Indeed. Matej, go and hear her confess. I shall await here.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Farár. Farár v nevestinci. Vlastnoručne ho zaškrtím. \n<Matej>
items.translation: A priest in a brothel. I shall personally deal with him. \n<Matej>

items.original: Ta co, našli sce ho? \n<Starenka>
items.translation: Hath you found him yet? \n<Elder>

items.original: Zabarikádované dvere.
items.translation: Barricaded doors.

items.original:
Ah, tu ste. Aj som si myslel, že ma nenechate. Ale my sme v presile teraz! Si pamätaš na ten podpisany lajster? Si prisahal, že ma nevykopneš z cerkvi, ak neprehram
v bitke, nemusim ju vyslovene vyhrať. A nemožem prehrat ferovku, keď sa nikdy neuskutočni! \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, thou art here. I suspected thou wouldst not forsake me. But we hold the advantage now! Dost thou remember the signed document? Thou hast sworn not to cast me out of the church unless I lose in battle, though it need not be a clear victory. And I cannot lose a fair contest if it never takes place! \n<Priest>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ty špinavá hadovitá líška! Lenže vy nie ste v presile, na našej strane stojí sám pán Boh!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou foul, serpent-tongued fox! But thou art not in the advantage; on our side stands the Lord God Himself! \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Och, prepana, čekajce. Hocičo še tu chysta teraz, prosim ce, najprv še ce musime spytac coška fakt doležite. Co ši to pil v bordeľu?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, calm thyself... Whatever schemes ye hast brewing now, I beseech ye, we must first inquire about something of utmost importance. What were thou drinking in the brothel? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Nedbam...
Qahwah sa to nazyva, arabske vino.\n
items.translation: I care not... Qahwah it is called, Arabian wine. \n<Priest>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, sme počuli.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, we've heard of it. \n<Pavol>

items.original: To z takych kostkoch sa robi?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Is it made from such seeds? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, ale pozri na moje obyčajne. Na tvojich su dajake divne jemnučke kresby vyryte. To jak ste vyrobeli?\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, but behold mine own. Thine bear peculiarly delicate etchings. How doth thee crafted them?\n<Priest>

items.original: Pravda cidušu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Truly. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Sme nevyrobeli, ale našli v starom hrade po požiari.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We did not craft them, but found them in the old castle after the fire . \n<Pavol>

items.original: Hmmm… \n<Pip>
items.translation: Hmmm… \n<Priest>

items.original: Ochutname to?\n<Pip>
items.translation: Shall we taste it? \n<Priest>

items.original:
By to mohlo byc otravene abo co. By sme možno najprv mali otestovac na zajacovi
a uvidime, co sa stane… Ale myslime si, že už zname. To iste co Jančimu. \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It may be poisoned or worse. Perhaps we should test it on a rabbit first and see what happens... But we believe we already know. The same as Janči. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Treba skusiť, ale hej… ľudia nam pomizli. Sme mysleli, že ich husiti zamordovali, ale potom sa k nejakej divnej sekte zopar mladych pridalo.
\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>'Tis  worth a try, but aye... the people hath vanished. We thought the Hussites had slain them, but then some of the youth joined a strange cult. \n<Priest>

items.original: Hmmm... a skadzi maš tote normalne kostky?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hmmm... And whence hast ye obtained these regular seeds? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Od takeho maleho chlopa Valera, on je moj priekupnik. Maskuje sa čarnym plašťom... ale každy zna, že v dedine je len jeden trpaslik, byva v tom polovičnom dome.
\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>From a small lad named Valer, he is my supplier. He disguises himself in a black cloak... but everyone knows there is only one dwarf in the village, dwelling in that half-timbered house. \n<Priest>

items.original: No dobre ty heretik, poďme sa biť!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Enough, thou heretic! Let us fight! \n<Matej>

items.original: Mno, choďte sa ale hlušiť vonku, nehodno sa biť v kostole.\n<Pip>
items.translation: Well, then go fight outside; 'tis unseemly to fight in the church. \n<Priest>

items.original: Akože my? Ty sa ideš biť tiež!\n<Matej>
items.translation: We? Thou art also to join the fray! \n<Matej>

items.original: Take sa v dohode nepiše!\n<Pip>
items.translation: That was not part of the agreement! \n<Priest>

items.original: Zbabelý had!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Cowardly serpent! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Na rannu omšu co sce nebuli? Pip čital zos Žalmoch, dobre mi padlo.
\n<Starenka>
items.translation: <WordWrap>At the morning mass, were you not? Priest read from Psalms, it fit me well. \n<Elder>

items.original: Záchrana! \n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Help came! \n<Cottager>

items.original: Sa mi zdalo, že ste práve odišli, či ne?\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: I thought you just left? \n<Cottager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta ja som znala, že naš valaľ je v nebezpeču. Ale som myslela, že husiti nas pridu vyrabovac, ne naše vlastne dzeci! Už ľem modľic še nam ostava. \n<Starenka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I knew that our town was in danger. But I thought the Hussites would try to ransack us, not our offspring! I can only pray to God. \n<Elder>

items.original: Konec s nama. Vlastne dzeci nas chcu pobic. \n<Dedinčanka>
items.translation: 'Tis our end. Our own blood, turned against us. \n<Villager>

items.original: Konečne dakto ozbrojeny prišol. Už som myslel, že s nama konec. \n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Finally, someone came armed. I thought it was over. \n<Freeman>

items.original: Jaksto sce še šem dostali? Šak barikadujeme šicko všadzi.\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: How did you get here? We barricaded everything.\n<Freeman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ty si žid?\n<Adam>
items.translation: Art thou a Jew? \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Áno.\n<Žid>
items.translation: Aye. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Potrebujeme ten tvoj lietajúci stroj. Vidíš Paliho meč? S ním vzlietne.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We art in need of thy flying contraption. Dost thou behold Pali's sword? With it, he shall soar. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Chlapi, nebláznite. Teraz som skoro umrel, aby som sa sem dostal.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Men, prithee, be not foolish. I did nearly meet my demise to find myself hither. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Cicho, žide. Idzeme a hotovo, bo doraz budze padac.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Silence, Jew. We must away, for the rain draweth near. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A to nás hneď opúšťate? Som si to takto nepredstavoval. Ja že pomoc prišla... a vy len žida beriete. \n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And dost thou depart hence so swiftly? 'Twas not the aid I did envision... and thou taketh only a Jew with thee. \n<Villager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Trim pysky. Riešime šicko, ty še nič nebuj.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Bloody peasant! Shut up! We shall manage all matters; fret thee not. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>TICHOOO! Drahí poddaní. Potrebujeme čas, zdržujte kultistov, koľko môžete. Ihneď pochytajte kostolné lavice a pribite ich cez okná, poriadnejšie to tu treba zabarikádovať, aj tá socha panenky Márie poslúži na zblokovanie dverí. Zemepán so zbrojnošmi je na ceste. Kde máte farára?\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>SILENCE! Dear subjects. We beseech time; hinder the cultists as much as thou art able. Seize the church pews forthwith and fasten them o'er the windows; thy must fortify this place thoroughly. Yon statue of the Virgin Mary shall serve to blockade the doors. The lord, with his retinue, approaches. Where be the priest? \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To keby sme vedeli, kade ten chodí. \n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: If only we knew his whereabouts. \n<Villager>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nič to, tak teba poverujem, máš to tu na povel. Poberte zbrane, sú dole pod kostolom. My ideme.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>No matter, I place my trust in thee; thou hast authority herein. Arm yourselves; the weapons lie below, beneath the church. We take our leave. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nič to, tak teba poverujem, máš to tu na povel. Schovajte sa na faru. My ideme.\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>No matter, I place my trust in thee; thou hast authority herein. Seek sanctuary in the rectory. We take our leave. \n<Adam>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]žida\c[0].
items.translation: You acquired a \c[14]Jew\c[0].

items.original: Majstri bojovnici, zachrance nas! \n<Mlynár>
items.translation: Master knight! Save us! \n<Miller>

items.original: Šak sme za vami dvere zabarikadovali! Jak sce sa sem dostali? \n<Mlynár>
items.translation: We barricaded the doors! How did you get in? \n<Miller>

items.original: V skirni je starý ale funkčný \c[14]gambeson\c[0].
items.translation: In the cabinet, there is an old but functional \c[14]gambeson\c[0].

items.original: Toto omšové \c[14]vínko\c[0] sa ti zíde. Snáď nebude farárovi chýbať.
items.translation: You'll find use for this \c[14]wine of Mass\c[0]. Hopefully the priest will not miss it.

items.original: P-Prišli ste si po mňa? To Ignác vás poslal? \n<Bohdan>
items.translation: H-Hath thee cometh for me. Has Ignac send thee? \n<Bohdan>

items.original: Neubližujce mu, zaprisahavam vas! \n<Počestná pani>
items.translation: I beseech thee do him no harm. \n<Venerable dame>

items.original: Žena, scahni mu gače, idzem mu odfakľic totu tetovačku z rici. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Woman, strip him of his trousers, I shall remove that tattoo from his backside. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Prosím, spolupracujte! Nejdeme ťa zabiť, snažíme sa ti zachrániť krk.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pray thee, cooperate! We seek not thy demise, but rather to preserve thy life. \n<Matej>

items.original: Krk hej, ale ric ne. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Life, not ass. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Co to robice? \n<Počestná pani>
items.translation: What manner of event is transpiring here? \n<Venerable dame>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Budz cicho, kedz mu chceš pomocť, ta dajaku handru mu do ust štur, naj šebe jazyk neodhryžne! A ty še nemykaj, bo ci vajca odfaklim miesto rici! Dakus vytrim, kedz ci je život mily. Zviaž mu ruky a trim ho poradne, na stol ho položime.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Silence thy tongue if ye dost seek to aid him, give him some cloth to prevent him biting his tongue. And ye, remain motionless, lest I mistakenly carve ye sack instead of his backside! Secure his limbs firmly and prepare to lay him upon the table. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Aaaaaajh! \n<Bohdan>
items.translation: Aaaaaah! \n<Bohdan>

items.original: Vydrž, vydrž!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hold fast, hold fast! \n<Matej>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]potetovanú polku Bohdanovej zadnice\c[0].
items.translation: You gained the \c[14]tattooed half of Bohdan's buttock\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No vidziš, ani nebulelo. Nič še nebuj, dokym še budzeš ženic, ta še ci tota ric zroštne i dva razy. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Behold, not a whimper to be heard. Fear not, for as long as thou dost draw breath, thy can heal ye buttock, twicefold even. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Ženo, daj kus paľinky, naj mu ranu vypaľim.  
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Woman, fetch forth some brandy, for I shall cauterize the wound. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A teraz ciško, idzem ce škryc ku zemepanovi, tam ci budze ľepši. Šebe tam s nim možes šachy bavic. Žena, obviaž mu to s dačim, naj nam nevykvapka, szegiň, to tu vypatra, jak by sme tu prasa zarezali. Felčiar ho potem zafačuje.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Now quiet, we must make our way to the lord's chambers, where the conditions shall be more favorable. There, ye may engage in a game of chess with him. Woman, bind his wound securely with something, lest his life escapes. And be quick about it. ‘This a sight like a pig slaughter. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tu maš parťaka na šachy, odkrveny ma mozek, nad nim isto vyhraš.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Here is ye companion for chess, his mind freshly drained of blood. Ye art certain to triumph over him. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Kto to je? Koho si to sem dotiahol? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: Who is this? Whom hast you brought here? \n<Jozef>

items.original: To je Bohdan toto. Veliteľ kultistov ho chcel dac zmarnic. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: ‘Tis Bohdan. The cult leader intended to hath him murdered. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Aah, no fasza. Dobre, že si ho sem priviedol, určite pozná informácie, ktoré budú pre kultistov chúlostivé.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, excellent that you hast brought him here. Surely, he possesses knowledge that would prove sensitive to the cultists. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Bohdan, kultisti tvrdia, že si zradca, čo si spravil?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Bohdan, the cultists claim ye art a traitor. What hast ye done? \n<Pavol>

items.original: To je ten zradca? \n<Jozef>
items.translation: ‘Tis the traitor? \n<Jozef>

items.original: Hej ten.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, that he is. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Už vám to môžem povedať, tak či tak by ma upálili. Som mal na starosti zaklínanie qahwahových zŕn v starom hrade na severe. Za pomoci Angra Mainyu sme povolali z temnoty zurvanistického démona Ahrimana, držíme ho tam v katakombách.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>At last, I can unburden my soul, for the pyre would await me regardless. 'Twas my charge to enchant the grains of qahwah within the castle to the north. From the depths, we conjured forth the Zurvanist demon Ahriman, and in the catacombs, we bind him still. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Miesto hlavy má večný plameň, na ktorom sme qahwah pražili. Kto z toho nápoj vypije, toho duša je večne prekliata a jeho telo zmutuje a ostáva verný tomu, kto ho naposledy zviedol. Pôvodný plán bol, že budeme tráviť husitských banditov, lenže tí začali byť po čase príliš podozrievaví, ich vodca Honza im zakázal piť hocičo od dedinčanov.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Instead of a head, he bears an eternal blaze, whereupon the qahwah is roasted. Whosoever imbibes this elixir shall find their soul eternally accursed, their form twisted. Our original design was to poison the Hussite brigands, yet their suspicion grew. Honza, their leader, forbade them anything  from the villagers. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak začali jed podávať aj nevinným obyvateľom. Ahriman sa neustále vzpiera našej vôli, preto musíme udržiavať magické zaklínanie pri pražení. Jedného dňa som teda čarovanie sabotoval a kým ho Pauli dostala späť pod kontrolu, Ahriman spôsobil hrozný požiar, dvaja kultisti uhoreli zaživa a tretí, taký Turek, sa udusil dymom.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hence, served the venom to innocent villagers. Ahriman, resisting our will, demands the constant chant during the roasting. One fateful day, I tampered with the incantation, and Ahriman wrought a fierce conflagration, claiming the lives of two brethren. \n<Bohdan>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Musíme očistiť tento kraj od takého zla!\n<Matej>
items.translation: We must purge this land of such malevolence! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Neviem však, ako sa dostať do tých katakomb, naša vyvolávačka Pauli vstup magicky uzavrela.\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But I know not the path to the catacombs. Our conjurer, Pauli, sealed it with magic. \n<Bohdan>

items.original: Vždy kej še pomolim pri oltari počestne, zahoja sa mi rany šicke. \n<Počestná pani>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Whenever I doth beseech at the altar with reverence, all wounds of mine doth heal.\n<Venerable dame>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ani som sa nestihla obliecť, jak som do kostola utekala. Aspoň holý život som si zachránila.\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I didn't even have time to get dressed when I ran to church. Lucky I save my life.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Bohdanovi neubližujce, to on je moj brat. \n<Počestná pani>
items.translation: Don't hurt Bohdan, please. He is my brother.\n<Venerable dame>

items.original: V truhlici bolo \c[14]50 korún\c[0].
items.translation: There were \c[14]50 crowns in the chest\c[0].

items.original: V sude je \c[14]vínko\c[0].
items.translation: The cask contained \c[14]wine\c[0].

items.original: Drevcové zbrane tu sú. Jednu \c[14]halapartňu\c[0] si zoberieš.
items.translation: Polearms are here. You will take one \c[14]halberd\c[0].

items.original: \c[14]Pavéza\c[0] sa zíde.
items.translation: A \c[14]pavise\c[0] will come in handy.

items.original: Aspoň jednu \c[14]kušu\c[0] si odtiaľto odnesieme.
items.translation: At least one \c[14]crossbow\c[0] will be taken away from here.

items.original: Neunašajte ma, prosim!\n<Somrák>
items.translation: Don't take me away,  I beseech thee! \n<Beggar>

items.original: Kam by sme ťa brali?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Where would we take ye? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Cij, to ne vy unašate ľudi? Miznu ľudia v kraju. Nič-nič a zrazu su fuč.\n<Somrák>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Whoi be ye not takin' folk away, eh? Folk be vanishin' in the realm. Nothin' at all, and poof, they be gone! \n<Beggar>

items.original: Pán zemepán, nech ti žehná Boh!\n<Mešťan>
items.translation: Milord, may God bless your soul!\n<Burger>

items.original: Každý deň tu postával taký žobrák. Ktohovie, kam sa podel.\n<Mešťan>
items.translation: <WordWrap>A beggar used to stand around here. Everyday. Wonder what happened to him.\n<Burger>

items.original: Vo vysokej tráve našiel si \c[14]žebrákov prsteň\c[0]!
items.translation: In the tall grass you found a \c[14]ring of a beggar\c[0]!

items.original: Chceš sa pasovať? \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Wanna tussle, eh? \n<Drunkard>

items.original: Už dobry budem prisamveru, lem me nebite! \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: I'll be good! I'll be good! Beat me no more.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Ejjjj, či si len mocný! Pridám sa ja k tebe, spolu nás nepremôže nik! \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Eyyy, art thou truly mighty! I shall join thee, together none shall overpower us.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Pridal sa voľajaky galgan k tebe.
items.translation: Some kind of drunk has joined you.

items.original: Tak ty sa nechceš pasovať? Ja ťa naučím! \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Aye, dost thou refuse to duel? I'll teach ye a lesson! \n<Drunkard>

items.original: Ejjjj či si len mocný! Pridám sa ja k tebe, spolu nás nepremôže nik! \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Eyyy, art thou truly mighty! I shall join thee, together none shall overpower us.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Nehajte me už. \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Leave me be.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: A nezaprší a nezaprší.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Will not rain, will not rain...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Rád sem za krčmu chodím. Stále tu ktosi niečo stratí. Mincu, šperk... kadečo.\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I adore coming here, behind the tavern. Folk looses things here all the time. A coin, a jewel... All sorts of things.\n<Mercenary>

items.original: Niekto sa sem v noci priplietol, takoj ho zamordovali kultisti.
items.translation: Someone wandered here last night, cultist promptly murdered him.

items.original: Bože! Tak som sa bála, že vás nenájdem. \n<Anička>
items.translation: Oh God! I feared I would not find thee. \n<Anička>

items.original: Dievča vzácne, čože sa prihodilo? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Fair maiden, what hath befallen thee? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Rýchlo! Už o hodinu sa chystajú zamordovať zemepána! Sa strašne pohnevali, keď zistili, že Ignác je mŕtvy! Musím sa hneď vrátiť, bo si všimnú, že som odišla! \n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Haste! In but an hour, they plan to murder the lord! They grew furious upon learning that Ignác is dead! I must return swiftly ere they notice I am gone! \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Počkaj, kľud. Akože zamordovať zemepána? Však tam je zbrojnošov a arzenálu toľko, že armáda samého Murada by s problémami ten hrad dobyla.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hold, calm thyself. How would they murder the lord? There are so many guards and an arsenal so vast that even the army of Murad would struggle to besiege the castle. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Majú tam spojku! Im zhodí lano z nejakej kaplnky na poschodí a odpúta pozornosť strážnikov, aby sa preplížili pod okno. \n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They hath a plan! They shall lower a rope from some chapel on the upper floor, distract the guards and sneak beneath the window. \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Budzeme tam. Ich prekvapime. Len sa stiahni pri boji dozadu, naj ce netrafi dajaka zbludila čepeľ.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We shall be there. We shall surprise them. Just stay back in the fray, lest a stray blade find ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
A čo to stretnutie Kor a Mar v krčme?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: And what of the meeting between Rot and Mar at the tavern? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Snaď tam pobudnu dlhšie do večura. Možnaj i tak stretnutie zrušili, kejc zistili, že Ignac už voňa fialky zo spodu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Perhaps they will linger until evening. Might hath canceled the meeting upon learning that Ignác has met his end. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Poďme teda.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Then let us be off. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Čo vy tu? To už prebehlo to stretnutie v krčme?
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What are you doing here? Hath the meeting at the tavern already taken place? \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To počka. Jožku, zamykaj oblak. Atentat na cebe idze o hodzinu. Maju preľezc cez Macejovo okno jak mravce.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That shall wait for now. Jožef, lock the window. An assassination attempt on the ye is imminent. They plan to climb through Matej's window like ants. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Aszt a hét kibaszott fejű sárkány faszát baszná meg a rohadt disznó! Az ángyod térdét néki már! Nemôžem v kľude ani vypísať objednávku na figy do Pešti! Oblok žiaden zamykať nebudeme, také nervy už na nich mám, cij panečky! Necháme ich naloziť dnu a prepadneme my ich! Sa neviem dočkať, jak dajakému okultistovi hlavu rozseknem. Takto, aha!
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap><Wordwrap>Aszt a hét kibaszott fejű sárkány faszát baszná meg a rohadt disznó! Az ángyod térdét néki már! By God, I cannot even place an order for figs from Buda! We shall not lock any windows, I am on edge with these fellows! Let them load themselves in and it shall be us who ambush them! I cannot wait to split a cultist's head open. 'tis the way, behold…  \n<Jozef>

items.original:
No to si nehaj na nich. Nešibrinkuj mi tu pred nosom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Do not sway yer sword in front of me face! Reserve it for the enemy.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Máme taktickú výhodu, budú loziť po jednom, sa chystali pred atentátom zhromaždiť v kaplnke. Ale nemali by sme hneď útočiť, najlepšie by bolo rozdeliť ich skupinu napoly a o zvyšnú polovicu, ktorá bude dole utekať preč, sa postarajú tvoji zbrojnoši.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, we hold a strategic edge; they shall ascend one by one, intending to convene in the chapel afore the deed of assassination. Yet, we ought not to launch our assault forthwith. 'Twould be most prudent to divide their company in twain, with your men attending to the half that endeavors to flee downstairs.\n<Matej>

items.original:
Múdro.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Wisely said.\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A zemepan, daj šebe pozor na Aničku, taka mala ščamba tam budze, ona je naša spojka u kultistoch, to od nej sme še toto doznali. Podzme na to, še poskryvajme dagdzik v kaplnke. Boj začneme vystrelom, to ich vyplaši načisto, bo budu potichučky lozic jak patkaňe.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And Lord, keep an eye on Anička. A young girl there shall be, she is our informant among the cultists. Let us hide in the chapel. The battle will commence with a shot, which wilt terrify them utterly, as they will be creeping like mice. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pali, Pali, ale ti vravím, že tvoja jediná možnosť je úplná abstinencia, ty už si regulérny alkoholik.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pali, Pali, I tell thee, thy only recourse is complete abstinence, for thou art truly a devotee of the drink. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale šak tam nejdzeme pic, informacije nam treba zisťovac. Natuty tu budze toten Koreň, nebudzem nic pic.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But we shall not partake of spirits, we must gather information. 'Tis Root we seek, not libations. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Neverím ti.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: I doubt thee. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hej, aľe ta šak co tam vof karčme budzeme pexeso hrac? Šak budu kukac na nas jak puci, že to co tam došlo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, and shall we play Pexeso in the tavern? They shall regard us as fools! No time for petiness here, we are prying into the matters of importance! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pexeso…? Ja to beriem ako moju misionársku činnosť, prisámbohu, aj keby to bola posledná vec, čo spravím, ja z teba zrobím abstinenta.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pexeso...? I consider it my missionary endeavor, by God's grace, even if it were the last thing I do. I shall make an abstainer of thee. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta veľo ščesca a hlavne to teľo nepreživaj, ci pana. Ta co tepir zrobime, šak tam nemožeme ľen tak nasucho šedzec jak mudžahedini.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>May ye hath plenty of luck in ye endeavour. What prey tell shall we do stead drink.. we shanot sit there as two Mujahideen! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Boh ochraňuj moju spásu, spravíme to takto… vymeníme si háby a ja budem piť miesto teba, to bude normálne, že ty ako mních nepiješ. Ale musíš do mňa furt hučať, nech ideme preč, nech to nie je nápadné.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>May the Lord protect my salvation, we shall do it thus... we shall exchange cloaks, and I shall drink in thy stead. 'Twill appear normal, for thee, as a monk, to abstain. But thou must continue to chide me, so we may depart without drawing attention. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Heh, no cij panabeka, ta toto še mi ľubi! Cebe ľen prospeje chľast, naj še dakus ukľudniš. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Heh, well said, this doth please me! Perhaps imbibing shall benefit thee, mayhap it shall calm thy spirit. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Slivovicu a henten len žinčicu, on iba omšove vínko ľúbi. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Slivovitza for me, and žinčitza for him, for he doth prefer the sacramental wine. \n<Matej>

items.original: Toto čo moje oči videli, už neodvidia.\n<Somrák>
items.translation: What my eyes witnessed, I cannot unwitness. \n<Sod>

items.original:
Si pripravený, zbabelec?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Art thou prepared, craven? \n<Matej>

items.original:
HAHAHAAAA Zachránil som calý svet. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: HAHAAA I saved the world in it's entirety! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Pravda to je! Si hrdina!
\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: 'Tis true, you are a true hero.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original:
Zrobím z nevestinca ženský kláštor!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: I will rebuild the brothel into a woman monastery.  \n<Matej>

items.original:
Toto ci trebalo, panabeka? 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
This is what you wanted? God above us.
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Do cebe kedz vojdze toten spravodľivy hnev, ta i nebesa še trasu. Aľe ta možnože i dobre sa nam stalo, pred rytierom sa ten kultista mohol mac na pozore, zos vešelym mnichom še mu možna ľahše jazyk rozvaže…
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>When righteous wrath consumes ye, even the heavens quake. Yet perchance it may serve us well; before the knight, this cultist could hath been wary, but with a cheerful monk, his tongue may loosen more easily... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Eeeeh...
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Eeeeh...\n<Matej>

items.original:
Drychmaj.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Enough, sleep. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pane, ta toto še mi bars ľubelo, jak ši teho mojeho zbrojnoša zmlacel! Dostal rozkazom ma doprevadzec, aľe hnusak furt mi ľen slopac zakazuje a sam še naľiva jak duha! Nemožem vas pozvac dakus na paľinku? Šebe dame preceky, že kto vecej vytrime pic! Kto perši spadne zos stoličky, toten šecko zaplaci! 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Sir, I commend ye for thy fortitude in quelling my squire's excesses. 'Twas he who was charged to escort me. He allowed me not a sip of drink, even though he himself drank as if bottomless! Pray, allow me to extend an invitation for a libation. We shall make a merry contest of it: whosoever consumes more shall bear the cost! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Nedbam.
\n<?>
items.translation: Very well. \n<?>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Naj ci služi zdravie! Co ty vobec? Som ce tu nevidzel ešči. Ja som... Matej inač.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well, may ye health be kept! Pray, sir, what is thy name? Ye countenance is unfamiliar to mine eyes. I am... Matej, at ye service. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nazdravie, Maceju. Škoda reči. Tu daco nakúpim, tu daco predám. Znaš jak, furt dačo zle. Mňa volaju Marek. A jak ši še šem dostal?
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hail, Matej. 'Tis a pity. Here I buy some, there I sell some. You know how it goes, always something amiss. They call me Marek. And how didst thou come upon this place? \n<Marek>

items.original:
Ženu hľedam, mi ušla. Pauli sa vola, nečul si o takej?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I seek a wife, she hath fled. Goes by the name of Paula, hast ye heard of her? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Šak ši mnich, ta jak možeš mac ženu?
\n<Marek>
items.translation: But art thou not a monk? How canst thou have a wife? \n<Marek>

items.original:
Jaj... ja som pravoslavny.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oh... I am of the Orthodox faith. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Nečul som o takej. No a jak, že ci ušla, či co?
\n<Marek>
items.translation: I hath not heard of such. But how doth she flee, or some such? \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta som bul vof Kosove robic poľneho pipa a tam som skoro o hlavu prišol. Potim som kus popijal das dve roky. A jedno rano jak som došol zos karčmy, ľen listek bul na posceli, že še pri mne už necici jak žena a take. Ta že mne opušca a dufa, že najdzem spasu vof Bohu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I was in Kosovo as a military chaplain and there I nearly lost my life. Then I drowned my sorrows for two years. And one morn, upon returning from the tavern, there was but a letter on the pillow, declaring she no more feels like a woman by my side and such. That she leaves me and hopes I shall find solace in God. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Ta ser na marhu! Najzdi sebe inu!
\n<Marek>
items.translation: What a wretched wench! Seek another for thyself! \n<Marek>

items.original:
Nemožem, furt som ženaty. By nemohlo byc požehnany taky sňatok.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I cannot, for I am still wedded. Blessed could not such a union be. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Boha s tym! Naľej si, nazdravie! Jak vobec znaš, že tu dagdzi budze?
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God with it! Pour for thyself, cheers! How dost thou even know she shall be here? \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta sem chodzila jedine; za šesternicou. Kedz me nešalila. Ale som ju i stretol predvčarom.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, she used to frequent this place solely; accompanied by her cousin. When her deceit was not upon me. Yet, I also encountered her but the day ere yesterday. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
A co bulo?
\n<Marek>
items.translation: And what ensued? \n<Marek>

items.original:
Ta mi vyľepila. Asi treba času ešči na toto.\!
A ty jak s tymi potvorami?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
She slapped mine face. Perchance, more time shall be required to mend this rift. 
And ye, how do ye deal with them?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Ta ja som taky... vlk samotar. Mam paru kamošky, ale nič važne. 
\n<Marek>
items.translation: Well, I am... a lone wolf. I have a few friends, but nothing serious. \n<Marek>

items.original:
Aidžbbbdmmhhhhhm! 
\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Arghmmbmhmmmm…\n<Drunkard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobre, daj pokuj. Marečku, naľejme si ešči. Šlivovica ne zla, ale moj dzedo lepšu znal zrobic. By sme boli davno dole obidvojo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Sure, go away now.
Marečku, let us imbibe once more. The šlivovica though passable, pales in comparison to that concocted by my grandsire. Should we partake of that, we would both have been laid to rest. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta to vof jakym klaštore ši še teľo chlastac naučil, hek! Som šebe dumal že takoj odpadneš. 
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Where didst thou acquire such a capacity for drink within the cloisters, hmm! Methought thou wouldst succumb forthwith. \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A co ši šebe myslel že co my vof seminari ľem na svate obrasky kukame? Nikto nezna lepšu šlivovicu kvasic jak ctihodny brat Arpád. My tak s bratmi dumeme, že šak i kvas jest božie dilo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What didst ye reckon we pondered whilst gazing upon the holy images in seminary? None possesses the art of plum fermentation better than the venerable Brother Arpád. We brethren hold that even fermentation is the handiwork of God. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ci pana, Maceju, ta to musim še dakedy zastavic u vas, hek! Džeš to je? Kam to mam išč? 
\n<Marek>
items.translation: By God, Matej, I must pay thee a visit one day, hmm! Whither am I bound? \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vof Debreczéne, to zbadaš takoj klaštor bo to rovina čista. Ale povedz ozaj, skadzi ši a co tutaj porabaš?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>In Debreczén, ye shalt discern naught but level terrain. But divulge, whence dost ye hail and what purpose dost ye pursue herein? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja som ľen taky potulny rytier zos Eperješa, najal si ma Turek zvaný Koreň, bo on nezna nikeho tu, ta žeby som mu kupcoch na take zrnka hľedal. Calkom to sype. Hek! 
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am but a wandering knight from Eperjes, in the employ of a Turk known as Root. For he is a stranger to these lands, he tasked me with seeking out merchants for such beans. 'Tis a profitable affair, indeed. Huh! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Qahwah myšliš? Ta to neznaš coška o totym starym hradze? Sme še tam buli kuknuc jak tam horelo a sme našli jakaške zrno. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Dost ye refer to Qahwah? Art thou knowledgeable of that old castle? We ventured thither to witness its conflagration and chanced upon some beans therein. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
! 
\n<Marek>
items.translation: ! \n<Marek>

items.original:
...
\n<Marek>
items.translation: ...\n<Marek>

items.original: Získal si mešec s \c[14]50 korunami\c[0].
items.translation: You gained a pouch with \c[14]50 coins\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta mne še coška doneslo do sluchoch, že to pip tam šebe pražil tote zrnka. Bars divny je. No mam dosc, idzem už spac, vyhral ši.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, something brought to my attention that the priest roasted those grains himself. 'Tis rather peculiar, indeed. Yet, I hath had my fill; I shall retire now, thou art the victor. \n<Marek>

items.original: Fuj... tak toto bolo dúfam naposledy. \n<Adam>
items.translation: Ohh. Hope that was the last time I flew.\n<Adam>

items.original: Musime teho Kor a Mar najsc.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Verily, we must seek out this Rot and Mar. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zásielka došla? Koľko mutantov ste vyrobili?\n<Turek>
items.translation: Hath the shipment arrived? How many mutants hast thou forged? \n<Turk>

items.original:
Došla. Za tento týždeň šesť. Zatiaľ všetko podľa plánu.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, the shipment hath reached our hands. Six mutants hath been crafted within this week. All proceedeth according to the grand design. \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ahrimana v starom hrade už máte pod kontrolou? Odkedy spôsobil požiar, všetci sú na nohách. Richtár s nami prerušil styky, museli sme proti nemu zakročiť. Do toho ten rytier od zemepána sa tu obšmieta, do všetkeho snorí. Dobre, že sa už chystá tá akcia.\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And hath Ahriman been brought under sway within the old castle? Since his hand hath kindled the inferno, all are in a state of agitation. The burgmaster hath severed his bonds with us; we were compelled to take action against him. Furthermore, that knight of the lord doth meddle here, thrusting his nose into every matter. 'Tis a boon that the operation is already set in motion. \n<Turk>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hej, Pauline zakliatie drží Ahrimana v hladomorni. Musí robiť všetko, čo mu rozkážeme. Ale Pauli tvrdí že už to tak dlho nebude, večný oheň je mocný. Čoskoro sa však s pomocou Zurvanistickej mágie prekopeme k pekelnému ohňu a nebudeme ho potrebovať.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Yea, Pauline's enchantment doth bind Ahriman. He must needs obey our every command. Yet Pauline doth assert that this bond may not endure much longer; the eternal flame holdeth great power. Nevertheless, with the aid of Zurvanistic sorcery, we shall soon penetrate the depths to the infernal blaze and shalt no longer require his service. \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chvála Allahovi. V mene sultánovom, tu máš 100 zlatých, odovzdaj Pauli. Akcia na pondelok platí?
\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Praised be Allah. In the name of the sultan, take these 100 gold coins and deliver them unto Pauline. Is the plan set forth this day ready? \n<Turk>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nie, uskutoční sa zanedlho. O pár hodín pred svitaním udrieme. Zabili Ignáca, musíme konať. Mne sa nepozdáva ani ten mních, bars vŕta. Ale Pauli jasne povedala, že treba odstaviť len rytiera.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed, all is prepared. We shalt strike ere the dawn breaks. I hold reservations regarding that monk; he doth arouse suspicion. But Pauline hath made it clear that only the removal of the knight is warranted. \n<Marek>

items.original:
Tak spravte ako rozkázala, má sultánovu dôveru. Ma'a salama.
\n<Turek>
items.translation: Then execute as commanded; she hath the trust of the sultan. Ma'a salama. \n<Turk>

items.original:
Ma'a salama.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: Ma'a salama.\n<Marek>

items.original:
Chlape, pašak jesteš pašak! Ja by jsem ťa sice prepiu, aľe i tak moc dobře.
\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, thou art a true drunkard! Though I may surpass thee in drink, yet I acknowledge thy prowess.\n<Mercenary>

items.original:
Fuh, nabuduce možeme sa pretekac chlope.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, next time we may engage in drinking game, friend. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nejsu sprosté, vidim že jakési bars divné osoby tu su. Moja vernosť je na tvojej strane bratku.
\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Fear not, I am no simpleton; I perceive that some rather peculiar individuals are present here. My loyalty lies with thee, brother. \n<Mercenary>

items.original:
Mhm.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Indeed. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta zahrajme šebe potom hod sekerkou do terčika! Teraz; musim ešči daco s Macejom rozobrac...
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let us then test our skill with the axe and target! But for now, I must attend to some matters with Macej... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Maceju, Maceju špiš? Coška še idze robic, už dneška nadranom!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Macej, Macej, art ye asleep? What business art ye to undertake so early on this day? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ppali... aj tys s kultistami? Mhhhhammm...uff. Ty kutis...kultista... ja ti, ja ti dammm.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>P-pali... art thou also with the cultists? Mhhhhammm...uff. Thou, a cultist... I shall... I shall deal with thee. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neeee... Mac hek! Maceju, sluchaj me... jaa len tu na minutku hlavu zložim... ale me zobudz takoj... rozumiš?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nayyy... Mat.., hic! Matej, heed my words... I shall just rest my head here for a moment... but wake me immediately... dost ye understand? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Fuj do Boha… co som to porobil zas. Ci pana… plny mechur mam a v hube sucho.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Alas, what transgression hath I wrought again? By the grace of the Almighty... my bladder is full and my mouth is parched. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zdar! Nikto nevedel tak prevážať človeka po Toryse ako iný človek, teda ja.\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hail! None knew how to ferry a man across Torysa as well as another man, that is, I.\n<Pisshead>

items.original: Serus, ja som Pali. A co tu robiš, šak Torysa ďaleko, ši stroskotal, či co?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hey there, I am Pali. And what art ye doing here, Torysa is far, hath ye run aground or what?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nevypýtaj sa ani! Mojej loďku najvyššieho stožiara ďaleko-široko premontoval, zle to vypadlo. Dňa jedného stožiara blesk sa tak dajak akože, no proste, dačo tam a horelo. Ako kapitán, prvý som odskočil a podplával na breh, pomoc že pôjdem po ňu. A tam s deťmi a ženami chlapi hádzali sa do vody ako otupievajají. 
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Ask not! My boat, the tallest mast, I've been far and wide refitting it, ill-fated it turned out. One day a lightning struck the mast, somehow or other, well, something happened there, and it caught fire. As the captain, I leaped first and swam ashore, thinking to seek aid. And there, men were throwing themselves into the water with women and children as if they were dumb.\n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Veď nehorela až tak loďka a ja už som vykričal im, že nech trpezlivo vyčkajú, veď nehorí. Teda horí, ale nie tak až. No podplávali nejak a prichvátali ku mne a hnev išiel ale vravím im, že veď ako inač to urobiť ako som to urobil. Loď mi po prúde odhorela i privesil som klinec na kapitánsku čapicu. 
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Yet the boat did not burn that much, and I already shouted to them, bidding them to patiently wait, for it's not burning. Well, it is burning, but not that much. Yet they swam somehow and clung to me angrily, but I told them, well, how else was I to do it except as I did. The boat burnt, down the current and I hung up my captaining. \n<Pisshead>

items.original: Boh naj nas chrani, žeby taki jak ty boli pri kormidle.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: God save us, would that there were more like ye at the helm.\n<Pavol>

items.original: To co ma byc? Me nechceš puscic? Ti prisušim?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What's this? Wilt thou not release me? Shall I ruffle thee?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Mincu do mňa nedáš? Obracať mincu budem akoby bola moja minca.\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Will you not put a coin into me? I will flip it as if it was mine to flip.\n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nie si garanciou toho, čo som ja, že keď poviem, že mincu dám a nemám, tak ju dám, ty nemáš a nedáš.
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Thou art not a guarantee of what I am, that when I say I'll give the coin and have none, I'll still give it, thou hast none, thou shalt not give it.\n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ľutovať raz darmo by bolo nebolo, stať sa nesmie, čo sa stalo. Preto vravím odjakživa, že treba si robiť sám uzáver. Mincu tvoju mocou svojou sebe si zakúpim, snáď raz novej plte a budem zas jak raz.
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>To regret once would be in vain, what's done cannot be undone. Therefore I say from the beginning, one must make their own closure. By the power of thy coin, I shall perhaps purchase for myself a new raft one day and be as one. \n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Preto som šiel sem, aby do mňa šla minca. I s takýmto obnosom môže sa prihodiť, že už si možeme dať robiť, ale nesmieme sa tak nechať, aby sme si nedali.
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Thus I came here, so that a coin would come into me. Even with such an amount, it may happen that we can start doing things, but we mustn't let ourselves be taken in. \n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chcel som povedať, že ty, teda chcel som využiť iný názov, ale tá najväčšia veľkosť je tvoje srdce. Takým vyhovuje vláda zemepána, ale pomáhaš tomu.
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I wanted to say, that thou, I mean I wanted to use another name, but the greatest size is thy heart. It suits to rule like a lord but thee also aid thus. \n<Pisshead>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pre lásku Božiu, Pali, prestaň sa rozprávať s tým oplanom! A ty, kapitáne, strať sa mi z očí navždy!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>In the name of the Lord, Pali, stop talking to this rascal! And thou, captain, begone from my sight forever.\n<Matej>

items.original: Zmizni, ty gauner! Keby si radšej zostal na tej svojej plťke!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Begone, thou scoundrel! Wouldst thou rather have stayed on thy raft!\n<Matej>

items.original: Zaš si tuna?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here again?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja som plavieviaval na toryse dopravaľava. Doľava bola hustá vtedy este bývavala. Som v kajute sedieviavial za ostrouhlým stolom. Si tú hodnosť zaslúžim, ale potopieviajaja loď moja sia-\^ 
\n<Pijak>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I swam on the right to the left. The left was dense at the time she was still living. I am in the cabin sitting at a sharp angled table. I deserve the rank, but they're sinking my ship-\^  \n<Pisshead>

items.original: Dobre, budz už cicho. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Sure, just shut up.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Všetko je životná skúsenosť, životná skúška. Že, som sa veľa vecí naučil. \n<Pijak>
items.translation: Everything is a life experience, a life test. That, I learned a lot of things. \n<Pisshead>

items.original: Už nežobri.\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: Cease thy begging. \n<Mercenary>

items.original: Rános nenašol žádné slipy?\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: Didst thou find any undergarments this morning? \n<Mercenary>

items.original: Neryp do me.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Cease ye jests. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Hahá! Bratku, vidím, že ti život naložil! Tu máš pár mincí.\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Haha! Brother, I see life hath dealt thee a blow! Here, take a few coins. \n<Mercenary>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]5 korún\c[0].
items.translation: You gained \c[14]5 coins\c[0].

items.original: Dajaký si mi povedomí.\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: You look familiar.\n<Mecenary>

items.original: Ty mne barz ne.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ye do not.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Há, už si pamatám. V Kosove sem te videu, jak si sekol turka přes čolo.\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: Oh, I remember now. In Kosovo, saw you slash a Turks forehead.\n<Mercenary>

items.original: Aleba? Ta to podiškurujeme potom.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Is that so? We may discourse later.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ta veľo šcesce chlopi. Žeby sce totych lapiduchoch našli.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>May fortune smile upon thee, my lads. Would that ye could find those scoundrels. \n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Chlopi? Co še vam stalo?\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: My lords,What hath befallen thee? \n<Innkeeper>

items.original: To škoda reči. Nas odžubali zlodeji ta ich hľedame teraz.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Tis a lamentable tale. We hath been robbed by thieves, and now we seek them. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jaajh bidaci. Tu mate aspoň kus vinka.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: Oh, poor souls. Here, at least, hath a bit of wine. \n<Inkeeper>

items.original: Krčmár ti daroval \c[14]tri fľašky vínka\c[0].
items.translation: The innkeeper have gifted you \c[14]three bottles of wine\c[0]. \n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šak ho zober do kostola naj še modli a ty še vrac, dakus pohutorime. Svatemu nehodno plano robic. Dneška tu plno, bo včera dzedzina bula zapreta, richtar še bal bo husiti hrad zapalili.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Take him to the church and return swiftly, we shall converse. 'Tis improper to vex a clergyman. Today it is full here, for yesterday the town was closed. Burgmaster was afraid of the Hussites. They torched the old castle.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šak ho zober do hradu a še vrac, dakus pohutorime. Svatemu nehodno plano robic. Dneška tu prazdno, bo dzedzina je zapreta, richtar še boji husitoch.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Take him to the castle and return swiftly, we shall converse. 'Tis improper to vex a clergyman. Today we're empty, town is closed, the burgmaster fears an attack by the Hussites.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Naj ci šmakuje! Dneška tu plno, bo včera dzedzina bula zapreta, richtar še bal bo husiti hrad zapalili.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>To your health! Today it is full here, for yesterday the town was closed. Burgmaster was afraid of the Hussites. They torched the old castle.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Naj ci šmakuje! Dneška tu prazdno, bo dzedzina je zapreta, richtar še boji husitoch.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>To your health! Today we're empty, town is closed, the burgmaster fears an attack by the Hussites.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Neznam, či husiti to zapalili. Ale hej, idzem s nim het.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I doubt 'twas Hussites who set it ablaze. But aye, I shall take him away.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej, dobre, idzem ho dac spinkac.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Indeed, very well, I shall let the clergyman rest.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Neznam, či husiti to zapalili. Fajne pifko, pridzem inokedy ešče.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I doubt 'twas Hussites who set it ablaze. Good brew, I shall come again sometime.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Fajne pifko, dojdzem zaš dakedy.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Good brew, I shall come again sometime.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Počkaj ešte, dačo dobreho nechceš kupiť?\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: Wait, wouldst thou not wish to purchase something of quality?\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Som počul, že vraj žida husiti vyrabovali. Nebyva v dedine, ta ho zbrojnoši neuchranili. Vraj mu husiti barz zle robili.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Heard Hussites raided a Jew. Doesn't live in the town, guards couldn't protect him. Treated him badly, they say.<WordWrap>\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A ešči vraj dajaky lupiči privandrovali do našho kraju. Ale nekukaj na mne že som mimo. Šak znam, že sa kradne furt všadzi, ale tito su echt bodri. Normalne do domu vlezu i za bieleho dňa a než sa nazdaš, ta su fuč...
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Also they say some thieves came to this domain. Do no look at me as if I was dull, I know that stealing is the most common crime anywhere. But this bunch is truly brave. Will come into your house and rob you in the light of day! And before you know it, they are gone...\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Dobre si čul. Nabehli mu do domu a richtar sa naňho vysral.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>You have heard the truth. Marched into his abode they did, and burgmaster did not lift a finger to help himn<Pavol>

items.original: Ta už nemam čo. Ale šak dojdi zajtra, možno dajaka klebeta sa prihodzi.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Alas, I have nought else. But come again tomorrow, perchance some gossip may arise.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Ta co, jak pomožem?\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: How can I help ye?\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Jakého proviantu sa ti zažiada, ja ti predám!\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>For a price I'll give anything you wish for!\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Som počul, že vraj žida husiti vyrabovali. Cez pivnične okno mu do domu vliezli. Nebyva v dedine, ta ho zbrojnoši neuchranili. Vraj mu husiti barz zle robili.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Heard Hussites raided a Jew. Doesn't live in the town, guards couldn't protect him. Treated him badly, they say.<WordWrap>\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Ta už nemam čo. Ale dojdi zajtra šak, možno daka klebeta sa prihodi.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Alas, I have nought else. But come again tomorrow, perchance some gossip may arise.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Ájh, pán zemepán, nech ti žehná pán Boh! Prosím prijmi tuhľa \c[14]vínečko\c[0], na účet podniku.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>My leige! God bless you! Please accept this \c[14]wine\c[0], on behalf of the business.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: Ďakujem.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: I appreciate it.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Ta som čul, že husiti pri vode dakoho z rana začali tryzniť.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: Heard that the Hussites began to torturing people by the water in the morning.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No veru. Žid vraj najal päťdesiat poliakov a oni vyhnali mu husitov zos domu.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That's right. Heard the Jew hired fifty Poles and they drove the Hussites out of his house. \n<Innkeeper>

items.original: No... Akože... To som počul už. Daco inšvo mi povidz.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I... ugh... heard that one. Tell us something different.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ta ešči som čul, že husiti pri vode dakoho z rana začali tryzniť.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well, also heard that the Hussites began to torturing people by the water in the morning.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: No veru. Žid vraj najal päťdesiat poliakov a oni vyhnali mu husitov zos domu.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That's right. Heard the Jew hired fifty Poles and they drove the Hussites out of his house.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Som čul, že sa dačo porobelo v totej vilke na zapade! Vravel mi jedon, že tam vidzel i Feriho!\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It is said something took place in the fort in the west! Someone said they saw Feri there as well!\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A co ja som s tebu kravy pasol? Ic het takoj! Mam roboty vyše holovy, ta me nezdržuj, hnoj musim do večara prehadzac bo me žena zmasakruje. Jaj, bodaj by ju šľak trafel! Na nervy mi idze, trebalo by ju dajak uzemnic, coška na ukľudnenie dac, bo odkedy nam syn ušol, neda še s ňu pod jednu strechu vytrimac.
\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hath we tended cattle together? I have tasks aplenty, bother me not, for I must spread dung till evening lest my wife unleash her wrath upon me. Oh, would the devil smite her! She vexes me so, she ought to be tamed somehow, perhaps given a draught for calming, for ever since our son left, I cannot endure her.\n<Farmer>

items.original: Furt po mne ľem vrešti, jak by ja som bul šeckemu vinovaty.\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The hag keeps hollering at me, as if I were guilty of all sins.\n<Farmer>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ten poodniaty husita Jiskra si to tu na Hornej zemi dobýva ako nejaký Mongol, akoby nám Turci nestačili. Poznal som toho poseru, čo mu otvoril bránu na Spišskom hrade, už leží pod zemou! Šak Jiskra má pod palcom Bratislavu, Košice i Levoču! S Hunyadym sa veľmi nemusia, vravím vám, tu ešte bude veselo!\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The damned Hussite Jiskra is conquering the upper lands like some Mongol, as if the Turks were not enough for us. I knew the fool who opened the gate to him in the Spiš Castle, he's already under the ground! Jiskra has Bratislava, Košice and Levoča under his thumb! They don't fancy each other with Hunyady very much, I tell you, there will be more fun here!\n<Peasant>

items.original: Co še tak trešeš?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What are ye trembling for?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nikdaj nič dobre nebude nikde.\n<Nešťastník>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Everything will be horrid forever everywhere.\n<Miserable man>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kym toten Jiskra z Čechoch budze na Spiši, nebudze tu kľud.\n<Nešťastník>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>While the Jiskra from Bohemia stays in Spiš, there will be no peace.\n<Miserable man>

items.original: Navždy bude šecko zle všade.\n<Nešťastník>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nothing will ever be good anywhere.\n<Miserable man>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Každu noc še budzim spoceny, še mi sniva že husiti Jiskrovi ma sekaju.\n<Nešťastník>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Every night I wake up sweaty, dreaming that the Hussites are chopping me up.\n<Miserable man>

items.original: Podriememe?
items.translation: Shall we snooze?

items.original: V pohodze ši, Maceju? Drychmaj drychmaj. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Are you alright, Matej? Sleep, sleep. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobre vinko?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Good wine?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Neščesce zapijam.\n<Tesár>
items.translation: Misfortune hath befallen me.\n<Woodworker>

items.original: Ta co? Krava sa ti zdurila?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Prey tell? Hath ye cow gone mad?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale nee, horše daco. Caly rok som zbieral desky, žeby za dedinou som most postavil. Ale sa dakto na desky ulakomil. Most rozobrali a kto zna co s nim porobili.
\n<Tesár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, worse it be. For a whole year I gathered planks, to build a bridge beyond the village. Yet someone did covet those planks. The bridge dismantled, and who knoweth what fate befell it.\n\n<Woodworker>

items.original: Desky su naspak tam, dze boli. Akorat most musiš odznava poskladac.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The boards are back at the cliffside. You just have to reassemble the bridge.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nadhera! Idzem takoj tam, most do hodziny novy postavim!\n<Tesár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Wonderful! I'm going there at once, in an hour the bridge shall stand anew!\n<Woodworker>

items.original: Ajh hľah. Ktos... kto si? Poznáme sa? Smršť. \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Mmnhg... Ay, Ye... Who are ye? Do I know ye?\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Hľeh- Ryh! Jojh. Vobec, som ťa... nikdy som ťa... nevidzel.\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: Hngh-Gulp! Oi, never have... have I see you... ever.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Co, ši spal ešči?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What, art thou still abed? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nie, modlil som sa.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Nay, I was in prayer. \n<Matej>

items.original: Len rypem. Praženica ešči nevychladla, daj si.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Only a jest. The porridge hath not yet cooled, partake. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zákvas nemáte?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hast thou any sourdough? \n<Matej>

items.original: Takoj donešem.\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: I shall fetch it forthwith.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak čo podnikneme najprv? Odchytíme nejakého kultistu? Vďaka židovej rade ich teraz rozpoznáme zľahka. Alebo hľadáme Valéra?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So, what shall we undertake first? Shall we apprehend some cultist? Thanks to the guidance of the Jew, we can now easily recognize them. Or shall we seek Valer? \n<Matej>

items.original: Co ja znam? Poc še najesc v kľudze. Daco vyhutame.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I doth not know. Let us break our fast in peace. We shall devise a plan thereafter. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sce čuli? Zemepan vraj nič pre kraj nezrobi. Mi vravela omama, že už mešac neni v kraju, že furt len dadzi po lazebnych domoch chodi.
\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Have you heard? The lord will not move a finger to help this land. My granny told me, that he only visits bathouses outside the region.\n<Zbrojnoš>

items.original:
Ty jeden!!!
\n<Jozef>
items.translation:
Bloody peasant!
\n<Jozef>

items.original:
Kašli na truľka. Sa nebudzeš jedovac koli nemu teraz, ne?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Forget him, you do not want to poison yourself with anger over him, do you? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Salam Aleikum!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Salam Alaykum!\n<Matej>

items.original: Aleikum Salam!\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Alaykum Salam!\n<Turk>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Môžem ťa pozvať? Veď slnko už nesvieti. Hostinský, ešte rovno dve ďalšie slivovice do zásoby! Prekvapilo ma, že ťa tu vidím, Uhorsko je predsa vo vojne s Turkami. Ako, že tu máš dovolené prebývať?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, may I extend thee an invitation? For the sun doth now set. Innkeeper, bring forth two more Slivovitz for us! 'Tis a surprise to behold thee here, for Hungary doth wage war against the Turks. How dost thou manage to dwell here amidst these times? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Smutný príbeh Turka jest, manželkám smel vlasy pliesť. Daroval však len Jasmíne milovanej drahý satén, Turkovi pomstu usnoval zvyšný harém! Privolil im zlý imám, právo ja už v kraji nemám. Kameňmi mu zabili zúrivo Jasmínu a Turka zaživa chvátali sa zahrabať pod hlinu. \n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Sorrowful tale of the Turk, braiding wives' hair with bliss. Yet to Jasmine, beloved, he gifted satin fair, devising vengeance against him doth the harem, a scheme beyond compare! Conspiring with an imam vile, stripped of justice in his land, stones did Jasmine kill, and buried me alive. \n<Turk>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ako však dal dobrý Alláh, Turek ušiel pod Váh! Uvolil mi týmto pergamenom kráľ uhorský, obchodovať v tomto kraji ľudu bez obriezky!\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By Allah's grace, the Turk fled, unto the river Vah he sped! Thus, by parchment, the Hungarian king grant trade in this realm, where circumcision is not. \n<Turk>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Neuveriteľné. Hostinský, ešte nalej! Hmm, povedz, pán Turek, čím je vaša kultúra odlišná?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Unbelievable. Innkeeper, another round! Hmm, pray tell, good Turk, how doth thy culture differ? \n<Matej>

items.original: …u nas taka obyčaj, zalej sebe so mnou čaj.\n<Turek>
items.translation: ...'tis a custom, quench thy thirst with me, a cup of tea for thee. \n<Turk>

items.original: A qahwah tiež pijete? Pip nám ťa odporúčal.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And dost thou also indulge in qahwah? 'Twas recommended to us by the priest. \n<Matej>

items.original: …Qahwah Turkovi karavána priváža, nebude tvoja žena nešťastná!\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>...Qahwah, brought by caravan to the Turk, shalt make thy wife not sad! \n<Turk>

items.original: Hostinský, aj nejakú inú pálenku nám dones! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Innkeeper, fetch us another spirit! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Vy máte ale tempo, pijete jak o život. Borovička alebo drienkovica? 
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ye hath quite the pace, drinking as if 'twere a matter of life or death. Borovička or Drienkovica?  \n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Drienkovicu skúsime, čo poviete pán Turek. Som aj tak hútal, čo robíte v tomto zapadákove, v okolitých mestách je mnoho obchodníckych cechov.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let's try the Drienkovica, what say thee, good Turk? I've been pondering, what brings thee to this backwater, when there are many trading guilds in the nearby towns. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Turek qahwah rozváža, ale má rád dievčatá. Nevestinec lepší, nie je ani v Pešti.\n<Turek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The Turk delivers qahwah, enjoys company of maidens. A better brothel there not, not even in Buda. \n<Turk>

items.original:
Takéto zrnká si už videl?
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hast thou seen such beans ere? \n<Matej>

items.original: ...\n<Turek>
items.translation: ...\n<Turk>

items.original: Také Turek nikdy nevidel, arabicu radšej daj mi sem.\n<Turek>
items.translation: Such beans the Turk not see, give the Arabic stead. \n<Turk>

items.original:
Na slovíčko.
\n<?>
items.translation: A word.\n<?>

items.original: Ten dze še tu vzal? Co tam sebe šuškaju?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What tumult ‘tis this? What clandestine whispers are exchanged? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Kto to je, pán Turek? Nejak zle sa na mňa díva.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pray tell, who is this, Turk? His gaze bears ill upon me. \n<Matej>

items.original: Turek povie jeho vec, zvedavosť prehnaná nech ide preč!\n<Turek>
items.translation: The Turk shall have his say, let undue curiosity be dispelled!

items.original:
Ty! Máš dačo proti mne? Zle si sa na mňa díval, vrav!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou there! Hast thou aught against me? Thou didst cast a sour look upon me, speak forthwith! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Ic do rici pajačku, sa staraj o seba.
\n<?>
items.translation: Begone, thou drunken fool, and tend to thyself. \n<?>

items.original:
Ty si isto s tými kultistami, takoj ťa rozpáram! Poď von na férovku!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thou art allied with those cultists. I shall challenge thee! Step forth for a duel fair and square! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Naj ce skare!
\n<?>
items.translation: So be it! \n<?>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ši zošalel načisto? Ta ja neznal, co zos tebu kus paľenky porobi! Boha, maj rozumu dakus! Ľen še tvar, že še biješ a takoj ľahni, že ši odpadnul!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hath ye lost ye wits entirely? I did not expect such a reaction over a mere sip of brandy! By God, exercise some restraint! Pretend ye art in a scuffle, then suddenly fall as if ye hast fainted! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Buď ticho, Ježiš je na mojej strane, zaraz tu bude poriadok v tej dedine!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Be still, for the grace of God is upon me; order shall soon be restored to this village! \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ťa obdivujem, bratm, koľko mas vypitô a ešte sa na nohach trimeš! Ťa pozyvam na pivko, nech maš zapijaka, to ti dobre zrobi.
\n<Žoldnier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I must commend thee, brother, for thy capacity to imbibe and yet maintain thy footing! I invite thee for a pint, to toast to thy victory. 'Twill do thee good. \n<Mercenary>

items.original: Diki, hneď, len sa skočim vyšabľovac.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Thank, I shall join thee presently, I just need to empty my bowels. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pukoce ohník v krbe.
items.translation: Fire crackles in the hearth.

items.original:
Ešči švici slunko, ale už idze čierňava. Viter še dviha.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>The sun still shines, but clouds doth approach. The wind is rising. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hej no. Cítiť vo vzduchu búrku.
\n<Adam>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Yes. You can feel it in the air. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Mam rad taky vzduch. Fuh.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I do enjoy such weather. Pfuh. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Pavol, si v poriadku?
\n<Adam>
items.translation: Pavol, art thou alright? \n<Adam>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ne som, šak Macej asi mrtvy. Ta snaď aspoň vof nebi už je kdeška, takemu i verim po včerajšku.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nay, I am not, for Macej is likely dead. Mayhaps he hath found peace in the heavens, I do believe so after yesterday. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To súvisí s tým mečom?
\n<Adam>
items.translation: Doth it hath aught to do with that sword? \n<Adam>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mi anjel dal. Ledva som vidzel naňho, jakeby tu slnko svietilo o polnoci. Krásne bolo všetko vidno. Predtym dajaky čort še tam chechtal. Ten anjel mi hutorel, že zos ohňom vstupim do kraľovstva božoho. Otviral usta, ale hlas mal jak keby sto vtačkoch naraz čvirikalo, ale tak pocichu. A taky pokuj i laska, že mi slzy padali jak dižď.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>An angel bestowed it upon me. I could barely see him, as if the sun were shining at midnight. Everything was clearly visible. Before that, some devil was sneering hither. The angel told me that with fire I shall rise into heavens. He opened his mouth, but his voice sounded as if a hundred birds were chirping at once, but ever so softly. And there was peace and love, my tears fell like rain. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Kriste, tu co še porobelo? Maceju! Dze ši!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Heavens above, what tumult has befallen here? Macej! Where art ye? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nechcel si prijať Zurvana... máš čo si chcel.
items.translation: That's what you get for rejecting Zurvan.

items.original: Bidáka dorichtovali, žeby ho mac nespoznala.
items.translation: Poor fellow, hath been beaten to a pulp.

items.original: Dobre mu tak. Mal sa pridať, kým sme mu to ponúkali.
items.translation: Should have joined us while you had the chance.

items.original: Chudáka domordovali, dobodali.
items.translation: They hats slain and stabbed him mercilessly.

items.original:
Keby si neriedil víno vodou, možno by sme ťa nehali žiť.
\n<Paula>
items.translation: If you hadn't diluted the wine with water, we might have left you alive. \n<Paula>

items.original:
Krčmár! Bože, i cebe zamordovali?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Innkeeper! By the saints, hath ye also been dispatched? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Hrozne. Večur sa tu rehtal, teraz leži jak v hore drevo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Horrible fate. In the evening, laughing along me. Now lies here prone, never to stand up again. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Še zobudz!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: In the name of all that is holy, awaken! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Uh!
\n<Paula>
items.translation:
Uh!
\n<Paula>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Panaboha, co ši mi to porobela? To čemu, šak še nam dobre žilo spolu, nigda som ci nic zľe nezrobel a ty račej še naľepiš na dajakeho Koreňa! Ty naivna baba sprosta! Co šebe myšľiš, že ce čeka v totej bande!? Šebe dumeš, že toten Koreň švety je? Vas ľen zneuživa na poľitiku, ti teper povim, co on je, turecky agent to je! A Ignac ešči horši, chysta sa vas šicke zahlušic, naj mu už nešaškujece vof kšefte!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Good Lord, what hast ye done to me? Why, when we lived so well together! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ach, Pali, odpusť!! Veď ty si bol taký dobrý na mňa, doteraz nikdy si na mňa ruku nevztiahol! To Koreň mi spôsobil halucinácie, donútil ma to všetko robiť, prisahám na moju dušu! Veď vieš, že ťa milujem!
\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh Pali, forgive me! Thou wert always so kind to me, until now never didst thou raise thy hand against me! 'Twas Root who induced these hallucinations, compelled me to do all this, I swear upon my soul! Thou knowest I love thee! \n<Paula>

items.original:
Neverim ci ani pol slova!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I believe not a word of it! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak ma rozviaž a poď hore, tomu uveríš. Ja už nechcem nič len byť navždy s tebou! Vzlyk. A ráno oslobodíme tvojho kamaráta, uvidíš!
\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I desire naught but to be with thee forever! Weep…  And in the morning, we shall set thy friend free, thou shalt see! \n<Paula>

items.original:
Jáj, laska moja… ale kedz me klameš, prisambohu...
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oh my love... but if thou deceivest me, by all that is sacred... \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hmmm, by som si podriemkal ešte, tote mrtvoly isto len dajaka nočna mora... Počkať, nie! Najprv musim Mateja najsť.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hmm, ye couldst use another quaff... the dead bodies must be a fever dream only... Nay, wait! First, ye must locate Matej.

items.original: Pali tam leží.
items.translation: Pali is lying there.

items.original: Smrť všade.
items.translation: Death everywhere.

items.original: Z popola sa zaleskol \c[14]prsteň\c[0]!
items.translation: From the ashes, the \c[14]ring\c[0] crested!

items.original: Popol.
items.translation: Ashes.

items.original:
No nazdar, Adam! Akurat si dobre došol!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Greetings, Adam! Ye hast arrived just in time! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Panabeka Pali, kto ťa tak dokatoval? Počkaj, utriem ti krv, všade ju tu pľuješ.
\n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By God Pali, who hath treated thee so brutally? Wait, let me wipe thy blood, thou dost spit it everywhere.

items.original:
Moja najdrahša žena utečena, pfuh, sebe predstav.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: My dearest fled wife hath, pfuh, imagine that. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobrú famfatale si si našiel, se všim všudy!
\n<Adam>
items.translation: Thou hast found thyself quite a lively partner, with all things considered! \n<Adam>

items.original:
Hej… najľepšu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye... the loveliest. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo sa tu vôbec odohralo?\n<Adam>
items.translation: What hath unfolded here? \n<Adam>

items.original:
Sam uplne neznam. Poc, rozpovim ci v hrade.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I know not entirely. Come, I shall recount all within the castle. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Šľachtic Adam sa pridaj do tvojej družiny.
items.translation: Nobleman Adam joins your band.

items.original: Ja si to tu užívam, ja sa cítim dobre. \n<Pijak>
items.translation: I'm enjoying it here, I'm feeling good. \n<Pisshead>

items.original:
Idzeme.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: We depart. \n<Marek>

items.original:
Vy hajzli.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ye scoundrels. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To čo má byť... vy ste si vymenili háby! Nič to, so Zurvanovou mágiou ťa ľahko premôžem aj sama.
\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By my troth, what manner of deceit is this... Hast thou swapped garbs? Be it as it may, with the arcane might of Zurvan, I shall vanquish thee with ease. \n<Paula>

items.original:
Toto budze perši raz, aľe za Mateja ci už taku prisušim, že še nezdohadaš!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Tis be the first time I raise my hand on ye, and you will not forget it.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
De si bola?
\n<Hnilička>
items.translation: Where hast thou been? \n<Rotface>

items.original:
Zdržal ma bývalý. Kam šli ostatní?
\n<Paula>
items.translation: I was delayed by an old acquaintance. Where hath the others gone? \n<Paula>

items.original:
Do starého hradu. Keď pobehneš, možnaj ich doženieš.
\n<Hnilička>
items.translation: To the old castle. If thou hurriest, thou mayest catch up with them. \n<Rotface>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tadeto sa potom i naspak do lesa dostaneme.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: Through here we can get back into the forest, if need be. \n<Ida>

items.original: Glob. \n<Škrata>
items.translation: Glob. \n<Insanity>

items.original: Boha, ďalšia potvora. To keľo dzeci ma toten chlop? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: God, another creature. How many children hath this lad spawned? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pali! Toto veru nie je zrastené dvojča, ale ozaj akási obluda! Meča sa chop, užaj! \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pali! Draw thy sword! This is no conjoined twin, but a true monstrosity! \n<Matej>

items.original: Dobrý deň. \n<Marianove sn>
items.translation: Greetings. \n<Marian's children>

items.original: Jaaaj, moji sn' znajut vyplašiti obludu!  \n<Marian>
items.translation: Oh, my sons, thou dost startle the monster! \n<Marian>

items.original: Ta to odvažni chalani, veruže! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Truly brave lads! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jakij parobci, to divki sut! Što ty nevidiš? \n<Marian>
items.translation: What sort of lads, those are maidens! Canst thou not see? \n<Marian>

items.original:
Divky? Akože dzivčata to su, hej? No ja neznam.
Ale čemu im potem furt hutoriš syn, parom by ťa bralo! \n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Maidens? Are these maidens, verily ? I doth ponder... But why dost ye continually address them as sons? One would think thee mad! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Sn' sut ditky! Dvi sn' sut dvi ditky! \n<Marian>
items.translation: They are children! Two sons are two children! \n<Marian>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj, taže syn su dzeci. Dobre, podzme už het Macej. Ta vam ďakujeme pekne, s Bohom ostavajte a my še ešči dakedy zastavime ochutnac totu hruškovicu. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, so ye sons ye mean children. Well, let us depart now, Matej. We thank ye kindly, farewell and may God be with you. May we return another time to sample this pear brandy. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dovidenia. \n<Marianove sn>
items.translation: Farewell. \n<Marian's children>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Prosím ťa. Potrebovali by sme, aby tvoje sn' pomohli nám v dôležitej veci. Len potrebujeme, aby sa ukázali husitom pri židovom dome. Neboj, nič strašné to nebude. Aj ti zaplatíme. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I beseech ye. We would require thine offspring's presence in an important matter. Only to show thyemself to the Hussites at the Jew's house. Fear not, it shall be naught dreadful. We shall also compensate thee.\n<Matej>

items.original: Mmmm, dobri. \n<Marian>
items.translation: Mmmm, very well. \n<Marian>

items.original: Tu maš tricec korun. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here are thirty coins for ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dal si marianovi tricec korun.
items.translation: You gave Marian thirty coins.

items.original: Sn' počkajut vas kde treba. \n<Marian>
items.translation: They shall await thee where needed. \n<Marian>

items.original: Ty dumau, že ja neznajut počitati? To nijest 30 korun! \n<Marian>
items.translation: Dost thou think they cannot count? That is not thirty coins! \n<Marian>

items.original: Musim hrušk zbirati. \n<Marian>
items.translation: I must gather pears. \n<Marian>
