items.original: Musim hrušk' zbirati. \n<Marian>
items.translation: I must gather pears. \n<Marian>

items.original: Bratu, počuješ ma? Čože ty tak vysoko lezieš? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Brother, dost thou hear me? Why dost thou climb so high? \n<Matej>

items.original: Hrušk' musim pozbirati, hrušk'! Len slabo roštňu, dišť už mešac nepadat.\n<Marian>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I must gather pears, pears! The branches are weak, and the harvest is upon us. For it hath not rained in a moon. \n<Marian>

items.original: A nebojíš sa, že padneš?  \n<Matej>
items.translation: And dost thou not fear falling? \n<Matej>

items.original: Što by jem sa bojau! Koli padnu, ta padnu. Hrušk' pre sn' musim pozbirati na večir! \n<Marian>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Why should I fear? If I fall, then so be it. I must gather the pears before nightfall! \n<Marian>

items.original: Pre koho? \n<Matej>
items.translation: For whom? \n<Matej>

items.original: Sn'! Mi dvi sn'!\n<Marian>
items.translation: For us! We two, us! \n<Marian>

items.original: A nemáme ti pomôcť, bratu? \n<Matej>
items.translation: And shall we not aid thee, brother? \n<Matej>

items.original: Ni!! Nemoža! Musim pozbirati hrušk' pre sn'!  \n<Marian>
items.translation: Ni!! It cannot be! I must gather the pears for us! \n<Marian>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To bude ten dedinský blázon, jeden z mnohých. Ale aj takých si ceniť treba, som čítal o tom spis od fra Fouc Aulta. Blázni majú tajomné spojenie s transcendentnom. Ale treba ich liečiť železnými pilinami, to je silné a vzpruží ich ducha. A maniakom treba strkať hlavu do ľadovej vody, ich mozog je totiž príliš horúci a suchý. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Tis the village fool, one of many. Yet even such as he should be valued, for I hath read in the writings of Brother Fouc Alta that fools possess a mysterious connection to the transcendent. But they must be treated with iron filings, for that strengthens and enlivens their spirits. And as for the maniacs, they must hath their heads plunged into icy water, for their minds are too hot and dry. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Eej! Kukaj še tu, toten blazon zna, co dobre. Štyri fľašky hruškovice tu ma v kešeni. Kusčok ochutnam. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Eh! Look here, that fool knows something. He has four bottles of pear brandy in his pocket. Let me taste a bit. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Neopovažuj sa! Nielen, že chľasceš, ešte aj kradnúť chceš?!  \n<Matej>
items.translation: Dare not! Thou not only drinketh but also desirest to steal? \n<Matej>

items.original: Daj pokuj. Stary sebe nevšimne ništ. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Cease thy prattle. The old one shall not notice a thing. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali! Nepi to! Čo to stváraš? Kam to lezieš?  \n<Matej>
items.translation: Stop! Do not drink it! What art thou doing? Where art thou going? \n<Matej>

items.original: Hk! Idzem mu pomahac, kejc taku dobru paľenku zna zos teho vykvasic! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hc! I am going to help him, for he knows how to make fine brandy from these pears! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Keby si bol taký rezký v čine aj keď treba dobro konať! \n<Matej>
items.translation: If only thou wert as eager to do good deeds when needed! \n<Matej>

items.original: Nenehaš me? Ci narucam hruške do toteho ksichta! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wilt ye not let me? Or shall I send the pears into ye face? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Prestaň! Poď dole z tej dreviny! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Halt! Descend from yon timber! \n<Matej>

items.original: Znaš co? Okoštujem totej jeho palinky. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Very well, I shall leave it be. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Neodoláš pokušeniu ani okamih? Okradnúť chceš deduška? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Ye know what I shall taste of that brandy. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali! Nepi to! Čo to stváraš? Kam to lezieš? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Wouldst thou not refrain? Dost thou wish to rob the old man? \n<Matej>

items.original: Naňho!
items.translation: Get him!

items.original: Bidak bidny.
items.translation: Poor sod.

items.original: Toľko zmareného života.
items.translation: So much wasted life.

items.original: Samé nešťastie.
items.translation: All misfortune.

items.original: Prekliaty snáď je tento kraj. Toľko smrti.
items.translation: Damn this land. So much death.

items.original: Beľmo strachu v očiach mŕtveho.
items.translation: Fear in the eyes of the dead.

items.original: Tento má pri sebe ešte \c[14]lekvár\c[0].
items.translation: This one still has\c[14]jam\c[0] with it.

items.original: Hrozné, čo sa tu porobilo.
items.translation: Terrible what has been done here.

items.original: Cipanečku, še maruju navzajom!  \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Observe, they are hunting each other!  \n<Pavol>

items.original: Jdou po nás zezadu! \n<Husita>
items.translation: They're coming for us from behind! \n<Hussite>

items.original: Spojme sily proti nemu! \n<Kultista>
items.translation: Let's join forces against him! \n<Cultist>

items.original: Ty co ši še ku nam pridal? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Why did ye join us? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
A šak ty nesi od nas?
\n<Pindžur>
items.translation: And ye are not one of us? \n<Bucket>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zurvan zachraňuj me! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na- \^
\n<Pindžur>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Zurvan save me! Zurvan upon ye! Zurvan upon ye! Zurvan upon ye!  \n<Bucket>

items.original: Cicho budz. Zošalel, skoro ma bodol do karku. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Shut it. He went crazy, almost stabbed me in the neck. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Smrť, všade smrť.
items.translation: Death, death everywhere.

items.original: Strašná bitka sa tu odohrala.
items.translation: A terrible battle took place here.

items.original: Už si našol Feriho?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Have you found Feri yet?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Furt ne. Šade som šecko prekutral i na každú kadibúdu som zaklopal. Vyparil sa.\n<Ďusi>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Still not. I scoured the everything and knocked on every outhouse. Disappeared.\n<Ďusi>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ty co tu robiš furt? Sme ťa neposlali het?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wherefore art thou lingerin' here still? Were ye not dispatched hence? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Okultisti zabili mi Dežiho. Ja teraz ich pozabijam.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: The cultists kill my Deži. 'Tis now they die. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hah! Nepriateľ našho nepriateľa. Bys nam mohla dajak pomocť.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hah! The enemy of our enemy. Ye couldst lend us some aid. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kebyže sa chceme dostac z dzedziny von, poznam tajnu cescičku. Cez les vas možem previesc, vyhneme sa kultistom.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know secret path, should we want to leave the village. Through woods I can guide, away from cultists.\n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tu vas počkam, kebyže sa chcece dostac naspak do lesa.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: I wait here, ye wish return to woods. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Znaš co, šak podz s nami.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Know ye what? She shall come along with us. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pali, prosím pekne, kto to je?
\n<Adam>
items.translation: Pali, pray tell, who is she? \n<Adam>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ci potem povim. Ale okultistoch isto neznaša vecej než nas.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I shall tell ye later. But surely she dislikes the cultists more than us. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zlodejka Ida pridala sa k tvojej družine.
items.translation: The thief Ida has joined your band.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kebyže sa chceme dostac z dzedziny von, poznam tajnu cescičku. Cez les vas možem previesc, vyhneme sa kultistom. Da sa prejc cez chyžku teho zberača hruškoch.
\n<Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I know secret path, should we want to leave the village. Through woods I can guide, away from cultists. We pass trough pear gatherer hut. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Prevedziem vas cez les?
\n<Ida>
items.translation: I lead through woods? \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tu vas čekam, hej?
\n<Ida>
items.translation: I wait here, aye? \n<Ida>

items.original: Pobodaný kultista.
items.translation: Stabbed cultist.

items.original: Okultista dorezaný.
items.translation: Cut up cultist.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nechajte ma, chlapi, idem sa obesiť na lipu. Husiti ma prepadli v dome, cez pivničné okno mi do domu vnišli. Sa naliali, tie prepiduše chrchliacke, i dostali nápad, že ma pokrstia.
\n<Žid>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Leave me be, good fellows, I am off to hang myself from the linden tree. The Hussites assaulted me in my home, they entered through the cellar window. Those cursed, drunken scoundrels poured into the house and got the idea to baptize me. \n<Jew>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A to zľe? Šak sice spravidla sa len raz krsti v živoce, aľe na škodu nemusi byť, ani kejc ťa dva raz pokrstia, šak do istoty.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>And is that so dire? While it is customary to be baptized only once in life, it may not be harmful even if they baptize ye twice, just for certainty. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale ja som žid! Pokrstili ma a huspeninu snažili sa mi natlačiť do gágora. Smiali sa i vyvádzali tí svindžúri sťa v chlieve, jháj, trasiem sa celý od zlosti, jak to vyprávam.
\n<Žid>
items.translation: <WordWrap>But I am a Jew! They baptized me and tried to force huspenina, that pork gelatinous concoction into my throat. They laughed and cavorted like swine in the sty. Oh, I tremble with anger as I recount this. \n<Jew>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Žid hovoríš? Richtár nas poslal za tebou. Horše veci sa deju, tak sa mi nerozdrapuj tuna. Kultisti robia inu psotu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>A Jew, you say? The burgmaster sent us after ye. Worse affairs plague the land, so let us not stir further discord here. Cultists sow mischief. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Horše veci sa tu deju v kraji, nerozdrapuj sa tuna. Kultisti psotu robia.\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<WordWrap>Worse affairs plague the land, so let us not stir further discord here. Cultists sow mischief. . 
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No o nich niečo viem. Ale nič nepoviem, kým nezískam späť svoje imanie i česť spravodlivým potrestaním.
\n<Žid>
items.translation: I <WordWrap>am privy to some knowledge of their ways. Yet, I shall remain silent until I hath reclaimed my possessions and honor through rightful retribution. \n<Jew>

items.original: Ak chcete moju pomoc, vyžeňte tú zberbu z môjho domu!\n<Žid>
items.translation: If you seek my aid, rid my abode of that rabble!  \n<Jew>

items.original: Nechceš ty nam pomocť, ta ani my ti nepomožeme.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: If ye refuse to help us, then neither shall we aid ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: 200 dukatov vam zaplatim! I vopred!\n<Žid>
items.translation: I shall offer you 200 coins! In advance! \n<Jew>

items.original: To už rozumnejša reč. Uvidzime, co zmožeme.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Now that is more reasonable. Let us see what can be achieved. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]200 korún\c[0].
items.translation: You have gained \c[14]200 coins\c[0].

items.original: Snažte sa, priatelia.\n<Žid>
items.translation: May thee endeavor be fair, friends. \n<Jew>

items.original: Tu hneď, veď sa dívaš na môj dom.\n<Žid>
items.translation: Right here, canst thou not see my dwelling? \n<Jew>

items.original: No to len tak nepôjde! Dosť ste už dostali.\n<Žid>
items.translation: Nay, it shall not be so simple! Ye hath received enough. \n<Jew>

items.original:
Nuž ale priviedli sme zbrojnošoch, aby proti husitom pomohli.
Oni zadarmo nebojuju.\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
<WordWrap>Well, we hath enlisted soldiers to aid against the Hussites.
They do not fight for free. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobre vy, ale mnoho už nemám. Tu máte, čo môžem dať.\n<Žid>
items.translation: Very well, but I hath not much left. Here is what I can offer. \n<Jew>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]30 korún\c[0].
items.translation: You have gained \c[14]30 coins\c[0] .

items.original: Čo ste to porobili, blázni?!\n<Žid>
items.translation: What madness hath thou wrought? \n<Jew>

items.original: Šak si chcel husitoch z domu vypakovac, a už ich tam nit.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ye didst seek to oust the Hussites from the house, and now they are not within.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Dom ale mal zostať stáť!\n<Žid>
items.translation: But the house was meant to remain standing! \n<Jew>

items.original: Veď ne my sme ho rozburdali. Husiti paseku narobili. To oni voľačo tam zapálili.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>'Twas not us who razed it. 'Twas the Hussites who wrought havoc. Ye set something ablaze therein.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Leží tu husita.
items.translation: There is a Hussite lying here.

items.original: Husita mal pri sebe \c[14]15 korún\c[0].
items.translation: Hussite had with him \c[14]15 crowns\c[0].

items.original: Husita mal pri sebe \c[14]lekvár\c[0] a \c[14]zákys\c[0].
items.translation: Hussite had \c[14]jam\c[0] and \c[14]sour cream\c[0] with him.

items.original: Husita mal pri sebe \c[14]40 korún\c[0] a \c[14]alpu\c[0].
items.translation: Hussite owned \c[14]40 crowns\c[0] and \c[14]alpa\c[0].

items.original: Ci pana. Maceji, šak ich tam jak hadoch.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Dear God, behold a venerable serpent's nest.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Trúfame si na nich takto vo dvojici?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Dost we dare confront them thus, in pair? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť. Povoláme sn' toho zberača hrušiek, husiti si budú myslieť, že na nich útočí sekta i zutekajú, potom už ich pochytáme. Alebo snáď niekto iný by sa k nám mohol pridať. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

items.original: Mali by sme získať posily. Snáď nám niekto z hradu alebo z dediny pomôže.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We should acquire reinforcements. Perhaps someone from the castle or the village shall aid us. \n<Matej>

items.original: Tak ako? Ideme predsa na nich?\n<Matej>
items.translation: How now? Shall we advance upon them. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť. Povoláme sn toho zberača hrušiek, husiti si budú myslieť, že na nich útočí sekta i zutekajú, potom už ich pochytáme. Alebo snáď niekto iný by sa k nám mohol pridať. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Mali by sme získať posily. Snáď nám niekto z hradu alebo z dediny pomôže.
 \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We should acquire reinforcements. Perhaps someone from the castle or the village shall aid us. \n<Matej>

items.original: Sn'! Zlate moje, pocce še ukazac tuhľa panstvu.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Rise, my children, show thyself to these gentlemen. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobrý deň.\n<Marianove sn>
items.translation: Greetings. \n<Marian’s children>

items.original: Doprdele, co to je ty, vole! \n<Husita>
items.translation: Bloody hell, what in the world is this! \n<Hussite>

items.original: Vidzel som i koňa v lufte srac... ale toto.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: I’ve seen a horse defecate mid flight… yet this… \n<Pavol>

items.original: Sn', môžete odísť.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Thanks be to thee, you may depart. \n<Matej>

items.original: Dovidenia.\n<Marianove sn>
items.translation: Farewell. \n<Marian’s children>

items.original: Naša robota tuna je dokončena. Ideme domu.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Our task is complete in this place. Let us make way back home.\n<Man at arms>

items.original: No, ste sa nepretrhli. Ale tu mace na pivko, že ste cestu merali.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Indeed, ye hath barely labored. Here, take this coin for ale as reward for ye efforts. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Bez nólabu sa nevracajte!\n<Žid>
items.translation: Don't come back without noollab!\n<Jew>

items.original: Aha tuto, dzirečka v scene. Asi do pivnici ide.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, look yonder, a hole in the wall. Mayhaps it leads to the cellar. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Isto sa tam husiti schádzajú.
Mať tak nejakú výbušninu. Raz dva by sme ich odtiaľ vydurili.\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<WordWrap>Verily, 'tis where those Hussites must gather.
If only we possessed some manner of explosive. 'Twould swiftly dislodge them. \n<Matej>

items.original: Rucam ho tam.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Off with ye. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Počkaj ešte, trošku to premyslíme. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Let us tarry a moment, and ponder this course. \n<Matej>

items.original: Neskoro, už je dnuka.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Too late, it is in. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dobrý deň. \n<Mariánove sn>
items.translation: Greetings. \n<Marian’s children>

items.original:
Ty co tu furt sa obšmietaš? Sme ci ne jasne povedali, že maš vypadnuc takoj?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Why are ye still around? Did we not clearly tell ye that ye are to leave at once? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pomstiť idzem mojich druhoch. Kultisti otravili Bruna i pobili ostatnych. Nezaspim, kym ich nevydrancujem.
\n<Zlodejka Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>To avenge my comrades. The cultist poisoned Bruno and kiled the others. I will not fall asleep until I plunder them. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hm, znaš co? Pokračuj, nebudzem ce rušic. Ale Boh naj ce chrani kejc ce zbadam, že daco zaš sa snažiš pocahnuc!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hm, ye know what? Go on, we will leave ye undisturbed. But God forbid, shall I see ye trying to nick something! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Už neška troch som dobila kultistoch. Snažia sa olupic žida.
\n<Zlodejka Ida>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I've already conquered three cultists. They are trying to rob the Jew. \n<Zlodejka Ida>

items.original:
Chlapi! Ďakujem, že ste prišli! Zas sa mi sem snažili vlúpať nejaký zločinci, tentokrát som našťastie zavrel pivničné okienko. Tu máte za odmenu \c[14]figu\c[0].
\n<Žid>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Merry men! Thank you for coming! Again, some criminals tried to break in, this time I closed the cellar window. Here's a \c[14]fig\c[0] as reward. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nešťastník v pästi zviera delobuch. Asi ho chcel odpáliť ale nešli mu ruky ku sebe.
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The unfortunate lad gris a petard in his fist. He probably wanted to detonate it, but his hands couldn't come close together.

items.original: Získal si \c[14]delobuch\c[0].
items.translation: You have earned \c[14]petard\c[0].

items.original: Možno to bol dajaky lesný robotník, abo dakto taký.
items.translation: Maybe it was some forest worker, or someone like that.

items.original: Čo vy tu ešte? Hádam ste vydumali pohon pre balón?\n<Žid>
items.translation: What else are you here for? Have you figured out the drive for the balloon?\n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak by som sa chcel venovať výskumu. Ale v poslednej dobe stále sa sem len ktosi snaží dobyť.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh how much I want to do research. But lately, seemingly everyone has been trying to conquer my abode.\n<Jew>

items.original: Tak by som sa chcel venovať výskumu. Ale v poslednej dobe stále sa sem len ktosi snaží dobiť.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh how much I want to do research. But lately, seemingly everyone has been trying to conquer my abode.\n<Jew>

items.original: Rozbité sudy. Husiti všetko pobrali. Okrem tejto \c[14]figy\c[0].
items.translation: Plundered barells. The Hussites took all, except for this \c[14]fig\c[0].

items.original: Prosím vás, nehrabte sa mi vo veciach.\n<Žid>
items.translation: I beg of you, do not rummage through my things.\n<Jew>

items.original: Poničené nádoby.
items.translation: Broken caskets.

items.original: Poničené nádoby. V jednej ostalo ale \c[14]vínko slivkové\c[0].
items.translation: Broken caskets. Only one \c[14]plum wine\c[0] remained here.

items.original:
Nejaký husita sem odložil \c[14]strieborný medailón\c[0] s vyobrazením Jána Husa.
Isto sa zíde.
items.translation: <WordWrap>Some Hussite left a \c[14]silver medailon\c[0] with the portrait of Hus here. May come handy.

items.original: Poďme teda nato. Pali, ukáž ten meč. \n<Adam>
items.translation: Let us proceed then. Pali, present thy sword. \n<Adam>

items.original: Hej, mňa tu necháte napospas?\n<Žid>
items.translation: Aye, and what of me? Wilt thee leave me here defenseless? \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Cežky balon budze. Tu še rychlo schovaj do pivnici. Abo ic dakdzi na strom vylez v ľese. Jeden deň vytrimeš i o hladze.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We must pack the balloon lightly. Quickly, conceal yeself in the cellar. Or seek refuge high in a tree in the forest. Day without sustenance ye shalt endure. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Rýchlo, dvíha sa vietor správnym smerom! \n<Adam>
items.translation: Hasten, the wind sets fair! \n<Adam>

items.original: Nuž, bude to len v Božích rukách, či nás tam zaveje.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Verily, it shall rest in God's hands whether we are borne thither. \n<Matej>

items.original: Jak šumne letí...\n<Žid>
items.translation: How swiftly it doth soar... \n<Jew>

items.original: Je tu \c[14]delobuch\c[0].
items.translation: \c[14]Petard\c[0] lies here.

items.original: Zdravím vás, maľujem tu obrazy.\n<Umelec>
items.translation: Greetings, I do painteth hither pictures.\n<Painter>

items.original: Obrazy? To sa ne vof vnutri maľuje? Šak tu ci nato napada dišč.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Pictures? Doth one not paint inside? Do ye not mind the rain?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To možno. Rýchlosť, ktorou ale musím pracovať, ma núti vytvárať diela, ktoré realitu zachycujú v svojej hrubej podstate.\n<Umelec>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Mayhap. The swiftness with which I must labor, however, doth compel me to create works that do capture reality in its raw essence.\n<Painter>

items.original: Ta ukaž daco, ne?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Then show something, prithee?\n<Pavol>

items.original: ...ci. Dobre si to zachytil. By si mi to nedal?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: ..aye. Thou hast captured it well. Wouldst thou not give it to me?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zadarmo veru nie. 50 korún a je tvoj.\n<Umelec>
items.translation: Freely indeed not. Fifty coins and 'tis thine.\n<Painter>

items.original: Je tvoj!\n<Umelec>
items.translation: It's yours!\n<Painter>

items.original: Ale veď nemáš dosť peňazí!\n<Umelec>
items.translation: But thou hast not enough coin!\n<Painter>

items.original: A čo tak so zľavou? Za 30 korún ti ho môžem dať.\n<Umelec>
items.translation: And what of a discount? For 30 coins I can give it to thee.\n<Painter>

items.original: Aspoň 10 korún zaň nedáš?\n<Umelec>
items.translation: Wilt thou not give at least 10 coins for it?\n<Painter>

items.original: Tak si ho zober, ty piškvora!\n<Umelec>
items.translation: Then take it, thou scoundrel!\n<Painter>

items.original: Idem ďalej maľovať.\n<Umelec>
items.translation: I go paint again.\n<Painter>

items.original: Asi som si grcol do pusy. \n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: I think I puked a little in me mouth.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Už ste boli v mlyne? Bol tam? \n<Anička>
items.translation: Have you been in the mill? Was he there?\n<Anička>

items.original: Dosky tu ležia.
items.translation: Planks lie here.

items.original: Matuš, kukaj dajake dzifče tu vyšlo zos cmy! \n<Ščevo>
items.translation: Matuš, behold a maiden emerging from the dark! \n<Ščevo>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ale dajaka je dorantana. No ta dobry večir sa praje mlada dama! Sa zohrej pri ohniku, traše ce jak osiku.
\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But she appears distressed. Well, good evening to thee, young lady! \n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dežku, čuješ, šak ic jej po dajaky plašť, naj sa zahreje, daco najdzi v totym vašim povoze.\n<Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Dežko, dost thou hear? Offer her a cloak to warm herself, find something in thy carriage. \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: Dobry večur. \n<Marianove sn>
items.translation: Greetings.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pali, predsa len by sme mali ísť hľadať tých pipovích zbrojnošov. Určite niečo nám prezradia.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pali, we should still go seek the priests mercenaries,\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Maceju, to glupocina. Šak už večur i tak, ich hľedac teraz, to holy nerozum. Abo še pomodli, možnože sa ti zjavi svata Tereza a ce nasmeruje abo co… I kedz aši to nema bars zmysel.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, dost we truly plan to pursue the priest’s minstrels at this hour? Or mayhaps ye shouldst pray, perchance Saint Teresa shall appear and guide us, or some such... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Ach.
Nuž dobre, ale zajtra musíme ích ísť hľadať.\n
items.translation:
Ah.
Thou mayst be right. Very well, but on the morrow we must venture forth in search of them. \n

items.original: Hej-hej. Pocme het už hlavne.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, aye, let us haste. Tomorrow we shall resolve. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Je možne toto? Kukaj, asi še ci splnilo prianie.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Could it be. Seems yer wish came true. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ach, či sú len sprostí! Takto sa prezradiť.\n<Matej>
items.translation: How foolish to reveal themselves in such manner.\n<Matej>

items.original: Heh... čoby nie.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Heh... why not.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Čo má toto znamenať?\n<Turek>
items.translation: What is the meaning of this?\n<Turk>

items.original: Aleže, keho nam sem čerti nešu?! Co ce zdržalo, draha?\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Behold, what misfortune hath the devils brought upon us?! What delayed thee, my dear? \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Marek, hrozí nám nebezpečenstvo! Koreň je turecký agent, celé toto mala byť len politika aaaa... a Ignác sa nás chystal zbaviť! Po boji pred krčmou ma Pali zajal, ale nakoniec som ho zavraždila a utiekla.\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Marek! Pali captured me, but in the end, I murdered him and fled . \n<Paula>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Áno? Čo nepovieš. A ja šebe myšlim, že to bulo calkom inač. Cale ši to narafičila i s tymito tvojimi novymi kumpanmi, priznaj še! Paliho mame tu predsa zajateho, ty ši še tam isto laškovala so svojim byvalym mužom, s tym Matejom! \n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>You say so? What tale dost thou spun? And I thought it was quite different. Thou hast concocted all this, even with thy new companions, confess! We hath Pali captive here, thou surely dallied there with thy former husband, with that Matej! \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo?? Akým mužom Matejom? Ja predsa... Marek, však vieš, že si pre mňa už jediný. \n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What?? What former husband Matej? I, of course... Marek, thou knowest that thou art the only one for me. \n<Paula>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Sa nehraj na glupu, som ce s nim zahliadol, jak sme Paliho unašali. Furt ho miluješ, prestaň mi tu klamac, že ši ho zabila!  \n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Do not play the fool with me, I saw thee with him, as we abducted Pali. Thou still lovest him, stop lying to me that thou hast killed him! \n<Marek>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ale toto nie je on, vzali ste toho mnícha Mateja… museli si naschvál vymeniť háby. \n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But this is not him, ye hath taken that monk Matej... thee must hath deliberately exchanged clothes. \n<Paula>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ti už ani slovo neverim, jak ši mi ho zatajovala! Ja budzem z nas dvoch ten, kto ziska nesmrteľnosc splynutim s Angra Mainyu! Teraz tu velim ja, ty podla zradkyňa. Chlopi! Zabice ju! \n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I trust not a word from thee anymore, how hast thou concealed it from me! I shall be the one to attain immortality through the merging with Angra Mainyu! Now I command here, thou treacherous one. Men! Seize her! \n<Marek>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hah, ty jeden malý červ! Ide ti len o moc a o tvoje trápne pomýlené a urazené ego, čo, vôbec ťa nezaujímajú zabudnuté poklady Zurvana! Vernosť týchto poskokov možno prešla k tebe, ale ešte mám zvyšky Ahrimanovej poslušnosti od posledného rituálu! Ahriman saldiri!
\n<Paula>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hah, thee little worm! Thou art only after power and thy pitifully misguided and offended ego, which, dost thou not care about Zurvan's forgotten treasures at all! Loyalty of these lackeys may hath shifted to thee, but I still harbor remnants of Ahriman's obedience from the last ritual! Ahriman, saldiri! \n<Paula>

items.original: Ty beštia, jak sa opovažuješ…!\n<Marek>
items.translation: Fiend, how dare you…!\n<Marek>

items.original:
Fajne, celý svet je môj teraz.
\n<Paula>
items.translation:
Good, the world is mine now!
\n<Paula>

items.original: Paula! Kam si ušla? Vráť sa! AAAAH!\n<Marek>
items.translation: Paula! Whither hast thou fled? Return! AAAAH! \n<Marek>

items.original: Rozrucane špekačky su tu roztarhane, medzi nimi leži \c[14]dýka\c[0].
items.translation: Asundered sausages lie here scattered, among them lies a \c[14]dagger\c[0].

items.original: Rozrucane špekačky su tu roztarhane.
items.translation: Asundered sausages lie here scattered.

items.original: Spečený nešťastník.
items.translation: The hapless one, roasted.

items.original: Asi sme našli Karla.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Methinks we found Kajo.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Kukaj jaky ma fajny nahrdelnik.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Gaze upon this fine necklace.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vzal si nešťastníkovi \c[14]zlatý náhrdelník\c[0].
items.translation: You took \c[14]golden necklace\c[0] from this lost soul..

items.original: Bidak spečeny tu našiel svoj koniec.
items.translation: The hapless one, roasted, met his end here.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nebice ma! Tu mace \c[14]vinko\c[0]. \n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Do not beat me anymore. Here take this \c[14]wine\c[0]. \n<Ščevo>

items.original: Nemam nič už pre vas. \n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I have nothing more for you. \n<Ščevo>

items.original: Nas Vlado nehal tu samich, dakam pošol s totu dievčinu. \n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Our comrade Vlado hath left us alone, he ventured forth with that maiden. \n<Maťo>

items.original: Nevychadzájte von, okultisti obsadili dedinu!\n<Adam>
items.translation: Stay within, for the cultists hath seized the village! \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vďaka za upozornenie. A vy kamže sa zberace? \n<Ščevo>
items.translation: Thank thee for the warning. And where art ye off to? \n<Ščevo>

items.original: Na huby.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Off to forage for mushrooms.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nas Vlado nehal tu samych, dakam pošol s totu dievčinu. \n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Our comrade Vlado hath left us alone, he ventured forth with that maiden. \n<Maťo>

items.original: Ihneď ho priveďte! \n<Adam>
items.translation: Fetch him back at once! \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Joj, to nema cenu. Daromna robota. Tu mace orechovicu, naj lepše vam je na totych huboch.\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ah, 'tis of no avail. A fruitless task. Here, partake of this hazelnut liqueur, it pairs well with your forage for mushrooms.\n<Maťo>

items.original: Dostal si \c[14]orechovicu\c[0].
items.translation: You received c[14]hazelnut liqueur\c[0].

items.original: <Wordwrap>No počekajce ešči. Pip tu nehal dajake svoje veci, medzi nimi dajaky kľučik. Kľudne ho šebe zoberce. \n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But wait a moment. The preist left behind some of his belongings, among them a key. Taketh it with thee. \n<Ščevo>

items.original: Dostal si \c[14]kľúč farára\c[0].
items.translation: You received c[14]priest's key\c[0].

items.original: Zgruchotal. Jak še mu to podarilo še nedozname asi.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Down he goes. How he managed to slip on flat ground, shall remain a mistery.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tadeto smom... som cho-chodil na kamennú horu, škaredú, hnusnú, vytrtkanú kamennú horu. Calé je to tu jak zakloté. Tam... Taký strašák tade chodil špatný, taký grobián. Že ho nikto nedobije jak koňa!
\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Through hrer... here I went. To the rock hill. Ugly, piss stained, repugnant, ugly rock hill. As if it was cursed, the whole place! A ghostly figure would traverse the... the place. Wonder noone thrashed him like a horse!\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Uhm... Užasne. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Truly inspiring.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Lesom tu ide cesta... Do lesa ide tá cesta. A na konci tej cesty... Les už neni. Som tade chodieval do doliny, na jarmkt...jarmart...jarmarkt. Dycky som najlepšu zednal cenu.
\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: <WordWrap>A path goes through the forest here... Into the forest, the path goes. At the end of the path... forest is no more. I journeyed through there to reach the valley. Went to the mrar... markek... market. Haggled for the best price, aye, I did.\n<Drunkard>

items.original: Ty sa nadristaš. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: What a yapper.  \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mno, chlapci moji. Do dediny by som nie úplne najradšej šiel. Teraz to tam bude prelezené kultistami. Jak ma zahliadnu, isto by mi o život usilovali.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Well, lads, twould not be wise to go into town. It's crawling with cultists, they will try their hardest to assassinate me.
\n<Jozef>

items.original: Poc do karčmy na jedno, šak už i tak večur. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Let's head to the tavern for a drink, for the evening is already upon us.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ešte raz mi takéto navrhneš! Hneď sa chcem vrátiť k môjmu iluminovaniu! \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Thou shalt not suggest such a thing to me again! Straightaway I shall return to my illumination!\n<Matej>

items.original: Joj, ta ic sam, co ja som, ce mam za ručičku vodic? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Alas, go forth alone. Or am I to babysit you? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Všade sa potulujú husiti! To kto ťa vychovával, že neodprevadíš mnícha? Čert mi bol tohto chumaja ožranského dlžen. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Everywhere do the Hussites roam! Hath thou been not taught manners, that thou dost not escort a monk? The devil take this drunken buffoon!\n<Matej>

items.original: Šmejdi, co se tady kňouráte? Maminka vás ráno zapoměla obléci?\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Ye scoundrels, why dost thou whine here? Did thy mother forget to clothe thee this morning?\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Honzo vole, nech je, dyť to vole mají těžký. \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: Honzo, let them be, you see they bear great burdens in life.\n<Hussite scoundrel>

items.original: Šak vy počkajce, zasrani.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Just wait, ye curs.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Co to huhláš?! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: What dost thou mutter?!\n<Hussite scoundrel>

items.original: Nič-nič. Požehnaný deň prajem.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nothing-nothing. Blessed day to thee.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Stůjte, katolickí šmejdi! Tudy zadarmo neprojdete! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Halt, ye Catholic swines! Ye shall not pass this way for free!\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Ve jménu Husa od vás vyžaduju příspěvek na pivko. \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>In the name of Hus, I demand a contribution from ye for ale. \n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Podpořils dobrou věc, tomu věr! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: Ye hast supported a good cause, ye can trust me on that.\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Tak ty nemáš žádny zlato, co? Nic, něco vzácního při sobě míť musíš. Chlapi berte je! 
\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: So ye hast no gold, dost ye? Well, ye must carry something of value.\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Odrezali sme im \c[14]uši\c[0].
items.translation: We took their \c[14]ears\c[0].

items.original: Ta to co ma byc... a ja ve jmenu Kačera od vas na šlivovicu. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What is this... and I demand a donation for Slivovitza from ye in the name of Goose.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Chjo, nerozuměls nám dobře synu... Naval dukáty, nebo chcípni! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Beggar, ye didst not understand us well, son... Bring forth thy coins, or perish! \n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original:
Bratži, slyšte, já obdivuju Husa, jestem vaš ctihodný pživrženec! 
Slyšel jsem ho mluviti v Praze. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Brethren, lend me thine ears, I doth admire Hus, I am thy honorable follower! I have heard him speaketh in Prague.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Bratře, tohle sis měl dřív rozmyslet, než sis navlíknul to proradný katolický roucho. Váhavce Husiti netolerujou, to si zapamatuj. 
\n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Brother, ye shouldst have thought aforetime ere donning that treacherous Catholic garb. Hussites do not tolerate, indecisives, remember that well. \n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Ty vole, co tu furt žvaníte, pojďme jim nandat! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: Ye knave, why dost ye keep prattling? Let us give them what for!\n<Hussite scoundrel>

items.original: Zaš vy? Šak už sce dostali, žebraci. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Ye once more? Ye hast already received enough, beggars. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Cos nám dal dlouho nevydrželo. Podpoř dobrou věc nebo táhni do pekel! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>What ye gavest us didn't last long. Support a good cause or be off to hell!\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original:
Tak ty nemáš žádny zlato, co? Nic, něco vzácního při sobě míť musíš.
Chlapi berte je! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>So ye hast no gold, dost ye? Well, ye must carry something of value.\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: Bačkoraci jedni, nič už vam nedam! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ye roaches, I shall give ye naught more!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Tak tos dohrál synku! \n<Husitský raubier>
items.translation: Ye art done for, sonny!\n<Hussite plunderer>

items.original: rowr :33 \n<Čort>
items.translation: rowr :33\n<devil>

items.original: Uši ma jak koň, a červene ma oči.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ears as those of a horse, eyes red as blood.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Satan, choď tam, odkiaľ si prišiel! Do pekla!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Satan, go there whence you came from! To hell!\n<Matej>

items.original: Tam už sa nikdy vracať nesmieme.\n<Matej>
items.translation: We must never return there, truly a cursed place.\n<Matej>

items.original: V sude je \c[7]pekelná hmota\c[0].
items.translation: There is \c[7]demonic matter\c[0] in the barrel.

items.original: Pali! Čo to tlačíš do seba? Prosím prestaň!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali! what are you gobbling up? Please stop!\n<Matej>

items.original: Maceju... dajak barz mi je zle...\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej... I don't feel too well...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vygrcaj to! Rýchlo! Nadžgaj si prsty do hrdla! Bože, zľutuj sa!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Puke it out, quickly! Put fingers up your throat!\n<Matej>

items.original: UAAARGH\n<Pavol>
items.translation: UAAARGH\n<Pavol>

items.original: Bože...tak zle mi nikda ešče nebulo.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: God... never have I felt so putrid.\n<Pavol>

items.original: owo \n<Prišerka>
items.translation: owo \n<Demon>

items.original: Na dno pekla sme sa dostali!\n<Matej>
items.translation: We are at the bottom floor of hell!\n<Matej>

items.original: Toto ne v poradku.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: This is does not bode well.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Kostra zos dajakeho patkaňa abo čo
items.translation: Skeleton of some rat or something

items.original: Červy červave
items.translation: Wormy worm

items.original: Nevieš nič o ničom
items.translation: you don't know anything about anything

items.original: Pekelny monument
items.translation: hellish monument

items.original: Nezdalo sa ti, že vedel viac, než nám povedal? \n<Matej>
items.translation: Didst thou not perceive that he concealed more than he revealed? \n<Matej>

items.original: Boh zna či od totych kultistoch rentu nebere. Mušime dac pozor naňho. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God alone knows if he hath not succumbed to the allure of bribes from those cultists. We must maintain vigilance. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Pan richtar, Boh s cebu. Pismo nešeme od zemepana. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Master burgmaster, God bless thee. We bring tidings from the lord. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Veľká vďaka, už dlhšie očakávam noviny od zemepána. Ukáž sem. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Many thanks, I hath awaited news from the landlord for some time. Show me. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Hmmmmm… \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Hmmmmm… \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neteší ma, čo čítam. Vedel som, že sa v našom chotári zdržujú nejakí čudáci, odkedy ale sídli Jiskra na Spiši, je to celkom bežný jav. Netušil som, že sú tak nebezpeční.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am not pleased with what I read. I knew that some oddities lingered within our domain, but I did not realize they were so perilous. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nenervač še tyľko, horši jak Turci abo husiti nebudu. Poratame še s nimi. Co o nich znaš? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Fret not, they shan't be worse than the Turks. We shall deal with them. What do ye know of them? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Veľa nie. Sedlač chyruje, že okolo starého hradu sa v noci ozýva pekelný ryk. Že v noci sa obšmietajú okolo hradu podivné stvory. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Not much. The peasants rumble that infernal howls echo around the old castle at night. They say strange creatures cavort around the castle in the darkness. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Cipana, ta to už sme si domysleli, šak si to iste teraz prečital. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Indeed, we had already surmised that, for ye've just read it.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja som dúfal práve, že s týmto mi vy pomôžete. Potrebujem na to niekoho jako ste vy. Koho v dedine nepoznajú. Zájdite za pipom a za židom, tí by mohli niečo vedieť. Majú styky snáď s každým v dedine. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Methought thou wouldst aid in this quandary. Verily, I require one such as thee, a stranger to our village. Visit yon priest and the Jew, perchance they hold knowledge. Their webs reacheth far into every corner of our hamlet. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Čekali sme od cebe vecej. Pome het, Matej. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: We had anticipated a greater contribution from ye. Matej, let us depart. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Dal už som vám všetko veď. Neotravujte ma! \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I gave you enough already, scour off. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Chlapci, ktože vás tak dorantal. Čo ste proti turkom vytiahli? \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Lads, who hath so battered thee? Did ye march against the Turks? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Nemôžeme za to, že ti tu zlodejka behá po uliciach. \n<Matej>
items.translation: We cannot be blamed for the fact that a thieving harlot roams these streets. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To baba vás vyprášila? No dobre... čo odomňa teraz chcete, vám mam rany vylízať?\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Did that woman thrash thee? Very well... what do ye seek from me now? Should I lick your wounds? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Len požič zbrane, brnenie a psa a ti ju donešeme. A to ne ona nas ščapala, za nami museli byť kumpani, som ju trimal pod karkom, nemohla nič ona.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Just lend us weapons, armor, and a hound, and we shall bring her to ye. 'Twas not she who beat us; there must hath been accomplices, I held her by the collar, she could do naught. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Psa? No šak dobre vy mantaci. Že som taká dobra duša, tak vám spravím po vôli. Viem že tu dakto kradne, ukradli i ženin náhrdelník. Ma stál toľko čo celá dedina i s hradom. Ale keď sa vrátite bez mojej Nory tak vás obesím za vajca do prievanu.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A hound? Very well, you rascals. I am a generous soul, I shall grant your request. I know that someone here is stealing; they even stole my wife's necklace. It cost as much as the whole village and the castle combined. But if you return without my hound, I'll hang you by your members in the draught. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Daj už veci a nepyskuj.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Give us the attire and spare us the babble.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Dostal si \c[14]halapartňu\c[0] a \c[14]meč\c[0] s \c[14]pästným štítom\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]gambeson\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]prešívanú čiapku\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]starý šľap\c[0].
items.translation:
You received a \c[14]halberd\c[0] and a \c[14]sword\c[0] with a \c[14]shield\c[0]. \!
You received a \c[14]gambeson\c[0]. \! 
You received a \c[14]quilted cap\c[0].\! 
You received an \c[14]old helmet\c[0].

items.original: Fena Nora sa pridala do tvojej družiny!
items.translation: Nora the dog has joined your party!

items.original: Nora, popachaj toto! Čmuchaj, moja, čmuchaj.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Sniff, my dear Nora. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tak čo, našli ste ten náhrdelník? \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I hath already bestowed upon you all, cease pestering me! \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Tam nebul, ale našli sme ho v lese. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Nora! Come ! What a noble hound. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Predpokladam, že v kostole bude. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I deem he'll be found within the church. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A znaš ty, že sa zdržuje v nevestinci?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: And art ye aware he doth frequent the brothel? \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nuž, občas sa tam stretávame. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Aye, we do cross paths there on occasion. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>To ste mu nedohovorili? Veď pip by mal byť vzorom pre ľud, svätým mužom! 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hast thou not rebuked him? A shepherd should lead by example, a paragon of piety! \n<Matej>

items.original: Na omšu je predsa v kostole. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: He doth attend the Mass with the church, doth he not? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Za dedinou v lese nájdete uprostred čistiny hrušku. Od nej dajte sa na juhozápad. Keby ste netrafili, tak sa spýtajte naňho v dedine, šak ho pozná každý. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Beyond our village, amidst the woodland, seek a pear tree nestled within a clearing. From thence, journey southwest. Should ye fail in your quest, inquire amongst our populace, for he is known to all. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No pravda sme ho už našli. Husiti ho o všetko ošklbali! To sa v celej dedine nenájde nikoho, kto by mu pomohol? 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath chanced upon him. Alas, the Hussites hath beset upon him! Is there no soul in our entire village willing to offer aid? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Husitov tu po lese je jak mravcov. Keby sme mali ratovať každého, koho napadnú, musel by som tu mať tisíc mužov. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The Hussites infest the forest akin to ants. Were we to rescue all they assail, a legion of a thousand men would be insufficient. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Za dedinou v lese najdete uprostred čistiny hrušku. Od nej dajte sa na juhozápad. Keby ste netrafili tak sa spýtajte naňho v dedine, šak ho pozná každý. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Beyond our village, amidst the woodland, seek a pear tree nestled within a clearing. From thence, journey southwest. Should ye fail in your quest, inquire amongst our populace, for he is known to all. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Vobec neznam, dze by mohol byc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Pray, do not weep. Verily, I know not where it may be. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Čože? Vy tupci! Okamžite vypadnite! \n<Richtár>
items.translation: What? Ye fools! Begone this instant. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
Za dedinou v lese najdete uprostred čistiny hrušku. Od nej dajte sa na juhozápad. Keby ste netrafili tak sa spýtajte naňho v dedine, šak ho pozná každý. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Beyond our village, amidst the woodland, seek a pear tree nestled within a clearing. From thence, journey southwest. Should ye fail in your quest, inquire amongst our populace, for he is known to all. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
Nebul tam. Ale myslim, že zname dze by mohol byc. Na sever od dzedziny. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It was not found. But perchance we know where it may be. To the north of the village. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nebul tu taky trpajzlik?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Was not a dwarf here?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Neviem. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Know not.\n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Za cvhíľu pôjdem. Už sa balím, už sa balím. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I will leave, I am packing.\n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Nechajte ma. Mám plné ruky práce. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Leave me be, I have work to attend to.\n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Nechcem vás už nikdy vidieť! Zmiznite!\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Begone from my sight forever! Get lost!\n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja som pripravený. Manželka s dcérkou; už ma čakajú v koči za dedinou, došli po mňa z Eperješa.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am prepared. My wife and daughter await me in the carriage beyond yon village. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
Nech ti Boh pomáha, ak nás ťaháš za nos.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: May the Lord hath mercy on thee if thou dost deceive us. \n<Matej>

items.original: Zamknuté dvere tu sú.
items.translation: Locked doors are here.

items.original: V šatníku nič.
items.translation: In the wardrobe, nothing.

items.original: Pri druhom pohľade objavil si groš.
items.translation: Upon a second look, you discover a coin.

items.original: Ozaj tam už nič nie je.
items.translation: Indeed, there is nothing else there.

items.original: V almare našiel si \c[14]kašu\c[0] a \c[14]alpu\c[0].
items.translation: In the trunk you found \c[14]porridge\c[0] and \c[14]alpa\c[0].

items.original: V truhlici bola \c[14]frndžalica\c[0].
items.translation: Within the chest was a bottle of \c[14]frndžalitz\c[0].

items.original: V truhlici tu richtár mal \c[14]vínečko\c[0] a \c[14]zákys\c[0].
items.translation: Content of this chest was \c[14]sour cream\c[0] and \c[14]wine\c[0].

items.original: Na stole bola butylka \c[14]orechovice\c[0].
items.translation: A bottle of \c[14]liquor\c[0] stood on the table.

items.original: Dobrý deň, vy ste ocovi kolegovia? \n<Richtárova dcéra>
items.translation: Good day to you, are you father colleagues? \n<Daughter of burgmaster>

items.original:
Ty si dcera richtara? Som neznal, že ma rodzinu. By som nebul taky svižny
s vyscahovanim. \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>You are burgmasters daughter? Have I know he has a family, I would not be so hasty with the eviction.\n<Pavol>

items.original: S vysťahovaním?\n<Richtárova dcéra>
items.translation: The eviction? \n<Daughter of burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ocec ci vysvetli.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Your father will explain.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vypadnice!\n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Get lost!\n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mace šcesce, daco musim isc robic ine. Itak len straceny čas s vami bešedovac. Ale jak vas uvidzim zaš ta... Uvidzice. Vas poranta, hehehe.
items.translation: <WordWrap>You are lucky, I have to go do something. Talking to you is a waste of time anyway. But if I see you again... You'll see. You'll soil yourself, hehehe.

items.original: Zbabelci, še me bojice! Hahahaha! Počujem jak še klepece.
items.translation: Cowards, you are afraid! Hahahaha! I can hear you shake in fear.

items.original: Tam sce ešte?
items.translation: You still there?

items.original: Šak choce het!
items.translation: Told you already, get lost!

items.original: Abo tupy-netupy, idem na vas! Dorubem vas jak polena!
items.translation: Sharp or not, attack! I'll slay you like dogs!

items.original: Idzem ozaj už na vas! Ozaj teraz! Meč len nabrusim ešte, patrim, že tupy je.
items.translation: <WordWrap>I'm going outside, for real this time! Only my sword is blunt, I have to sharpen it.

items.original: Hluchi sce? Dajce nohy na pľeca kym še da!
items.translation: Are you deaf? Run away while you still can!

items.original: Padajce het, bo už idem na vas!
items.translation: Bugger off, for I'm going outside!

items.original: Meč si davam za opasek. Vas poranta, jak sa na vas rozbehnem.
items.translation: Sword is in my hands now. When I attack you will soil yourselves.

items.original: Už si zapinam helmicu! Hneď som tam!
items.translation: I'm putting on my helmet! I'll be there right away!

items.original: Prisambohu, že vybehnem na vas!
items.translation: I swear to God I'll charge at you!

items.original: Mam vonku isc? Vam natrepem!
items.translation: Must I come outside? I'll beat you!

items.original: Choce stadzi!
items.translation: Go away!

items.original: Hvarim, že idzte het!
items.translation: I told you! Piss off!

items.original: Nooo... Akože, šak skoro. Kus to len pozmeň. \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Nay... ‘tis like, nearly right. Just a tad off, methinks. \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Ej, daj mi pokuj so somarinami! Šak dobre som to povedal! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Give me some grace with the words! 'Twas spoken well enough! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Nuž... Šak hej, akože. Ah, vieš čo, poď dnu. \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well... Aye, verily, as thou sayest. Ah, thou knowest what? Come hither. \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Počkať, neboli ste tu už včera abo predvčera? \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Hold on, were ye not here yesterday or the day afore? \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Ba, veru! Chceli sme sa k vám pridať. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Aye, forsooth! We sought to join thy company. \n<Matej>

items.original: Jajh, dobre. \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Ah, well and good then. \n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Vy kto sce? Jak sem si še dostal? \n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <WordWrap>And who art thou? How didst thou find thy way hither? \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kľúd, kľúd! Na vašej sme strane. Ňuma a Vecheť nas za vami poslali, že vraj nabor do kultu robice.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Peace, good sir, peace! We are on ye side. Weenie and Dick sent us, declaring ye art conducting a recruitment for the cult. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Heslo? \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: Password?\n<Gatekeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Daj mi pokuj s heslama gluptaku! Co ši zapomnul, teraz takoj som tu bul. S tvojim veducim som bešeduval, neznam co si pojid, že ci ta informacia v gebuli neostala! 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Give me peace with ye passwords, fool! What hast ye forgotten, that ye art here again? I conversed with ye leader, I know not what ye took, that the information hath not remained within thy skull. \n<Pavol>

items.original: :( \n<Vrátny>
items.translation: :(\n<Gatekeeper>

items.original: Vymlátime husitov, potom zemepana a bude dobre! \n<Kultistka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We shall vanquish the Hussites, then the lord, and all shall be well! \n<Cultist>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zemepan mi bol vždy podozrivy, ako to, že je taky bohaty a ja som taky chudobny? Dlho som nad tym premyšľal včera a nerozumiem.
\n<Kultista>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The lord hath always aroused my suspicion. How can he be so wealthy whilst I am but poor? I pondered on this long yesterday and comprehend naught. \n<Cultist>

items.original:
Co chceš ešči?
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: What more do you want of me?\n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Istý Koreň. Nikto presne nezna, kto to je ten Koreň, ale peňáze neboli problém.
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A certain Root. None know precisely who Root is, but money has never been a problem. \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Najperšej poženieme husitoch stadzi! Šak už koľke roky burdeľ tu robia. A kejc naše čisla budu veľke, i Jiskru zo Spiša vytlačime i so šeckyma jeho nohsledama. Mno a celkom nakonec, zemepana vyženieme!
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We aim first to expel the Hussites from our lands! For years they've sown chaos here. And when our numbers swell, we shall drive out Jiskra of Spiš and all his followers. And in the end, we shall rid ourselves of the lord! \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: To jak šicko chcete dokazac? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: And how dost ye intend to prove all this? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Náš mocný pán Zurvan všetko zariadi.
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: Our powerful lord Zurvan shall arrange all things.\n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: Mam, co ši pytal. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: I hath what ye asked for. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Panečku, Piťu, ta ja som nigda coška take nevidzel! Jak živa!
Šak ona vyzera jak naozaj! \n
items.translation: Good Heavens, Piťu, I hath never seen anything like this! It looks so real! \n<Cultist>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Še ukľudni, idzem perši s tym do kračkoch, potim cebi požičim. Chlape, maš našu doveru, bereme ťa k našemu nadriadenemu. Tu vojdi dnu. A dze je ten svaty?
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Calm thyself, I shall deal with it first in yonder bush, then I shall lend it to thee. Lad, thou hast our trust; we shall take thee to our superior. Enter herein. And where is that holy one? \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: Zašpal. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Asleep. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Už si bul za hlavnym?
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: Hath you been to the leader yet? \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: Sem smú vstúpiť len tí povolaní!\n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: Only the chosen ones may enter here! \n<Bodyguard>

items.original: Sem smú vstúpiť len tí povolaní! \n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: Only the chosen ones may enter here! \n<Bodyguard>

items.original: Mno. To presne ja som. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Well, that would be me. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Asi ešte nevedia, že už sme ich chodbu odhalili. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Verily, they seem unaware that our eyes hath uncovered their secret passage.  \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vyzera, že sme krok napered. Musime využic momentum, to i vof veľkej vojne še tak robi. Pome rychlo.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Tis evident we hath gained ground. Let us capitalize on this momentum. Quickly, onward we must press. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ty parchante katolíckej!\n<Husita>
items.translation: Catholic scoundrels!\n<Hussite>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Kedvesem, ste v poriadku? Videli sme ťa, jak sa dívaš z okna Matej, hneď lučeštník strieľal. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Kedvesem, art you unharmed? We saw you, Matej, gazing out the window, and the archer immediately let fly his arrow. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
Nas nabonzovala moja stara. Takoj na nás poslal svojich hrdlorezov Ignác.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We were betrayed by mine beloved. Ignác sent forth his cutthroats upon us. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Podarilo sa nám ale čmajznúť Ignácov kalendár. Pali, pozri do neho, nech viem, či toto vôbec stálo za to…
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But we managed to pilfer Ignác's calendar. Pali, peruse it and tell us if this endeavor was worthwhile... \n<Matej>

items.original:
Choďte ta! Ja idem do hradu. 
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Go hence! I shall head to the castle. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Chlapci moji, hádam tam nejdeme takto spredu? Pali, zaveď ma do tej chodby predsa.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Lads, dost you truly intend to venture forth from the front? Pali, guide me into yon corridor. \n<Jozef>

items.original: Pomstime dnes Jančiho, Feriho, i šicke ktorym kultisti škodia.\n<Rytier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>This day shall see vengeance for Janči, Feri, and all those wronged by the cultists. \n<Knight>

items.original: Takoj jak date znamenie, nabehneme tam. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: At the signal, we shall charge forth with valor. \n<Knight>

items.original: Ci panečku, už dlho nebula taka akcia. Kus mam nervy. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By God, it hath been long since such excitement graced our path! My nerves doth tremble with anticipation. \n<Knight>

items.original: Budeme tu čakať na vaše znamenie. Potom ihneď na kultistov nabehneme. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We'll await your signal, and rush the fortress with utmost haste. \n<Knight>

items.original: Zurvan nám dá Ahrimana! \n<Kultista>
items.translation: Zurvan shall grant us Ahriman! \n<Cultist>

items.original: Ahriman nám dá silu. \n<Kultista>
items.translation: Ahriman shall grant us strength! \n<Cultist>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vykynožili sme šicke. Pravda ale, že dajak malo ich tu bulo. Väčšina sa musela presunuc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath vanquished them all. Yet, it appears that many hath fled. Most likely,  relocated. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Toľko zmareného života... \n<Matej>
items.translation: So much life wasted...\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nuž. So zemepánom sme prekutrali Ignácovu pracovňu. Našli sme tam aj ten kalendár, o ktorom rozprával Bohdan. Hľa.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, with the lord's assistance, we thoroughly searched Ignác's chambers. We found the calendar Bohdan spoke of. Look here. \n<Matej>

items.original: Dobrá bitva. Než sa nazdali, pokapali všecia. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: They had fallen before they realized, A valiant battle.\n<Knight>

items.original: Už len sám som tu ostal. Asi sa tu zabívam \n<Rytier>
items.translation: Alone I am here, perchance I'll occupy this place and become a lord myself. \n<Knight>

items.original: Sám som tu zostal. Asi sa tu zabývam. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: Alone I am here, perchance I'll occupy this place and become a lord myself. \n<Knight>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Fialové plášťe vezmem domu, so starou si znich zrobime vankuše. By ma zajimalo, de beru peňeži na totu fialovu. 
\n<Rytier>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The purple cloaks we shall bring home, perhaps fashion some cushions with them. I wonder whence they acquire the funds for such finery. \n<Knight>

items.original: Kultistov som čakal, že vecej tu bude. \n<Rytier>
items.translation: I hadst expected more cultists to be present. \n<Knight>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Idzem s dcerou het odtiaľto, zajdeme k bratovi do Vranova. Kým je Jiskra na Spiši, ta tu pokoj nebude.
\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am departing hence with my daughter, we shall visit my brother in Vranov. As long as the Jiskra roams in Spiš, there shall be no peace here.\n<Peasant>

items.original: Záškodníci, nie je dôvodu ich ľutovať.
items.translation: Fiends, no sense in mourning them.

items.original:
Oco tvrdi, že to ľen smrť nas čeka tuna.
\n<Dievčina>
items.translation:
Dad says only death awaits us in this land.
\n<Girl>

items.original: ...\n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: ...\n<Bodyguard>

items.original:
Stráže!
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: Guards! \n<Ignác>

items.original:
Maceji, takoj pocem dvere zaprec!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej, bar the door at once! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tak... parobci.\n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: So... lads. \n<Bodyguard>

items.original: Sce dohrali.\n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: ‘Tis over. \n<Bodyguard>

items.original:
Maceji, vytrimeš to ešči? Idzem natarhac s dyku toten Ignacov habit a še spuscime dolu oblokom, to ne vysoko. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, canst ye manage it still? I shall swiftly cut through Ignác's habit with my dagger, then we shall lower down from the window,’tis not too high. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Len rýchlo, Pali, už nevládzem, pre Krista! A zober ten kalendár!
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hurry, Pali, I am growing weak, for the love of Christ! And take that calendar! \n<Matej>

items.original:
Podz, idzeme! 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Quickly, go! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Hoja hop!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, alley-oop! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tu chvíľu pobudnem ešte. Strašne veľa je tu vriec s qahwah. Všetko poberieme a odnesieme do hradu. \n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>I shall tarry here a while longer. There are terribly many sacks of qahwah here. We shall gather everything and carry it to the castle.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Skrýval tu Ignác okrem iného i \c[14]medailón\c[0]!
items.translation: Among other things, Ignac hid a \c[14]medailon\c[0] in here!

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Som sa sem prišol schovac. V dzedzine to je uplna Golgota teraz. Do večura nikto tam neprežije.
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>I came to hide hide, it's Golgotha in the village. Noone will survive by noon.
\n<Dedinčan>

items.original: Príliš dlho sa tu neobšmietaj. \n<Telesná stráž>
items.translation: Doth not linger here. \n<Bodyguard>

items.original: Dvere zaprete zos kladinu, dam ju het. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Door barged by wood I shall remove it.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pfuha. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ooh.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobrý večer, pane, volám sa Ignác. Vraj Ste sa preukázali loajálny našej veci. Ale mňa by zaujímalo, odkiaľ Ste sa tu vzali. A prečo Vás zaujíma naša organizácia.
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Greetings, noble sir, I am Ignác. 'Tis said thou hast proved thy fealty to our cause. Yet, I ponder, whence hast thou come, and what hath piqued thy curiosity about our fellowship? \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Žena mi ušla. Zapredam dušu i satanovi, naj še mi vraci. Ciganske čary nič, nepomohli, som mešac nosil jej chlupy z pazuchoch vo vrecku a ništ. I psikovi som labku napoly zlomel a tyž ništ. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Milady hath absconded from my side. I bargain my soul to Satan himself for her return. Gypsy enchantments availed naught; I even bore her tresses in my pocket, yet to no avail. I even broke a hound's limb in desperation, but still, no sign. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Aha. A ten svätý? \n<Ignác>
items.translation: I see. And what of that holy man? \n<Ignác>

items.original: Stary heretik, ušol z klaštora v Debrecine, chcu ho upalic.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>An aged heretic, fled from the cloisters of Debrecen. They seek to consign him to the flames. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No dobre, si to overím, ak klamete, Ste mŕtvy muž. Štandardný postup je taký, že nasleduje aspoň štvrťročná služba, potom môžete pristúpiť k iniciácii. Ale... vidím, že Ste ozbrojený dobre, nie Ste len nejaký prďús z ulice. Mám pre Vás takú ponuku.
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Very well, I shall verify this. Shouldst thou deceive me, thou shalt be a dead man. Standard protocol dictates a term of service, no less than a quarter of a year, ere initiation. But... I perceive thou art well-armed, no mere common street vagrant art thou. Thus, I hath a proposition. \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Potrebujeme dostať utečenca, zradcu z našich radov, volá sa Bohdan a má na riti vytetované zuby. Keď ho dostanete, zbavte sa tela a prineste mi kus jeho zadnice, sám som to tetoval, takže spoznám, ak ma oklamete. Jeho rodinu sme už mučili, nevedia nič o tom, kde sa skrýva. 
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We seek to apprehend a fugitive, a turncoat from our ranks, by the name of Bohdan. He bears teeth inked upon his posterior. Upon his capture, dispose of his remains and present me with a fragment of his hindquarters. I personally etched the mark, hence I shall detect any deception. We've already wrung confessions from his kin; they know naught of his whereabouts. \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Naposledy sme ho videli vojsť do kostola, vnútri sme ho však nenašli. To je všetko, musím sa vrátiť k papierovačkám, by Ste neverili, koľko logistiky je okolo toho qahwahu, všade po regióne pýtajú. Keď splníte misiu, môžem vám zveriť časť distribúcie, peniaze to sype.
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We last glimpsed him entering yon church, yet within its walls, he eluded us. Yet, I must return to the matters of parchment; the logistics surrounding qahwah are more intricate than one might fathom. Once thy mission is accomplished, a share of the distribution may be entrusted to thee; coin shall flow. \n<Ignác>

items.original:
Vitajte páni, máte, čo som požadoval? 
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: Greetings, gentlemen, hast thou brought what I requested? \n<Ignác>

items.original:
Tu mace, ale už to začina šmerdzec.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here ye hast, yet it doth begin to reek. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ignácovi si dal \c[14]polku Bohdanovej zadnice\c[0].
items.translation: Ignác, received \c[14]half of Bohdan's buttock\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Výborne. Tak bratu Mateji, čože ťa privádza k nám, nehodným okultistom? Čo ťa odvrátilo od správnej cesty?
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Excellent. Now, to thee, Brother Matej, what brings thee unto us, unworthy occultists? What hath turned thee away from the righteous path? \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nuž, do kláštora, kde som iluminoval, ma raz prišla navštíviť moja mladšia sestra, iba také šteňa… opát ju znásilnil, keď sa k nemu šla vyspovedať. Keď som to zistil, začal som to roztrubovať, ale bratia sa priklonili na opátovu stranu, tvrdil, že ho chcem zdiskreditovať, a že som heretik posadnutý satanom. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, within the monastery where I illuminated, my younger sister once came to visit me, a mere innocent... the abbot violated her when she went to confess to him. When I discovered this, I began to trumpet it forth, but the brethren sided with the abbot, claiming I sought to discredit him and branding me a heretic possessed by Satan. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Do rána ma aj so sestrou chceli predať inkvizícii, ale pomohol mi ujsť brat Gyusi. Odvtedy sa paradoxne naozaj pohybujem medzi heretikmi a spoznal som tam mnoho dobrého.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By morning, they intended to deliver me and my sister unto the Inquisition, but Brother Gyusi aided me in escaping. Since then, paradoxically, I hath indeed mingled among heretics and discovered much good therein. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Skutočne ale túžim po pozícii v mocnej sekte, ktorá by bola schopná naplniť moju pomstu a zavraždiť Gejzu z Debrecína, ideálne aj celý kláštor vyhladiť. O vašej organizácii toho veľa neviem, poznám len katolíckych heretikov…
Savonarolu, Husu i Abba Estefania. \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Truly, however, I yearn for a position within a powerful sect capable of fulfilling my vengeance and murdering Gejza of Debrecín, ideally even wiping out the entire monastery. I do not know much about your organization; I only know Catholic heretics... Savonarola, Hus, and Abbot Estefan.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Aká milá náhoda, s Estefanim a jeho katolíkmi priamo spolupracujeme na organizácii karaván qahwahu z Etiópie, náš zdroj totiž nie je obľúbený v moslimskom svete. \! 
<Wordwrap>To ti Bohdan poradil ho spomenúť? Dobre ste mu riť zafačovali, aby nevykrvácal? Je to veľmi pekný príbeh, čo si si pripravil.
\n<Ignác>
items.translation:
What a delightful coincidence! We directly cooperate with Estefan and his Catholics on organizing caravans of qahwah from Ethiopia, as our source is not favored in the Muslim world. \!
Did Bohdan advise thee to mention him? Didst thou bind his wounds well enough to prevent him from bleeding out? 'Tis a very nice story thou hast prepared. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Šťastnou náhodou sa tu pred chvíľou zastavila Paliho nežná polovička na kus reči. Viem všetko. Vypytoval som sa jej aj na teba a zistila, že pokornejšieho baránka, než teba by v Debrecíne široko ďaleko nenašli. Čo na to povieš?
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By a stroke of luck, Pali's gentle half stopped by a moment ago for a chat. I know everything. I inquired about thee as well, and she discovered that a more obedient lamb than thee would scarcely be found in Debrecín. What sayest thou to that? \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mamka barz sa durdila na mňa, keď som z domu ušla, ale jak vyženieme husitov, istotne i ona prijme blahoslavenoho Zurvana.
\n<Kultistka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My dear mother frowned upon me when I left home, but when we expel the Hussites, surely even she shall embrace Zurvan. \n<Cultist>

items.original: Všade sú tu zrnká Qahwah. Väčšina je surová.
items.translation: Qahwah grains are scattered everywhere. Most of them in raw state.

items.original: V skrine objavil si nádherne pomaľovanú \c[14]pavézu\c[0]!
items.translation: You found a beautifuly painted \c[14]pavise\c[0]!

items.original: Je tu turban.
items.translation: A turban lies here.

items.original: Pohľaď! Tam leží telo! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Behold! There lies a body!\n<Matej>

items.original: Sa udusil dymom. Poďme ho obracic. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Choked on smoke. Let us turn him over.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Osman!
items.translation: Ottoman!

items.original: Dajaky vyzera byť... Odtál ne, odtál ne.\n<Ogrgeľ>
items.translation: He seems to be .. No, not from here, not from here.\n<Drunkard>

items.original:
No ale daco divne še tu robi. Tu na hornej zemi Turci nemaju co hľedac, 
dajaky špeh možno. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Well something strange is afoot here. Turks hath no place here in the north, spy perhaps.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Leží tu turek bez ducha.
items.translation: A lifeless Turk lies here.

items.original: Pekne to tu upratali. \n<Matej>
items.translation: They made sure to clean this place up nicely. \n<Matej>

items.original: Šarlatán v posmrtnom kŕči schúlený. Celkom mladý bol.
items.translation: A charlatan curled up in postmortem spasm. He was quite young.

items.original: Zmarený život.
items.translation: Wasted life.

items.original: Vypratať to tu musíme! Čo keď sem dakto snoriť príde?\n<Šarlatán>
items.translation: <WordWrap>We must clear this place! What if some interloper should come snoop around?\n<Charlatan>

items.original: ... \n<Pavol>
items.translation: ... \n<Pavol>

items.original: ... \n<Šarlatán>
items.translation: ... \n<Charlatan>

items.original: Mateju, do nich! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Matej, to arms!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Diľina, mysleli, že nas premožu. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Dullards, ye thought to best us.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Nemusel si ich tak domárovať, s prerezanými hrdlami nám nič neprezradia.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Thou need'st not have been so brutal; with slit throats, they shall reveal naught unto us.\n<Matej>

items.original:
To je ale krásny pach… pripomína mi môj sen o extáze svätej Terezy. Máločo je
v živote krajšie, ako keď sa ti pekné prisnije. Pamätaj, že to svedčí o čistote duše
a správnosti cesty. \n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Verily, what a sweet scent doth fill the air... it doth bring to mind I dreamed ecstasy of Saint Teresa. Few things in this mortal coil are as fair as when pleasant dreams doth grace thy slumber. Remember, it doth speak to the purity of the soul and the righteousness of the path.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta ja sa stavim, že ďablovi še o šummych sväticoch každu jednu noc zda. Mne ten pach pripomina jednu taku tučnu macatu zos Vranova... 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>By my troth, I wager the devil hath dreams of beautiful saints every night. Forsooth, this scent doth remind me of a plump maid from the hamlet of Vranov...\n<Pavol>

items.original: Kukaj ale sem na zem, to zaš je co? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>But look here, what be yon on ground?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Hej, Pavol! Nejedz to zrno, čo keď je jedovaté? \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hark, Pavol! Partake not of that seed, for what if it be poisonous? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nič še nebuj, ich len berem ukazac zemepanovi, on je cvok do orientalnych roštlin. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Nay, fret not, I do but show it unto the lord, for he hath fondness for oriental flora. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]zvláštne zrno\c[0].
items.translation: You acquied a \c[14]strange seed\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>No a čomu slúži táto divná kovová mašinka? Ale obdobné som videl, na tom hrali diabolskú hudbu, krúti sa s tým a trieska. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>And what purpose doth this curious metallic contraption serve? I have beheld something akin, whereon diabolical melodies were played, spinning and clanging. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Za to im dozaista Lucifer do daru priniesol ovocie pekelného stromu Zaqqum, z neho tu je pach a kôstky. Rastie na ohni na dne pekelnom. Ovocie má na sebe jemnú kresbu satanovho portrétu sťa na rímskej minci, zatratených ho núti jesť a v bruchu, keď sa im so šťavami pomieša, horí jak kyselina. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Methinks Lucifer himself didst bestow upon them the fruit of the infernal Zaqqum tree, whence this scent and bones doth come. It flourisheth in the fire at the depths of hell. The fruit doth bear a subtle portrait of Satan, as on a Roman coin, and he doth compel the damned to partake, whereupon it burneth in their bellies like acid. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Chujoviny dristaš. Ale daso barz zle sa tu chysta. Zemepanovi takoj by sme mali
o tym povedať. \n
items.translation: <WordWrap>Ye speakest folly. But something wicked doth brew here. We must forthwith inform our lord.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Poďme už preč, cítim tu zlé duchy. Stmieva sa. \n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Let us away, for I sense malevolent spirits here. The shadows lengthen.\n<Matej>

items.original: Zaprete su dvere zos dnuka.
items.translation: Something holds these doors from inside.

items.original: Še vzdaj i odidz het, skadzi ši prišol. Nam daj pokuj svaty už. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Surrender and leave this place at once, return from whence ye hast come. Grant us holy peace. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Vrátiť sa odkiaľ pochádzam nie je v mojich silách. Pavol, pusť ma odtiaľto a nechám ťa nažive. Čítam v tebe, že nenávidíš Turkov celou svojou dušou. Ukážeš mi cestu a ja sa tam vydám, ich ríšu prevrátim na popol. Nie som zlý, vieš rovnako dobre ako ja, že devastácia je nevyhnutným predpokladom novej kreácie. \n<Ahriman>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I cannot return to the place of my origins. Pavol, release me from this plight, and I shall spare thy life.
