I discern in thee a fervent disdain for the Turks, burning deep within thy soul. Show me the path, and I shall embark upon a quest to lay waste to their lands, reducing them to naught but ash. I am not malevolent, as thou well knowest. Devastation is but a necessary step towards the dawn of a new creation. \n<Ahriman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak ako dospievaním vraždíte kúsok po kúsku dieťa v sebe v nevýslovnej agónii, tak je potrebné vraždiť aj zaostalé národy na oltári pokroku. A pokrok je Rakúsko-Uhorská monarchia. Rozosievam oheň, pripravujem pôdu pre to nové ako oráč ničiaci burinu! \n<Ahriman>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>As adolescence doth consume a part of the child within, shrouded in unspeakable agony, so must backward nations be sacrificed upon the altar of progress. And progress, as thou dost well know, is embodied in the Austro-Hungarian monarchy. I sow the flames, preparing the soil for the emergence of the new, much like a plow doth uproot the weeds. \n<Ahriman>

items.original: Joj, dosc si už rozosieval, daj pokuj.  \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Cease thy sowing and bestow peace upon us. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Vybral si si. Zhyň!\n<Ahriman>
items.translation: Thou hast made thy choice. Perish! \n<Ahriman>

items.original: Dve ohnive meče? Može byc.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Two fiery blades? So be it! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pozor! Zaiste je prekliaty, neradno ho používať!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Take care! This one surely is cursed! You must not fight with it, lest a terrbile curse will fall onto us.\n<Matej>

items.original: Dobre, ta ale aspoň do teho nolabu ho možme dať.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: It can power noollab at the very least.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pozrite tu na stenu. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Behold yon wall.\n<Matej>

items.original: Inskripcie znázorňujú asi obetný rituál. \n<Matej>
items.translation: The inscriptions depict some form of sacrificial rite. \n<Matej>

items.original: Dyť já tú sošku znám, to jest pod kostolom. \n<Kandich>
items.translation: I recognize that statue; it rests beneath the church. \n<Kandich>

items.original: Šak tota socha je pod kosceľom! \n<Ida>
items.translation: Aye, statue beneath church! \n<Ida>

items.original: Totu sochu už sme vidzeli, ne? Pod kosceľom je v katakombe.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath beheld that statue ere now, hath we not? 'Tis housed within the catacombs beneath the church. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A toten chlop vypatra jak naš Janči. Adam, ja som zapomnul, že my trímeme v ľadnici jednoho z totych zmutovanych qahwahovych oblud. Idzeme pitvac!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And this lad resembles our Janči. Adam, I hath forgotten that we keep in the larder one of those mutated qahwah beasts. Let us proceed with the autopsy. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Zázrak! Vravel som ti Pali, že Boh je na našej strane! \n<Matej>
items.translation: This a miracle! I told thee, Pali, that God is on our side! \n<Matej>

items.original: Hej, šak ja znam. Aľe dze je Adam? Adam! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Aye, I know. But where is Adam? Adam! \n<Pavol>

items.original: Tu som... ešte v nólabe... dajte mi minútku... hneď sa postavím na nohy. \n<Adam>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Here I am... still in the basket... give me a minute... I'll be on my feet in a moment. \n<Adam>

items.original: To si mohol povedať, že máš strach z výšok! \n<Matej>
items.translation: Thou couldst hath mentioned thou art afraid of heights! \n<Matej>

items.original: Nie... potrebujete ma... \n<Adam>
items.translation: Nay... ye need me... \n<Adam>

items.original: Až sa nám podarí zneškodniť kultistov, balónom sa dostaneme z hradu von.
items.translation: Once we rid this place of cultistic presence, we may use the nalloob to leave.

items.original: Zapadané kamením. Až tak magicky to tu uzavreté nebolo.
items.translation: Not magic held this door, but rocks. Maybe both.

items.original: Mŕtvy okultista, jakeby ho niečo roztrhlo.
items.translation: A fallen cultist, rent in twain.

items.original: Kristove rany, tu riadny masaker musel prebehnúť.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: By Christ, what massacre took place here?\n<Pavol>

items.original: Strašný je démon, čo takúto spúšť spôsobil.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Terrible is the demon, who caused this carnage.\n<Matej>

items.original: Niečo hrozné sa tu muselo odohrať, tento okultista nemá hlavu.
items.translation: A terrible death befell this cultist. ‘Tis impossible to say what happened to him.

items.original: Mŕtvy kultista, rozseknutý je na pol.
items.translation: The cultist is clawed, as if a pack of wolves attacked him.

items.original: Snažil sa zahojiť, než dodýchal. \c[14]Vínko\c[0] však vypiť nestihol, vezmeme ho.
items.translation:
Tried to save himself, yet he didn't manage to drink the \c[14]wine\c[0] in time.
We shall take it.

items.original: Hrozná smrť postihla tohoto okultistu. Ani nemožno povedať, čo sa mu stalo.
items.translation: Terrible fate awaited this poor cultist. What happened to him cannot be described.

items.original: Kultista je dodriapaný, sťa by svorka vlkov sa naňho vrhla.
items.translation: Something foul must hath unfolded herein; this cultist lacks a head.

items.original: Všade sú tu zrnká qahwah rozhádzané.
items.translation: A slain cultist, as if something rend him asunder.

items.original: Inskripcia.
items.translation: Inscription.

items.original: Nápis: "Qahwah nad hlavou".
items.translation: Tis' written: "Qahwah over head"

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ucahany som jak koň. Poc, idzeme do karčmy prespac. Do hradu še mi nechce. Na frištik šebe dam vajca zos pivom.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am wearied as a steed. Come, let us retire to the tavern for the night's rest. The castle holds no allure for me at this hour. A breakfast of eggs and ale shall fortify me in the morn. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak ci povim, Maceji, bars som rad, že s cebu možem dakus tak veselo čavargovac. Mi to pomaha nemyšlec na glupoty. I som rad, že še teho tyľko dzeje teper. Ale neznam zastavic čas, beži jak bešny a to tyž mi z teho plano. Kedz še ale zastavi, ta neznam vytrimac. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed, Master Matej, I find solace in our merry discourse. It distracts me from idle thoughts. It heartens me to see the world teeming with activity. Alas, I cannot seem to arrest the march of time; it gallops on like a wild stallion, troubling my soul deeply. Yet, were it to halt, I know not if I could bear it. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To rád čujem, brat môj. Príliš tomu neverím, ale keď Boh dá, snáď aj ťa k správnej ceste privediem. Lež veru aj mne padlo na úrodnú pôdu vyliezť trochu z rozjímavej samoty v mojej cele. Božie cesty sú nevyspytateľné.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Your words hearten me, brother. Though I cannot wholly grasp their truth, if it be God's will, mayhap I shall guide thee onto the path of righteousness. Verily, I too have found some respite emerging from my meditative seclusion within the cell into the light of day. God's ways are truly inscrutable. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ale povedz mi, prečo si začal toľko piť? Predsa vidím, že nie si sprostý.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But tell me, why dost thou drown thy sorrows in drink? Thou art not foolish, surely. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta znaš jak... i keď... ech.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Well, ye see... even though... ech. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hm?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Hmm? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Po bitke v Kosove, Turci jak nas rozbili, ma zajali a už som mal šabľu na karku. Ku sťatiu hlavy pre potešenie sultana. V tom však z dagdzi zaznela strašna rana z dela, dodneška si neznam vysvetlic skadzi. V totym zmätku še mi podarilo ubic väzniteľa. Za popraviskom som šebe prezliekol jeho haby a takto sa mi podarilo ujsc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>After the battle of Kosovo, when the Turks laid us low and took me captive, I faced a sword at my throat, poised to cleave my head for the Sultan's delight. Yet, a thunderous blast from a cannon echoed through the air. In the ensuing chaos, I managed to dispatch my captor. Disguising myself in his garb beyond the place of execution, I slipped away. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Odvtedy ale mam na karku chladne miesto, furt tam totu šabľu citim.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Since then, however, a cold spot upon my neck lingers, as if that sword still hangs over me. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pome pod duchny spac už.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us seek our rest now. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zdravim vospolok, jedno pivko mi naľejce. A hentemu šašovi nic, on trucuje tepir. Abo kec omšove vino mace, ta to možno odchlipne.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Greetings, good fellow! Pour me a pint of ale. And as for that fool over yonder, pay him no mind, he's as stubborn as a mule.\n
Or perhaps a mug of the church's wine, that might sooth his soul. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Zdravim vospolok, jedno pivko mi naľejce. Konečne še možem napic v pokoju.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Greetings, good fellow! Pour me a pint of ale. Finally I can enjoy a pint in peace. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Takoj, chlope. Skadzi ši sem došol?\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: Good man from where hast thou come?\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
Ja som od Šariša, ľem mi žena ušla. Ta ju tu hľedam, ši nevidzel taku krasavicu
s modrymi očami?\n
items.translation: <WordWrap>I am from Šariš, and my wife hath fled from me. Have ye seen a beauty with blue eyes? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Takych kižasoňkoch tu je dosc, bo bordeľ tu v malej dzedzine mame, šebe predstav! Pip i richtar temu privolili a ľudze dajak zatemu ich nehnali het.
\n<Krčmár>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hath an abundance of such here, for a brothel doth reside in our village, I bid thee imagine! The priest and the burgmaster have convened on this matter, yet the people somehow have not driven them away as they ought.\n<Innkeeper>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jáj, paradne pivo mace, chladne! Skoro jak u nas. Maceji, isto neokoštuješ? Co tam teľo v kute stojiš zadurdeny?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh, goodly ale, friend, chilled! 'Tis akin to our homely brews. Matej, dost ye not wish to sample? Wherefore dost ye stand yonder, lost in scowly face. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jáj, paradne pivo mace, chladne! Skoro jak u nas.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Oh, goodly ale, friend, chilled! 'Tis akin to our homely brews. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ši še predviedol Vlado. Si nas ochabeu napospas, šak by sme vyhrali, keby si nezdrhol jak chumaj!\n<Ščevo>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Ye hast shown thyself, Vlado. Ye didst leave us at the mercy of the foe; we would have prevailed if ye didn't flee like a coward!
\n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>...ser naňho Števo, to nema zmysel, je to posera. Bratranku, no aľe ta my sme suhlasili, že še budzeme tvaric, že sme tvoji najati žoldnieri, aľe ne že nas ochabiš napospas. To co ma byc.\n<Maťo>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>...pay him no mind, Števo, 'tis futile, he's a fool. Cousin, indeed, we agreed to stand together, that we would be your hired mercenaries, but not that thou wouldst abandon us to our fate. What was that?
\n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta... mi prepačte, keď ja som to tak vyšpekuloval, že sa neopovažia s nami bojovať, keď budeme v presile, ale… keby sme toho mnicha zmlatili, zmluva nezmluva, už by to riešil so zemepanom, ten sa mu teraz len vysmeje. Ta som kus spanikaril.\n<Pip>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Forgive me... for I schemed thus, thinking they would not dare to fight us when we outnumber them, but... if we had beaten that monk, contract or no contract, he would have settled it with the lord, who now merely scoffs at him. I panicked a bit.\n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Och, bože, ta teraz ši to vyšpekuloval perfektne, azaňát... Ic aspoň pohľadac daľše konare na ohnik, bo tu umaržneme dorana.\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh, God, thou hast schemed it perfectly now... Anyway, at least go for more branches for the fire, lest we get cold until morning.\n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak, tak, ic ty hľadac drevo Vlado a my šebe tu zatiaľ ustelieme na machu. Ty naš utečenec, hehehe.\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So, so, let thy gather wood, Vlado, whilst we make ourselves comfortable here on the moss. Ye art our squire, hehehe.\n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, hej, dobre hutoriš Števo, aj šebe dakus vypijeme zos totej orechovice, co som minule vykopal na zahrade na narodeniny... Vlado, ty ši ešči furt tu?! Migaj takoj do ľesa nosic konare, naj ce už nevidzim. No... hybaj!\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Ye, aye, well said, Števo. And we shall enjoy a sip of that nutmeg liquor I unearthed in the garden for my birthday... Vlado, art thou still here? Make haste to the forest and fetch branches, lest I see thee loitering. Now, begone! \n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej, hej, už idem.\n<Vlado>
items.translation: Aye, aye, I am going.\n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čuj Matuš, taaa... ja som dostal taky super napad... mali by sme daco vydumac, kedz už musime byc ujdzeni vof ľese. Šak tu všadzi teraz padaju orechy. By sme mohli vypaľic orechovicu. Hehe. By sme tu vypalili sudok a potem še už pomaly zabudne na toten naš vyprask. \n<Ščevo>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Hear me, Matuš, ahhh... I've got such a brilliant idea... we should come up with something, since we're now on the run in the woods. See, nuts are falling everywhere here. We could set up a nut distillery. Hehe. We could burn a barrel here and then they'll slowly forget about our thrashing.
\n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pošleme pipa riskovac život do dzedziny a zavola, naj sem dojdu na zabavu šumne dzivčata, aspoň na daco nam budze dobry.\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Let's send the priest to risk his life and limb into the village and call some maidens. At least some use he will be to us.\n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nooooo, to je dačo! To sa mi pači, ci pana! Hej a pipa budzeme pošilac na misie zhaňac i ciganskych muzikantoch.\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hmm, I'd want some music too. But I know not if musicians doth be good in the village... Ah well, we shall find out, the priest will handle everything. \n<Maťo>

items.original: ...hehe.\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: ...hehe.\n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No! Teraz na nich zaútočme!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Now let us have at them. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Maceju, nedaš sebe pokoja? Šak kukaj na nich, pňaci konečne daco užitočne robia. Dojdzeme potim na totu ich zabavu sebe kusčok okoštovac.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, canst ye not cease? Behold, the dullards finally want to do something of value. We shall approach and partake in their revelry once they throw their party.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Joj, ty by si furt iba koštoval. Útočiť treba, ti vravím!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Oh, thou wouldst only indulge thyself incessantly. We must attack, I tell thee! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta co, kto vyhral?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: So, who emerged victorious? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zase ja, pozri na chudáka zemepána ako plače. Povedal, že si objedná z Pešti šachistu, nach ho naučí fígle. Bohužiaľ, ale môj opát Gejza z Debrecína je veľmajster, lepšieho ťažko nájde…\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Once again, 'twas I. Look upon the pitiful lord, how he weeps. He mentioned he shall summon a chess tutor from Buda, to teach him some tricks. Alas, my abbot Gejza from Debrecen is a grandmaster, one would scarcely find a better... \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Raz ťa porazím, len keď si neviem zapamätať, jak chodí kôň! Hát, énis tompaagyú vagyok.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: I shall defeat you someday, only should I remember how a knight moves! \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nuž, šachy sú ťažké remeslo, to bárs veľa treba študovať.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Well, chess is a craft that requires much study. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Na niečo nám musíš odpovedať.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Thou must answer us. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Toto ja neviem. Bohužiaľ, tieto veci držia v prísnej tajnosti. Skúste zistiť od úradníckeho akolytu Ignáca, ten má na starosti kšefty okolo qahwahu.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I cannot say. Alas, such matters are held in strict secrecy. Seek information from the bureaucratic acolyte Ignác; he oversees the dealings concerning qahwah. \n<Bohdan>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Spolupracovník Koreňa. Spolu prišli do nášho kraja. Bol jeho pravou rukou.\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The Turk stood as the right hand of Root, their ventures entwined as they cometh  into our realm. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jeden lúpežný rytier, rodák z Prešova, žil dlhé roky strašne ďaleko, kdesi v Arménsku. Priučil sa tam nejakej satanistickej odnoži zurvanizmu uctievajúcej ich diabla Angra Mainyu. Ahriman je nezávislý čriepok jeho duše. Pračudesná viera. Snažil sa to tu rozšíriť, ale až keď prišiel Koreň a začal ho financovať, začalo sa mu dariť naberať nových členov. 
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>A rogue knight from Prešov ventured afar to distant lands, imbibing the teachings of a peculiar branch of Zurvanism in Armenia. He sought to propagate this faith upon his return, yet it was the backing of Root that granted him success in recruiting new adherents. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Bystré dievča. Rýchlo sa priučila našim rituálom, vlastne už je lepšia zaklínačka odo mňa. Len pár mesiacov dozadu sa k nám pridružila.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pauli, a swift-witted maiden, swiftly acquainted herself with our arcane rituals, proving herself a masterful conjurer in her own right. She joined our ranks but a scant few moons ago. \n<Bohdan>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To isto dajaka ina Paula budze. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: 'Tis surely was another Paula. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak, od Bohdana sme sa doznali šicko potrebne. Co zrobime teraz?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>From Bohdan's lips, we hath gathered all the needed knowledge. What be our next course of action? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pôjdem s vami! Vezmeme aj Ďusiho, on je šikovný zbrojnoš. Tuhľa pána kultistu zatiaľ zavrieme do temnice kamenice.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I shall join thy company! We shall also bring Ďusi, he is a capable man-at-arms. Meanwhile, we shall confine here present mister cultist to the dungeon. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pred ten brloh kultistický rozmiestnime mojich zbrojnošov. Budú čakať na naše znamenie, zrobíme hurhaj, zamávame na nich z okna.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Before the entrance to their den, let us position my soldiers. They shall await our signal, then we shall cause a distraction, and signal from the window. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Počkať, to ste kožu zo mňa nadarmo drali?
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Wait! So you peeled my skin for nothing?
\n<Bohdan>

items.original: Daj pokuj. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hush now. Into the dungeon with ye.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Skrze Ignáca sa isto dostaneme ku Koreňovi. Zabránime mu dovážať sem qahwah raz a navždy.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Through Ignác, to Root we shall find our path. We shall hinder him from ever importing Qahwah hither again. \n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ta ale on nam to len tak nevykeca. Je dosť podozrievavy, musel som mu klamac, že Matej je heretik a v Debrecine ho chcu upaliť, vraj si to overi… 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>But he shall not easily reveal his secrets. He is suspicious enough. I hath to resort to deceit, claiming Matej a heretic and they seek to burn him in Debrecen, saying he would verify it... \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Keď chce tvrdiť, že je heretik, môžem mu spraviť na hruď tetovanie, pentagram. 
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>If thee insists on branding Matej a heretic, a pentagram on his chest I could make. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
To nie! \!
Beztak, Ignác spoznal by rýchlo, že je tetovanie čerstvé. Hneď by nás odhalil. \n
items.translation:
Nay! Absolutely not! \!
Nevertheless, Ignác swiftly would discern the fresh tattoo. He would reveal us straightaway. \n

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pravda. Čítal si aspoň nejaké knihy z Index librorum prohibitorum? 
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Truth. Hast thou perused any tomes from the Index Librorum Prohibitorum? \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Máločo, ale poznám spisy brata Savonarolu, Husa a Estifanosa.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Scant few, but the works of Brother Savonarola, Hus, and Estifanoso I am acquainted with. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Čo si hneď nevravel, drž sa isto tých etiópskych štefanitov, počul som, že s nimi nejak spolupracuje naša vec. Ale i tak neviem, či vám niečo prezradí, Ignác je opatrný. Lenže má jednu Achillovu pätu, všimol som si, že všetko si zapisuje do kalendára, skúste mu ho čorknúť. Ignác si ten zápisník stráži ako oko v hlave, nikdy ho nepúšťa z ruky.
\n<Bohdan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Why didst thou not speak of this sooner? Stick to the writings of those Ethiopian Stephanites, for I hath heard our cause hath some affiliation with them. Yet, I doubt if Ignác shall reveal aught unto thee, for he is wary. Nevertheless, I hath noticed that he records all within his calendar. Seek to acquire it. \n<Bohdan>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Treba mac daco v zalohe. Vonku budze čekac naš človek s lukom. A kedz mu dame znamenie, ta vystreli horiaci šip do oblaka a v tom zmatku mu to uchmatneme. Len naj isto netrafi toteho Ignaca, bo mame pruser, nas zamorduju na mieste.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We must have a contingency plan. Our comrade with the bow shall await. And when we give the signal, he shall loose a flaming arrow into the window, and amidst the confusion, we shall seize it. Yet, make certain it doth not strike Ignác, for then we shall face dire consequences. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Znamenie treba čo najjednoduchšie. Dajme tomu, že keď sa pozriem von oknom.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>The signal must be simple. Let us say, when I cast my gaze out the window. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Veľa šťastia, kamaráti.
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: Godspeed, lads.   \n<Jozef>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Uf, mi riadne duni vof gebuli. Bozuľu mam jak gunču.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oy, my head doth pound mightily. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo to bolo?! Au... sám čert jej pomáha! Hogy bosorkányos!\n<Matej>
items.translation: What devilry was that?! Alas... mayhaps the devil aid her. Hogy bosorkányos!\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nas dobili riadne. Ta aspoň gače nam ochabeli.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath been thoroughly thrashed. At least our britches remain.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Prekliata dedina! Prečo ja!?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Accursed village! Why me!? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Idzeme ich hľedac. Ale za zemepanom takto nemožeme isc, bo nas vyruci. Skusme richtara. Mi zostala pamiatka, tota jej kukla.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We pursue them. But in such a state, we cannot venture forth to the lord, for he shall banish us. We should try and approach the burgmaster. I yet possess keepsake of hers, that hood. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nejaký pes by tú cigánku mohol vyňuchať. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Mayhap a hound could scent out that gypsy harlot. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Stoj, zlodej!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Halt, thief!\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Marha!\n<Pavol>
<Wordwrap>Co piskaš, pizda?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Who are you whistling at, sod?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Džamore, gádži... fajny ši bujak... i v posceli ši dobry? Bo hribet maš jak štajerak.
\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Džamore, gádž... a sight... ya fair well in hey? Oy,  ye rugged manbear. \n<Thief>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hej, ale zos lupičku som ešči nedrychmal. Heh, kedz neratam moju staru! Ty tepir paru ročky ľen sama v hladomorni budzeš dečku medzi scehnami sciskac!\ 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, but I hath not pilfered a rogue like ye yet. Heh, not counting my old woman! Ye be pinching sheets between ye thighs for a year or two in the oubliette! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Co še nahaňaš, že mnich pri cebe? Naj idze do koscelu kľačac na hodzinku. Tote taľafatky, co som pobrala šecky vracim, še nebuj.
\n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What ye jabbering , cause a monk by you side? He should go church and pray for an hour. All the trinkets I pilfered, I return them all. \n<Thief>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ty co si pijana? To ci jedno, že ce do reťazoch dame? Abo na škripec? Len budz už cicho, bo ci rucim jednu medzi oči. Idzeme.  
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Art ye drunk? Does it matter if we bind ye in chains? Or upon the rack? Be silent, lest I put a bolt betwixt ye eyes. Let us away. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Te chas la dakeri mindž!!  \n<Zlodejka>
items.translation: Te chas la dakeri mindž!! \n<Thief>

items.original:
Modlitba obnovila tvoje sily!
Všetky rany sa ti zahojili.
items.translation:
The prayer restored your strength!
All your wounds have healed.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Rýchlo, poďme dovnútra! Snáď sa tomu nič nestalo!\n<Žid>
items.translation: Haste, let us enter swiftly! Mayhap nothing dire hath occurred! \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Och, chvála na nebi! Husiti to nezničili!\n<Žid>
items.translation: Oh, praise be to the heavens! The Hussites hath not laid it to ruin. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Moja najväčšia cennosť, našťastie je celá. Vec, čo dokáže lietať, som vyšmelil vo Firenzi. Len tam treba vymyslieť poslednú vec, zdroj tepla, drevo a uhlie sú ťažké, s tým to nevzlietne… už celé roky si nad tým lámem hlavu. Volám to... nólab.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>My most prized possession, thankfully, remaineth unharmed. The contraption capable of flight, I procured it in Florence. Yet, the final aspect remains elusive, the source of heat. Wood and coal are too heavy, it cannot take flight... for years hath I pondered upon this. I call it... Noollab. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nólab? A prečo nie balón?\n<Matej>
items.translation: Noollab? Why not Balloon? \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Balón? To znie dobre!\n<Žid>
items.translation: Balloon? That doth sound fine! \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To je pekne, ale my potrebujeme znac coška o kultistoch, dze ich najsc?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed, but we do require knowledge of the cultists, where might we find them? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ľutujem, neviem... ale vyhrážali sa mi smrťou, aby som nikomu neprezradil ich tajnú skrýš - zhromažďujú sa v panskom opevnenom sídle Villa Elektra na západ od dediny. Ale, bohužiaľ, neviem ako by ste sa medzi nich mohli infiltrovať... skúste si všímať znamenie, podľa ktorého sa členovia vedia navzájom spoznať. \n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Alas, I know not, for they threatened me with death should I divulge their secret hideout - they gather at the lord's fortified mansion, Villa Elektra, west of the village. Yet, I know not how thou might infiltrate among them... try to observe a sign by which they recognize each other. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Fialové plášte nosia len pri otvorených útokoch... ale z čoho tie okná zaplatím? Aspoň sto grošov prispejte.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>They wear purple cloaks only during open assaults... but whence shall I procure funds for the windows? At least a hundred coins would be a boon. \n<Jew>

items.original: Tu maš.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here ye shalt have. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Maľoval som pre nich také ozdobné zuby, celkom dobrý kšeft to bol. Keď zbadáte upírske zuby na pribliciach, je to jeden z nich!\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I once painted ornate fangs for them, it was quite a profitable deal. If thou dost spy such vampiric fangs upon their helmets, thou art in their midst! \n<Jew>

items.original:
Upírske zuby, hej? Dobri, budzeme na nich merkovac.\!
A ešči mi povidz, na tote fialove plašte skadzi maju peňeži? Šak to musi stať hotovy majetok. \n
items.translation:
Vampiric fangs, eh? Very well, we shall be wary of them. \!
And tell me, whence doth the funding for those purple cloaks arise? It must require substantial wealth. \n

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak to už neviem. Musí ich niekto zámožný financovať. \n<Žid>
items.translation: Alas, I know not. Some affluent benefactor must be financing them. \n<Jew>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej! Banda oplanska!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hey! Ye sniveling fools!\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hnusny ste jak riť!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: As ugly as an ass ye are!\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Naša robota tuna je dokončena. Ideme domu.\n<Zbrojnoš>
items.translation: Our task is complete in this place. Let us make way back home.\n<Man at arms>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tu mace na pivko. Diky chlapci, že ste došli. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Here, some coin for ale, for you endeavours. Thank you.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hmmm, nedam vas teda zahlušic na misce. Ak však pridac ku nam še chcete, mušice pre nas coška splnic. Ak uspejete, vybavime vas, vyzbrojime. Spolu vyženieme husitoch najprv zos našeho chotara, potom aj zo Spiša.
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hmmm, I shan't have thou killed on the spot then. However, if thou dost wish to join us, ye must fulfill a task for us. If successful, we shall armor arm thee. Together, we shall drive the Hussites first from our lands, then from Spiš. \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To znie blahosklonne. Nuž, ako by sme vám len mohli pomôcť? \n<Matej>
items.translation: That sounds gracious. Well, how may we assist thee? \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Sme čuli take od špehov, že zemepan skryva vo svojej izbici taku tajnu maľuvku, nadovšetko si ju ceni, nam ju dones. Heh… chlapi, som čul, že holu babu tam ma nakrešľenu! Take čosi som ešči nevidzel.
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We hath heard from spies that the lord keeps a secret painting in his chamber, highly prized. Bring it to us. Heh... comrades, I hath heard'tis a nude woman! Such a sight I hath never seen. \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pohoda, do večura ju maš tu. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Agreed, you shall have it by nightfall. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Vytrim, vytrim, ne tak zhurta. Tu maš kľučiky. Su od takej chyži, co pred hradom stoji. Tam kejc vojdzeš, idz cez pozemok, prebroď potok i najdeš tajnu chodbu!
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Patience, patience, not so hastily. Here are the keys. They are for a cabin outside the castle. Once inside, traverse the grounds, ford the river, and you shall find the secret passage! \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Získal si \c[14]kľúčik od chyži\c[0] pri hrade.
items.translation: You received \c[14]the key to the cabin\c[0] by the castle.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Cipana, tajna chodba hej? Dobre znac. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: A hidden passage, indeed? Well noted. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pojdeme pomaly. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: We shall proceed. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Najperšej poženeme husitoch stadzi! Šak už koľke roky brajgeľ tu robia. A kejc naše čisla budu veľke, i Jiskru zo Spiša vytlačime i so šeckyma jeho nohsledama. Mno a calkom na fertig, zemepana vyženeme!
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We aim first to expel the Hussites from our lands! For years they've sown chaos here. And when our numbers swell, we shall drive out Jiskra of Spiš and all his followers. And in the end, we shall rid ourselves of the lord! \n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: <Wordwrap>To jak šicko chcete dokazac? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: And how dost ye intend to prove all this? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Náš mocný pán Zurvan všetko zariadi.
\n<Kultista nadriadený>
items.translation: Our powerful lord Zurvan shall arrange all things.\n<Cultist supervisor>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ta dobre. Ešte som bul zvedavy: \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Very well. Still curious. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Haha, nie. On všetko financuje. \n<Ignác>
items.translation: Haha, nay. He is the one who provides the funds. \n<Ignác>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nevidno mu do tváre, práve podľa toho ho spoznáte. Stále sa jak pojašený zahaľuje dekou. Len oči mu spod nej vykukujú. Naposledy sme ho videli ísť do kostola.
\n<Ignác>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>One cannot discern his face; that is how thou shalt identify him. He perpetually hides beneath a cloak. Only his eyes peer out from beneath. \n<Ignác>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Šak to hrad pomaly. Z teho qahwahu dane odvadzace zemepanovi? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: 'Tis  a castle almost, Doth ye pay dues and taxes from qahwah to the lord? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ešte raz sa ma na to opýtaš, takú ti prijebem, že sa nespamätáš! \n<Ignác>
items.translation: Ask me that again and I shall strike thee so hard, thou shalt not regain thy senses! \n<Ignác>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kľud, sa len pytam.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Peace, I merely inquire. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Náhrdelník tam bol? V tom brlohu lupičskom.\n<Richtár>
items.translation: The necklace was there? In that den of thieves? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tam nebul, ale našli sme ho v lese. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: It was not there, but we found it in the forest.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nebul. Vobec neznam, dze by mohol byc. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Pray, do not weep Verily, I know not where it may be. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Náhrdelnik tam bol?\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Was the necklace there? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čože? Vy tupci! Okamžite vypadnite! \n<Richtár>
items.translation: What? Ye fools! Begone this instant. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Náhrdelnik ste našli?\n<Richtár>
items.translation: Found ye the necklace? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Nebul tam. Ale možnaj zname, dze by mohol byc. Na sever od dzedziny.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>It was not found. But perchance we know where it may be. To the north of the village. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Sliepočka utešená.
items.translation: The hen seems content.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dajže si zrnka, daj.
items.translation: Let her peck at the beans, go on.

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pane na nebi! Kôstky sú prekliate! Musíme pipa nájsť a vyzistiť od neho viac!\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>By the heavens above! The grain is accursed! We must find the priest and extract more information about this bean! \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čo teda chcete odo mňa? \n<Richtár>
items.translation: What do you want of me?\n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Predpokladam, že v kostole bude. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: I deem he'll be found within the church. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nuž, občas sa tam stretávame. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Aye, we do cross paths there on occasion. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Na omšu je predsa v kostole. \n<Richtár>
items.translation: He doth attend the Mass with the church, doth he not? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Och! Zaš toti!...\n<Maťo>
items.translation: Oy! Thee again! \n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Aj tu schovanych nas našli? To jak?\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: How doth thee find us hidden here? \n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Však sedíte uprostred čistini.\n<Matej>
items.translation: Ye sit right in the middle of the clearing. \n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jaj... ta ale šak panstvo len kolo hradu a kostolu sa mota.\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: Oy... well, the gentry do tend to roam around the castle and church. \n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Zaútočme!\n<Matej>
items.translation: Have at them! \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Boha, neprestaneš? Ja nepomaham, bi sa sam. Mame robotu, dorima. Prisambohu, že kedz budze toto cale fertig, ta vlastnoručne zmlacime pipa.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Wilt ye not cease? I shall not assist, lest ye end up fighting alone. We have other tasks at hand. By heaven, when all this is over, I shall personally thrash the priest. And ye, give me some brandy! I know ye hast some. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Dostal si \c[14]orechovicu\c[0].
items.translation: You received \c[14]nutmeg liquor\c[0].

items.original: <Wordwrap>Čuj bratu a pošli za to sem dajake holky, keby ste na dajake natrafili v dzedzine, že mame orechovice, to zdrave. Ale dajake jedlo by mohli donesc.\n<Maťo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Listen, brother, and send word to any lasses ye encounter in the village that we have nutmeg liquor, 'tis healthy. But they could bring some food.\n<Maťo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A po papuli nechceš? Joj chlapci, vojnu vam treba.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And dost thou not want a fist in yer face? Oh lads, ye hath need of an goodly army march. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Šak ho neprovokuj, rytiera, nam naloži ešte. Pošleme pipa potom.\n<Ščevo>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Doth not provoke the knight, lest he turns his ire towards us. We shall send the priest after thee. \n<Ščevo>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Kto ste? Poslal vás môj drahý? \n<Anička>
items.translation: Who art thou? Hath my beloved sent thee? \n<Anička>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nezname, dze še tvuj drahy flaka, ale nas poslali tvoji rodičia, od strachu nedychaju. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We know not where ye beloved wanders, but 'tis thy parents who hath sent us. They are fraught with fear. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ja späť nepôjdem, otec ma zmlatili jak malého haranta. Ale, prosím vás, nepohľadali by ste Matúša? Len mu povedzte, že ho čaká Anička, asi zabudol… Pracuje v mlyne, to je budova pri nevestinci. Pracuje tam u svojho otca. Ja sa už nemôžem v dedine nikdy ukázať. 
\n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I shall not return home. My father hath beaten me like a wayward urchin. But I beseech thee, wouldst thou not seek out Matúš? Tell him that Anička awaits him, perchance he hath forgotten... He toils at the mill, adjacent to the brothel. He works there alongside his father. I can never show my face in the village again. \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ty še spamataj, sme tu prišli ťa docahnuc nazad domu a ne ti chlopoch nosic do ľesa. Migaj takoj domu, bo ce tam inač za ušiska docahnem. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Get a hold of yeself. We hath come to escort ye back home, not to play matchmaker in the woods. Make haste and return home at once, else we shall drag ye back by thy earlobes. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Och... teda dobre… pôjdem, ale prosím, len priveďte Matúša, musím ho vidieť. Sa potom vrátim domov so zvesenými ušami, sľubujem. 
\n<Anička>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh... very well... I shall go, but I beg of thee, bring Matúš. I must see him. I shall return home with my tail between my legs, I promise. \n<Anička>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ajh, znaš co? Dobre. Idzeme ci najsc teho Matúša. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Ah...very well, let us go and find this Matúš. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Buďte zdrááávi, pánové, já su tady přiženenej vod Moravy. To se jděte poptat tamdle Aničkinych rodičů, její fotr se mi stěžoval, že prý se jim dceruška, taková tichá šikovná dívenka, dala do spolku s těma hovadama, chudák její mať voči nadobro vybřečela. 
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Be ye hale, sirs, I hail from the lands of Moravia. Ye should inquire of Anička's parents over yonder. Her father lamented to me that their daughter, a quiet and industrious lass, allied herself with those ruffians. Alas, her poor mother wept bitterly. \n<Freeman>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Diki, ale už znam o nich. V dzedzine pri mosce byvaju.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Thank you, but I already know where they live. Closeby to the bridge. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pojďte!
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: Come along! \n<Freeman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No, čo máte nové? Kde je môj milý? \n<Anička>
items.translation: Pray, what tidings bring ye? Where is my beloved? \n<Anička>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tvoj mily je bars mily, ale na dakeho ineho. Tu smotri na obrazčok, i znamienko do detailu Macej nakrešlil, kebys neverila svatemu. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Thy beloved is now another's beloved. Behold this sketch, rendered to the finest detail by Matej, ye mayest doubt it not. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Och moj Božeeee… prečooo? Ja sa zabijem! S Tomašom! Ja som to tušila!
\n<Anička>
items.translation: Oh, sweet Heaven... Why? I shall end my life! With Tomáš! I knew it! \n<Anička>

items.original: <Wordwrap> Boha! Boha, Maceji, rob coška! Takoj! Ja nemožem v totych bľachoch nič! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Gods! Matej, act swiftly! Do something! I cannot do nought in this armor! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tu nemal nahodou most byť? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Methinks there was meant to be a bridge here? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Bul tu chviľu, ale dosky sme pobrali s kamošmi do het. \n<Somrák>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Aye, 'twas here a while, but the planks we took down with our companions. \n<Sluggard>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Hej? Ta migaj ho postaviť naspak, bo inač ce dobijem jak koňa. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Indeed? Then swiftly rebuild it, else ye be thrash like a mule. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jojh, pan veľkomožny, nehnevajce se! Užaj nanosime desky naspak. \n<Somrák>
items.translation: Oh, mighty sir, forgive us! We shall set the planks back in place forthwith. \n<Sluggard>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Teraz neže drgneš domňa bo zgruchocem dole. \n<Somrák>
items.translation: And mind ye do not stagger towards me, or I shall come crashing down. \n<Sluggard>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dobrý deň sa praje. Zemepán i richtár nás poverili vyšetrovať sektu, čo sa tu usadila. Vraj vaša dcéra o tom niečo vie.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Good morrow to thee. The lord and the burgmaster hath entrusted us with a quest to unravel the mystery of the cult that hath taken root in these lands. 'Tis said thy daughter doth possess knowledge thereof. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Gutntag, damnundher, majne name ist Ludwig Pallmer. Ale nebojte sa, to je všetko, čo viem po nemecky, starý dedo sa sem z Bavorska priženil. Nuž, Anička sa nám odcudzila, domov skoro nechodí a včera sme po nej ziapali aj bitku dostala. Ráno nebola v posteli. Nevieme, či sa vôbec vráti.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Guten Tag, Damen und Herren, meine name ist Ludwig Pallmer. Fear not, for 'tis the extent of mine acquaintance with the German tongue, for my forefather hailed from Bavaria. As for Anička, she hath distanced herself from our hearth, scarce returning home. Only yesterday doth we berate even laid hands on her. Come dawn, she was not to be found in her chamber. Whether she shall return, we know not. \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Dajte denník, ja viem čítať. Žiadne strachy, vám ju domov privedieme.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Grant me the diary. I am versed in the art of reading. Fear not, we shall escort her safely back to thy abode.\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Mno. Celkom pekné písmo...
\n<Matej>
items.translation: Verily. The script is rather finely wrought... \n<Matej>

items.original:
"Začiatok leta roku Pána 1451. Asi milujem M. Spravím to preňho. Pridám sa k zurvanistom." \!
Hm, pridala sa ku kultu... pohľadám súčastný dátum... \n
items.translation:
"'Tis the outset of the summer in the year of our Lord 1451. I find myself enamored with M. I shall undertake aught for his sake. I shall align myself with the Zurvanists."
Hmm, she hath pledged herself to the cult... Let me ascertain the present date... \n

items.original:
"Odídem, toto už nezvládam. Drahý denník, obetujem preňho všetko, pobalím sa, v noci sa vykradnem a počkám ho pri útese. Ach, môj drahý M., snáď mi sinky pofúkaš…"
Ideme! \n
items.translation: <Wordwrap>"I shall depart, for I cannot bear this burden no longer. Beloved diary, I shall sacrifice all for him. I shall pack my belongings, slip away under the cloak of night, and await him by the cliffside. Oh, my dearest M., mayhap thou shalt caress me..."

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nemyslel som si, že ho ešte uvidím. Som vaším dlžníkom, čo za to chcete?\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I never deemed I would lay eyes upon it again. I am indebted to thee, what dost thou seek in return? \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tvoju chyžu chceme. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: We desire ye abode. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Och... si zo mňa žarty robíte? Navaľte náhrdelník a ťahajte ta het! \n<Richtár>
items.translation: Oh... dost thou jest with me? Give the necklace and depart! \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Žiadne take. Čau. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: None such jests. Fare thee well. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pavol! Stojte! Dobre, dám vám všetko, čo chcete. Dobre dám, vam kľúče od domu, ale vysťahujem sa až zajtra. Načo som vám vravel, ako je hodnotný... \n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Pavol! Stay! Very well, I shall grant thee all thou desirest. I should not hath underestimated its worth. Take the keys to my house, but I shall depart on the morrow. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nas pusce dnuka, šak my sme zos vami! Zemepanovi ľudze! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Let us proceed forthwith! \n<Matej>

items.original: Šak ich jesto jak hadoch! Ucekajme! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: As many as snakes in a nest! Run away!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Jediny neprežil kultista. Vyhrali sme život! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: No a single cultist remains! We won at life.\n<Pavol>

items.original: To čo bolo? Ešteže toten delobuch sme mali. \n<Pavol>
items.translation: What was that? Luck would have it, that we had a petard. \n<Pavol>

items.original: Už utiekol. Už neni tu. Som počul, utiekol. \n<Matej>
items.translation: It's not here anymore. It ran away. \n<Matej>

items.original: Ucekaaaj! Bo nas dozdiga! \n<Pavol>
items.translation: Run awaaaay! Or it shall spill our intestines!\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pipa zas hľadáte? Hore je, musíte počkať.\n<Neviestka>
items.translation: Looking for priest again? Up he is, you have to wait.\n<Bathmaid>

items.original: Jak počkac, takoj idz po ňoho!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Wait? Go get him immediately!\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj... to ste vy?
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Oh... it is thou?
\n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: Navaľ kľučik od arzenalu v koscele!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Surrender the key from the church arsenal!\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj, takže richtar vam veri? Tu mace kľučik, nech posluži v mene Panovom.
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So burgmaster has his trust in thou? Here is the key, let it serve in the Lord's name. \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Pip Vlado ti dal \c[14]kľúčik\c[0].
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Priest Vlado gave you the\c[14] key\c[0].

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chlapi a by ste mi nepomohli? Ma furt otravuje jedna baba, jej vysvetlice, že ja som vof celibace a nemožem take ništ, bo to proci voli Božej. Vam za to pridam i dajaku orechovicu abo co. 
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Men, wouldst thou not help me? One woman doth incessantly troubles me, explain to her that I am in celibacy and cannot engage in serious relationship, for it is against the will of God. I shall reward thee for it with a good amount of nut brandy or whatever else thou desirest.\n<Priest Vlado>

items.original:
...
\n<Matej>
items.translation: ... \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaka baba zas?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What woman again? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Maja sa vola, chodi často myc pradlo k rieke pri nevestinci.
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Her name is Maja, she often goes to wash laundry in the river near the brothel. \n<Pip Vlado>

items.original: Získal si \c[14]chápadielko\c[0].
items.translation: You have acquired a \c[14]tentacle\c[0].

items.original: Mno. Tak to by sme mali.\n<Adam>
items.translation: So. 'Tis done. \n<Adam>

items.original:
Ta snaď to na daco bulo. Pozri to ty, ja pomaly čitam.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Hope it was for something. You, look upon it, I read slowly.\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Hmm...
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
Hmm...
\n<Matej>

items.original:
HA! Šikovný... píše v gréčtine a obmieňa samohlásky, málokto to prečíta. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
HA! Inventive... writes in Greek and changes up vowels, few could decipher it. 
\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Z minulého týždňa je tam veľká poznámka "Kor je sultánov agent, celá sekta je iba hra!!!". Pali, vyzerá to tak, že celá táto záležitosť smrdí vysokou politikou. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>From last week there is a big note "Rot is sultans agent, the whole cult is but a game!!!". Pali, this doth reeks of high political intrigues.
\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Potom nasleduje "streda: stretnutie ohľadom dohody s Ric na odstránenie Kor, Mar a Pau".
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Then comes "Wednesday: meeting with Bur about getting rid of Rot, Mar and Pau."
\n<Matej>

items.original:
Kto je ten Ric?
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Who is Bur?
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neviem... nejaký Richard možno. Ale to Pau... Pali, podľa mňa sa Ignác chystal obrátiť stranu a zlikvidovať tvoju ženu!
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>Don't know, Buridan maybe? but Pau... Pali, I think Ignác was planning to turn colors and obliterate your wife!
\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>"Štvrtok: konečne príde prvá dodávka qahwahu nezávisle od Kor. Podarilo sa!!"
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>"Thursday: finally, first caravan of qahwah independent from Rot. We did it!!"
\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A "piatok: stretnutie s Kor a Mar v krčme."
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
<Wordwrap>And "Friday: meetup with Rot and Mar in the tavern."
\n<Matej>

items.original:
Piatok? Šak to neska! Maceji, podzme, bo doras cma!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation:
Friday? Matej, that is today! Come, quickly! Dusk is nigh!
\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Hej tam, jasne, bylinky dajakemu truľkovi budzeme zhaňac.
Naj ho bruško neboli. Tutaj bodľač zos zeme vydrapneme. To ho nauči, zos zadanu 
še budze švoňať.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hark ye, we shall indeed seek herbs for some dullard. Mayhap this shall teach ye not to complain of bellyaches. Let us pluck this thistle from the ground. 'Twill teach him not to consort with forespoken women.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Pali, pre Boha, šak on nevedel dozaista. \n<Matej>
items.translation: Pali, for God's sake, he surely knew naught.\n<Matej>

items.original: Isto, isto. Vystači mu tuna burina.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Verily, verily. This bunch of weeds shall suffice.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Získal si akúsi \c[14]bodľač\c[0].
items.translation: You obtained some sort of \c[14]thistle\c[0].

items.original: Čo vy tu ešte? Jasné ste dostali zadanie.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: What dost you still here? You have your orders.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Choďte za bylinkárom. Toten starý mních. Možnaj dajaký lokaj vás tam zavedie.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Go to the herbalist. The aged monk. Perhaps some servant shall guide you thither.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Neviete pár suchárov nájsť? Choď do hradu veď. Sa spýtaj kuchárky abo kieho.\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Can you not find few biscuits? Within the castle they might be. Ask the cook or whomever.\n<Jozef>

items.original: Dze je tota tajna chodba?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Where is the secret passageway?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Jaka tajna chodba? Z hradu kejc sa chceš von dostať, iď cez branu normalne.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What secret passageway? If you want to get out of castle, use the gate.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Šak normalne vyjdi cez branu. Abo tuto cez tajnu chodbu choď.\n<Pištík>
items.translation: Simply, through the gate. Or hence through this secret passageway.\n<Pištík>

items.original: Tajnu čo?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: The secret what?\n<Pavol>

items.original:
Tak sa vráťme po ňu! Vezmeme ju do hradu, tam bude v bezpečí, aspoň na čas.
\n<Matej>
items.translation:
Return to her, we should! Take here to the castle, there she shall find safety, at least temporary.
\n<Matej>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Mame tuhľa toto. To fajne, ne?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We have this here. That's nice, right?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Nádhera, to si isto zaľúbi, idem mu to hneď ukázať.\n<Maja>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Beautiful, he'll surely love it. I'm off to show him.\n<Maja>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ale ak ma i tak odmietne, tak mu roztrhnem ten obraz o hlavu. Je to taký chudáčisko, ale roztomilý veľmi, nedá sa naňho hnevať, zlatíčko malé.\n<Maja>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>If he refuses nonetheless, then I shall tear that picture over his head. He's such a poor thing, but very cute, one cannot be angry with him, a darling little one.\n<Maja>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Joj, dobre, toto sebe nechaj pre kamaratky.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oi! Keep this for your friends.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>No mame toto tu, ale to nam treba ešte.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Well, we have this here, but we need it for a bit longer.\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Fiha, to skade take mate?\n<Maja>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Woah, where did you get that?\n<Maja>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Takoj sme nazad.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We'll be righ back.\n<Pavol>

items.original: Šak on je neviditeľny!
items.translation: It's invisible!!!

items.original: Prosím, prosím nieee! Vzdávam sa! Vzdávam sa! Aaajh! \n<Vecheť>
items.translation: Please, please noo! I yield, I yield, aah!\n<Dick>

items.original: Kultista Vecheť sa vzdáva!
items.translation: Cultist Dick yields.

items.original:
\c[14]5 korún\c[0] sme získali!\!
\c[14]Zviazaný kultista\c[0] teraz patrí nám.
items.translation:
\c[14]5 coins\c[0] are now ours!\!
\c[14]Bound cultist\c[0] now belongs to us!

items.original: Ohhh... to je bolesť.\n<Chorá hlava>
items.translation: Ohhh... the pain.\n<Sick head>

items.original: Aaaaahhhhh!\n<Chorá hlava>
items.translation: Aaaaahhhhh!\n<Sick head>

items.original: Ahriman! Sem poď! Na moju stranu! \n<Marek>
items.translation: Ahriman! Get here! To my side! \n<Marek>

items.original: Biedny kultista.
items.translation: Pitiful cultist.

items.original: Ste nevideli Feriho? Caly chotar ho zhaňa.\n<Sedliak>
items.translation: Have you seen Feri? The whole region is looking for him.\n<Peasant>

items.original: Poničené nádoby. V jedej ostalo ale \c[14]vínko slivkové\c[0].
items.translation: Broken caskets. Only one \c[14]plum wine\c[0] remained here.

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Valér tým, že sme sa pripiravili, chcel naznačiť, že sme aj bez vás riešili vojnu proti kultistom. Len sme vojnou nechceli ohroziť obchody. Jednak to sype a ničomu by to nepomohlo. Bez zlata by sme nič podniknúť nemohli. Preto sme medzitým spoločnými silami s istým kolegom získali vlastný kontakt z Etiópie a pripravili sa na útek z tejto prekliatej dediny.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Colleague Valér doth imply that even without thy involvement, we were engaged in the struggle against the cultists. We were loath to imperil our trade with the specter of war. 'Twas folly, nay, futility to engage thus. Bereft of means, we could take no decisive action. Thus, we hath sought another contact from the distant lands of Ethiopia and readied ourselves to flee this accursed village . \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A celý čas sme popritom zhromažďujeme arzenál. Písali sme listy šlachticom, lenže ten Koreň musí mať kontakty na vysokých miestach. 
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>All the while, we hath been amassing an arsenal. We hath dispatched missives to the nobles, yet Root holds sway in the highest courts. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nič nám nevravela, ale voľačo si škriabala do tejto knížky. Lenže my nevieme lúštit litery, aspoň vidíte, že sme sa jej o učenie postarali, aj keď trieme biedu. A tak sa nám odplatila.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Nary a word hath she spoken to us, yet she hath been seen to etch into this tome.  We doth made her learned, alas we are unable to decipher its contents. Despite our toil, this is her recompense. \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Idze kuknuc k Pallmerofcom. Hore v dzedzine byvaju, hneď pri mosce. Ich dcerka Maruša tyž do kultu vnišla, možnaj vam daco o tym povi. 
\n<Dedinčan>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Go see Pallmers. That faimily lives up in the village, right by the bridge. Their daughter Anička joined the cult, mayhaps they shall tell you about it themselves. \n<Freeman>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Svätá panenka Mária… Čítal si vôbec nový zákon? Vieš kto je Ježiš?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>God above... Hast thou not perused the New Testament? Art thou acquainted with the teachings of our Lord, Jesus Christ. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Što, jakij mič bis hľedal?! To sut mi dvi sn'! Hrušk' jiďat! Sn' hrušk' ľubit jisti! Tipir musm hrušk' zavarati do noči, žeby maľ jem do zimy! I hruškovu paľinku dam kvasiti.
\n<Marian>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What art thou seeking with such urgency?! These are my two sons! Pear devourers! They delight in feasting upon pears! Today, I must preserve pears until nightfall, that we may hath sustenance for winter! And I shall set pear brandy to ferment. \n<Marian>

items.original:
Pri útese čaká naša chudinečka. Hrozný to svet.
\n<Pallmer>
items.translation: She awaits him by the cliffside. What a dreadful world . \n<Pallmer>

items.original:
Hmmm, tuhľa, skúsim na tehlu zatlačiť... Alebo tu snáď? Vyzerá byť kus ináč zafarbená.
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Hmmm, mayhap pressing on this brick... Or perchance this one? This one doth seem to bear a different hue. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Pištík, čo si ihneď za mnou nešiel? Také veci, keď sa tu dejú mi pod riťou, musím takoj znac!
\n<Jozef>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Pištík, why didst you not come to me forthwith? When such events take place, I must needs be informed!\n<Jozef>

items.original:
<Worwrap>Snaď tam pobudnu dlhšie do večura. Možnaj i tak stretnutie zrušili, kejc zistili, že Ignac už voňa fialky zo spodu.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Perhaps they will linger until evening. Might hath canceled the meeting upon learning that Ignác has met his end. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>A co ši šebe myslel že co mi vof seminari ľem na svate obrasky kukame? Nikto nezna lepšu šlivovicu kvasic jak ctihodny brat Arpád. My tak s bratmi dumeme, že šak i kvas jest božie dilo.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>What didst ye reckon we pondered whilst gazing upon the holy images in seminary? None possesses the art of plum fermentation better than the venerable Brother Arpád. We brethren hold that even fermentation is the handiwork of God. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Nie, uskutoční sa za nedlho. O pár hodín pred svitaním udrieme. Zabili Ignáca, musíme konať. Mne sa nepozdáva ani ten mních, bars vŕta. Ale Pauli jasne povedala, že treba odstaviť len rytiera.
\n<Marek>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Indeed, all is prepared. We shalt strike ere the dawn breaks. I hold reservations regarding that monk; he doth arouse suspicion. But Pauline hath made it clear that only the removal of the knight is warranted. \n<Marek>

items.original:
Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť. Povoláme sn' toho zberača hrušiek, husiti si budú myslieť, že na nich útočí sekta i zutekajú, potom už ich pochytáme. Alebo snáď niekto iný by sa k nám mohol pridať. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

items.original:
Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť. Povoláme sn toho zberača hrušiek, husiti si budú myslieť, že na nich útočí sekta i zutekajú, potom už ich pochytáme. Alebo snáď niekto iný by sa k nám mohol pridať. 
\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Pomstiť idzem mojich druhoch. Kultisti otravili Bruna, i pobili ostatnych. Nezaspim kym ich nevydrancujem.
\n<Zlodejka Ida>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>To avenge my comrades. The cultist poisoned Bruno and kiled the others. I will not fall asleep until I plunder them. \n<Ida>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Hm, znaš co? Pokračuj, nebudzem ce rušic. Ale Boh naj ce chrani kejc ze zbadam, že daco zaš sa snažiš pocahnuc!
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Hm, ye know what? Go on, we will leave ye undisturbed. But God forbid, shall I see ye trying to nick something! \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Tak by som sa chcel venovať výskumu. Ale v poslednej dobe stále sa sem len ktosi snaží dobiť.\n<Žid>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh how much I want to do research. But lately, seemingly everyone has been trying to conquer my abode.\n<Jew>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Maceju, to glupocina. Šak už večur i tak ich hľedac teraz to holy nerozum. Abo še pomodli, možnože sa ti zjavi svata Tereza a ce nasmeruje abo co… I kedz aši to nema bars zmysel.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Matej, dost we truly plan to pursue the priest’s minstrels at this hour? Or mayhaps ye shouldst pray, perchance Saint Teresa shall appear and guide us, or some such... \n<Pavol>

items.original: Ty beštia jak sa opovazuješ…!\n<Marek>
items.translation: Wench, how dost thou dare...! \n<Marek>

items.original: Ihneď ho privedte! \n<Adam>
items.translation: Fetch him back at once! \n<Adam>

items.original: A znaš ty, že sa zdržuje v nevestnci?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: And art ye aware he doth frequent the brothel? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>A znaš ty, že sa zdržuje v nevestnci?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: And art ye aware he doth frequent the brothel? \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Ty še spamataj, sme tu prišli ťa docahnuc nazad domu a ne ti chlopoch nosic do ľesa. Migaj takoj domu, bo ce tam inač za ušiska. 
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Get a hold of yeself. We hath come to escort ye back home, not to play matchmaker in the woods. Make haste and return home at once, else we shall drag ye back by thy earlobes. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Jaj, takže richtar vam veri? Tu mace kľučik, nech posluži v mene panovom.
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>So burgmaster has his trust in thou? Here is the key, let it serve in the Lord's name. \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chlapi a by ste mi nepomohli? Ma furt otravuje jedna baba, jej vysvetlice, že ja som vof celibace a nemožem take ništ, bo to proci voli božej. Vam za to pridam i dakalu orechovicu abo co. 
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Men, wouldst thou not help me? One woman doth incessantly troubles me, explain to her that I am in celibacy and cannot engage in serious relationship, for it is against the will of God. I shall reward thee for it with a good amount of nut brandy or whatever else thou desirest.\n<Priest Vlado>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Uf, mi riadne gebuli. Bozuľu mam jak gunču.\n<Pavol>
items.translation: Oy, my head doth pound mightily. \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Ty znaš po maďarsky?\n<Pavol>
items.translation: You know Hungarian?\n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Prosím ťa, Pali, čo by som bol za diplomata bez maďarčiny. Vieš koľko kumánov som musel presviedčať, aby nezavraždili mojich bratov či mňa?\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh please, what diplomat would I be without Hungarian. Do you know how many cumans I had to persuade into not murdering my brothers or myself?\n<Matej>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Totu Aničku by sme mali isc hľedac. Útes v lese je.
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>That Annička, we should go look for. The cliffside is in the forest. \n<Pavol>

items.original:
Pojdzeš pekne ty na dereš. Tam ťa trošku ponaťahujeme- \^
\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Come now, peacefully to the rack. There, we shall have our reckoning- \^\n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Neteší ma, čo čítam. Vedel som, že sa v našom chotári zdržujú nejaký čudáci, odkedy ale sídli Jiskra na Spiši, je to celkom bežný jav. Netušil som, že sú tak nebezpeční.
\n<Richtár>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>I am not pleased with what I read. I knew that some oddities lingered within our domain, but I did not realize they were so perilous. \n<Burgmaster>

items.original: Nenervač še tyľko, horši jak Turci abo husiti nebudu. Poratame še s nimi. Co o nich znaš? \n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Fret not, they shan't be worse than the Turks. We shall deal with them. What do ye know of them? \n<Pavol>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Co ma toto byc? Stoj ty pľuha!\n<Pavol>
items.translation: What madness is this? Halt, ye scoundrel! \n<Pavol>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Chlapi a by ste mi nepomohli? Ma furt otravuje jedna baba, jej vysvetlice, že ja som vof celibace a nemožem take ništ, bo to proci voli božej. Vam za to pridam i kľučik od sekretaru s omšovym vinkom z kosceľa, ľuďom potim dam hocjake, im jedno. 
\n<Pip Vlado>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Lads, would thou not help me? I am annoyed by one lass, explain to her for me that I live in celibacy, so no thing will come of our relationship. For this, I will give you som liquor.  \n<Priest Vlado>

items.original:
<Wordwrap>Idem teda medzi nich. Snáď niečo sa niečo dozviem.
\n<Anička>

<Wordwrap>Hej, cítiť vo vzduchu búrku. Dlho nepršalo. 
\n<Adam>
items.translation: <WordWrap>Aye, one can feel the storm in the air. \n<Adam>

items.original: <Wordwrap>Prosím ťa, Pali, čo by som bol za vzdelanca bez maďarčiny.\n<Matej>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Oh please, what diplomat would I be without Hungarian. Do you know how many cumans I had to persuade into not murdering my brothers or myself?\n<Matej>

items.original:
Nas nabonzovala moja stara. Takoj na nás poslal svojich hrdlorezov Ignác.
\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Som sa sem prišol schovac. V dzedzine to je uplna Golgota teraz. Do večura nikto tam neprežije
\n<Dedinčan>

Mno, chlapci moji. Do dediny by som nie úplne najradšej šiel. Teraz to tam bude prelezené kultistami. Jak ma zahliadnu, isto by mi o život usilovali.
\n<Jozef>
Máme, po čo sme prišli. Pokračujme do hlbín katakomb.

Zadrž! Toto nie sú žiadne knihy či spisy, o ktorých ste rozprávali.
Rozprávaš o vzdelaní, lež toto je diablovský amulet!

Prosím ver nám. Potrebujeme tento artefakt aby sme sa dostali 
k našemu poznaniu.
V tom prípade musíš zahynúť. Je mi to ľúto rytieru.
CHALAJSNIANFASVLALSVN
HSSS

Odporné beštie! Koľko nevinných padlo im za obeť. Čo im, mne!
Jak som sa to mohol nehať zlákať. Nikdy nemal som sa s nimi
spolčovať.

Ďakujem ti mnoho. Tento artefakt teraz použijeme, aby sme otvorili
bránu do knižnice.

<Wordwrap>No ta ja hej ale oco... oca zabili... Bože moj šak on nikemu nezrobil nič... len im vravel, nech ma nechajú.
\n<Dievčina>
Získal si \c[14]Feriho\c[0]. \n<Feri>
Toto omšové \c[14]vínko sa ti zíde\c[0]. Snáď nebude farárovi chýbať.

<Wordwrap>Jaj, hnev boži na nas sadnul! A richtar fras na šecko sere, prstom nepohne. Ľem še vymluva, Boh zna s jakym čartom ďablom še bratričkuje! A zemepan tyž ľem by cale dni pexeso hral a na totu svoju scenu v komnate kukal.\n<Dedinčan>
Poďte, poďte! Bo oni ho domaruju uplne!
Videl som už aj koňa v lufte srať... ale toto...
Získal si \c[14]Žida\c[0].

<Wordwrap>No a čo, že s Ignácom? Pre dobrú vec sa spojím aj s Džingischánom. Šak si ho neberiem za ženu, čo bude o týždeň, to je predsa vo hviezdach.  
\n<Richtár>

Me vykradli! Teraz, za biľeho dňa! Normalne som išol k sušedovi po hrabľe, a kym som domu prišol, ta almara vyrabovana dočista. Nikto mi veric nechce, vraj, že sam som si tote veci moje odľifroval.  
\n<Občan>
Oooejh, joj. Amencma s našim valaľom. Kultisti zaútočili. \n<Ogrgeľ>
Žiadanku na zbrane! Nič vám nepovedali, do riti Paľovej? Keď máte podpísanú žiadanku, môžem vám za ne vydať matroš miesto peňazí.\n<Okultista>

Kedysi to býval Komár, tak ho volali v celej obci. Bol dosť otravný, tak sa nám aj uľavilo, že prijal túto formu existencie. U nás každý nájde svoje pravé miesto. Poskytuje nám útočisko, rozsrastá sa podľa rozkazov. Kŕmime ho zapichnutím ľudí do zeme, potom ich polievame qahwah. Aj teraz stojíme na Komárových črevách. \n<Okultista>

<Wordwrap>Moje pravé meno je Hasan Bey. Som agent sultána Murada II. Bol som vyslaný ako špeh za účelom podvratnej činnosti, plán bol zneužiť mýtus spotvorenej podoby mazdaismu. Lákať vašich ľudí a presviedčať ich k rebélii, živiť ďalšiu uhorskú vnútornú krízu.
\n<Turek>

<Wordwrap>Kráľovský edikt, ktorý mi umožňuje prebývať v hornom Uhorsku je falzifikát, ale podplácame vašu šľachtu a niekoľkých palatínov, takže správy a nenápadné snahy richtára o riešenie situácie ostávajú nevypočuté. Lenže celé sa mi to vymklo spod kontroly.  
\n<Turek>

Tu máte ešte šnapsu, to môj herrpapa doniesol z Bavorska, som šetril dcére na svadbu, ale toto treba poriadne osláviť. Anička, šak my ťa ľúbime, jak si nám toto mohla spraviť…
\n<Pallmer>

Tak, tak, kukni tu i na mnicha, jaky suci chlop, kym mal rucho, som ani nezbačila.
\n<Pallmerová>

Joj, už teľo nefňukajce. Kedz nam ste zaviazani, znali by sme coška, co nam fakt že treba. Vaša dcerka budze naš agent u kultistoch. 
\n<Pavol>

Spravím, čo len chcete. Vzdávam sa Zurvana. To isto v sekte môjho Matúša skazili, on má dobré srdce.
\n<Anička>

<Wordwrap>Nőjön gitár a hasadba és a rák pengesse!!! Pali, ja ťa obesím, prisámbohu! Prepiduša zosraná, kvôli tebe sme tu skoro všetci bačkory natiahli. Prac sa mi z očú! Hüje!
\n<Jozef>

Pozri, na bráne je tu pribitý pergamen, na ktorom sa píše: "Zemepánovi: držíme mnícha Mateja v stodole za hradom. Príďte ráno vyjednávať o výkupnom. Ak sa o niečo pokúsite, mníchovi podrežeme hrdlo."\n<Adam>

Pozri, na bráne je tu pribitý pergamen, na sa ktorom píše: "Posádke hradu: držíme mnícha Mateja v stodole za hradom. Príďte ráno vyjednávať o výkupnom. Ak sa o niečo pokúsite, mníchovi podrežeme hrdlo."\n<Adam>
Mních Matej sa pridal do tvojej družiny
items.translation: Monk Matej has joined your band.

items.original: Zemepan zaš na mäso dostal chuť. Furt len mäsko, mäsko, mäsko. Halušky mu nigda nekoštuju, ľen slaninu zos nich povybera.\n<Služobná>
Už ľem modľic še nam ostava. \n<Starenka>
Získal si \c[14]Žida\c[0]

<Wordwrap>Tak začali jed podávať nevinným dedinčanom. Ahriman sa neustále vzpiera našej vôli, preto musíme udržiavať magické zaklínanie pri pražení. Jedného dňa som teda zaklínanie sabotoval a Ahriman spôsobil hrozný požiar, dvaja kultisti uhoreli zaživa.
\n<Bohdan>

<Worwrap>To počka. Jožku, zamykaj oblak. Atentat na cebe idze o hodzinu. Maju preľezc cez Macejovo okno jak mravce.
\n<Pavol>

Pali, Pali, ale ti vravím, že tvoja jediná možnosť je úplná abstinencia, ty už si regulérny alkoholik.
\n<Matej>

Ale šak tam nejdzeme pic, informacije nam treba zisťovac. Natuty tu budze toten Koreň, nebudzem nic pic.
\n<Pavol>

Hej, aľe ta šak co tam vof karčme budzeme pexeso hrac? Šak budu kukac na nas jak puci, že to co tam došlo.
\n<Pavol>

Pexeso…? Ja to beriem ako moju misionársku činnosť, prisámbohu, aj keby to bola posledná vec, čo spravím, ja z teba zrobím abstinenta.
\n<Matej>

Ta veľo ščesca a hlavne to teľo nepreživaj, ci pana. Ta co tepir zrobime, šak tam nemožeme ľen tak nasucho šedzec jak mudžahedini.
\n<Pavol>

Boh ochraňuj moju spásu, spravíme to takto… vymeníme si háby a ja budem piť miesto teba, to bude normálne, že ty ako mních nepiješ. Ale musíš do mňa furt hučať, nech ideme preč, nech to nie je nápadné.
\n<Matej>

Heh, no cij panabeka, ta toto še mi ľubi! Cebe ľen prospeje chľast, naj še dakus ukľudniš. 
\n<Pavol>

Sce čuli? Zemepan vraj nič pre kraj nezrobi. Mi vravela omama, že už mešac neni v kraju, že furt len dadzi po lazebnych domoch chodi.
\n<Zbrojnoš>

Panaboha, co ši mi to porobela? To čemu, šak še nam dobre žilo spolu, nigda som ci nic zľe nezrobel a ty račej še naľepiš na dajakeho Koreňa! Ty naivna baba sprosta! Co šebe myšľiš, že ce čeka v totej bande!? Šebe dumeš, že toten Koreň švety je? Vas ľen zneuživa na poľitiku, ti teper povim, co on je, turecky agent to je! A Ignac ešči horši, chysta sa vas šicke zahlušic, naj mu už nešaškujece vof kšefte!
\n<Pavol>

Zurvan zachraňuj me! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na vas! Zurvan na- \^
\n<Pindžur>

<Wordwrap>Poznam tajnu cescičku. Cez les vas možem previesc, vyhneme sa kultistom.
\n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>Poznam tajnu cescičku. Cez les vas možem previesc, vyhneme sa kultistom. Da sa prejc cez chyžku teho zberača hruškoch.
\n<Ida>
Daco neskutočne.\n<Pavol>

Pomstiť idzem mojich druhoch. Kultisti otravili Bruna, i pobili ostatnych. Nezaspim kym ich nevydrancujem.
\n<Zlodejka Ida>

Hm, znaš co? Pokračuj, nebudzem ce rušic. Ale Boh naj ce chrani kejc ze zbadam, že daco zaš sa snažiš pocahnuc!
\n<Pavol>
Sem neviem čo dať, jaké itemy zajímavé by ste chceli? Tu je zatiaľ \c[14]50 korún\c[0].
Tu taky quest bude s maliarom.

Ale dajaka je dorantana. No ta dobry večir sa praje mlada dama! Sa zohrej pri ohniku, traše ce jak osiku.
\n<Maťo>

Marek, hrozí nám nebezpečenstvo! Koreň je turecký agent, celé toto mala byť len politika aaaa... a Ignác sa nás chystal zbaviť! Po boji pred krčmou ma Pali zajal, ale nakoniec som ho zavraždila a utiekla.\n<Paula>
Rozrucane špekačky su tu roztarhane, medzi nimi leži \c[14]založny delobuch\c[0].

Všade sa potulujú husiti! To kto ťa vychovával, že neodprevadíš mnícha? Čert mi bol tohto chumaja ožranského dlžen. 
\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Neteší ma, čo čítam. Vedel som, že sa v našom chotári zdržujú nejaký čudáci, ale netušil som, že sú tak nebezpeční. 
\n<Richtár>
Nenervač še tyľko, horši jak Turci nebudu. Poratame še s nimi. Co o nich znaš? \n<Pavol>
Tu bude poschodie ale este neje nakreslene. Na poschodi bude mat starosta dajake harampadie. tu ti ho davam

<Wordwrap>Chujoviny dristaš. Ale daso barz zle sa tu chysta. Zemepanovi takoj by sme mali o tym povedať. 
\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nevidno mu do tváre, práve podľa toho ho spoznáte. Stále sa jak pojašený zahaľuje dekou. Len oči mu spod nej vykukujú. 
\n<Ignác>
Chudáka isto sa dal naverbovať mysliac si, že vyženie husitov z rodného kraja.
items.translation: Probably joined the cult in hope of driving the Hussites out of his land.

items.original: <Wordwrap>A toten chlop vypatra jak naš Janči. Adam, ja som zapomnul, že my trímeme v ľadnici jednoho z totych zmutovanych qahwahovych oblud. Idzeme pitva\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And this guy looks like our Jančí. Adam, I forgot that we are keeping one of these mutated qahwah monsters in the fridge. We're going for an autopsy\n<Pavol>

items.original: Vrátiť sa odkiaľ pochádzam nie je v mojich silách. Pavol, pusť ma odtiaľto a nechám ťa nažive. Čítam v tebe, že nenávidíš Turkov celou svojou dušou. Ukážeš mi cestu a ja sa tam vydám, ich ríšu prevrátim na popol. Nie som zlý, vieš rovnako dobre ako ja, že devastácia je nevyhnutným predpokladom novej kreácie. \n<Ahriman>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Going back to where I came from is not in my power. Pavol, let me out of here and I'll let you live. I read in you that you hate the Turks with all your soul. You show me the way and I will go there, turning their realm to ashes. I'm not evil, you know as well as I do that devastation is a prerequisite for a new creation. \n<Ahriman>

items.original: Tak ako dospievaním vraždíte kúsok po kúsku dieťa v sebe v nevýslovnej agónii, tak je potrebné vraždiť aj zaostalé národy na oltári pokroku. A pokrok je Rakúsko-Uhorská monarchia. Rozosievam oheň, pripravujem pôdu pre to nové ako oráč ničiaci burinu! \n<Ahriman>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>Just as you are murdering the child inside you bit by bit in unspeakable agony, so it is necessary to murder the underdeveloped nations on the altar of progress. And progress is the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy. I am sowing fire, preparing the ground for the new, like a plower destroying weeds! \n<Ahriman>

items.original: A toten chlop vypatra jak naš Janči. Adam, ja som zapomnul, že my trímeme v ľadnici jednoho z totych zmutovanych qahwahovych oblud. Idzeme pitva\n<Pavol>
items.translation: <Wordwrap>And this guy looks like our Jančí. Adam, I forgot that we are keeping one of these mutated qahwah monsters in the fridge. We're going for an autopsy\n<Pavol>

items.original: Ďakujem.\n<Pavol>
\n<Pavol>
Nadhera! Idzem takoj tam, most do hodiny bude naspak!\n<Tesár>
s
Ta čo vy dvojo, neznace paru suchare najsť?\n<Jozef>
Feri som. Slnko som nevidel už celé dni, aký je deň? Pár hodín dozadu ma sem zapichli, \n<Feri>
Zapadané kamením.
<Wordwrap>Ticho! Pozri sa na mňa! Matej ešte žije, ta prestaň sa tu teraz hádzať o zem! Čo si nebol na vojne? Kto tu je dajaky schopny zbrojnoš, nech mu to dám na povel?\n<Adam>
My ideme do vašej ľadnice, musíme ihneď pitvať Jančiho.\n<Adam>
<Wordwrap>Potrebujeme ten tvoj lietajúci stroj. Vidíte Paliho meč? S ním vzlietne.\n<Adam>

Tak ako dospievaním vraždíte kúsok po kúsku dieťa v sebe v nevýslovnej agónii, tak je potrebné vraždiť aj zaostalé národy na oltári pokroku. Rozosievam oheň, pripravujem pôdu pre to nové ako oráč ničiaci burinu! \n<Ahriman>
<Wordwrap>Ale povedz mi, prečo toľko piješ, predsa nie si sprostý.\n<Matej>

Dostal si \c[14]halapartňu\c[0] a \c[14]meč\c[0] so \c[14]štítom\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]gambeson\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]prešívanú čiapku\c[0]. \!
Dostal si \c[14]starý šľap\c[0].
Núdza z ľudí lotrov činí a vlky z lesa ženie hlad.
Konečne dakto ozbrojeny prišol. Už som myslel, že s nama konec \n<Dedinčan>
Ani som sa nestihla obliecť, jak som do kostola utekala. Aspoň holý život som si zachránila.\n<Neviestka>

Practe sa! Richtár dnes zakázali vstup do dediny. 
V krčme kvôli tomu tiež skoro zatvárajú, neunúvajte sa.\n<Strážnik>

Páni dobrotiví, vidím, že dobré úmysly máte, ale nesmieme 
vás pustiť. Richtár prikázali, bojíme sa, že husiti vyčíňajú, podpálili zase 
starý hrad alebo ak nie husiti... tak ešte horšia banda... Ale do krčmy choďťe, 
isto vám aspoň jedno ešte nalejú na dobré spanie.\n<Strážnik>
Važeni pani, za čože do dediny ste k nám dorazili?\n<Strážnik>
Za richtarom idzeme.\n<Pavol>
Mal by doma byť. Byva v strede dediny.\n<Strážnik>
Nervozny už je pes. Pome ho richtarovi vracic. \n<Pavol>
Áh, tu ste. Poď Nora, poď k páničkovi.\n<Richtár>
